<page> <title>aspca_pet_insurance</title><text>{{advert|date=february 2013}}\n{{infobox company\n | name             = aspca pet health insurance\n | type             = insurance\n | founded       = 2006\n| location_city    = [[canton, ohio]]\n | location_country = [[united states|u.s.]]\n | area_served      = [[united states]]\n | industry         = [[insurance]]\n | services         = [[pet insurance]] \n | homepage         = [http://www.aspcapetinsurance.com aspcapetinsurance.com]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'aspca pet insurance\'\'\' is a property and casualty insurance program that reimburses pet owners for the costs of covered veterinary care. it was developed by the hartville group, inc., which is a strategic partner of the [[american society for the prevention of cruelty to animals]] (aspca). \nthe hartville group, inc. is based in canton, ohio. founded in 1997 along with its subsidiary agency, petsmarketing insurance.com agency,<ref name=\"subsidaries\">{{cite web|title=hartville subsidiaries|url=http://www.hartvillegroup.com/hartville-subsidaries.aspx|accessdate=02/12/2013}}</ref> hartville is one of the largest providers of pet health insurance in the u.s. hartville’s agency is authorized to sell insurance in all 50 states and the district of columbia.<ref name=\"insurance\">{{cite web|title=hartville pet insurance history and mission|url=http://www.hartvillegroup.com/hartville-pet-insurance-about-us.aspx|accessdate=02/12/2013}}</ref>\n\n==history==\nby 2005, more than 500,000 pets in north america were covered by pet insurance, and hartville was already one of the larger providers, according to packaged facts.<ref name=\"market reports\">{{cite web|title=pet insurance market reports|url=http://www.packagedfacts.com/pet-insurance-market-c1643/|accessdate=02/12/2013}}</ref> today, hartville provides several brands of pet insurance <ref name=\"brands\">{{cite web|title=hartville brands|url=http://www.hartvillegroup.com/hartville-pet-insurance-brands.aspx|accessdate=02/12

<page> <title>ata_chapter_numbers</title><text>the \'\'\'ata chapter numbers\'\'\' provide a common referencing standard for all [[commercial aircraft]] documentation. this commonality permits greater ease of learning and understanding for [[aviator|pilot]]s, [[aircraft maintenance technician]]s, and [[engineer]]s alike. the standard numbering system is controlled and published by the [[air transport association]].\n\nthe unique aspect of the chapter numbers is its relevance for all aircraft. thus a chapter reference number for a [[boeing 747]] will be the same for a [[bae 125]]. examples of this include oxygen (chapter 35), electrical power (chapter 24) and doors (chapter 52).\n\n==ata chapters==\n\'\'\'aircraft general\'\'\'\n\n{| class=\"wikitable\" border=\"1\"\n|-\n! ata number\n! ata chapter name\n|-\n| ata 05\n| time limits/maintenance checks\n|-\n| ata 06\n| dimensions and areas\n|-\n| ata 07\n| lifting and shoring\n|-\n| ata 08\n| leveling and weighing.\n|-\n| ata 09\n| towing and tax\n|-\n\n| ata 10\n| parking, mooring, storage and return to service\n|-\n| ata 11\n| placards and markings\n|-\n| ata 12\n| servicing - routine maintenance\n|-\n| ata 18\n| vibration and noise analysis(helicopter only)\n|-\n|}\n\n\'\'\'airframe systems\'\'\'\n\n{| class=\"wikitable\" border=\"1\"\n|-\n! ata number\n! ata chapter name\n|-\n| ata 20\n| standard practices – airframe\n|-\n| ata 21\n| air conditioning and pressurization\n|-\n| ata 22\n| autoflight\n|-\n| ata 23\n| communications\n|-\n| ata 24\n| electrical power\n|-\n| ata 25\n| equipment/furnishings\n|-\n| ata 26\n| fire protection\n|-\n| ata 27\n| flight controls\n|-\n| ata 28\n| fuel\n|-\n| ata 29\n| hydraulic power\n|-\n| ata 30\n| ice and rain protection\n|-\n| ata 31\n| indicating / recording system\n|-\n| ata 32\n| landing gear\n|-\n| ata 33\n| lights\n|-\n| ata 34\n| navigation\n|-\n| ata 35\n| oxygen\n|-\n| ata 36\n| pneumatic\n|-\n| ata 37\n| vacuum\n|-\n| ata 38\n| water/waste\n|-\n| ata 39\n| electrica
<page> <title>ati_multi_rendering</title><text>\'\'\'ati multi-rendering\'\'\' (\'\'\'amr\'\'\') is a video technology created by [[ati technologies]] that enables a single computer to use more than one video processor. created in 2002, amr uses a technology ati calls \"super tiling\" to connect multiple (two or more) video cards together. amr has been primarily used by [[evans and sutherland]], for commercial [[flight simulator]]s, because of its ability to use more than two [[graphics processing unit|vpus]]. ati has introduced a \"consumer level\" version of amr, which they refer to as [[ati crossfire|crossfire]].\n\n==super tiling==\nsuper tiling is a technology that splits the screen up into equal divisions whose size is based on the number of vpus. these divisions are called tiles. the partial images are then put together and displayed on the screen. although not much is known about the interconnect method, it may be a device that bridges the cards together in a method similar to [[nvidia]]\'s [[scalable link interface|sli]] bridge card, or it may pass data over unused pcie ports (as each card will be on a 16x slot, but will only be working at 8x interconnect rates)\n\n==release==\nthe official name of amr\'s commercial variant is known as ati crossfire. the chipset was launched with ati\'s r520 core for intel and amd platforms in the summer of 2005.\n\n== see also ==\n*[[nvidia scalable link interface]]\n*[[scan-line interleave]]\n*[[graphics card]]\n\n\n==references==\n{{unreferenced|date=march 2009}}\n\n{{ati}}\n\n[[category:ati technologies]]</text> </page>

<page> <title>atp_citrate_lyase</title><text>{{protein\n|name=atp citrate lyase\n|caption=crystal structure of truncated human atp-citrate lyase.<ref name=\"pmid20558738\">{{pdb|3mwe}}; {{cite journal | author = sun t, hayakawa k, bateman ks, fraser me | title = identification of the citrate-binding site of human atp-citrate lyase using x-ray crystallography | journal = j. biol. chem. | volume = 285 | issue = 35 | pages = 27418–27428 | year = 2010 | month = august | pmid = 20558738 | doi = 10.1074/jbc.m109.078667 | url = | issn = | pmc = 2930740 }}</ref>\n|image= atpcitratelyase.pdb.png\n|width=\n|hgncid=115\n|symbol=acly\n|altsymbols=\n|entrezgene=47\n|omim=108728\n|refseq=nm_001096\n|uniprot=p53396\n|pdb=\n|ecnumber=2.3.3.8  \n|chromosome=17\n|arm=q\n|band=21.2\n|locussupplementarydata=\n}}\n\'\'\'atp citrate lyase\'\'\' is an [[enzyme]] that represents an important step in [[fatty acid biosynthesis]].<ref name=\"pmid1371749\">{{cite journal | author = elshourbagy na, near jc, kmetz pj, wells tn, groot ph, saxty ba, hughes sa, franklin m, gloger is | title = cloning and expression of a human atp-citrate lyase cdna | journal = eur. j. biochem. | volume = 204 | issue = 2 | pages = 491–499 | year = 1992 | month = march | pmid = 1371749 | doi = 10.1111/j.1432-1033.1992.tb16659.x| url = http://www.blackwell-synergy.com/openurl?genre=article&sid=nlm:pubmed&issn=0014-2956&date=1992&volume=204&issue=2&spage=491 }}</ref> this step in fatty acid biosynthesis occurs because atp citrate lyase is the link between the metabolism of carbohydrates (which causes energy) and the production of fatty acids.<ref name = \"pmid20558738\"/>\n\n==function==\natp citrate lyase is the primary enzyme responsible for the synthesis of [[cytosolic]] [[acetyl-coa]] in many tissues. the enzyme is a tetramer of apparently identical subunits. the product, acetyl-coa, serves several important biosynthetic pathways, including [[lipogenesis]] and [[mevalonate pathway|cholesterogenesis]].<ref name=

<page> <title>auriga</title><text>\'\'\'auriga\'\'\' (\'\'antenna ultracriogenica risonante per l\'indagine gravitazionale astronomica\'\') is an ultracryogenic resonant bar [[gravitational wave detector]] in italy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://arstechnica.com/science/2012/12/threatening-to-discover-quantum-gravity-with-a-big-metal-bar/|title=threatening (to discover) quantum gravity with a big metal bar|first=matthew|last=francis|publisher=ars technica|date=2012-12-18}}</ref> it is at the [[laboratori nazionali di legnaro]] of the [[istituto nazionale di fisica nucleare]], near [[padova]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.infn.it/esperimenti/esperimentien.php?gruppo=2&sigla_naz=auriga|title=  auriga experiment, responsible: massimo cerdonio |publisher=infn|accessdate=2012-12-18}}</ref> it is being used for research into [[gravitational waves]] and [[quantum gravity]].\n\n== see also ==\n* [[ligo]]\n* [[weber bar]]\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n== external links ==\n* http://www.auriga.lnl.infn.it/\n\n{{gravitational wave observatories}}\n\n{{coord missing|italy}}\n\n[[category:astronomical observatories in italy]]\n[[category:gravitational wave telescopes]]\n\n{{physics-stub}}\n{{astronomy-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>auscannzukus</title><text>\'\'\'auscannzukus\'\'\' is a naval [[command, control, communications and computers]] (c4) interoperability organization involving the [[anglosphere]] nations of [[australia]], [[canada]], [[new zealand]], the [[united kingdom]], and the [[united states]]. the [[acronym]] is also used as security caveat in the [[ukusa community]], where it is also known as \"\'\'\'five eyes\'\'\'\".<ref>{{cite web|last=mcgregor|first=richard|title=global insight: us spying risks clouding ‘five eyes’ vision|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/d0873f38-d1c5-11e2-9336-00144feab7de.html|publisher=\'\'[[financial times]]\'\'|accessdate=30 august 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=lee|first=michael|title=snowden leak reaffirms australia\'s four spy installations|url=http://www.zdnet.com/snowden-leak-reaffirms-australias-four-spy-installations-7000017799/|publisher=[[zdnet]]|accessdate=13 august 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=gurney|first=matt|title=canada navy spy case|url=http://fullcomment.nationalpost.com/2012/03/28/matt-gurney-despite-their-annoyance-the-u-s-shouldnt-hold-spy-against-canada/|publisher=\'\'national post\'\'|accessdate=13 august 2013}}</ref> \n\n==objectives, strategies and guiding principles==\nthe organization\'s vision and mission,<ref name=portal/> objectives, strategies and guiding principles,<ref name=osgp>\n{{cite web |url=http://www.auscannzukus.net/overview.html |title=auscannzukus overview |publisher=auscannzukus.net |date=2010-03-01 |accessdate=2011-11-04}}{{dead link|date=june 2013}}</ref>\nand structure<ref name=structure>\n{{cite web|url=http://www.auscannzukus.net/structure.html |title=auscannzukus structure |publisher=auscannzukus.net |date=2010-03-01 |accessdate=2011-11-04}}{{dead link|date=june 2013}}</ref>\nare presented on the auscannzukus information portal.\n\n;objectives\n#to achieve internal sharing and understanding of maritime c4 knowledge.\n#to produce products and processes to achieve maritime c4 in
<page> <title>avebe</title><text>{{infobox company |\n| company_name = avebe u.a.\n| company_logo = \n| company_type = [[cooperative]]\n| slogan = innovation by nature\n| foundation = 1919\n| location = [[veendam]], the [[netherlands]]\n| key_people =\n| industry = [[agriculture]]\n| products = starch, starch derivatives, protein\n| revenue = € 574 miljoen <small>(2009-2010)</small>\n| homepage = http://www.avebe.com/\n| num_employees = 1,400\n}}\n{{coord|53.10675|6.87130|scale:5000000|display=title}}\nthe [[cooperative]] \'\'\'avebe u.a.\'\'\' (abbreviation of \'\'aardappelmeel verkoop bureau\'\') is an international dutch [[starch]] manufacturer located in the north of the [[netherlands]] and produces starch products based on [[potato starch]] and potato protein for use in food, animal feed, paper, construction, textiles and adhesives.\n\nabout 2600 farmers are member of avebe. the cooperation is divided into six districts (two in [[germany]] and four in the netherlands). avebe starch factories in the netherlands, germany and [[sweden]] processes about 3 million tons in [[potato]]es.\n\n==history==\nthe history of avebe is strongly connected with the history of the province [[groningen (province)|groningen]], the many privately owned starch manufacturers in the area and the former starch company ksh (royal scholten-honig) founded by willem albert scholten in 1841, the first dutch multinational.\n\nthe name avebe is derived from the dutch words aardappelmeel verkoop bureau (potato flour sales office) (avb). the cooperative was founded in 1919 as a cooperative partnership between different potato starch manufacturers located in the province groningen owned by potato farmers to ensure good market prices for their native starch. the farmer cooperatives successfully pushed the privately owned starch companies away from native starch into the production of [[modified starch|starch derivatives]]. in 1948 the cooperation became one company and the name was changed to av

<page> <title>a_barcelona</title><text>{{essay-like|date=january 2009}}\n{{unreferenced|date=january 2009}}\n\'\'\'a barcelona\'\'\' is a [[poem]] by [[jacint verdaguer]], published in 1883. it is a triumphant song of the transformation undergone by [[barcelona]] since the mid-19th century.\n\nconsisting of 46 [[quatrain]]s of [[alexandrine]] verses, and a re-editing process started in 1874 and completed in 1875, it is the fruit of a labour started in 1883. the author then lengthened and amended it three times, the last two shortly before its publication.\n\nthe first three stanzas present the city protected by the mountain of [[montjuïc]], identified with [[heracles|alcides]] (hercules), the mythic founder of barcino according to a legend that verdaguer had already picked up on in the atlàntida (1878).\n\nnext are sixteen quatrains, in which the poet celebrates the demolition of the walls and the extension of the city (1859), with a prophecy of bursting growth, beyond the collserola mountain range and the besos and llobregat rivers, as if \"paris of the seine\" had been transplanted to [[catalonia]].\n\nhowever, the three following stanzas, in the name of the homeland, reject any awe of the french capital, affirming instead the personality of barcelona, which had been the catalan center of a medieval mediterranean empire and «she shone on spanish lands as eastern star».\n\nin the 23rd to 40th stanzas, the poet evokes the historical characters and the monuments that distinguish the city.\n\nthe six final stanzas, written from the perspective of the cathedral, imaginatively transfigured into [[james i of aragon|king jaume i]], formulate the ideological conclusion, the providential perspective, in which barcelona and catalonia are exhorted to promote economic progress, based on their industries, but without ever renouncing the catholic tradition, since in the end «god alone brings down or lifts up peoples».\n\nin spite of the rhetorical flourishes denounced by s
<page> <title>a_beam_of_sun_to_shake_the_sky</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{infobox artwork\n| image_file         = taylorabeamofsuntoshakethesky2004.jpg\n| painting_alignment = \n| image_size         = 200px\n| title              = a beam of sun to shake the sky\n| alt                = \n| other_language_1   =\n| other_title_1      =\n| other_language_2   =\n| other_title_2      = \n| artist             = richard taylor (artist)\n| year               = 2004\n| type               = aluminum\n| height_metric      = \n| width_metric       = \n| length_metric      = \n| height_imperial    = 168\n| width_imperial     = 48\n| length_imperial    = 84\n| diameter__metric   = \n| diameter_imperial  = \n| imperial_unit      = in\n| metric_unit        = cm\n| city               = milwaukee, wisconsin\n| museum             = milwaukee public library\n| coordinates        = {{coord|43|2|24.27|n|87|55|20.55|w|region:us-wi_type:landmark|display=inline,title}}\n| owner              =  city of milwaukee\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a beam of sun to shake the sky\'\'\'\'\' is a [[public art]] work by american artist [[richard taylor (artist)|richard taylor]], located in downtown [[milwaukee]], [[wisconsin]].<ref name=m>{{cite web|last=bialek|first=nan|title=heavy metal|url=http://www.gmtoday.com/content/m_magazine/2012/may/m_052012_22.asp|work=m milwaukee\'s lifestyle magazine|publisher=gm today|accessdate=1 october 2012}}</ref>  the sculpture was created for the central [[milwaukee public library]] as part of the remodeling of the wells street entrance.  \n\n==description==\n\'\'a beam of sun to shake the sky\'\' consists of two vertically oriented sculptures set upon massive granite pedestals in front of the library\'s glass facade. the sculptures appear made of bright red ribbon-like strips of painted aluminum that snake skyward.<ref name=omc>{{cite web|title=milwaukee daily photo 8/14/08|url=http://www.onmilwaukee.com/myomc/blog/show/1888|publisher=onmilwaukee.com|accessdate=1 october 201
<page> <title>a_bekkersdal_marathon</title><text>\'\'\'a bekkersdal marathon \'\'\' is anthology of [[short stories]] written by [[herman charles bosman]].\n\n==publication history==\nthe 22 short stories assembled in this volume, published in book format in 1971 by [[human and rousseau]], were all written during the last 18 months of herman charles bosman’s life <ref>bosman, hc (1971) a bekkersdal marathon. cape town: human and rousseau.</ref> \n. originally, the stories appeared as a weekly serial in ‘the forum’ magazine.<ref>bosman, hc (1971) a bekkersdal marathon. cape town: human and rousseau.</ref>\n\n==synopsis==\nafter leaving university, bosman was appointed as a school teacher in the [[groot marico]] district.<ref>http://www.marico.co.za/hcbosman/books.htm</ref> in small, underdeveloped rural towns, such as the one where bosman worked, the living room (‘voorkamer’) of a local farmer would serve as a post office. people would often gather here to chat and gossip. the conversations he participated in with the townspeople and farmers inspired the anthology.<ref>http://www.marico.co.za/hcbosman/books.htm</ref> \n\nin ‘a bekkersdal marathon’, the ‘voorkkamer’ of jurie steyn, a prosperous maize farmer, doubles as the village post office.<ref>bosman, hc (1971) a bekkersdal marathon. cape town: human and rousseau.</ref> regular visitors include gysbert van tonder (a notorious cattle rustler), at naude (the owner of the district\'s only radio who prides himself on keeping abreast of national and world affairs) and oupa bekker (the oldest man in the district).<ref>bosman, hc (1971) a bekkersdal marathon. cape town: human and rousseau.</ref> vermaak, the school master, represents bosman himself.\n\nbosman uses gentle irony to poke fun at the afrikaans farmers.<ref>http://www.marico.co.za/hcbosman/books.htm</ref> outwardly, the farmers project an image of conservative respectability which contrasts with their inner natures. the plots, language and co

<page> <title>a_big_package_for_you</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=december 2012}}\n{{infobox album\n| name        = a big package for you\n| type        = video\n| artist      = [[simple plan]]\n| cover       = a big package for you.jpg\n| released    = november 25, 2003\n| length      = \n| genre       = rock\n| label       = [[lava records|lava]]\n| producer    = \n|}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a big package for you: 1999-2003\'\'\'\'\' is a dvd/cd by the [[pop punk]] band [[simple plan]] from [[montreal]], [[canada]]. the band consists of five members [[pierre bouvier]], lead singer, [[david desrosiers]], bassist and backing vocalist, [[sébastien lefebvre]], rhythm guitarist and backing vocalist, [[chuck comeau]], drummer, and [[jeff stinco]], lead guitarist.\n\n==track listing==\n===dvd (\"a big package for you\")===\n*meet simple plan\n*recording \"[[no pads, no helmets... just balls]]\"\n*shooting the album cover\n*making our first video\n*going on tour\n*filming \"[[i\'d do anything (simple plan song)|i\'d do anything]]\"\n*guten tag from europe\n*hitting the road again\n*behind the scenes at the \"[[addicted (simple plan song)|addicted]]\" video shoot\n*konichiwa from japan!\n*experimenting in bangkok\n*sp loves going down...under: australia 2002\n*spring break! sp under the sun!\n*big rock show: sp does arenas\n*return to the land of the rising sun\n*the \"[[perfect (simple plan song)|perfect]]\" video\n*punk rock summer camp: warped tour \'03\n*looking back...\n\n===cd (\"a small package for you\")===\n#\"crash and burn\"\n#\"one day\" (live)\n#\"[[i\'d do anything (simple plan song)|i\'d do anything]]\" (live)\n\n{{simple plan}}\n\n{{defaultsort:big package for you, a}}\n[[category:simple plan video albums]]\n[[category:2003 video albums]]\n[[category:live video albums]]\n[[category:2003 live albums]]</text> </page>

with the originally intended track sequencing in 2004 by [[koch records|koch records]].  the title of the album comes from a line in the opening verse of \"paint the town beige\":\n:\'\'i gave up the <page> <title>a_bone_for_a_bone</title><text>{{infobox hollywood cartoon\n|series = [[looney tunes]] ([[goofy gophers]])\n|image = a bone for a bone title card.png\n|caption = title card\n|director = [[friz freleng|i. freleng]]\n|story_artist = [[ben hardaway|j.b. hardaway]]\n|animator = [[virgil ross]]<br>[[arthur davis (animator)|arthur davis]]<br>[[manuel perez (animator)|manuel perez]]<br>ken tunes]]\'\' [[short subject|short]] starring the [[goofy gophers]]. the cartoon, released in 1951, was directed by [[friz freleng]] and released by [[warner bros. pictures]], and was the first of four goofy gophers cartoon directed by freleng, and would be the final work by [[ben hardaway|j.b. hardaway]] at the [[warner bros.]] studio, having returned after almost a decade at the walter lantz studio. as this cartoon was reissued in 1959 the closing was the 1959 closing of looney tunes cartoons.\n\n==plot==\nthe gophers (mac and tosh) are playing a [[gin rummy|gin]] game in their hole in the ground outside a house, where tosh loses his fifth game in a row, when geo p. dog (otherwise known as \'the barnyard dawg\' in the foghorn leghorn series) digs a hole and dumps a bone on the gophers and then dirt as he fills the bone in. geo does remove the bone upon tosh\'s request, but realizing that it was gophers who asked him to move the bone, he returns to the same hole to dig the bone. this time, mac goes up
<page> <title>a_boy_and_his_atom</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name = a boy and his atom\n| image          = a boy and his atom (still).jpg\n| image_size     = 240px\n| alt            = an image of a small boy on the right made out of silvery dots against a gray background, with a single dot on the left\n| caption        = the atom (left) and the boy\n| distributor = [[ibm research]]\n| released = {{film date|2013|04|30}}\n| runtime = 1 minute\n| language = english\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a boy and his atom\'\'\'\'\' is a 2013 [[stop-motion animation|stop-motion animated]] short film released on [[youtube]] by [[ibm research]]. the movie tells the story of a boy and a wayward atom who meet and become friends. it depicts a boy playing with an atom that takes various forms. one minute in length, it was made by moving [[carbon monoxide]] [[molecule]]s viewed with a [[scanning tunneling microscope]], a device that magnifies them 100 million times. these two-atom molecules were literally moved to create images, which were then saved as individual frames to make the film. the movie has been recognized by the [[guinness book of world records]] as the world\'s smallest stop-motion film. \n\nthe scientists at ibm research - [[ibm almaden research center|almaden]] who made the film are moving atoms to explore the limits of data storage because, as data creation and consumption gets bigger, data storage needs to get smaller, all the way down to the atomic level. traditional silicon transistor technology has become cheaper, denser and more efficient, but fundamental physical limitations suggest that scaling down is an unsustainable path to solving the growing big data dilemma. this team of scientists is particularly interested in starting on the smallest scale, single atoms, and building structures up from there. using this method, ibm announced it can now store a single bit of information in just 12 atoms (current technology takes roughly one million atoms to store a single bit).<ref>
<page> <title>a_brush_with_fame</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=november 2012}}\n{{unreferenced|date=march 2008}}\n{{infobox television\n| show_name            = a brush with fame\n| image                =\n| caption              =\n| format               = [[art]]\n| runtime              = 60 minutes\n| presenter            = [[carol smillie]]\n| channel              = [[itv (tv network)|itv]]\n| country              = united kingdom\n| first_aired          = october 2005\n| last_aired           = november 2005\n| related              =\n|}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a brush with fame\'\'\'\'\' is a light hearted [[itv (tv network)|itv]] daytime television show, featuring a nationwide search to find britain\'s best amateur portrait painter. it was presented by [[carol smillie]], and the last episode was broadcast on 11 november 2005.\n\n==format==\nsixty people in each of nine uk regions were given half an hour to produce a self-portrait using materials supplied by the programmers.  then, while the artists took a break, carol and the two judges, [[christian furr]] and [[david lee (art critic)]] looked at the painted pictures and chose twenty five people to go into the next round and paint a celebrity guest.  the artists could then use their own materials and any medium. \nout of the 25, the judges  then chose 10 who would go on to the next round and paint a second celebrity. \nout of the 10, one finalist was selected and also one wild card show contestant who would compete with 8 others from the other regions in a wild card show for the chance to join the nine finalists in london.\n\n==final==\nthe final, broadcast in november 2005, starred eamonn holmes dressed as a gladiator.the winner received a cheque for £10,000 and also the opportunity to turn professional, with the offer of a deal with leading art publisher, washington green.\n\n==axed==\nit was announced by [[itv (tv network)|itv]] in january 2006, that \'\'a brush with fame\'\' would not return for a second series.\n\
<page> <title>a_case_of_conscience</title><text>{{refimprove|date=june 2011}}\n{{infobox book| <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name          = a case of conscience\n| title_orig    =\n| translator    =\n| image         = [[image:acaseofconscience(novel).jpg|200px]]\n| caption = cover of first edition\n| author        = [[james blish]]\n| illustrator   =\n| cover_artist  =\n| country       = [[united states]]\n| language      = [[english language|english]]\n| series        = after such knowledge trilogy\n| genre         = [[science fiction]] [[novel]]\n| publisher     = [[ballantine books]]\n| release_date  = 1958\n| media_type    = print ([[paperback]])\n| pages         = 192 pp\n| isbn          = isbn 0-345-43835-3 (later paperback printing)\n| dewey= 813/.54 21\n| congress= ps3503.l64 c37 2000\n| oclc= 45074320\n| preceded_by   =\n| followed_by   = [[black easter]] / [[the day after judgment]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a case of conscience\'\'\'\'\' is a [[science fiction]] [[novel]] by [[james blish]], first published in 1958. it is the story of a [[jesuit]] who investigates an alien race that has no religion yet has a perfect, innate sense of [[morality]], a situation which conflicts with catholic teaching.  the story was originally published as a [[novella]] in 1953, and later extended to novel-length, of which the first part is the original novella. the novel is the first part of blish\'s thematic \"after such knowledge\" trilogy, followed by \'\'[[black easter]]\'\', \'\'[[the day after judgment]]\'\' and \'\'[[dr mirabilis]]\'\'.\n\nthe story is unusual in several respects.  few [[science fiction]] stories of the time attempted religious themes, and still fewer did this with catholicism.  (compare [[walter m. miller, jr.|walter m. miller, jr.\'s]] [[hugo award]]-winning [[post-apocalyptic]] science fiction novel \'\'[[a canticle for leibowitz]]\'\'.)\n\nmany reacted negatively to the story, but surprisingly few educated cat

<page> <title>a_chorus_of_obliteration</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=july 2013}}\n\n{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a chorus of obliteration\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[the showdown (band)|the showdown]]\n| cover       = a chorus of obliteration.jpg\n| released    = november 16, 2004\n| recorded    =\n| genre       = [[melodic death metal]]<br>[[death metal]]<br>[[metalcore]]\n| length      =\n| label       = [[mono vs stereo records]]\n| producer    = [[bruce fitzhugh]]\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'a chorus of obliteration\'\'\'\'\'<br />(2004)\n| next album  = \'\'\'\'\'[[temptation come my way]]\'\'\'\'\'<br />(2007)\n}}\n{{album ratings\n| rev1      = [[allmusic]]\n| rev1score =(unrated)  [{{allmusic|class=album|id=r717944|pure_url=yes}} link] \n|rev2=[[jesus freak hideout]]|rev2score={{rating|4|5}} [http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/cdreviews/achorusofobliteration.asp]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a chorus of obliteration\'\'\'\'\' is [[the showdown (band)|the showdown]]\'s debut album.  it blends christian [[metalcore]] with [[southern metal]], and [[melodic death metal]]. every song on \'\'a chorus of obliteration\'\' is based on a story in the [[bible]]. for example, \"a monument encased in ash\" is based on the destruction of the cities of sodom and gomorrah, \"epic: a chorus of obliteration\" is based on the israelites taking down jericho, \"from the mouth of gath comes terror\" is based on the conflict between [[david and goliath]], and \"dagon undone (the reckoning)\" is based on [[delilah#biblical narrative|samson and delilah]]. \n\n==track listing==\n# a monument encased in ash (5:53)\n# hell can\'t stop us now (3:36)\n# epic: a chorus of obliteration (3:31)\n# from the mouth of gath comes terror (featuring josh scogin of [[the chariot (band)|the chariot]]) (6:28)\n# a proclamation of evil\'s fate (4:03)\n# dagon undone&nbsp;– the reckoning (4:31) (featuring bruce fitzhugh of [[living sacrifice]])\n# isca

<page> <title>a_cold_case</title><text>{{other uses|cold case (disambiguation)}}\n{{infobox book\n| name           = a cold case\n| image          = philip gourevitch - a cold case.jpeg\n| dewey= 364.15/23/097471 21\n| congress= hv6534.n5 g68 2002\n| oclc= 49582857\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a cold case\'\'\'\'\' is a 2002 novel by [[philip gourevitch]]. a film adaptation of the novel starring [[tom hanks]] was attempted, but the project did not enter production.\n\n==plot summary==\n\'\'a cold case\'\' follows real-life chief investigator andy rosenzweig from the [[new york county district attorney|manhattan district attorney]]\'s office as he investigates the 1970 murders of richie glennon and pete mcginn, a case which was seemingly closed too soon. an ex-con, frank gilbert koehler, is finally arrested in 1997.\n\n==film adaptation==\n\'\'a cold case\'\' was originally slated to have a film adaptation starring [[tom hanks]] after the actor\'s performances in \'\'[[the terminal]]\'\' (2004) and \'\'[[the ladykillers (2004 film)|the ladykillers]]\'\' (2004). director [[mark romanek]] was signed to helm the project with a script by [[john sayles]] and [[eric roth]], but when hanks chose to do \'\'[[the polar express (film)|the polar express]]\'\' (2004) instead, the project came to a halt.\n\n==references==\n* {{cite news | last=leopold | first=todd | author=stephen saito | url=http://www.premiere.c
<page> <title>a_cold_heart</title><text>{{multiple issues|orphan =august 2010|unreferenced =may 2009|tone =may 2009|\n{{notability|book|date=may 2009}}\n}}\n\n{{infobox book  | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name           = a cold heart\n| image          = [[file:acoldheart.jpg|200px]]\n| caption  = cover of 1st edition\n| author         = [[jonathan kellerman]]\n| cover_artist   = \n| country        = [[u.s.|united states]]\n| language       = [[english language|english]]\n| series         = [[alex delaware]] novels\n| genre          = [[crime novel]]\n| publisher      = [[ballantine books|ballantine]]\n| release_date   = 2003\n| media_type     = \n| pages          = 0-345-45255-0\n| isbn           = 400\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a cold heart\'\'\'\'\' is a [[mystery novel]] by american author [[jonathan kellerman]]\n\n==plot introduction==\nafter the events of \"the murder book\", robin and alex have separated. robin moved out and quickly fell in with a man named tim, who was a vocal coach she met out tour. meanwhile, alex has started a serious relationship with a fellow psychologist, allison gwynn, who appeared in the murder book for the first time. while the two have broken their relationship, the two remain in contact during the course of the book, which suggest that some unresolved feelings still remain. at the same time, alex delaware is pulled into a case in which several \"young, up-and-coming\" artists are murdered, some of which alex had met during his time with robin. towards the end of the novel alex and allison\'s relationship seems to be going strong, but there are some unresolved issues between alex and robin that have yet to play out.\n\n==characters in \"a cold heart\"==\n*alex delaware - psychologist\n*milo sturgis - police detective\n\n{{defaultsort:cold heart}}\n[[category:2003 novels]]\n[[category:novels by jonathan kellerman]]\n[[category:21st-century american novels]]\n[[category:ballantine books books]]\n\n
<page> <title>a_community_of_witches</title><text>{{good article}}\n{{infobox book\n  | name           =  a community of witches: contemporary neo-paganism and witchcraft in the united states\n  | image          =  [[file:a community of witches.jpg|200px]]\n  | caption  =  the first edition cover of the book.\n  | author         =  helen a. berger\n  | country        =  [[united states]]\n  | language       =  [[english language|english]]\n  | subject        =  [[sociology of religion]]<br>[[pagan studies]]\n  | publisher      =  [[university of south carolina press]]\n  | release_date   =  1999\n  | media_type     =  print ([[hardcover]] & [[paperback]])\n  | pages          =  148\n  | isbn           =  978-1-57003-246-2\n  | oclc           =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a community of witches: contemporary neo-paganism and witchcraft in the united states\'\'\'\'\' is a [[sociology|sociological]] study of the [[wicca]]n and wider [[paganism (contemporary)|pagan]] community in the [[northeastern united states]]. it was written by american sociologist [[helen a. berger]] of the [[west chester university of pennsylvania]] and first published in 1999 by the [[university of south carolina press]]. it was released as a part of a series of academic books entitled studies in comparative religion, edited by frederick m. denny, a [[religious studies]] scholar at the [[university of chicago]].\n\nberger became interested in studying the wiccan and pagan movement in 1986, when she presented a lecture on the subject at the [[boston public library]]. subsequently becoming acquainted with members of the new england pagan community, she undertook fieldwork in both a local wiccan coven, the circle of light, and a wider pagan organisation, the earthspirit community (esc). in total, berger underwent 11 years of fieldwork among the pagan community. along with esc founder andras corban arthen, berger also undertook a \"pagan census\" survey of the u.s. in the mid-1990s to obtain more data on the cou
<page> <title>a_computer_animated_hand</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name           = a computer animated hand\n| image          = acah title screen.png\n| caption        = the title screen, crediting the film simply as, \'\'a computer animated hand\'\'.\n| alt            = three-dimensional letters read, a computer animated hand.\n| director       = [[edwin catmull]]<br>fred parke\n| producer       = edwin catmull<br>fred parke\n| released       = {{film date|1972}}\n| runtime        = 1 minute (approx.)\n| country        = united states\n| language       = english\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a computer animated hand\'\'\'\'\' is a 1972 american [[list of computer-animated films|computer-animated]] film produced by [[edwin catmull]] and fred parke. produced during catmull\'s tenure at the [[university of utah]], the short was created for a graduate course project. after creating a model of catmull\'s left hand, 350 triangles and polygons were drawn in ink on the model. the model was digitized and laboriously animated in a three dimensional animation program that catmull wrote.\n\nthe film consists of three sequences - the data output of the hand without lines, a halftone sequence that lacks smooth shading, and finally, the completed animation. the film depicts the hand swiveling, opening and closing, pointing at the viewer, and lastly, zooms to the inside of the hand. the clip also features animation of an artificial heart valve and human faces. snippets of the film were used in the 1976 film \'\'[[futureworld]]\'\'.\n\nas one of the earliest examples of computer animation, the film has been hailed as groundbreaking and revolutionary. catmull went on to become a co-founder of [[pixar|pixar animation studios]] and president of pixar and [[walt disney animation studios]]. in 2011, the film was inducted in the [[national film registry]], labeled \"culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant.\" [[library of congress]] scholars wrote: \"in creating the film, catmull wo
<page> <title>a_concise_treatise_on_the_art_of_angling</title><text>{{infobox book\n| name          = a concise treatise on the art of angling\n| title_orig    =\n| translator    =\n| image         = titlepageaconcisetreatise.jpg\n| caption       = title page - 7th edition 1807\n| author        = thomas best\n| illustrator   =\n| cover_artist  =\n| country       = england\n| language      = english\n| series        =\n| subject       = fly fishing\n| genre         =\n| publisher     = b. crosby and co., london\n| pub_date      = 1787\n| english_pub_date =\n| media_type    =\n| pages         = 186\n| isbn          =\n| oclc          =\n| preceded_by   =\n| followed_by   =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a concise treatise on the art of angling\'\'\'\'\'- \'\'confirmed by actual experiences and minute observations to which is added the compleat fly-fisher\'\' is a [[fly fishing]] book written by thomas best, first published in london in 1787.\n\n==synopsis==\n[[image:best-frontpiece.jpg|thumb|left|frontispiece (7th edition) showing very early renditions of [[artificial fly|artificial flies]]]]\n[[image:best-frontpiece1810.jpg|thumb|left|frontispiece (9th edition)]]\nalthough the first part of \'\'a concise treatise\'\' is a general angling work that provided little new information when it was published, the second part of the book--\'\'the complete fly-fisher\'\' was one of the earliest how-to books on the subject of fly fishing and artificial fly making.  the book proved to be extremely popular and useful, being issued in thirteen editions from 1787 to 1846.\n\n==reviews==\n* in \'\'ancient angling authors\'\' (1910) w. j. turrell notes:\n<blockquote>\n\'\'a concise treatise on the art of angling\'\'. . . . by thomas best, gent. late of his majesty\'s drawing room in the tower, london, appeared in 1787. thirteen editions of this work were published;, to the tenth and eleventh editions the greater part of nobbes\' compleat troller was added. this book, though it contains nothing str
<page> <title>a_conspiracy_of_friends</title><text>{{infobox book\n| name          = a conspiracy of friends\n| title_orig    =\n| translator    =\n| image         =\n| caption =\n| author        = [[alexander mccall smith]]\n| illustrator   = \n| cover_artist  = \n| country       =  united kingdom\n| language      = english\n| series        = corduroy mansions\n| subject       = the inhabitants of corduroy mansions\n| genre         = [[fiction]]\n| publisher     = [[polygon]]\n| pub_date      = 1 may 2011\n| english_pub_date =\n| media_type    = hardback\n| pages         = 368\n| isbn          = 978-18469-7182-2\n| oclc          =\n| preceded_by   = [[the dog who came in from the cold]]\n| followed_by   =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a conspiracy of friends\'\'\'\'\' is the third online novel by [[alexander mccall smith]], author of the [[the no. 1 ladies\' detective agency]] series. in the first series, the author wrote a chapter a day, starting from 15 september 2008, and the series ran for 20 weeks, totalling 100 episodes. the daily chapters, read by [[andrew sachs]], were also available as an audio download.\nthe second and third series were published online, running from monday 21 september 2009 and monday 13 september 2010, respectively.<ref>http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/books/corduroymansionsbyalexandermcca/</ref>\n\n==episodic writing==\n\nthe concept for the \'\'corduroy mansions\'\' series is based on [[charles dickens]]’ [[episodic writing]], novels that were serialised through journals in weekly or monthly instalments, in the 1800s. following a meeting with acclaimed [[san francisco]] novelist [[armistead maupin]], alexander mccall smith pursued this method of writing in 2004 with his novel \'\'[[44 scotland street]]\'\'. the story was serialised in instalments every weekday through \'\'[[the scotsman]]\'\' newspaper. \n\nas corduroy mansions and its successors was released online, readers had the opportunity to interact with each other and the author himself 
<page> <title>a_crime_in_the_neighborhood</title><text>{{infobox book\n<!-- |italic title = (see above) -->\n| name             = a crime in the neighborhood\n| image            = [[file:acrimeintheneighbourhood.jpg|200px|1st edition]]\n| caption    = \n| author           = suzanne berne\n| title_orig       = \n| translator       = \n| illustrator      = \n| cover_artist     = \n| country          = \n| language         = english\n| series           = \n| subject          = \n| genre            = crime novel, young adult\n| publisher        = [[algonquin books]]\n| pub_date         = 1997\n| english_pub_date = \n| media_type       = \n| pages            = 285\n| isbn             = \n| oclc             = \n| dewey            = \n| congress         = \n| preceded_by      = \n| followed_by      = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a crime in the neighborhood\'\'\'\'\' is a novel by [[suzanne berne]].  it won the [[orange prize for fiction]] in 1999.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.independent.co.uk/news/disturbing-and-lyrical-first-novel-wins-orange-prize-1099021.html | title = `disturbing and lyrical\' first novel wins orange prize|first=boyd|last=tonkin|accessdate=2009-06-07|date=1999-06-09|work=the independent}}</ref>  told through the eyes of a ten-year-old girl, the book chronicles a child\'s murder in a sleepy suburb of washington, d.c. against the backdrop of the unfolding [[watergate scandal]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{defaultsort:crime in the neighborhood}}\n[[category:crime novels]]\n[[category:debut novels]]\n[[category:1997 novels]]\n[[category:orange prize for fiction winning works]]\n[[category:algonquin books books]]\n\n\n{{crime-novel-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>a_date_with_the_smithereens</title><text>{{refimprove|date=april 2011}}\n{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a date with the smithereens\n| cover      = a date with the smithereens.jpg\n| type        = studio album\n| artist      = [[the smithereens]]\n| released    = {{start date|1994|04|26}}\n| recorded    = 1993-1994\n| genre       = [[rock music|rock]]/[[heavy metal music|metal]]\n| length      = 48:28\n| label       = [[rca records|rca]]\n| producer    = [[don dixon (musician)|don dixon]]\n|\n| last album  = \'\'blow up\'\' <br /> (1991)\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'a date with the smithereens\'\'\'\'\' <br /> (1994)\n| next album  = \'\'[[god save the smithereens]]\'\' <br /> (1999)\n}}\n{{album ratings\n| rev1      = [[allmusic]]\n| rev1score = {{rating|2|5}}<ref name=allmusic />\n| noprose   = yes\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a date with the smithereens\'\'\'\'\' is the fifth album by the [[new jersey]] [[rock band]] [[the smithereens]], released in 1994. it is seen as a stylistic departure by the band, as \'\'a date\'\' is mainly influenced by [[hard rock]] and [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]], while previous albums have leaned more towards straightforward [[pop rock]]. the title is meant to be ironic as nearly all songs on the album are hate-inspired.\n\n== details ==\nfrontman pat dinizio explained the darkness of the album saying: \"so why\'s it so dark? well, i\'m not a particularly happy person these days, and i do feel that society\'s going to hell in a handbag. you can hear that in the first song: \'guess what, there\'s a black cloud inside of my head, don\'t mess around with me or you\'ll find yourself dead.\' if you live in new york city, you can feel that way, like everyone around you is a walking time bomb.\" also, producer [[butch vig]] left the band prior to the recording of the album, which is said to have inspired some of the hatred expressed in this album.\n\nthe album was originally planned to be rele

<page> <title>a_decade_under_the_influence</title><text>{{about||the 2003 film|a decade under the influence (film)}}\n{{infobox single |\n| name           = a decade under the influence\n| cover under the influence\'\'\'\" is a [[maxi single]] released by american [[rock music|rock]] band [[taking back sunday]]. it was the first single to be released from \'\'[[where you want to be]]\'\' with former members [[fred mascherino]] (former guitarist / background vocalist) and [[matt rubano]] (former bassist). tracks 2 and 3 of the single were produced by long island producer and friend [[mike sapone]]. although it is not officially part of this release, the unreleased song entitled \"follow the format\" was recorded with mike sapone during the same session as the \"a decade under the influence\" and \"little devotional\" demos.\n\n==track listing==\n{{tracklist\n| all_writing = \n| collapsed = no\n| title1    = a decade under the influence\n| length1   = 4:09\n\n| title2    = <page> <title>a_delicate_truth</title><text>{{engvarb|date=september 2013}}\n{{use dmy dates|date=september 2013}}\n{{infobox book | <!-- see [[wikipedia:wikiproject novels]] or [[wikipedia:wikiproject books]] -->\n| name          = a delicate truth\n| image         = \n| caption =\n| author        = [[john le carré]]\n| country       = united kingdom\n| language      = english\n| publisher     = [[penguin books]] <!--- may need to change this to [[penguin groups]] or perhaps another imprint. --->\n| release_date  = 25 april 2013\n| english_release_date =\n| media_type    = print (hardcover)\n| pages         = 320\n| isbn          = 9780670922796\n| oclc          =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a delicate truth\'\'\'\'\' is a 2013 spy novel by [[john le carré]]. set in 2011, the book flashes back to a 2008 joint american-british covert mission on the [[rock of gibraltar]] and the consequences for two british civil servants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.curtisbrown.co.uk/john-le-carre/a-delicate-truth/|title=a delicate truth|publisher=curtisbrown.co.uk}}</ref>\n\nle carré describes this as not only his most british novel but also his most autobiographical work in years.<ref name=\"stock (2013)\">{{cite news|last=stock|first=jon|authorlink=jon stock|title=john le carré gets personal for new novel|newspaper=[[the daily telegraph]]|date=5 april 2013|page=unknown|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/books/booknews/9972523/john-le-carre-gets-personal-for-new-novel.html}}</ref> the author told \'\'[[the daily telegraph]]\'\' that he has based two of the book\'s characters on himself. le carré sees toby bell as the \"thirty-something rising star of her majesty\'s foreign service, [...] the striving ambitious fellow i fancy myself to have been at much the same age.\" whereas sir christopher (\"kit\") probyn, \"is a retired foreign office civil servant, who lives in rural cornwall,\" – the author \"has lived in a clifftop house outside st buryan, near land\'s end, for more than 
<page> <title>a_dictionary_of_hymnology</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a dictionary of hymnology: origin and history of christian hymns and hymnwriters of all ages and nations, together with biographical and critical notices of their authors and translators\'\'\'\'\' by [[john d. julian]], first published in 1892, is a standard historical reference for early [[christian]] [[hymns]], with more than 40,000 entries.<ref>{{cite book |last=hawn |first=c. michael |title=gather into one: praying and singing globally |publisher=eerdmans |location=grand rapids |year=2003}}</ref>\n\nthe work contains biographical and historical notes about the history of hymns and hymn writers. it is not a collection of hymn texts or [[hymn tune]]s, though brief quotations and references are included. originally published in 1892 in [[london]] by [[john murray (publisher)|john murray]] and in [[new york]] by [[charles scribner\'s sons]], it was reprinted in 1907-1908 by john murray, in 1957 by [[dover publications]] (in two volumes) and in 1985 by kregel publications. it was not revised after 1902, but remains an important source for early christian hymns, such as [[latin]] ones.<ref>{{cite book |last=nutter |first=charles s. |last2=tillett |first2=wilbur f. |title=the hymns and hymn writers of the church |publisher=the methodist book concern |location=new york |year=1911}}</ref>\n\na new \'\'dictionary of hymnology\'\', edited by j.r. watson and emma hornby, is set to be published on-line by canterbury press in october 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bris.ac.uk/arts/birtha/events/hymnology/ |title=canterbury dictionary of hymnology launch conference |publisher=bristol university |date=2013-05-16 |accessdate=2013-05-27}}</ref> \n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* [http://books.google.com/books?id=abdpaaaaiaaj \'\'a dictionary of hymnology\'\'] on google books\n* <page> <title>a_different_kind_of_truth_tour</title><text>{{infobox concert tour\n|concert_tour_name = a different kind of truth tour\n|image =\n|image_caption =\n| album = \'\'[[a different kind of truth]]\'\'\n|artist = [[van halen]]\n|start_date = january 5, 2012\n|end_date = july 24, 2013\n|number_of_legs = 5 \n|number_of_shows = 58, 36 canceled\n|last_tour = [[van halen 2007-2008 north american tour]] <br> (2007-08)\n|this_tour =  \'\'\'a different kind of truth tour\'\'\'<br> (2012)\n}}\n\'\'\'a different kind of truth\'\'\' (or \'\'\'viva la van halen tour\'\'\') was a 2012-2013 [[concert tour]] for [[hard rock]] band [[van halen]]. it was van halen\'s tour in support of their 2012 album, \'\'[[a different kind of truth]]\'\'.\n\n==history==\non december 26, 2011, the official van halen website was updated announcing that tickets for the 2012 tour would be available starting january 10, 2012. also on january 10, their first single, titled \"tattoo\", premiered on radio stations. the band\'s new album from [[interscope records]] entitled \'\'[[a different kind of truth]]\'\' was released on february 7. \n\nthree warm-up shows were played at [[cafe wha?]] in [[new york city]], [[henson recording studios|henson studios]] in [[hollywood|hollywood, california]], and [[the forum (inglewood)|the forum]] in [[inglewood, california]], followed by the kickoff off the 1st north american leg of the tour in [[louisville, kentucky]] on february 18, lasting until june 26th in [[new orleans]]. although another north american leg was scheduled to begin july 7 and last until september 25th, it was initially postponed indefinitely and then cancelled due to the band feeling overworked. in november, the band was scheduled visit japan for the first time since their 1998 [[iii tour]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vhnd.com/2012/06/15/van-halen-2012-japanese-tour-dates/ |title=van halen official japan 2012 tour dates! |publisher=van halen news desk |publisher=2012-06-15 |accessdate=
<page> <title>a_dirge</title><text>{{wikisource|a dirge (shelley)}}\n\"\'\'\'a dirge\'\'\'\" is a poem composed by [[percy bysshe shelley]].<ref>[http://www.recmusic.org/lieder/get_text.html?textid=14931 a dirge (shelley) at recmusic.org] retrieved march 23, 2010</ref>  it was published by his wife, [[mary shelley]], in 1824.<ref>[http://www.online-literature.com/shelley_percy/complete-works-of-shelley/177/ the complete poetical works of shelley: a dirge] retrieved march 23, 2010</ref>\n\n== poem ==\n<poem>\nrough wind, that moanest loud\ngrief too sad for song;\nwild wind, when sullen cloud\nknells all the night long;\nsad storm whose tears are vain,\nbare woods, whose branches strain,\ndeep caves and dreary main,—\nwail, for the world\'s wrong!\n</poem>\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist|2}}\n{{percy bysshe shelley}}\n\n{{defaultsort:dirge, a}}\n[[category:1824 poems]]\n[[category:british poems]]\n[[category:poetry by percy bysshe shelley]]\n\n\n{{poem-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>a_dream_within_a_dream</title><text>{{for|the vivid dream experience about awakening from sleep|false awakening}}\n\n\"\'\'\'a dream within a dream\'\'\'\" is a [[poetry|poem]] written by [[edgar allan poe]], first published in [[1849 in literature|1849]]. the poem is 24 lines, divided into two stanzas. the poem questions the way one can distinguish between reality and fantasy, asking, \"is \'\'all\'\' that we see or seem but a dream within a dream?\"\n\n{{wikisourcepar|a dream within a dream}}\n\n==analysis==\nthe poem dramatizes a confusion in watching the important things in life slip away.<ref name=silverman402>silverman, kenneth. \'\'edgar a. poe: mournful and never-ending remembrance\'\'. new york: harper perennial, 1991. p. 402 isbn 0-06-092331-8</ref> realizing he cannot hold onto even one grain of sand leads to his final question that all things are a dream.<ref name=sova73>sova, dawn b. \'\'edgar allan poe: a to z\'\'. new york: checkmark books, 2001: 73. isbn 0-8160-4161-x</ref>\n\nthe poem references \"golden sand,\" an image derived from the [[california gold rush|1848 discovery]] of [[gold]] in [[california]].<ref name=silverman402/>\n\n==publication history==\nthe poem was first published in the march 31, 1849 edition of a [[boston, massachusetts|boston]]-based [[periodical]] called \'\'flag of our union\'\'.<ref name=sova73/> the same publication had only two weeks before first published poe\'s short story \"[[hop-frog]].\" the next month, owner frederick gleason announced it could no longer pay for whatever articles and poems it published.\n\n==adaptations==\n*\'\'[[picnic at hanging rock (film)|picnic at hanging rock]]\'\', a story about a group of girls disappearing while on a field trip to a rock formation in the early 20th century, begins with a voice over that states \"\'\'what we see and what we seem is but a dream. a dream within a dream\'\'\". this line thereby becomes the mantra of the movie, and sticks with the viewer through
<page> <title>a_drink_in_the_passage</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=february 2012}}\n{{infobox film\n| name           = a drink in the passage\n| image          = \n| image size     = \n| alt            = \n| caption        = \n| director       = [[zola maseko]]\n| producer       = david max brown\n| writer         = [[alan paton]]\n| narrator       = \n| starring       = \n| music          = \n| distributor    = africa film library/ [[m-net]]\n| released       = 2002<!-- {{start date|yyyy|mm|dd}} -->\n| runtime        = 26 minutes\n| country        = [[south africa]]\n| language       = english\n| budget         = \n| gross          = \n| preceded by    = \n| followed by    = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a drink in the passage\'\'\'\'\' adapted from a short story by [[alan paton]], the celebrated south african writer who gave the world [[cry, the beloved country]], this short film is a stark reminder of the inhumanity and indignities of apartheid. a drink in the passage is the story of edward simelane who is awarded first prize in a national fine arts competition for his remarkable stone sculpture, called mother and child. but unbeknownst to him, the competition is for whites only. nonetheless, the judging panel decides to stick to its decision. in the ensuing national furor, the absurdities of legalised racial discrimination are gently, but tellingly, revealed.. \n \n==references==\n<references />\n== external links ==\n* {{imdb title|0353376|a drink in the passage}}\n\n{{defaultsort:drink in the passage}}\n[[category:south african films]]\n[[category:english-language films]]\n[[category:2002 films]]\n[[category:2000s drama films]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>a_drug_against_war</title><text>{{infobox single\n|  name        = a drug against war\n|  type        = [[single (music)|single]] \n|  b-side      = \"blood\"\n|  artist      = [[kmfdm]] \n|  cover       = drugagainstwar.jpg \n|  released    = september 14, 1993<ref name=\"amgonline\"/>\n|  recorded    = chicago recording company\n|  genre       = [[speed metal]]<ref name=\"cmj\"/><ref name =\"amgbook\"/>\n|  length      = 16:38\n|  label       = [[wax trax! records]]/[[tvt records]] \n|  producer    = kmfdm\n|  last single = \"[[sucks (song)|sucks]]\"<br />(1993)\n|  this single = \"a drug against war\"<br />(1993)\n|  next single = \"[[light (kmfdm song)|light]]\"<br />(1994)\n| misc      = {{extra music sample | filename=a drug against war.ogg | title=\"a drug against war\" | type=single}}\n}}\n{{album ratings\n| rev1 = [[allmusic]]\n| rev1score = {{rating|4|5}}<ref name=\"amgonline\"/>\n}}\n\n\"\'\'\'a drug against war\'\'\'\" is a song by [[industrial rock]] band [[kmfdm]] from their 1993 album \'\'[[angst (kmfdm album)|angst]]\'\'. it was released as a single prior to the album, and was shown on the [[mtv]] cartoon \'\'[[beavis and butt-head]]\'\' on july 11, 1994.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tv.com/beavis-and-butt-head/mr.-andersons-balls/episode/58234/summary.html#|title=mr. anderson\'s balls episode|publisher=[[tv.com]]|accessdate=february 28, 2010}}</ref> it was re-released as a 7\" in 2009. on december 16, 2010, it was made available as a downloadable song for the game \'\'[[rock band]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rockband.com/songs/ugc_5001447|title=a drug against war by kmfdm|publisher=[[harmonix music systems]], inc.| accessdate=june 6, 2012}}</ref>  in late 2011, the band released a new version of the song called \"a drug against wall street\", with lyrics in support of the [[occupy wall street]] movement, and made it available for free download from their site.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://coma-online.com/?p=7880 | title=coma m
<page> <title>a_dubious_legacy</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see [[wikipedia:wikiproject novels]] or\n[[wikipedia:wikiproject books]] -->\n| name          = a dubious legacy\n| title_orig    =\n| translator    =\n| image         = <!--prefer 1st edition-->\n| author        = [[mary wesley]]\n| illustrator   =\n| cover_artist  =\n| country       = united kingdom\n| language      = english\n| series        =\n| genre         = [[novel]]\n| publisher     = vintage (2008 edition)\n| pub_date      = 1992\n| english_pub_date =\n| media_type    = print\n| pages         = 319\n| isbn          =\n| preceded_by   =\n| followed_by   =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a dubious legacy\'\'\'\'\' (1992) is a novel written by the british author [[mary wesley]]. the story takes place in the [[west country]], england, from 1944 to 1990. it concerns the tragic and bizarre marriage of the tillotsons and their relationship with two young couples who keep visiting them throughout the years.\n\n==plot summary==\nwhile stationed abroad during [[world war ii]] henry tillotson has married a complete stranger at his father\'s  request. when the war is over, and his father has died, henry brings his bride with him back to his estate, cotteshaw, in the [[west country]]. the first thing the bride does on their arrival is to give her husband a black eye and without a word march upstairs to her bedroom where she will reside for the best part of the rest of her life.\ntwo young couples, antonia and matthew, and barbara and james, begin to visit cotteshaw frequently. unwilling to admit it, the two young ladies are attracted to the fifteen years older henry tillotson, and fascinated and frightened by his mysterious wife, margaret, who will endure their visits in her bedroom with bored superiority. margaret tillotson is beautiful - but mad. she likes to make up malicious stories about everyone at cotteshaw and enjoys inflicting pain on everyone who comes into range, preferably without lifting her head from the 
<page> <title>a_family_thing</title><text>{{for|the [[private practice (tv series)|\'\'private practice\'\']] episode|list of private practice episodes}}\n{{infobox film | name = a family thing\n  | image = familythingposter.jpg\n  | caption = \n  | director = [[richard pearce (film director)|richard pearce]]\n  | producer = michael hausman\t<br/>[[robert duvall]]\n  | writer = [[billy bob thornton]]<br/>[[tom epperson]]\n  | starring = [[robert duvall]]<br/>[[james earl jones]]<br/>[[irma p. hall]]<br/>[[michael beach]]\n  | music =\n  | cinematography = [[fred murphy (cinematographer)|fred murphy]]\n  | editing =\n  | distributor = [[united artists]]\n  | released = march 29, 1996 ([[united states|usa]])\n  | runtime = 109 minutes\n  | country = united states\n  | language = english\n  | budget = \n  }}\n\'\'\'\'\'a family thing\'\'\'\'\' is a 1996 film starring [[robert duvall]], [[james earl jones]] and [[irma p. hall]]. it was written by [[billy bob thornton]] and [[tom epperson]] and directed by [[richard pearce (film director)|richard pearce]].\n\n==plot==\nthe film is a drama about a [[scotch-irish american]] [[southern united states|southerner]] (duvall) named earl pilcher, whose late mother makes a shocking revelation in a letter that is given to him after her death. she reveals that earl\'s biological mother was an [[black american]] maid named willa mae, who was raped by earl\'s (white) father and that she died while giving birth to earl. his adoptive mother\'s dying wish is that he go to [[chicago]] to meet his half-brother, raymond murdoch (jones). ray blames earl\'s father for his own mother\'s death and does not want to speak to earl, whose very presence reminds ray of the past. but his loving aunt t. (hall) welcomes earl and insists the family accept him.\n\nearl initially takes the unexpected news of his mixed parentage badly, tearfully challenging his father to confirm the facts in the letter. as a result, he packs up his clothes and takes off for

<page> <title>a_foreign_field</title><text>{{no footnotes|date=march 2013}}\n{{infobox film\n| name=a foreign field\n| image=a-foreign-field.jpg\n| director=[[charles sturridge]]\n| writer=[[roy clarke]]\n| starring=[[alec guinness]]<br>[[leo mckern]]<br>[[edward herrmann]]<br>[[john randolph (actor)|john randolph]]<br>[[geraldine chaplin]]<br>[[lauren bacall]]<br>[[jeanne moreau]]\n| producer=[[martyn auty]]<br>richard broke<br>[[steve lanning]]\n| cinematography = [[richard greatrex]]\n| distributor=[[bbc]]\n| released=10 september 1993\n| runtime=95 min\n| country=united kingdom\n| language=english\n| budget=\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a foreign field\'\'\'\'\' (1993) is a motion picture about [[great britain|british]] and [[united states of america|american]] [[world war ii]] veterans returning to the beaches of [[normandy]] as old men. it is more a [[drama]] than a [[comedy]], although it combines aspects of both. it was directed by [[charles sturridge]] and featured an ensemble cast of american, australian, british, and french actors and actresses.\n\nthe film was made to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the [[d-day]] landings and was driven into production by alec guinness who used his influence with the bbc to make it and with the various famous actors to appear in it.\n\nit was shown only once on bbc1 at the time, but repeated a number of times some thirteen years later (2007) on the digital channel uktv history.\n\n==plot==\ncyril (mckern) and waldo (randolph), who are british and american, respectively, have both returned to france in search of the same woman (moreau) with whom they each had a rendezvous in 1944 (unknown to the other). cyril is accompanied by fellow veteran amos (guinness), while waldo has his petty daughter beverly (chaplin) and her henpecked husband (herrmann) in tow. the two groups encounter one another, and after some conflict find common ground in old sorrows. along the way they meet the recently widowed lisa (bacall), who has come in search

<page> <title>a_funny_thing_happened_on_the_way_to_the_forum</title><text>{{about|the musical|the film|a funny thing happened on the way to the forum (film)}}\n{{infobox musical\n|name=a funny thing happened<br> on the way to the forum\n|image=a-funny-thing-happened-on-the-way-to-the-forum.jpg\n|image_size=240px\n|caption=revival cast recording\n|music=[[stephen sondheim]]\n|lyrics=stephen sondheim\n|book=[[burt shevelove]]<br />[[larry gelbart]]\n|basis=\n|productions=1962 [[broadway theatre|broadway]]<br />1963 [[west end theatre|west end]]<br />1966 [[a funny thing happened on the way to the forum (film)|film]]<br />1972 broadway<br />1986 west end<br />1996 broadway<br />2004 [[royal national theatre]]<br />2009 [[kwai tsing theatre|hong kong]]<br />2009 [[stratford shakespeare festival]]<br />2012 [[her majesty\'s theatre|melbourne]]\n|awards=[[tony award for best musical]]<br />[[tony award for best book of a musical]]\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a funny thing happened on the way to the forum\'\'\'\'\' is a [[musical theatre|musical]] with music and lyrics by [[stephen sondheim]] and book by [[burt shevelove]] and [[larry gelbart]].\n\ninspired by the [[farce]]s of the [[ancient rome|ancient roman]] playwright [[plautus]] (251&ndash;183 bc), specifically \'\'[[pseudolus]]\'\', \'\'[[miles gloriosus (play)|miles gloriosus]]\'\' and \'\'[[mostellaria]]\'\', the musical tells the bawdy story of a [[slavery|slave]] named pseudolus and his attempts to win his freedom by helping his young master woo the girl next door. the plot displays many classic elements of [[farce]], including puns, the slamming of doors, cases of [[mistaken identity]] (frequently involving characters disguising themselves as one another), and satirical comments on social class. the title derives from the line that [[vaudeville]] comedians often used to begin a story: \"a funny thing happened on the way to the theater\".\n\nthe musical\'s original 1962 [[broadway theatre|broadway]] run won several [[tony aw
<page> <title>a_gathering_of_days</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name          = a gathering of days\n| image         = [[file:a gathering of days.jpg|200px]]\n| caption = front cover of unknown edition\n| author        = [[joan blos]]\n| illustrator   = \n| cover_artist  = robert papp\n| country       = [[united states]]\n| language      = [[english language|english]]\n| series        = \n| genre         = [[historical novel]]\n| publisher     = [[prentice hall]]\n| release_date  = 1979\n| media_type    = print ([[hardcover]] & [[paperback]])\n| pages         = 144\n| isbn          = isbn 978-0-684-16340-6\n| congress      = pz7.b6237 gat\n| oclc          = 5171140\n| preceded_by   = \n| followed_by   = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a gathering of days; a new england girl\'s journal, 1830-32\'\'\'\'\'  (1979) is a [[historical novel]] by [[joan blos]] that won the 1980 [[national book award for young people\'s literature|national book award for children\'s books]] (hardcover)<!-- national book awards were called \"american\" for several years from 1980, but must not be confused with [[american book awards]]\n --><ref name=nba1980>\n[http://www.nationalbook.org/nba1980.html \"national book awards – 1980\"]. [[national book foundation]]. retrieved 2012-02-21.</ref><ref group=lower-alpha>\nfrom 1980 to 1983 in [[national book award#history|national book award history]] there were dual awards for hardcover and paperback books in many categories. almost all of the paperback award-winners were reprints, including the 1980 children\'s paperback.</ref>\nand the 1980 [[newbery medal]] for excellence in [[united states of america|american]] [[children\'s literature]].\n\nthe book is written in the form of a [[journal]] kept by catherine hall, a young girl living in a rural village in [[new england]] with her [[widower]] father and younger sister.  the journal details her daily life between the years of 1830 and

group [[southern pacific (band)|southern pacific]].  it was released in 1986 as the first single from the album \'\'killbilly hill\'\'.  the song reached #17 on the \'\'[[billboard (magazine)|billboard]]\'\' [[hot country songs|hot country singles & tracks]] chart.<ref>{{cite book |title= the billboard book of top 40 country hits: 1944-2006, second edition|last=whitburn |first=joel |authorlink=joel whitburn |year=2004 |publisher=record research |page=326}}</ref>  it was written by group members tim goodman, [[john mcfee]], [[stu cook]] and [[keith knudsen]].\n\n==chart performance==\n{|class=\"wikitable sortable\"\n!align=\"left\"|chart (1986)\n!align=\"center\"|peak<br />position\n|-\n|align=\"left\"|u.s. \'\'billboard\'\' hot country singles country       = united states\n| language      = english\n| budget        = $1,820,000<ref>solomon, aubrey. \'\'twentieth century fox: a corporate and financial history (the scarecrow filmmakers series)\'\'. lanham, maryland: scarecrow press, 1989. isbn 978-0-8108-4244-1. p250</ref>\n| gross         = $1.5 million (us)<ref>\"top grosses of 1957\", \'\'variety\'\', 8 january 1958: 30</ref>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a hatful of rain\'\'\'\'\' is a 1957 dramatic film.  the movie was a rarity for its time, in its frank depiction of the effects of [[morphine]] [[drug addiction|addiction]]. it is a medically and sociologically accurate account of the effects of morphine on an addict and his family.<ref>aj giannini (1982). \'\'handbook of overdose and detoxification emergencies\'\'. new hyde park, ny: medical examination publishing co., p.166. isbn 0-87488-182-x</ref>\n\nit stars [[eva marie saint]], [[don murray (actor)|don murray]], [[anthony franciosa]], [[lloyd nolan]], and [[henry silva]]. the movie was adapted by [[michael v. gazzo]], [[alfred hayes (writer)|alfred hayes]], and [[carl foreman]] from the play by gazzo. foreman was blacklisted at the time of the film\'s release. the [[writers guild of america]] added
<page> <title>a_hidden_life</title><text>{{for|the 2001 brazilian film|a hidden life (film)}}\n{{unreferenced|date=march 2009}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a hidden life\'\'\'\'\' is a memoir by the dutch-american author [[johanna reiss]]. reiss won the newbery honor for her account of her experiences as a child during the holocaust, \'\'[[the upstairs room]]\'\', which was followed by a sequel \'\'[[the journey back]]\'\' (both published by [[harpercollins]]).\n\nin \'\'a hidden life\'\', [[johanna reiss]] recounts her visit to the home of her youth and the tragedy that followed. she had been 10 years old at the beginning of [[world war ii]], and spent nearly three years hiding from the nazis with a family in rural holland. in the postwar period, she immigrated to the united states. after living there for several years, she decided to visit the family that aided her during the harrowing nazi years. she made this journey in the summer of 1969, spending nearly two months in holland with her husband and her two young children. while there, she had to confront her painful memories. but during that time, a worse and more immediate tragedy befell her: her husband returned to america early and committed suicide. \'\'a hidden life\'\', which [[lucy kavaler]] calls \"one of the most moving books\" she has ever read, is the story of one woman\'s perseverance through past and present tragedy.\n\n\n{{defaultsort:hidden life}}\n[[category:american memoirs]]\n[[category:2009 books]]\n[[category:children in the holocaust]]\n[[category:harpercollins books]]\n[[category:works about children in war]]</text> </page>

derogatory towards women and with a slightly perverse sense of humour, but through this we can see that in a way, they are right: frost has no place in the mod
<page> <title>a_knight_in_camelot</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a knight in camelot\'\'\'\'\' is a 1998 [[tv movie]] starring [[whoopi goldberg]] and [[michael york (actor)|michael york]]. it was directed by roger young, distributed by [[disney]] and is loosely based on [[mark twain]]\'s \'\'[[a connecticut yankee in king arthur\'s court]]\'\'.\n\n==plot==\nscientist vivien morgan is zapped back to the medieval age and time of [[king arthur]] and [[camelot]], when her scientific machine malfunctions. she is sent back along with many objects from her desk, including her [[laptop]] and [[boom box]]. as she is sentenced to be burned at the stake, she discoveres among the laptop-data, that there will be a [[solar eclipse]] in short time. with her \"magical powers\" she makes the sun re-appear and is being knighted by king arthur as \'\'sir boss\'\' and becomes a member of the knights of the [[round table (camelot)|round table]]. she soon begins constructing devices that will not be present for many centuries, she saves the king, defeats sir sagramore and saves the day countless times before being zapped back to the present.\n\n==cast==\n* [[whoopi goldberg]] as dr. vivien morgan\n* <page> <title>a_little_bit_of_love</title><text>{{infobox single |\n| name = a little bit of love\n| cover =a little bit of love single cover rupaul.jpg\n| artist = [[rupaul]]\n| from album = foxy lady\n| released = february 25, 1997\n| format = [[cd]]\n| recorded = 1996\n|genre=  dance\n| length = 3:55\n| label = [[rhino records|rhino]]\n| producer = [[rupaul]] and [[joe carrano]]\n| last single = [[snapshot (song)|snapshot]]<br />(1996)\n| this single = \"a little bit of love\"<br />(1997)\n| next single = \"celebrate\"<br />(1997)\n| misc = \n}}\n\n\"\'\'\'a little bit of love\'\'\'\" is a song and music video performed and produced by [[drag queen|drag]] icon [[rupaul]] and released on february 25, 1997. this was the second single released from the [[foxy lady (rupaul album)|foxy lady]] album. the song was written by rupaul and joe carrano and released through [[rhino records]] and features guest vocals by vicki sue robinson.\n\nthe song reached number twenty-eight on the [[hot dance club play]] chart in the us. the cd single contained six remixes: welcome\'s extended original mix, moretta electro-funk mix, welcome\'s sly vocal extended mix, hot mix version mix, moretta love beats mix, and the edge factor dub mix. \n\nthe single\'s [[music video]] depicted rupaul along with female impersonator [[jazzmun]] and [[transgender]] cabaret performer [[candis cayne]] as aliens out to conquer the world. the video received a [[glaad media awards|glaad media award]] nomination for \"best video of 1998.\" the clip, directed by randy barbato and fenton bailey, was in included on rupaul\'s \'\'work it girl\'\' compilation dvd.\n\nrupaul performed the song that same year on \'\'[[ricki lake (talk show)|the ricki lake show]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoid=29880242 |title=video a little bit of love (live on ricki lake) van rupaul - myspace video |publisher=vids.myspace.com |date=2009-12-18 |accessdate=2012-02-01}}</re
<page> <title>a_little_fable</title><text>{{infobox short story | <!-- see [[wikipedia:wikiproject novels]] or [[wikipedia:wikiproject books]] -->\n| name          = a little fable\n| title_orig    = kleine fabel\n| translator    = \n| author        = [[franz kafka]]\n| country       = \n| language      = [[german language|german]]\n| series        =\n| genre         = [[short story]]\n| published_in  = \'\'[[the great wall of china (collection)|beim bau der chinesischen mauer]]\'\'\n| publication_type =\n| publisher     = \n| media_type    = book (hardcover)\n| pub_date      = 1931\n| english_pub_date = {{plainlist|\n* {{start date|1933}} london, {{nowrap|[[harvill secker (publisher)|martin secker]]}}\n* {{start date|1946}} new york, [[schocken books]]\n}}\n}}\n\"\'\'\'a little fable\'\'\'\" (\"\'\'\'kleine fabel\'\'\'\") is a short story written by [[franz kafka]] between 1917 and 1923, likely in 1920. the anecdote, only one paragraph in length, was not published in kafka\'s lifetime and first appeared in \'\'beim bau der chinesischen mauer\'\' (1931). the first english translation translation by [[edwin muir|willa and edwin muir]] was published by [[martin secker]] in london in 1933. it appeared in \'\'[[the great wall of china (collection)|the great wall of china. stories and reflections]]\'\' ([[new york]]: [[schocken books]], 1946).<ref>\'\'the great wall of china: stories and reflections\'\'. franz kafka - 1946 - schocken books</ref>\n\n== the story== \n\"alas\", said the mouse, \"the whole world is growing smaller every day. at the beginning it was so big that i was afraid, i kept running and running, and i was glad when i saw walls far away to the right and left, but these long walls have narrowed so quickly that i am in the last chamber already, and there in the corner stands the trap that i must run into.\" \n\n\"you only need to change your direction,\" said the cat, and ate it up.\n\n==popular culture==\na comics adaptation of the story, illustrated by
