<page> <title>a_million_little_pieces</title><text>{{use mdy dates|date=june 2013}}\n{{infobox book| <!--see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name          = a million little pieces\n| image         =  [[image:a million little pieces.jpg|200px|]]\n| image caption = cover by fredrik brodén \n| title_orig    =\n| translator    = english\n| author        = [[james frey]]\n| official website  = [http://www.bigjimindustries.com]\n| country       = united states\n| language      = english\n| series        = 1\n| genre         = [[memoir]]/[[fiction]]\n| publisher     = [[john murray (publisher)|john murray]]\n| release_date  = april 15, 2003\n| media_type    = print (hardback & paperback)\n| isbn          = 0-385-50775-5\n| dewey         = 362.29/092 b 21\n| congress      = hv5831.m6 f74 2003\n| oclc          = 51223590\n| followed_by   = [[my friend leonard]]\n\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a million little pieces\'\'\'\'\' is a [[semi-fiction]]al<ref>frey admitted in interviews that he had embellished central details of his purported incarceration for \"obvious dramatic reasons.\" [http://www.thesmokinggun.com/archive/0104061jamesfrey1.html the man who conned oprah]</ref> novel, originally sold as a [[memoir]], by [[james frey]]. it tells the story of a 23-year-old alcoholic and drug abuser and how he copes with rehabilitation in a [[twelve-step program|twelve steps]]-oriented treatment center. while initially promoted as a memoir, it was later discovered that many of the events described in the book never happened.\n\n==summary==\n\nthe badly tattered james awakens on an airplane to chicago, with no recollection of his injuries or of how he ended up on the plane. he is met by his parents at the airport, who take him to a rehabilitation clinic.  we find out that james is 23 years old, and has been an alcoholic for ten years, and a crack addict for three.  he is also wanted by the police in three different states on several charges.\n\nas he checks in
<page> <title>a_minor_adjustment</title><text>{{infobox play\n|name       = a minor adjustment\n|image      = \n|image_size = \n|caption    = \n|writer     = eric nicol\n|chorus     = \n|characters = \n|mute       = \n|setting    = \n|premiere   = 6 october 1967 \n|place      = \n|orig_lang  = english\n|series     = \n|subject    = \n|genre      = \n|web        = \n|playbill   = \n|ibdb_id    = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a minor adjustment\'\'\'\'\' is a 1967 play.<ref>[http://www.playbillvault.com/show/detail/8051/a-minor-adjustment playbill for original production] accessed 16 june 2013</ref> it was written by eric nicol, a canadian humorist and the original production cost $72,000 and closed after 13 performances.<ref>albee adaptation acquired by fox: film rights to \'everything in garden\' bring $300,000\nby sam zolotow. new york times (1923-current file) [new york, n.y] 09 oct 1967: 60. </ref> it received a poor review in the \'\'new york times\'\'.<ref>the theater: \'a minor adjustment\': redfield in comedy at the brooks atkinson\nby clive barnes. new york times (1923-current file) [new york, n.y] 08 oct 1967: 84. </ref>\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n==external links==\n*[http://ibdb.com/production.php?id=2953 \'\'a minor adjustment\'\'] at [[ibdb]]\n[[category:1967 plays]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>a_motown_christmas</title><text>{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name     = a motown christmas\n| type     = compilation\n| artist   = various [[motown]] artists\n| cover    = amotownchristmas.jpg\n| released = 1973\n| genre    = [[bubblegum pop]], [[soul music|soul]], [[christmas music]]\n| length   = 75:34\n| label    = [[motown]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a motown christmas\'\'\'\'\' is a [[christmas music]] [[compilation album]], originally released as a 2-lp set by [[motown records]] in 1973. it contains various seasonal singles and album tracks recorded by some of the label\'s artists from the 1960s and early 1970s. much of the music is from an earlier album, \'\'merry christmas from motown,\'\' 1968.<ref>allmusic.com \'\'merry christmas from motown\'\' http://www.allmusic.com/album/merry-christmas-from-motown-1968-mw0000856933</ref>\n\nthe music has several times been recycled into different packagings.  in 1992, the album was reissued on [[compact disc]], with all 24 tracks from the original album on one cd. in 1999, a new single-cd version was released, with a bonus track by [[marvin gaye]] added (\"i want to come home for christmas\").\n\na second compilation, \'\'a motown christmas, volume 2\'\', was issued on cd in 2001.\n\n==track listing, \'\'merry christmas from motown\'\'==\n;side 1\n#\'\'[[santa claus is coming to town]]\'\'&nbsp; – [[the supremes]]\n#\'\'christmas everyday\'\'&nbsp;- [[smokey robinson and the miracles]]\n#\'\'what christmas means to me\'\'&nbsp;– [[stevie wonder]]\n#\'\'[[rudolph the red-nosed reindeer]]\'\'&nbsp;– [[the temptations]]\n#\'\'my christmas tree\'\'&nbsp;– [[the supremes]]\n#\'\'white christmas\'\'- irving berlin\n;side 2\n#\'\'[[ave maria]]\'\'&nbsp;– stevie wonder\n#\'\'[[silent night]]\'\'&nbsp;– the temptations\n#\'\'[[god rest ye merry, gentlemen]]\'\'&nbsp;– smokey robinson\n#\'\'[[silver bells]]\'\'&nbsp;– the supremes\n#\'\'one little christmas tree\'\'&nbsp;– 
<page> <title>a_new_era_of_corruption</title><text>{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a new era of corruption\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[whitechapel (band)|whitechapel]]\n| cover       = aneweraofcorruption.jpg\n| released    = june 8, 2010\n| recorded    = december 27, 2009-march 31, 2010 <small>at audio hammer studios</small>, [[orlando, florida]]\n| genre       = [[deathcore]]\n| length      = 41:39\n| label       = [[metal blade records|metal blade]]\n| producer    = [[jason suecof]]\n| last album  = \'\'[[this is exile]]\'\'<br />(2008)\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'a new era of corruption\'\'\'\'\'<br />(2010)\n| next album  = \'\'[[recorrupted]]\'\'<br />(2011)\n| misc        = {{singles\n  |name       = a new era of corruption\n  |type       = studio\n  |single 1       = the darkest day of man\n  |single 1 date  =\n  |single 2       = breeding violence\n  |single 2 date  =\n}}}}\n\n{{album ratings\n| rev1 = [[allmusic]]\n| rev1score = {{rating|3|5}} [{{allmusic|class=album|id=r1800469|pure_url=yes}} link]\n| rev2 = the new review\n| rev2score = {{rating|5|5}} [http://thenewreview.net/reviews/whitechapel-a-new-era-of-corruption link]\n| rev3 = [[rock sound]]\n| rev3score = {{rating|8|10}} [http://www.rocksound.tv/reviews/article/whitechapel-new-era-of-corruption link]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a new era of corruption\'\'\'\'\' is the third studio album by [[whitechapel (band)|whitechapel]]. it was released worldwide on june 8, 2010, through [[metal blade records]]. in the usa, just under 10,700 copies were sold in the first week, placing it at no. 43 on the \'\'[[billboard 200]]\'\' chart.<ref>[http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=article&newsitemid=141642 whitechapel: \'a new era of corruption\' cracks u.s. top 50 – june 16, 2010]</ref>\n\n==history and background==\nthe recording session for \'\'a new era of corruption\'\' ran from december 27, 2009, to march 2010 with [[jason suecof]
<page> <title>a_new_literary_history_of_america</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a new literary history of america\'\'\'\'\'<ref>{{cite book|title=a new literary history of america|year=2009|publisher=[[harvard university press]]|first=greil|last=marcus|authorlink=greil marcus|first2=werner|last2=sollors|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=ehnapgaacaaj&dq=a+new+literary+history+of+america|isbn=978-0-674-03594-2|accessdate=september 24, 2009}}</ref>is a collection of essays edited by [[greil marcus]] and [[werner sollors]]. its roughly 200 essays span a range of topics that the editors selected as a sample of the different voices and perspectives on [[north america]] since the genesis of the european concept of a [[new world]].<ref name=nytreview>{{cite news|title=the essence of america in 1,095 pages|first=patricia|last=cohen|date=september 22, 2009|accessdate=september 24, 2009|newspaper=[[the new york times]]|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/23/books/23harvard.html}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{defaultsort:new literary history of america}}\n[[category:2009 books]]\n[[category:american history books]]\n[[category:21st-century history books]]\n[[category:essay collections]]\n[[category:history books about literature]]\n\n{{nonfiction-book-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>a_pagan_poem</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a pagan poem\'\'\'\'\' is a [[tone poem]] for [[orchestra]] composed in 1906 by [[charles martin loeffler]].  originally scored for [[piano]], [[woodwind]]s, [[violin]], and [[contrabass]], the work was soon rescored for two pianos and three [[trumpet]]s.  the final version, which in addition to traditional forces included piano [[obbligato]], solo [[english horn]], and three solo trumpets, was introduced on november 23, 1907 by the [[boston symphony]] under the direction of [[karl muck]].\n\nloeffler derived his inspiration for the work from the eighth [[eclogue]] of [[virgil]], in which a maiden of [[thessaly]] uses magic to revive her lover\'s ardor once he has deserted her.  rather than follow the program literally, the composer chose to depict moods and feelings suggested by the text.  the trumpets are used offstage, first against a background of piano and [[timpani]] and next  as [[chromatic]] accompaniment to a declamation from the english horn.\n\n==references==\n*david ewen, \'\'encyclopedia of concert music\'\'.  new york; hill and wang, 1959.\n\n{{defaultsort:pagan poem}}\n[[category:1906 compositions]]\n[[category:compositions by charles martin loeffler]]\n[[category:symphonic poems]]\n{{classical-composition-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>a_period_of_transition</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=november 2012}}\n{{use british english|date=november 2012}}\n{{infobox album | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n  name        = a period of transition |\n  type        = [[album]] |\n  artist      = [[van morrison]] |\n  cover       = period of transition album cover.jpg |\n  released    = april 1977 |\n  recorded    = autumn 1976/early winter 1977 |\n  genre       = [[folk rock]], [[rhythm and blues|r&b]] |\n  length      = 34:12 |\n  label       = [[warner bros. records|warner bros.]] |\n  producer    = van morrison, [[dr. john]] |\n  last album  = \'\'[[veedon fleece]]\'\'<br />(1974) |\n  this album  = \'\'\'\'\'a period of transition\'\'\'\'\'<br />(1977) |\n  next album  = \'\'[[wavelength (album)|wavelength]]\'\'<br />(1978) |\n|misc        = {{singles\n  | name           =a period of transition\n  | type           =studio\n  | single 1       =[[the eternal kansas city]]\" b/w \"joyous sound\n  | single 1 date  =april 1977\n  | single 2       =joyous sound\" b/w \"mechanical bliss\n  | single 2 date  =july 1977\n  | single 3       =\n  | single 3 date  =\n  | single 4       =\n  | single 4 date  =\n  }}\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a period of transition\'\'\'\'\' is the ninth [[studio album]] by [[northern irish]] [[singer/songwriter]] [[van morrison]], released in 1977 (see [[1977 in music]]). it was his first album in two and a half years, largely forgotten or looked over by most casual fans.  at the time of its release it was received with some disappointment by critics and fans: \"most were hoping for a work of primeval vocal aggression that would challenge the emerging élite of morrison pretenders, whose ranks included [[bruce springsteen]], [[bob seger]], [[phil lynott]], [[graham parker]] and [[elvis costello]].\"<ref>rogan. \'\'no surrender\'\', p.309</ref>([[johnny rogan]]) however, the album is still notable for several major compositions, including \"heavy connection,\" \"flamingo
<page> <title>a_physical_presence</title><text>{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a physical presence\n| type        = live\n| artist      = [[level 42]]\n| cover       = \n| released    = june 1985\n| recorded    = march 1985\n| genre       = \n| length      = 89:38 (2 cd edition)\n                65:18 (1 cd edition)\n| label       = \n| producer    = greg jackman, level 42\n| reviews     = \n| last album  = \n| this album  = \n| next album  = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a physical presence\'\'\'\'\' is a two-disc live album by the british jazz-funk pop group [[level 42]], released in june 1985 and recorded in england during march 1985 at the coronet woolwich, the hexagon, reading and goldiggers, [[chippenham]], [[wiltshire]].<ref>[http://level42.150m.com/physical_presence_album.html \" a physical presence\" info page<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref> this album is notable for being the first live album by level 42, and for containing a previously unreleased song (\"follow me\", which was later remixed and issued as part of an e.p.) and a live recording of a non-lp track (\"foundation & empire\", originally b-side of \"[[starchild (song)|starchild]]\",<ref>[http://level42.150m.com/starchild.html \"starchild\" single info page<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref> available on the 2000 cd reissue of \"[[level 42 (album)|level 42]])\". \"love games\" is preceded by an extended bass intro, which contains also part of \"dune tune\". also, the first track (\"almost there\") starts with a taped intro which quotes \"hot water\".\noriginally issued in the uk as a two-album set and long-play cassette, the version issued on cd consisted of a single disc, omitting three tracks (\"turn it on\", \"mr pink\" and \"88\"). those tracks were restored when the remastered version of the album was issued in a two-cd set in 2000.\n\n==track listing==\n===disc one===\n\n#\"almost there\" (king / p. gould/ r. gould)&nbsp;– 6:47\n#\"turn it on\" (badarou / p. 
<page> <title>a_pistol_for_ringo</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name           = a pistol for ringo\n| image          = una pistola per ringo.jpg\n| image size     =\n| caption        =\n| director       = [[duccio tessari]]\n| producer       = [[luciano ercoli]]<br>[[alberto pugliese]]\n| writer         = \'\'\'story:\'\'\'<br>duccio tessari<br>\'\'\'screenplay:\'\'\'<br>duccio tessari<br>[[alfonso balcázar]]\n| narrator       =\n| starring       = [[giuliano gemma|montgomery wood]]<br>[[fernando sancho]]<br>[[nieves navarro]]<br>[[antonio casas]]<br>[[josé manuel martín]]<br>[[lorella de luca|hally hammond]]\n| music          = [[ennio morricone]]\n| cinematography = [[francisco marín]]\n| editing        = [[licia quaglia]]\n| distributor    = [[embassy pictures corporation]]\n| released       = {{film date|1965|5|12|df=y}}<br>{{film date|1966|11|2}}\n| runtime        = 98 min.\n| country        = italy/spain\n| language       = [[italian language|italian]]\n| budget         =\n| gross          = 17,379,404 ₧ ([[spanish peseta|esp]])\n}}\n\n\'\'\'a pistol for ringo\'\'\' (\'\'\'{{lang-it|una pistola per ringo}}\'\'\') is a 1965 [[spaghetti western]], a joint italian and spanish production. originally written and directed by duccio tessari, the film\'s success led to a sequel, \'\'[[the return of ringo]]\'\', later that year. \n\nthe film starred [[giuliano gemma]] billed as montgomery wood and co-starred [[fernando sancho]], [[nieves navarro]], [[george martin (spanish actor)|george martin]], [[antonio casas]], [[josé manuel martín]] and [[lorella de luca|hally hammond]].<ref>hughes, howard. \'\'once upon a time in the italian west: the filmgoers\' guide to spaghetti westerns\'\'. new york: i.b. tauris & co., 2004. (pg. xii) isbn 1-85043-896-x</ref>\n\n==plot==\nthe film opens as the films protagonist, a gunfighter known as \"angel face\" or ringo, kills four men in a gunfight. he is then arrested for manslaughter and locked up in the city jail where he aw
<page> <title>a_place_in_england</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see [[wikipedia:wikiproject novels]] or [[wikipedia:wikiproject books]] -->\n| name          = a place in england\n| title_orig    = \n| translator    = \n| image         = <!-- prefer 1st ed. cover -->\n| caption = \n| author        = [[melvyn bragg]]\n| illustrator   = \n| cover_artist  = \n| country       = united kingdom\n| language      = english\n| series        = [[cumbrian trilogy]]\n| genre         = [[family saga]]\n| publisher     = [[secker & warburg]]\n| pub_date      = 1970\n| english_pub_date =\n| media_type    = print ([[hardcover]])\n| pages         = 247 pp\n| isbn          = 0-436-06706-4 \n| dewey= 823/.9/14\n| congress= pz4.b8125 pl pr6052.r263\n| oclc= 124366\n| preceded_by   = [[the hired man]]\n| followed_by   = [[kingdom come (bragg novel)|kingdom come]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a place in england\'\'\'\'\' is a novel by [[melvyn bragg]], first published in 1970. it is the second part of bragg\'s [[cumbrian trilogy]].\n\nthe story is set predominantly in thurston (bragg\'s name for [[wigton]]), from the 1920s to the 1960s, and follows the life of joseph tallentire, a labourer, footman, and eventually publican. joseph is the son of john tallentire, the central character of bragg\'s \'\'[[the hired man]]\'\', and father of douglas tallentire, central character of \'\'[[kingdom come (bragg novel)|kingdom come]]\'\'.\n\n{{cumbrian trilogy}}\n\n{{defaultsort:place in england, a}}\n[[category:1970 novels]]\n[[category:british novels]]\n[[category:novels by melvyn bragg]]\n[[category:novels set in cumbria]]\n[[category:secker & warburg books]]\n\n\n{{novel-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>a_private_state</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a private state\'\'\'\'\' (1997) is a collection of short stories by [[charlotte bacon (author)|charlotte bacon]]. it won the [[hemingway foundation/pen award|ernest hemingway foundation/pen award]] (1998), and the [[association of writers & writing programs|associated writing programs award for short fiction]] (1996).<ref name=pw/> a story from the collection \"live free or die,\" won the 1996 [[pirate\'s alley faulkner society award]] for best short story.<ref name=pw>{{cite web |url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/978-1-55849-114-4 |title=private state -awp |work=[[publishers weekly]] |author=[[staff writer]] |date=november 3, 1997 |accessdate=december 17, 2012}}</ref>\n\n==reception==\nwriting in the \'\'new york times book review\'\', [[lisa zeidner]], a professor of english at [[rutgers university]], said:\n:bacon is attempting to produce exciting fiction about essentially unexciting and predictable lives -- a surprisingly difficult task. it\'s hard to get the balance right between dailiness and drama. readers may occasionally wish that these women and bacon\'s stories took more chances. she often succeeds..<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nytimes.com/books/first/b/bacon-private.html |title=frequent fliers |work=[[new york times book review]] |author=lisa zeidner |date=march 1, 1998 |accessdate=december 17, 2012}}</ref>\n\n==editions==\n*charlette bacon. \'\'a private state\'\', [[university of massachusetts press]], 1997.  isbn 1-55849-114-7\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{defaultsort:private state}}\n[[category:1997 short story collections]]\n[[category:american short story collections]]\n[[category:single-writer short story collections]]\n[[category:short story collection stubs]]\n\n\n{{story-collection-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>a_public_disservice_announcement</title><text>{{infobox album<!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a public disservice announcement\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[methods of mayhem]]\n| cover       = methods of mayhem a public disservice announcement cover.jpg\n| format      = [[compact disc|cd]]\n| released    = september 21, 2010\n| recorded    = march 2009&ndash;2010\n| length      = 43:06\n| genre       = [[rock music|rock]], [[nu metal]], [[rap rock]], [[rap metal]], [[electronic rock]], [[electronica]],  [[dance-rock]]\n| producer    = [[scott humphrey]], [[tommy lee]]\n| label       = [[roadrunner records|roadrunner]]/loud & proud\n| last album  = \'\'[[methods of mayhem (album)|methods of mayhem]]\'\'<br/>(1999)\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'a public disservice announcement\'\'\'\'\'<br/>(2010)\n}}\n{{album ratings\n|rev1 = [[allmusic]]\n|rev1score = {{rating|3|5}}<ref>{{cite web|url={{allmusic|class=album|id=r1948745|pure_url=yes}}|title=a public disservice announcement - methods of mayhem|publisher=[[allmusic]]}}</ref>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a public disservice announcement\'\'\'\'\' is the second album by the band [[methods of mayhem]], released on september 21, 2010.\n\n==album information==\nthe album, produced by [[scott humphrey]], is unique in that it is composed partially of renditions and parts submitted by individuals from around the world based on the demos [[stem (music)|(stems)]] of each song that were posted online at [[thepublicrecord.com]]. both the band and humphrey listened to the recordings, which numbered over 10,000&nbsp;– choosing the best and most fitting submission ideas to add to the songs final mix.  in speaking about those who submitted their parts to the music, vocalist [[tommy lee]] said that:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=article&newsitemid=136018|title=methods of mayhem\'s \'a public disservice announcement\' due in may|publisher=blabbe
<page> <title>a_raisin_in_the_sun</title><text>{{otheruses}}\n{{infobox play\n| image      = raisininthesun.jpg\n| image_size = \n| image_alt  = front cover of the first edition\n| caption    = first-edition publication ([[random house]] 1959)\n| writer     = [[lorraine hansberry]]\n| characters = {{plainlist|\n*walter younger\n*ruth younger\n*travis younger\n*lena younger (mama)\n*beneatha younger\n*george murchison\n*joseph asagai\n}}\n| mute       = \n| setting    = [[south side, chicago]]\n| premiere   = {{start date|1959|03|11}}\n| place      = [[ethel barrymore theatre]]\n| orig_lang  = english\n| series     = \n| subject    = \n| genre      = [[domestic tragedy]]\n| web        = \n| playbill   = \n| ibdb_id    = 1252\n| theatricalia_id = 48b/a-raisin-in-the-sun\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a raisin in the sun\'\'\'\'\' is a play by [[lorraine hansberry]] that debuted on [[broadway theatre|broadway]] in 1959.<ref>http://www.ibdb.com/production.php?id=2083</ref>  the title comes from the poem \"harlem\" (also known as \"[[a dream deferred]]\"<ref>http://www.cswnet.com/~menamc/langston.htm</ref>) by [[langston hughes]]. the story is based upon a black family\'s experiences in the [[washington park subdivision]] of [[chicago, illinois|chicago]]\'s [[woodlawn, chicago|woodlawn]] neighborhood.\n\n==plot==\nwalter and ruth younger and their son travis, along with walter\'s mother lena (mama) and sister beneatha, live in poverty in a dilapidated two-bedroom apartment on chicago\'s south side. walter is barely making a living as a limousine driver. though ruth is content with their lot, walter is not and desperately wishes to become wealthy, to which end he plans to invest in a liquor store in partnership with willy, a street-smart acquaintance of walter\'s whom we never meet. at the beginning of the play, mama is waiting for an insurance check for ten thousand dollars. walter has a sense of entitlement to the money, but mama has religious objections to alcohol and beneatha has to 
<page> <title>a_random_walk_down_wall_street</title><text>{{infobox book\n |name = a random walk down wall street\n |author = [[burton malkiel]]\n | image        = [[image:book cover random walk.jpg|150px]]\n |genre = [[finance]]\n |language = [[english language|english]]\n |publisher = [[w. w. norton & company, inc.]]\n |release_date = 1973\n |pages = 456\n |isbn = 0-393-06245-7\n| dewey= 332.6 22\n| congress= hg4521 .m284 2007\n| oclc= 72798896\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a random walk down wall street\'\'\'\'\', written by [[burton malkiel|burton gordon malkiel]], a [[princeton university|princeton]] [[economics|economist]], is an influential [[book]] on the subject of [[stock market]]s which popularized the [[random walk hypothesis]].  malkiel argues that asset prices typically exhibit signs of [[random walk]] and that one cannot consistently [[alpha (investment)|outperform market averages]].  the book is frequently cited by those in favor of the [[efficient market hypothesis]]. as of 2012, there have been eleven editions.<ref>burton malkiel (2011) [http://worldcat.org/oclc/50919959 \'\'a random walk down wall street: the time-tested strategy for successful investing\'\']</ref> a practical popularization is \'\'the random walk guide to investing: ten rules for financial success\'\'.<ref>hardback: isbn 978-0-393-05854-3, paperback: isbn 978-0-393-32639-0</ref>\n\n==investing techniques==\nmalkiel examines some popular investing techniques, including [[technical analysis]] and [[fundamental analysis]], in light of academic research studies of these methods. through detailed analysis, he notes significant flaws in both techniques, concluding that, for most investors, following these methods will produce inferior results over passive strategies.\n\nmalkiel has a similar critique for methods of selecting actively managed mutual funds based upon past performance. he cites studies indicating that actively managed mutual funds vary greatly in their success rates over the long term
<page> <title>a_rap_on_race</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name          = a rap on race\n| title_orig    = \n| translator    = \n| image         = [[image:raponrace.jpg|175px]]\n| caption = first edition cover\n| author        = [[james baldwin]], [[margaret mead]]\n| illustrator   = \n| cover_artist  = \n| country       = [[united states]]\n| language      = [[english language|english]]\n| series        = \n| subject       = \n| genre         = \n| publisher     = [[j. b. lippincott]]\n| release_date  = 1971\n| media_type    = \n| pages         =\n| isbn          = \n| preceded_by   = \n| followed_by   = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a rap on race\'\'\'\'\' is a [[non-fiction]] book co-authored by [[james baldwin]] and [[margaret mead]]. it consists of a conversation on a tape recorder, transcribed into a book.\n\n==summary introduction==\nthe transcript mentions \'[[new guinea]], [[south africa]], [[women\'s lib]], the south, [[slavery in the united states|slavery]], [[christianity]], their early childhood upbringings, [[israel]], the arabs, the bomb, [[paris]], [[istanbul]], the [[english language]], [[huey newton]], [[john wayne]], the [[black bourgeoisie]], baldwin\'s 2-year-old grand nephew and professor mead\'s daughter.\'<ref name=\"new york times review\">[[new york times]], \'\'a rap on race\'\' by richard elman, june 27, 1971 [http://www.nytimes.com/books/98/03/29/specials/baldwin-race.html]</ref>\n\n==literary significance and criticism==\nthe book has been dismissed as \"baloney\", under the assumption that it was solely published because the two talkers were famous.<ref name=\"new york times review\"/>\n\n==references==\n{{refimprove|date=december 2009}}\n{{one source|date=december 2009}}\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{james baldwin}}\n\n{{defaultsort:rap on race, a}}\n[[category:1971 books]]\n[[category:books by james baldwin]]\n[[category:books by margaret mead]]\n[[category:j.b. lippincott & co. boo

<page> <title>a_river_of_roses</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a river of roses\'\'\'\'\' is the fourth novel by [[singapore]]an [[eurasian]] writer [[rex shelley]], first published in 1998 by times book international. the novel was awarded the dymocks singapore literature prize in 2000.<ref>http://www.bookcouncil.sg/_writers/pdf/slp%20winners%20(1992-2010).pdf. retrieved april 4, 2013.</ref><ref>http://infopedia.nl.sg/articles/sip_1641_2010-01-31.html. retrieved april 4, 2013.</ref>\n\n==plot summary==\nthe novel is a saga about four generations of the eurasian rosario family, who have [[malay people|malay]] and [[portuguese people|portuguese]] blood in them. (\"rosario\" is [[portuguese language|portuguese]] for \"rosary\", or \'\'rosa\'\', i.e., \"rose\" and \'\'rio\'\', i.e. \"river\", which form the title.)<ref>wong, alan. \"under the pear tree\", \'\'[[the star (malaysia)|the star]]\'\', november 13, 2011. http://thestar.com.my/lifestyle/story.asp?file=/2011/11/13/lifebookshelf/9774312. retrieved april 4, 2013.</ref> it follows the exploits of alfonso rosario, an illiterate fisherman born in 1870 who was later promoted to be the [[regidor]] of a [[british malaya|malaya]]n village. the novel then moves on to his grandchildren antonio and philippa, who shift from [[malacca]] to singapore. finally it ends in 1966–7, when his great-grandson ignatius rosario enrolls in the country\'s first [[junior college]] and is then enlisted into the first intake of singapore\'s [[conscription in singapore|military national service]]. some characters from his earlier novels re-appear as minor characters in this instalment, for example vicky viera from \'\'[[island in the centre]]\'\', and gus perera and ah keh from \'\'[[people of the pear tree]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{defaultsort:river of roses, a}}\n[[category:singaporean novels]]\n[[category:1998 novels]]\n[[category:novels set in singapore]]\n[[category:novels set in malaysia]]\n{{1990s-novel-stub}}</text> </page
<page> <title>a_romance_of_mayfair</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name           = a romance of mayfair\n| image          = \n| caption        = \n| director       = [[thomas bentley]]\n| producer       = \n| writer         = j.c. snaith (novel)\n| screenplay     = \n| story          = \n| based on       = <!-- {{based on|title of the original work|writer of the original work}} -->\n| starring       = [[betty faire]]<br>[[henry victor]]<br>molly johnson<br>[[fred raynham]]\n| music          = \n| cinematography = \n| editing        = \n| studio         = stoll pictures\n| distributor    = stoll pictures\n| released       = 1925\n| runtime        = \n| country        = united kingdom\n| language       = \n| budget         = \n| gross          = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a romance of mayfair\'\'\'\'\' is a 1925 british romance film directed by [[thomas bentley]] and starring [[betty faire]], [[henry victor]] and molly johnson.<ref>http://ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/title/48739</ref> the love affair between the heir to a [[duke]] and a young actress is almost ruined because of the gulf in class between them. it was based on the novel \'\'the crime of constable kelly\'\' by j.c. snaith and made by stoll pictures at their [[cricklewood studios]].\n\n==cast==\n* [[betty faire]] - mary lawrence \n* [[henry victor]] - jack dinneford \n* molly johnson - lady blanche \n* [[fred raynham]] - sir dugald maclean \n* [[edward o\'neill (actor)|edward o\'neill]] - duke of bridport \n* [[george foley (actor)|george foley]] - sergeant kelly \n* temple bell - millie wren \n* [[reginald bach]] - lord wrexham \n* [[gertrude sterroll]] - lady wargrave \n* eva westlake - mrs. wren \n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* {{imdb title|0239908|a romance of mayfair}}\n\n{{thomas bentley}}\n\n{{defaultsort:romance of mayfair}}\n[[category:1925 films]]\n[[category:british films]]\n[[category:english-language films]]\n[[category:films directed by thomas bentley]]\n[[category:1920s romance film

<page> <title>a_soldier_of_the_great_war</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name          = a soldier of the great war\n| title_orig    = \n| translator    = \n| image         = <!--prefer 1st edition-->\n| image_caption = \n| author        = [[mark helprin]]\n| illustrator   = \n| cover_artist  =  \n| country       = [[united states]]\n| language      = [[english language|english]]\n| series        = \n| subject       = <!-- subject is not relevant for fiction -->\n| genre         = [[war novel]]\n| publisher     = [[harcourt (publisher)|harcourt]]\n| pub_date      = may 1991 \n| english_pub_date = \n| media_type    = print ([[hardcover|hardback]] & [[paperback]])\n| pages         = 804 pp \n| isbn          = 978-0-15-183600-0\n| dewey= 813/.54 20\n| congress= ps3558.e4775 s65 1990\n| oclc= 22308235\n| preceded_by   = \n| followed_by   = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a soldier of the great war\'\'\'\'\' (1991) is a novel by [[mark helprin]] concerning an aged [[world war i]] veteran who recounts his life and adventures while traveling with a young man he meets after the two of them are thrown off a bus, the former leaving after the latter is refused entry, as the older man marches toward a visit with his granddaughter, neither knowing the outcome of their journey. \n\nas a young man, alessandro giuliani foresees italy\'s entry into the great war and joins the navy rather than waiting to be drafted into the more dangerous infantry. this reasoned and logical course of action has no place in a world gone mad, and alessandro\'s life, loves, friendships and fortunes all take bizarre and often tragic turns. still, alessandro is able to find beauty not so much because he is a professor of aesthetics (though he is) but because he is profoundly spiritual. as he nears the end of his life story, alessandro tells his young companion, \"and yet if you asked me what [the truth] was, i can\'t tell you. i can tell you only
<page> <title>a_song_of_stone</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name         = a song of stone\n| orig title   =\n| translator   =\n| image        = [[file:asongofstone.jpg|200px]]\n| caption = 1st edition\n| author       = [[iain banks]]\n| cover_artist = \n| country      = scotland\n| language     = english\n| series       = \n| genre        = \n| publisher    = [[abacus (publishers)|abacus]]\n| release_date = 1997\n| media_type   = print ([[hardcover|hardback]] & [[paperback]])\n| pages        = 280 pp\n| isbn         = 0-349-11011-5\n| oclc= 60211679\n| preceded_by  = \n| followed_by  = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a song of stone\'\'\'\'\' is a [[novel]] by scottish writer [[iain banks]], published in 1997.\n\n==plot introduction==\na novel about an [[aristocracy (class)|aristocrat]]\'s experience of [[civil war]].\n\n==plot summary==\nabel and morgan, an aristocratic couple of brother and sister, live in a small [[castle]] in an indeterminate place and time of civil war. they decide to abandon their home and join a treck of [[refugee]]s seeking safety. a group of [[irregular military|irregular]]s led by a woman called \"the lieutenant\" (or \"loot\") stops them and takes them back to the castle, which the irregulars proceed to fortify as a base. they loot the castle, and morgan is seduced by the lieutenant. a rival faction attacks the castle with [[artillery]] and abel is taken along with the fighters on a [[counter-attack]]. when they return, abel almost shoots the lieutenant and there is a violent and nihilistic ending.\n\n\'\'a song of stone\'\' tells the frightening story of what happens when the normal rules of society break down. themes of [[incest]], [[violence]] and [[war]] are intertwined with the lives of the rather pompous but lyrical disgraced aristocrat abel, his vacuous and submissive sister morgan, the ruthless lieutenant and her soldiers with names like \"psycho\", \"karma\" and \"dea

<page> <title>a_step_from_heaven</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_novels or wikipedia:wikiproject_books -->\n| name         = a step from heaven\n| image        = [[file:a step from heaven (an na novel) cover art.jpg|200px|cover]]\n| caption      =\n| author       = [[an na]]\n| country      = [[united states]]\n| language     = [[english language|english]]\n| translator   =\n| cover_artist =\n| genre        = [[young adult novel]]\n| publisher    = [[casemate publishers|front street press]]\n| release_date = [[2001 in literature|2001]]\n| media_type   = print ([[hardcover|hardback]] & [[paperback]])\n| pages        = 156\n| isbn         = 1-886910-58-8\n| congress     = pz7.n1243 st 2001\n| oclc         = 44703366\n| preceded_by  =\n| followed_by  =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a step from heaven\'\'\'\'\' is the first novel by [[an na]], published in 2001 by [[casemate publishers|front street press]]. it won the 2002 [[michael l. printz award]] from the [[american library association]].<ref name=ala>american library association: michael l. printz winners and honor books [http://www.ala.org/ala/mgrps/divs/yalsa/booklistsawards/printzaward/previouswinners/winners.cfm].  url accessed 6 july 2009.</ref> \n\n==summary==\nat age four, young ju moves with her parents from [[korea]] to [[southern california]]. while expecting an easy, blissful life in america, young ju sees the stress that the cultural adjustment puts on her family. she struggles with the language barrier at her new school, and her parents\' relationship becomes inceasingly strained due to financial issues. young ju\'s brother, joon, is born, and is given more freedom and choices due to his gender. their father has a [[jekyll and hyde personality]]; sometimes a playful, loving parent, and all too often a violent alcoholic, eventually getting arrested for [[dui]] and losing his drivers licence. as young ju matures and begins to enjoy friends and school, her parents fight constantly and joon

<page> <title>a_strange_arrangement</title><text>{{infobox album \n| name       = a strange arrangement\n| type       = studio\n| artist     = [[mayer hawthorne]]\n| cover      = mayer hawthorne a strange arrangement.jpg\n| released   = september 8, 2009\n| recorded   = 2008&ndash;2009\n| genre      = [[neo soul]]\n| length     = 34:42\n| label      = [[stones throw records]]\n| producer   = \n| last album = \n| this album = \'\'\'\'\'a strange arrangement\'\'\'\'\' <br />(2009)\n| next album = \'\'[[how do you do (mayer hawthorne album)|how do you do]]\'\' <br />(2011)\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a strange arrangement\'\'\'\'\' is the debut [[studio album]] by american musician [[mayer hawthorne]]. the album was released on september 8, 2009, by [[stones throw records]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/a-strange-arrangement-explicit/dp/b002ls4m9e/ref=sr_1_1_bnp_1_mus?ie=utf8&qid=1376835922&sr=8-1&keywords=a+strange+arrangement |title=a strange arrangement [explicit&#93;: mayer hawthorne: mp3 downloads |publisher=amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2013-08-18}}</ref> the album debuted at number 147 on the \'\'[[billboard 200]]\'\' chart, in the first week of its release.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/310228/mayer-hawthorne/chart |title=mayer hawthorne - chart history |publisher=billboard |date= |accessdate=2013-08-18}}</ref><ref name=\"apple1\">{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/strange-arrangement-bonus/id325250582 |title=itunes - music - a strange arrangement (bonus track version) by mayer hawthorne |publisher=itunes.apple.com |date=2009-09-08 |accessdate=2013-08-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=steve leggett |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/a-strange-arrangement-mw0000824001 |title=a strange arrangement - mayer hawthorne &#124; <page> <title>a_sunday_at_the_pool_in_kigali</title><text>[[image:sundayatkigali.jpg|thumb|right|150px|front cover of \'\'a sunday at the pool in kigali\'\']]\n\'\'\'\'\'a sunday at the pool in kigali\'\'\'\'\' (original [[french language|french]] title: \'\'un dimanche à la piscine à kigali\'\') is the first [[novel]] by [[montreal]] author [[gil courtemanche]], originally published in 2000.\n\nset in [[kigali]], [[rwanda]], the novel deals with a love affair between an elder canadian expatriate and a young rwandan, [[aids]] and the 1994 [[rwandan genocide|rwandan genocide]].\n\n==plot==\nbernard valcourt, a documentary filmmaker from [[quebec]], has been sent to the rwandan capital [[kigali]] to set up a television station. he falls in love with a rwandan girl gentille, who in reality is an ethnic [[hutu]], but she is often mistaken for a [[tutsi]]. with the hutu government is encouraging violence against tutsis, gentille\'s life becomes in danger. encouraged by his love for gentille, and a desire to complete a documentary to bring the tragedy of aids to the attention of the outside world, valcourt refuses to leave rwanda. when the two are married, they become tragically separated, leaving valcourt believing that gentille has, inevitably been killed. he then determines to document her life story, and sets out to discover the story of her final days.\n\n==recognition==\nthe novel was translated into [[english language|english]] as \'\'a sunday at the pool in kigali\'\' by [[patricia claxton]] in 2003 (isbn 0-676-97482-1). it was nominated for the [[governor general\'s literary award]] for [[governor general\'s award for french to english translation|french to english translation]].\n\n\'\'un dimanche à la piscine à kigali\'\' was chosen for inclusion in the [[french language|french]] version of \'\'[[canada reads]]\'\', \'\'le combat des livres\'\', broadcast on [[canadian broadcasting corporation|radio-canada]] in 2004, where it was defended by [[writer]], [[e
<page> <title>a_tale_of_two_kitties</title><text>{{about|the 1942 film|the 2006 film|garfield: a tail of two kitties}}\n{{infobox hollywood cartoon\n| cartoon_name      = a tale of two kitties\n| series            = [[merrie melodies]] ([[tweety]]/[[babbit and catstello]])\n| image             = a tale of two kitties blue ribbon reissue title.gif\n| caption           = the unrestored july 31, 1948 blue ribbon reissue title card of \'\'a tale of two kitties\'\'.\n| director          = [[bob clampett]]\n| story_artist      = [[warren foster]]\n| animator          = \n| background_artist = \n| voice_actor       = [[mel blanc]] (catstello / tweety)<br>[[tedd pierce]] (babbit; uncredited)\n| musician          = [[carl w. stalling]]\n| producer          = [[leon schlesinger]]\n| studio            = [[warner bros. cartoons|leon schlesinger studios]]\n| distributor       = [[warner bros.]]\n| release_date      = november 21, 1942 (usa)\n| color_process     = [[technicolor]]\n| runtime           = 7 minutes (one reel)\n| preceded_by       = [[wacky blackout]]\n| followed_by       = [[birdy and the beast|birdy and the beast]]\n| movie_language    = [[english language|english]]\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a tale of two kitties\'\'\'\'\' is an american [[cartoon]], released in 1942, notable for the first appearance of a flesh colored canary,  who would come to be known as [[tweety]].  it was directed by [[bob clampett]], written by [[warren foster]], and features music by [[carl w. stalling]]. it was also the first appearance of [[babbit and catstello]], based on the popular comedy duo [[abbott and costello]]. the title is an obvious pun on the [[charles dickens]] classic, \'\'[[a tale of two cities]]\'\'.\n\nit is one of many [[associated artists productions|a.a.p.]]-owned cartoons to fall in the [[public domain]], as [[united artists]] did not renew the copyright in time. it was released to dvd commercially on \'\'[[looney tunes golden collection: volume 5]]\'\'.\n\neven in this initial a
<page> <title>a_taste_of_power</title><text>{{italic title}}\n\n{{unreferenced|date=september 2008}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a taste of power: a black woman\'s story\'\'\'\'\' ([[pantheon books]], 1992) is a [[memoir]] written by [[elaine brown]]. the book follows her life from childhood up through her activism with the [[black panther party]]. in the early chapters of the book, brown recalls growing up on york street in a rough neighborhood of north philadelphia. due to her mother\'s persistence, she is able to attend an experimental elementary school in a nice neighborhood and becomes friends with some [[jewish]] girls. from that point on, brown describes being a part of two worlds. she\'d act \"white\" while hanging out with her school friends, and \"black\" when with the girls in her neighborhood.\n\nat age 19, brown moves to california, where she has a love affair with jay kennedy. she later ends the affair, and through her neighbor begins to meet people involved in the black panther party. brown describes her experiences in developing a black consciousness, and later, a [[feminist]] consciousness. she overcomes sexism in the party as well as her own personal obstacles to be the head of the party from 1974-1977. the book also covers her two runs for councilwoman in oakland. there is a large amount of writing on friend, lover, and fellow panther [[huey p. newton]], including information on his theory of \"revolutionary intercommunalism,\" in which he foresaw the weakening of the nation-state under the power of the market economy.\n\n\'\'a taste of power\'\' was optioned in january, 2007 by hbo to use in its upcoming six-part series, \"the black panthers.\"\n\n== external links==\n* [http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m2838/is_n2_v31/ai_20051247 african american review]\n\n{{defaultsort:taste of power, a}}\n[[category:1992 books]]\n[[category:american autobiographies]]\n[[category:books about the san francisco bay area]]\n[[category:politics of the san francisco bay ar
<page> <title>a_thousand_winding_roads</title><text>{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a thousand winding roads\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[joe diffie]]\n| cover       = diffieroads.jpg\n| released    = september 7, 1990\n| recorded    = \n| genre       = [[country music|country]]\n| length      = 31:13\n| label       = [[epic records|epic]]\n| producer    = [[bob montgomery (songwriter)|bob montgomery]]<br />johnny slate\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'a thousand winding roads\'\'\'\'\'<br />(1990)\n| next album  = \'\'[[regular joe]]\'\'<br />(1992)\n}}\n{{album ratings\n| rev1      = [[allmusic]]\n| rev1score = {{rating|4.5|5}} [{{allmusic|class=album|id=r92195|pure_url=yes}} link]\n|rev2=\'\'[[entertainment weekly]]\'\' |rev2score= c+ [http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20199859,00.html link]}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a thousand winding roads\'\'\'\'\' is the debut album of [[united states|american]] [[country music]] artist [[joe diffie]]. the album\'s title is derived from a line in its lead-off single \"[[home (joe diffie song)|home]]\", which reached #1 on the \'\'[[billboard (magazine)|billboard]]\'\' hot country singles & tracks (now [[hot country songs]]) charts in late 1990. other singles from this album include \"if you want me to\" (#2) \"if the devil danced (in empty pockets)\" (#1), and \"[[new way (to light up an old flame)]]\" (#2). \"there goes the neighborhood\" would later be recorded by [[shania twain]] on [[shania twain (album)|her debut album]].\n\n==track listing==\n#\"[[home (joe diffie song)|home]]\" (fred lehner, andy spooner) – 3:20\n#\"[[if the devil danced (in empty pockets)]]\" (ken spooner, kim williams) – 2:45\n#\"[[if you want me to]]\" (joe diffie, larry williams) – 3:42\n#\"[[new way (to light up an old flame)]]\" (joe diffie, lonnie wilson) – 2:42\n#\"there goes the neighborhood\" (bill c. graham, [[alan laney]], tommy dodson) – 3:14\n#\"almost home\" (larry williams, johnny slate)– 
<page> <title>a_touch_of_zen</title><text>{{infobox film\n|name = a touch of zen\n|image = atouchofzen.jpg\n|alt = \n|caption = film poster\n| film name = {{film name|traditional = 俠女\n |simplified = 侠女\n |pinyin = xiá nǚ}}\n|director = [[king hu]]\n|producer = hsia wu ling-fung\n|writer = king hu\n|starring = [[hsu feng]]<br>shih jun<br>pai ying<br>[[roy chiao]]\n|music = wu ta-chiang<br>lo ming-tao\n|cinematography = hua hui-ying\n|editing = king hu<br>wing chin-chen\n|studio = union film<br>international film production\n|distributor = union film (hong kong)\n|released = {{film date|1971|11|18}}\n|runtime = 200 minutes\n|country = taiwan\n|language = mandarin\n|budget = \n|gross = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'a touch of zen\'\'\'\'\' is a 1971 taiwanese \'\'[[wuxia]]\'\' film directed by [[king hu]]. the film won significant critical acclaim and became the first chinese language action film ever to win a prize at the [[cannes film festival]], claiming the technical grand prize award.\n\nalthough filming began in 1969, \'\'a touch of zen\'\' was not completed until 1971.<ref>[http://hkcinemagic.ifrance.com/siteanglais/atsuihark/kinghubio.htm king hu biography<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref> the original taiwanese release was in two parts in 1970 and 1971 (filming was still ongoing when the first part was released) with the bamboo forest sequence that concludes part 1 reprised at the beginning of part 2; this version has a combined run time of 200 minutes. in november 1971 both parts of the film were combined into one for the hong kong market with a run time of 187 minutes.<ref>{{cite book |last=teo |first=stephen |title=king hu\'s a touch of zen |year=2007 |publisher=hong kong university press |isbn=978-962-209-815-2}}</ref> its running time of over three hours makes it an unusually epic entry in the wuxia genre.\n\n== plot ==\nthe story is largely seen through the eyes of ku, who is a well-meaning but unambitious scholar and painter, with a tendency towards being
<page> <title>a_tranquil_star</title><text>{{infobox book\n| name          = a tranquil star\n| title_orig    = vizio di forma and storie naturali\n| translator    = ann goldstein and alessandra bastagli\n| image         = [[file:tranquil star.jpg|200px|]]<!--prefer first edition-->\n| caption = first edition cover - published by penguin classics.\n| author        = [[primo levi]]\n| illustrator   =\n| country       = united kingdom\n| publisher     = [[penguin books|penguin]]\n| release_date  = 2007\n| media_type    = print ([[hardcover]])\n| pages         = 164 pp\n| isbn          = 978-0-7139-9955-6\n| oclc= 76798314\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a tranquil star: unpublished stories of primo levi\'\'\'\'\' is a 2007 [[anthology]] of [[short stories]] by the italian writer [[primo levi]]. released 20 years after levi\'s death, the book consists of seventeen stories previously unpublished in english. the stories were translated by [[ann goldstein]], an editor at \'\'[[the new yorker]]\'\' and [[alessandra bastagli]], an editor at [[palgrave/macmillan]].\n\n== contents ==\n*\'\'\'part i: the early stories\'\'\'\n** \'\'the death of marinese\'\', 1949 first published in il ponte, translated by alessandra bastagli.\na captured italian partisan sits in the back of a truck with other prisoners and german guards. slowly he realises that he is going to be tortured and killed and so he decides to fight back. he works out a plan to take a grenade from one of the guards and explode it, killing himself and some of the guards, but will he succeed?\n** \'\'bear meat\'\', 1961 first published in il mondo, translated by alessandra bastagli.\nbear meat is \"the taste of being strong and free\". a group of mountaineers swap stories about their adventures, all of which involve a mistake - a central part of being free and living life to the full.\n** \'\'censorship in bitinia\'\', 1961 published in storie naturali, translated by jenny mcphee.\ncensors are suffering from strange and incurable dise

<page> <title>a_whisper_to_a_roar</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'a whisper to a roar\'\'\'\'\' is a 2012 american [[documentary film]] made by [[ben moses]] and inspired by the work of [[larry diamond]].  the film chronicles the fight for democracy in [[egypt]], [[malaysia]], [[ukraine]], [[venezuela]], and [[zimbabwe]], and includes animated segments narrated by [[united kingdom|british]] actor [[alfred molina]].\n\n==production==\nproduction of the film began in 2008 when moses collaborated with diamond and diamond\'s former student [[prince moulay hicham of morocco]] and the team began filming in 2009. according to the film\'s website, diamond \"invited moses to attend [[stanford university|stanford\'s]] center for democracy, development and the rule of law’s annual draper hills summer fellowship on democracy and development program, where democracy activists around the world gather to received training and support for their work.\" at the program, moses also began to gather funds for the project, only to be set back by the [[financial crisis of 2007–08|financial crisis of 2008.]] however, prince moulay hicham agreed to fund the project in full soon after.\n\nunder diamond\'s guidance the five countries were selected based on several factors including:  the team did not want to include the united states or other western countries because the intended audience was outside of that geographic region; and a desire to focus on democracies in different stages of the process:  the student leader, roberto patino of [[voto joven]] in venezuela; [[israa abdel fattah|esraa ahmed fattah]] and [[ahmed maher (youth leader)|ahmed maher]] of egypt; [[anwar ibrahim]] of malaysia; [[morgan tsvangarai]] of zimbabwe; and [[viktor yushchenko]] of ukraine.  filming concluded in 2011 with final trips to egypt following the [[arab spring]] and to malaysia to interview former prime minister [[mahathir mohamad]].\n\nprince moulay hicham was tapped to interview many of the heads-of-state inclu

<page> <title>a_woman_of_substance</title><text>{{about|the novel|the 1984 television adaptation|a woman of substance (mini-series)}}\n{{infobox book | <!-- see [[wikipedia:wikiproject novels]] or [[wikipedia:wikiproject books]] -->\n| name          = a woman of substance\n| title_orig    = \n| translator    = \n| image         = <!-- prefer 1st edition cover -->\n| caption = \n| author substance\'\'\'\'\' is a [[novel]] by [[barbara taylor bradford]], and was published in 1979.\n\nthis novel is the first of a saga about the fortunes of a retail empire and the machinations of the business elite across three generations.\nit is the first of seven novels about [[emma harte]] and her family. subsequent novels are \'\'hold the dream\'\', \'\'to be the best\'\', \'\'emma\'s secret\'\', \'\'unexpected blessings\'\', \'\'just rewards\'\' and \'\'breaking the rules\'\'.\n\n==plot summary==\n\nthe book starts with emma, now an old lady, flying to new york with her personal assistant and favourite grandchild, paula. emma contemplates the empire she has created. she has trained paula to be her successor, both as the head of harte stores and as representative of her mother, daisy amory, at sitex. \n\non their arrival in new york, emma\'s secretary, gaye, tells her that she heard emma\'s sons discussing a plan to force her to retire and break up her empire so the <page> <title>a_world_with_no_skies</title><text>{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = a world with no skies\n| cover       = slaine_a-world-with-no-skies.jpg\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[slaine (rapper)|slaine]]\n| released    = august 16, 2011\n| genre       = [[hip hop music|hip hop]]\n| label       = [[suburban noize records]]\n| \n{{singles\n|name = a world with no skies\n|type = studio\n|single 1 = 99 bottles\n|single 1 date = september 28, 2010\n}}}}\n{{album ratings\n| rev1      = \'\'rapreviews\'\'\n| rev1score = (8/10)<ref>[http://rapreviews.com/archive/2011_01f_noskies.html rapreviews review]</ref>\n| noprose   = yes\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'a world with no skies\'\'\'\'\' is a debut album by [[hip hop music|hip hop]] artist [[slaine (rapper)|slaine]]. \n\nthe album was originally scheduled for release on october 26, 2010, and copies were actually pressed and ready for distribution when slaine and surburban noize chose to hold back and substantially rework the album due to sample clearance issues.<ref>[http://thephoenix.com/blogs/onthedownload/archive/2010/10/27/exclusive-the-story-behind-slaine-s-the-devil-never-dies-plus-free-mixtape-download.aspx the boston phoenix]</ref> to make up for the delay, slaine released his mixtape \'\'the devil never dies\'\' at the same time the album had been expected to hit shelves. \n\nthe original version of the album leaked after nokia digital accidentally released a digital version for sale on the planned october 26 release date.<ref>[http://twitter.com/slainesworld/status/29288927110 slaine on twitter]</ref> therefore, the album was set to be released in february 2011 but was later pushed back again to an unknown date. slaine later confirmed that the album will be released on august 16, 2011 and will be known as \"a world with no skies 2.0\". slaine has stated that roughly half of the tracks on the cd are the same as the original track list.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt
<page> <title>a_solis_ortus_cardine</title><text>{{expand german|date=july 2011|a solis ortus cardine}}\n[[file:a solis ortus.jpg|thumb|\'\'a solis ortus cardine\'\', early christian melody, 16th century printing]]\n\'\'\'\'\'a solis ortus cardine\'\'\'\'\' (\"from the region [literally \'pivot, turning-point\'] of the rising of the sun\") is a latin poem by [[coelius sedulius]] (died circa 450), narrating christ\'s life from his birth to his resurrection. its 23 verses each begin with a consecutive letter of the alphabet, making the poem an [[abecedarius]]. it is the basis for two hymns in the roman catholic liturgy, both later adapted by [[martin luther]].\n\nthe first seven verses, with a [[doxology]] verse by a different writer, were used from the early middle ages onwards as a christmas hymn. they write of the striking contrast between the grandeur and omnipotence of the word of god (the second person in the [[holy trinity]]) and the vulnerable humanity of the child in whom the word became flesh. luther translated this into the hymn \'\'christum wir sollen loben schon\'\', which long remained the main german protestant christmas hymn until the 1995 \'\'evangelisches gesangbuch\'\' hymnal, in which it did not appear. it was also the basis for the bach cantata \'\'[[christum wir sollen loben schon, bwv 121|christum wir sollen loben schon]]\'\'.\n\nverses 8, 9, 11 and 13 of sedulius\' poem were also used, with an added doxology, as \'\'hostis herodes impie\'\', a hymn for the [[epiphany (holiday)|epiphany]]. these verses narrate the story of [[herod the great]] and the [[three kings]], along with the [[baptism of jesus|baptism of christ]] and the [[marriage at cana|miracle at the wedding at cana]]. luther\'s translation of this hymn into german, as \'\'was fürchtst du, feind herodes, sehr\'\', has long fallen out of use. the german-language [[book of hours]] also gives a translation of the verses 1, 2, 6 and 7 by sedulius, plus a doxology, as \'\'vom hellen tor d

<page> <title>aachen_chamber_choir</title><text>{{orphan|date=september 2011}}\n{{unreferenced|date=august 2011}}\n\nthe \'\'\'aachen chamber choir\'\'\' (aachener kammerchor) has been founded in september 1981. during the last 30 years there were many concerts in and around aachen as well as other german and international locations. next to recordings with broadcasting services there has been a cooperation with the [[theater aachen|aachen theatre]]. conducted by [[marcus bosch|marcus r. bosch]] there have been several compositions.\n\n{{defaultsort:chamber choir}}\n[[category:choirs]]\n[[category:musical groups established in 1981]]\n\n{{germany-band-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aachen_rathaus</title><text>[[file:aachen rathaus 1520.jpg|thumb|the aachen city hall, drawing by [[albrecht dürer]] in 1520]]\n[[file:de merian westphaliae 100.jpg|thumb|the aachen city hall, engraving by [[matthäus merian]] in 1647]]\n[[file:aachen marktplatz 1840.jpg|thumb|the baroque city hall and the aachen market, [[steal engraving]] von [[henry winkles]] around 1840]]\n[[file:dreikönigenreliefacr.jpg|thumb|torsos of the “three king relief”, from the 14th century]]\n[[file:aachencityhallfromsouthhdr.jpg|thumb|the aachen city hall, as viewed from the south]]\n\nthe [[gothic architecture|gothic]] \'\'\'aachen rathaus\'\'\', or \"aachen [[seat of local government|city hall]]\", lies next to the [[aachen cathedral]] and is one of the most striking structures in the [[altstadt]] of [[aachen]], [[germany]].\n\n== history ==\nin the first half of the 14th century, aachen’s citizenry built the city hall under the leadership of its acting mayor gerhard chorus (1285–1367) as a sign of their civic freedom, though they did have to promise to establish a space in the new city hall that could host the traditional meal that accompanies new coronations.  up to then, the nearby mid-13th century grashaus (which is one of the city’s oldest still-standing structures) had served the community in that function. construction began in 1330 on top of the foundations walls of the [[aula regia]], part of the derelict [[palace of aachen]], built during the [[carolingian dynasty]]. dating from the time of [[charlemagne]], the granus tower was incorporated into the structure as well. additionally, [[masonry]] from that era was incorporated into the south side of the building as well.<ref>wilhelm niehüsener: \'\'bericht des arbeitskreises für den wiederaufbau der rathaustürme.\'\' aachen, j.a. mayer, 1977</ref> the structure was completed in 1349, and while the city hall served as the administrative center of the city, part of the city’s munitions and weaponr

<page> <title>aakasha_ganga</title><text>{{infobox film\n|name           = aakasha ganga\n|image          = aakasha ganga.jpg\n|director       = [[vinayan]]\n|writer         = [[vinayan]], [[benny p nayarambalam]]\n|starring       = [[mukesh (actor)|mukesh]], [[divya unni]], [[mayoori (actress)|mayuri]], [[madhupal]]\n|producer       = vinayan\n|cinematography = [[ramachandra babu]]\n|editor         = \n|distributor    = \n|released       = 1999\n|runtime        = \n|language       = [[malayalam language|malayalam]]\n|music          = [[berny-ignatious]]\n|gross          = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'aakasha ganga\'\'\'\'\' is a 1999 malayalam horror film by [[vinayan]] starring [[divya unni]] and [[mukesh (actor)|mukesh]] & produced by aakash films.\n\n==plot==\n\nganga ([[mayoori (actress)|mayuri]]) the a poor slave girl fall in love with one of the maanikkasheri family member devan ([[madhupal]]) and gets pregnant. when the maanikkasheri family come to know about it they angrily kick ganga out of the house and arrange for the funeral of unconscious ganga thinking her to be dead. ganga regains consciousness and asks for water,but devan\'s father ([[spadikam george]]) angrily finish the funeral by setting up the fire burning ganga alive. ganga become a [[vengeful spirit]] haunting the family. devan ([[madhupal]]) commits suicide and [[spadikam george]] is brutally killed by ganga. manikyasseri family hires a priest ([[rajan p. dev]]) who exorcise ganga in to a tree with a long nail. also he advise manikyasseri family that the men in the family should remain as a bachelor and if in any case if any one fails to follow this, no one will be able to protect them from ganga\'s vengeful spirit. he warns them that ganga\'s spirit should never be freed and if ganga\'s spirit is freed in any case, no one has the power to control her anymore.\n\ndaisy/maya ([[divya unni]]), a playful college girl accidentally removes the nail from the tree when she goes to an excursion with her friends. 
<page> <title>aakhri_khat</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name           = aakhri khat\n| image          = aakhrikhat.jpg\n| caption        = \n| director       = [[chetan anand (director)|chetan anand]]\n| producer       = himalaya films\n| writer         = [[chetan anand (director)|chetan anand]]\n| narrator       = \n| starring       = [[rajesh khanna]]<br />[[indrani mukherjee]]\n| music          = [[khayyam (music director)|khayyam]]<br />[[kaifi azmi]] (lyrics)\n| cinematography = [[jal mistry]]\n| editing        = jadav rao\n| distributor    = prabha pictures \n| released       = 1966\n| runtime        = 153 minutes\n| country        = india\n| language       = hindi\n| budget         = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'aakhri khat\'\'\'\'\' (english: the last letter) is a 1966 [[bollywood]] film written and directed by [[chetan anand (director)|chetan anand]].  the music of the film is by [[khayyam (composer)|khayyam]] and lyrics by [[kaifi azmi]]; it includes the song \"baharon mera jeevan bhi sanwaro\", sung by [[lata mangeshkar]]. the film was given 5 stars in bollywood guide collections.\n\nchetan anand, started the film with a bare outline of a script and a 15-month-old infant who he let loose in the city, following him with his camera, mostly a hand-held camera, taking in all the city sounds, under the cinematic direction of jal mistry <ref>[http://www.expressindia.com/latest-news/chetan-anand-my-father/239819/ chetan anand, my father] \'\'[[the indian express]]\'\', premankur biswas, 16 november 2007.</ref> the film was selected as the indian entry for the [[academy award for best foreign language film|best foreign language film]] at the [[40th academy awards]] in 1967, but was not accepted as a nominee.<ref>margaret herrick library, academy of motion picture arts and sciences</ref><ref>http://www.bollywoodmantra.com/news/rajesh-khanna-and-his-films/9256/</ref>\n\n== plot ==\ngovind ([[rajesh khanna]]) is a young sculptor, while vacationing near [[kullu]], sees lajjo 
<page> <title>aalborg_county</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=january 2007}}\n[[image:aalborgamt.jpg|thumb|400px|aalborg county]]\n\'\'\'aalborg county\'\'\' ({{lang-da|Ålborg amt, former spelling: aalborg amt}}) is a former [[counties of denmark|province]] in [[denmark]], located in north-eastern [[jutland]] around the eastern approach to the [[limfjord]]. aalborg county was established in 1793 and abolished in 1970 when it merged with [[hjørring county]] forming the new [[north jutland county]]. \n\nthe region  belonged to [[himmerland|himmersyssel]] during the [[middle ages]], with the exception of kær herred - located north of the [[limfjord]] - which belonged to [[vendsyssel]]. in 1542, the north jutland region was reorganised as [[aalborghus len]]. this province was divided in 1662 forming [[aalborghus county]] and [[aastrup, sejlstrup and børglum county]]. \n\nthe latter province was divided again in 1793 with the bulk of its territory being reorganized as hjørring county. smaller parts of the province became parts of the counties of [[thisted county|thisted]] and aalborg. this division lasted from 1793 to 1970 when the two counties merged, forming the new north jutland county.\n\naalborg county featured the [[market town]]s (\'\'købstæder\'\') of [[aalborg]], [[løgstør]], [[nibe]], and [[nørresundby]].\n\n== list of former hundreds \'\'(herreder)\'\' ==\n* Års herred \n* fleskum herred\n* gislum herred\n* hellum herred\n* hindsted herred\n* hornum herred\n* kær herred\n* slet herred\n\n\'\'this article incorporates material from [[:da:aalborg amt|the corresponding article]] on the danish wikipedia, accessed january 14, 2007.\'\'\n\n== see also ==\n* [[aalborg municipality]]\n* [[aalborg]] city\n\n{{coord|56.9961921|9.9907108|display=title}}\n{{denmark-geo-stub}}\n\n[[category:counties of denmark dissolved in 1970]]\n[[category:north denmark region]]\n[[category:aalborg municipality]]\n[[category:history of aalborg]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aalborg_shipyard</title><text>\'\'\'aalborg shipyard\'\'\' (\'\'[[danish language|danish]]: aalborg vaerft a/s\'\'), was a [[shipyard]] located in the [[denmark|danish]] town of [[aalborg]].\n\nfounded in 1912 by brothers immanuel stuhr and peter philip stuhr, the shipyard was founded under the name stuhr engine and ship construction, a development of their father\'s business. from 1937 until the yard closed in 1988, it was owned by [[j. lauritzen]]\n\n==ships built at aalborg shipyard==\n\n{| class=\"wikitable\" \n! <page> <title>aalborg_university</title><text>{{infobox university\n|name     = aalborg university (aau)\n|native_name = aalborg universitet (aau)\n|latin_name  = universitas alburgensis\n|image_name  = aau logo 2012.png\n|image_size  = 250px\n|motto    = viis novis\n|mottoeng   = \n|established = 1974\n|type     = public university\n|endowment  = \n|staff    = 3.479 (2012)\n|faculty   = \n|rector    = [[finn kjærsdam]]\n|students   = 21.606 (2013)\n|undergrad  =\n|postgrad   =\n|doctoral   = 575 (2012)\n|city     = [[aalborg]], [[esbjerg]], [[copenhagen]]\n|state    = \n|country   = denmark {{flagicon|denmark}}\n|campus    = aalborg <br /> esbjerg <br /> copenhagen\n|affiliations = [[european consortium of innovative universities|eciu]], [[european network for training and research in electrical engineering|entree]] and [[conference of european schools for advanced engineering education and research|cesaer]]\n|logo     = \n|website   = [http://en.aau.dk www.aau.dk]\n}}\n\n{{coord|57.015000|n|9.985000|e|region:dk_type:edu|display=title}}\n\n\'\'\'aalborg university\'\'\' is a [[denmark|danish]] [[university]] located mainly in [[aalborg]], [[denmark]] with campuses in aalborg, [[esbjerg]] and [[copenhagen]]. aalborg university (aau) was established in 1974 under the name of aalborg university center (auc), but changed its name to aalborg university in 1994. today, aalborg university is the fifth largest university in denmark based on the number of enrolled students. in aalborg, the university is mainly located on the main campus in the eastern part of the city, but the university also has departments located in downtown aalborg.<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.tal.aau.dk/bygninger/ | title= aau departments and campuses | accessdate= 2012-02-08 }}</ref> currently, aalborg university has approximately 21.606 students and 3.479 employees.<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.tal.aau.dk/studerende/studerende+i+alt/ | title= information on the total study population| acces
<page> <title>aalenian</title><text>{{jurassic}}\nthe \'\'\'aalenian\'\'\' {{ipac-en|ɑː|ˈ|l|iː|n|i|ə|n}} is a subdivision of the [[middle jurassic]] [[epoch (geology)|epoch]]/[[series (stratigraphy)|series]] of the [[geologic timescale]] that extends from about 175.6 [[annum|ma]] to about 171.6 ma (million years ago). it was preceded by the [[toarcian]] and succeeded by the [[bajocian]].<ref>see gradstein \'\'et al.\'\' (2004) for a detailed version of the geologic timescale</ref>\n\n==stratigraphic definitions==\nthe aalenian takes its name from the town of [[aalen]], some 70&nbsp;km east of  [[stuttgart]] in [[germany]]. the town lies at the southwestern end of the [[jura mountains|frankischer jura]]. the name aalenian was introduced in scientific literature by [[switzerland|swiss]] geologist [[karl mayer-eymar]] in 1864.\n\nthe base of the aalenian is defined as the place in the stratigraphic column where the [[ammonite]] [[genus]] \'\'[[leioceras]]\'\' first appears. a global reference profile is located 500 meters north from the village of [[fuentelsaz]] in the [[spain|spanish]] [[guadalajara (province)|province of guadalajara]].<ref>cresta \'\'et al.\'\' (2001)</ref> the top of the aalenian (the base of the bajocian) is at the first appearance of ammonite genus \'\'[[hyperlioceras]]\'\'.\n\nin the [[tethys ocean|tethys domain]], the aalenian contains four ammonite [[biozone]]s:\n*zone of \'\'[[graphoceras|graphoceras concavum]]\'\'\n*zone of \'\'[[brasilia (ammonite)|brasilia bradfordensis]]\'\'\n*zone of \'\'[[ludwigia|ludwigia murchisonae]]\'\'\n*zone of \'\'leioceras opalinum\'\'\n\n==palaeontology==\n\n===†ammonitids===\n{| class=\"wikitable\" align=\"center\" width=\"100%\"\n|- \n! colspan=\"5\" align=\"center\" |\'\'\'†[[ammonitids]] of the aalenian\'\'\'\n|-\n! taxa\n! presence\n! location\n! description\n! images\n|-\n| \n*\'\'[[abbasites]]\'\'\n**\'\'abbasites platystomus\'\'\n| confirmed.<ref name=\"sepkoski ceph\">sepkoski (2002)</ref>\n| \

<page> <title>aalto_university_school_of_engineering</title><text>{{notability|organizations|date=february 2013}}\n{{infobox university\n|name        = aalto university school of engineering\n|native_name = {{lang|fi|aalto-yliopiston insinööritieteiden korkeakoulu}} <br />{{lang|sv|aalto-universitetets högskola för ingenjörsvetenskaper}}\n|established = 1849\n|image_name  = aalto university school of engineering.svg\n|motto       = \n|dean        = professor gary marquis\n|campus      = [[urban area|urban]], [[inner city|inner city]]\n|students    = 3,444 (2012)<ref>http://eng.aalto.fi/en/about/statistics/</ref>\n|city        = [[espoo]]\n|country     = {{flagicon|finland}}[[finland]]\n|faculty_and_staff     = 800\n|endowment   =   \n|website     = [http://eng.aalto.fi/en/ eng.aalto.fi/en]\n}}\n\'\'\'aalto university school of engineering\'\'\' ({{lang-fi|aalto-yliopiston insinööritieteiden korkeakoulu}}, {{lang-sv|aalto-universitetets högskola för ingenjörsvetenskaper}}) is part of [[aalto university]]. it is one of the four new schools of technology established on 1 january 2011 from [[aalto university school of science and technology]], formerly known as helsinki university of technology. the four new schools continue to offer education and research that promotes advances in science and technology. the department of architecture was part of the school of engineering until 2012, when it was restructured into the [[aalto university school of arts, design and architecture]].<ref name=\"testi\">[http://arts.aalto.fi/en/current/news/view/2012-01-02/ school of arts, design and architecture began operations at the start of the year], 02.01.2012.</ref>\n\nthe school of engineering creates new information and solutions which serve the goals of sustainable development; key focus areas both in teaching and research include global warming, energy conservation and clean energy, and the sustainable use of natural resources.  the wellbeing of the environment and healt
<page> <title>aam_aadmi_party</title><text>{{pp-protected|reason=disruptive editing|expiry=9 december 2013|small=yes}}\n{{use dmy dates|date=august 2013}}\n{{use british english|date=july 2013}}\n{{infobox indian political party\n|party_name        =  aam aadmi party\n|logo              = [[file:official aam aadmi party logo from their website.png]]\n|colorcode         = {{aam aadmi party/meta/color}}\n|leader            = [[arvind kejriwal]]\n|foundation        = 26 november 2012\n|headquarters      = ground floor, a-119, [[kaushambi (ghaziabad)|kaushambi]] ([[national capital region (india)|ncr]]), [[ghaziabad, uttar pradesh|ghaziabad]]- 201010\n|publication       = \n|students          = \n|youth             = \n|women             = \n|labour            = \n|ideology          = [[swaraj]]\n|international     = \n|colours           = \n|symbol            = <!-- [[image:aap election symbol.jpg|aap election symbol|150px]] -->\n|website           = {{url|http://www.aamaadmiparty.org}}\n}}\n\n\'\'\'aam aadmi party\'\'\' ([[translation]]: \'\'common man\'s party\'\'; abbreviated \'\'\'aap\'\'\') is an [[political parties in india|indian political party]], formally launched on 26 november 2012. it came into existence following differences between the activists [[arvind kejriwal]] and [[anna hazare]] regarding whether or not to politicise the popular [[india against corruption]] movement that had been demanding a [[jan lokpal bill]] since 2011. hazare preferred that the movement should remain politically unaligned while kejriwal felt the failure of the agitation route necessitated a direct political involvement. the party\'s political symbol for the 2013 elections in delhi is a broom.\n\nthe aap has led several protests since its formation. among these was a campaign against an alleged nexus between government and private corporations relating to price rises for electricity and water in [[delhi]]. another saw the party demanding justice for victims of sexual harassment a

then-[[prime minister]] [[indira gandhi]]\'s life, but in reality, only the look was inspired by politician [[tarkeshwari sinha]], apart from [[indira gandhi]].<ref name=hin/> the film story is based around a chance meeting of a  married couple after years of separation, when wife aarti devi, now a leading politician happens to stay in the hotel run by her estranged husband during an election campaign. <ref name=\"joshi2002\">{{cite book|author=lalit mohan joshi|title=bollywood: popular indian cinema|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=egxlaaaamaaj|page=123|date= 2002|publisher=dakini books}}</ref>  the movie is noted for its songs composed by [[rahul dev burman]], written by gulzar and sung by [[kishore kumar]] and [[lata mangeshkar]].\n\nactress [[suchitra sen]] played the character of aarti devi after actress [[vyjayanthimala]] refused the film as she had reservations about enacting the lead role.\n\nthe movie was not allowed a full release when mrs.gandhi was in power. the film [[list of films banned in india|was
<page> <title>aar_glaciers</title><text>{{unsourced|date=september 2010}}\nthe \'\'\'aar glaciers\'\'\' are [[glacier]]s located at the sources of the [[aar river]] in the [[bernese alps]], [[switzerland]]. they are constituted by two distinct glacier systems:\n*[[unteraar glacier]]: composed by the converging \'\'lauteraar glacier\'\' and \'\'finsteraar glacier\'\', between the [[lauteraarhorn]], [[finsteraarhorn]] and [[grimselsee]].\n*[[oberaar glacier]]: between [[oberaarhorn]] and [[oberaarsee]].\n\n{{coord|46.5694|n|8.19167|e|source:kolossus-dewiki|display=title}}\n\n[[category:glaciers of switzerland]]\n[[category:glaciers of the alps]]\n[[category:aar]]\n\n{{glaciology-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>aaron_broussard</title><text>\'\'\'aaron f. broussard\'\'\' (born 6 january 1949 ) was the president, a combined municipal-parish position, of [[jefferson parish, louisiana]] from 2003 to 2010. a [[democratic party (united states)|democrat]], broussard is known nationally for appearances he made in the aftermath of [[hurricane katrina]].\n\n== life and career ==\nbroussard was born in [[marksville, louisiana|marksville]], the seat of [[avoyelles parish]] in south central [[louisiana]]. he moved to [[kenner, louisiana|kenner]], a city in jefferson parish, in 1958. he received a [[law]] degree from [[loyola university new orleans]] in 1973. the following year he was elected to the jefferson parish school board and reelected in 1976. in 1977, he was elected as a district chairman to the jefferson parish council and re-elected in 1981. he successfully ran for [[mayor]] of kenner in 1982, and he was reelected in 1986, 1990, and 1994.\n\nbroussard was elected chairman of the jefferson parish council in 1995, and reelected in 1999.\n\nin 2003, broussard was elected jefferson parish president. he defeated [[republican party (united states)|republican]] john m. mcdonald by a huge margin, 72-28 percent, even though jefferson parish is considered a [[republican party (united states)|gop]] stronghold in louisiana.<ref>http://www.sos.louisiana.gov:8090/cgibin/?rqstyp=elcpr&rqsdta=10040326</ref>\n\nbroussard was president of parishes against coastal erosion (pace) and in a june 14, 2005, press release predicted:\n\n:\'\'with the national hurricane center predicting another active hurricane season, pace president aaron broussard said he fears that it is going to take a major storm and significant loss of life before the nation acts responsibly.\'\'<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.americaswetland.com/article.cfm?id=241&cateid=2&pageid=3&cid=16 |title=america\'s wetland |publisher=americaswetland.com |date=2005-06-14 |accessdate=2011-03-16}}</ref>\n\n== hurricane katrina
