<page> <title>aaron_kernan</title><text>\'\'\'aaron kernan\'\'\' is a [[gaelic football]] player from [[crossmaglen]], [[county armagh]], in ireland.  he plays for the local [[crossmaglen rangers]] club and for the [[armagh gaa|armagh senior football team]].\n\n==early and personal life==\nkernan is the son of former armagh player and manager [[joe kernan (gaelic footballer)|joe kernan]], his brothers stephen, tony and paul are also crossmaglen and armagh panel members, and their younger brother ross plays for crossmaglen also.\n\n==playing career==\nin 2005, kernan made the breakthrough into the armagh senior team, with his father joe as manager.<ref name=\"independent.ie\">http://www.independent.ie/sport/gaa-championships/gaelic-football/kernans-cast-off-family-ties-1407947.html</ref>  in 2005 armagh won the [[national football league (ireland)|national football league]] and the [[ulster senior football championship]].  aaron was named [[all stars young footballer of the year]].<ref name=\"independent.ie\"/>  \n\nsince then, kernan has won the [[ulster senior football championship]] with armagh in 2006 and 2008 as has emerged as one of their top defenders.<ref>http://www.irishnews.com/appnews/597/5764/2008/4/15/585211_342471913522kernaneme.html</ref>  he was selected for the ireland team to play in the [[2008 international rules series]].<ref>http://www.rte.ie/sport/gaa/championship/2008/1007/internationalrules.html?gaa</ref> aaron has also had great success with his club team [[crossmaglen rangers]]. he has won 8 armagh county medals,  5 ulster club medals and 2 all-ireland club medal in 2007,2011 he received man of the match for his performancce in the match. aaron has won the ulster championship 4 times in 2004, 2005, 2006, and 2008 and a [[ulster under-21 football championship]] in 2004 and an [[all-ireland under-21 football championship]] in 2004.h e joined the cross senior team in 2003\n\n==honours==\ncrossmaglen\n* 10 [[armagh senior football championship]]
<page> <title>aaron_koblin</title><text>{{infobox artist\n| bgcolour    = #fbec5d\n| name = aaron koblin\n| image = aaron_koblin-portrait_2010.png\n| caption = \n| alt = \n| birth_name = \n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|01|14}}\n| birth_place = [[santa monica]], california\n| death_date = \n| death_place = \n| nationality = american\n| field = digital art\n| training = \n| influenced by = \n| movement =\n| works = flight patterns,<ref name=\"flightpatterns\">{{cite doi|10.1145/1665137.1665156}}</ref> the sheep market,<ref name=\"sheepmarket\">{{cite doi|10.1145/1640233.1640348}}</ref> ten thousand cents, bicycle built for two thousand, the wilderness downtown, the johnny cash project\n| patron = \n| awards =\n}}\n\'\'\'aaron koblin\'\'\' is an american digital media artist best known for his innovative uses of data visualization and [[crowdsourcing]]. he is currently creative director of the data arts team at [[google]] in [[san francisco]], [[california]].<ref>{{cite doi|10.1038/486033a}}</ref>\n\nkoblin\'s artworks are part of the permanent collections of the [[victoria and albert museum]] (v&a) in london, the [[museum of modern art]] (moma) in new york, and the [[centre georges pompidou]] in paris. he has presented at [[ted (conference)|ted]], and [[world economic forum|the world economic forum]], and his work has been shown at international festivals including [[ars electronica]], [[siggraph]], and the [[japan media arts festival]]. in 2006, his flight patterns project received the [[national science foundation]]\'s first place award for science visualization.<ref>{{cite web\n|url=http://www.nsf.gov/news/news_summ.jsp?cntn_id=108017\n|title=2006 science and engineering visualization challenge winners\n|date=september 2006\n|accessdate=2009-04-08\n}}</ref> in 2009, he was named to [[creativity (magazine)|creativity magazine]]\'s creativity 50,<ref>{{cite web\n|url=http://creativity-online.com/?action=news:article&newsid=134508&sectionid=creativity_50\n|

<page> <title>aaron_shang</title><text>{{infobox person\n| image =\n| imagesize =\n| caption =\n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|08|05|mf=y}}\n| birthname = \n| birth_place = \n| yearsactive = 2003–present\n| occupation = actor/singer\n| website      = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'aaron shang\'\'\' (born august 5, 1996) is a [[chinese american]] actor and singer.\n\n==career==\n\naaron shang began his career in the early 2000s, mainly appearing in chinese film and tv productions. since then, he has contributed to numerous american, chinese, and international productions as both an actor and a musician. shang is best known in china for his performance at the 2008 [[cctv new year\'s gala]], where he accompanied original artist [[guang liang]] in a duet remix of liang\'s hit single \'\'fairy tale\'\'. the track, released online two days later, spent 8 straight weeks at #1 on the [[baidu 500]] (7 weeks short of the record set by the original release).\naaron is currently represented by xing qun (constellation) agency based in mainland china, and has been signed under his family company, [[tencent holdings|tencent holdings media]], since 2003.  though born in the united states, shang is largely unknown outside of mainland [[china]] due to his limited experience in international film and music productions.\n\n==in the media==\nin april 2012, [[zhejiang television]] announced the attachment of shang as a table judge in the inaugural season of [[the voice of china]]. however, in june 2012 the network replaced shang with veteran entertainer yang kun, citing viewer requests for the popular traditional singer. in early december 2012, unconfirmed reports that shang was cast in the [[legendary pictures]] 2014 film adaptation of [[godzilla (2014 film)|godzilla]] surfaced and circulated online. these reports were officially denied by xing qun (constellation) agency on behalf of shang.\n\n==personal life==\naaron shang is a close relative to chinese media mogul [[ma huateng]], and also

hockey league]] (ahl). he was awarded the [[clare drake award]] and named the cis rookie of the year for his outstanding play during the 2005-06 season.\n\nprior to turning professional, sorochan played five seasons of [[major junior hockey]] in the [[western hockey league]] before he attended the [[university of alberta]], where he played four seasons with the [[alberta golden bears]] men\'s ice hockey team. sorochan was in the net as he led the golden bears to win the cis national championship in 2008.<ref>[http://www.canada.com/story_print.html?id=96006303-8cc9-44bf-83c6-ff5ec2d92fad&sponsor= playing his 100th game in net for the university of alberta golden bears, aaron sorochan turned in a performance for the ages]</ref>\n\nin december 2007, while still a member of the alberta golden bears, sorochan was signed by the [[edmonton oilers]] to a [[national hockey league]] amateur try-out agreement,<ref>[http://www.sportsnet.ca/hockey/2007/12/22/devils_oilers/ sportsnet.ca, december 22, 2007]</ref> and was dressed, but did not play, as the oilers\' backup goaltender for the december <page> <title>aaron_steadman</title><text>{{multiple issues|orphan =april 2010|notability =march 2010|blp sources =march 2010|one source = march 2010}}\n\n\'\'\'aaron steadman\'\'\' is a local theatrical producer, director and performer. his regular performances charity work and major scale productions are seen by many in the south most notably so for his production of \'\'[[the little shop of horrors]]\'\') at the [[kings theatre]], [[southsea]]. steadman became the youngest producer in not only the uk but across the globe to have produced \'\'fame\'\' the musical<ref>[http://www.famenetwork.com/pastbuzz/aaronsteadman2.php]</ref> in 2006 at age 16 with response from [[david de silva]] the creator of the film and show. he has also been nominated in the guide awards with best musical for the portsmouth evening news . steadman is currently training professionally in the north of the uk .\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = steadman, aaron\n| alternative names = aaron andrew steadman\n| short description = actor, singer, producer and director\n| date of birth     = 1990\n| place of birth    = surrey, england\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:steadman, aaron}}\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:year of birth missing (living people)]]\n[[category:english theatre directors]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aaron_trent</title><text>{{infobox cyclist\n| name           = aaron trent\n| fullname       = aaron jacob trent\n| birth_date     = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1986|2|26}}\n| height         = {{height|m=1.72}} \n| currentteam    = us paralympic national team\n| discipline     = road and track endurance \n| ridertype      =  climber\n| majorwins      = [[file:maillotusa.png|20px]] 2009 paralympic kilo national champion\n[[file:maillotusa.png|20px]] 2010 paralympic team sprint national champion\n| medaltemplates = \n| updated        =\n}}\n\'\'\'aaron jacob trent\'\'\' (born february 26, 1986<ref name=usa>[http://usparalympics.org/athletes/aaron-trent aaron trent - profile], [[us paralympics]]</ref> in [[fort stewart, georgia]]) is an american paralympic cyclist specializing in track racing.\n\n==cycling==\n\n===2009===\nin july 2009 trent won the 1&nbsp;km time trial at usac para-cycling track national championships in los angeles.\n\nin november 2009 he represented the united states at the [[uci para-cycling track world championships]] in [[manchester]], england.  his first race of the event was the kilo.  after a mechanical mishap and a restart, he won the silver medal in the cp4 category.  trent won the bronze medal in the 4&nbsp;km individual pursuit.  he also raced the mixed disability team sprint with [[jennifer schuble]] and [[sam kavanaugh]] and placed 4th.\n\n===2010===\na restructuring of the disability categories saw trent move from the cp4 classification to the c5 group in 2010.\ntrent became a member of the [[united states olympic training center|us olympic training center]] residency program in colorado springs, co in 2010 so he could train full-time.\ntogether with teammates will chesebro and sam kavanaugh, he won the team sprint at usac para-cycling track national championships in colorado springs.  trent will represent the united states at the next uci para-cycling world championships (dates tba).\n\n== disability ==\ntrent suffered a

<page> <title>aaron_wexler</title><text>{{refimprove|date=february 2009}}\n\'\'\'aaron wexler\'\'\' (born 1974) is an artist based in [[new york]].\n\nwexler was born in [[philadelphia]].  he makes layered [[acrylic paint|acrylic]] and [[paper]] [[collage]]s on surfaces of panel and paper.<ref>press release, [http://www.re-title.com/exhibitions/oneintheother.asp re-title.com]</ref>  his work features a mixture of [[figurative art|figurative]] and [[abstract art|abstract]] imagery, and real and imagined spaces.<ref>[price. marshall n, [http://www.joseebienvenugallery.com/pdf/wexler-essay06.pdf mind over matter],[http://www.joseebienvenugallery.com joseebienvenu.com]</ref>\n\nhe received his [[master of fine arts|mfa]] in [[painting]] and [[drawing]] from [[the school of the art institute of chicago]] in 1999.\n\n==selected exhibitions==\n\'\'\'1999\'\'\'\n*\'\'post mfa\'\', peter miller gallery, chicago\n\'\'\'2000\'\'\'\n*\'\'minimal provocations\'\', betty rymer gallery, chicago,\n*\'\'flat files\'\', bellwether gallery, brooklyn\n\'\'\'2001\'\'\'\n*\'\'ffwd miami\'\', contemporary art fair, miami\n*\'\'the willow house\'\', ukrainian institute of modern art, chicago\n\'\'\'2002\'\'\'\n*\'\'gecenkondu\'\', apexart, new york\n\'\'\'2003\'\'\'\n*\'\'team work\'\', vox populi gallery, philadelphia\n\'\'\'2004\'\'\'\n*\'\'aaron wexler & colin keefe\'\', ps122 gallery, new york\n\'\'\'2005\'\'\'\n*\'\'no apology for breathing\'\', jack the pelican presents, brooklyn\n\'\'\'2006\'\'\'\n*\'\'the new collage\'\', pavel zoubok gallery, new york\n*\'\'181st annual invitational exhibition of contemporary art\'\', the national academy museum, new york\n\'\'\'2008\'\'\'\n*one in the other gallery, london\n*josee bienveunu gallery, new york\n\n==references==\n<references/>\n\n==external links==\n*aaron wexler’s [http://aaronwexler.blogspot.com/ blog]\n*aaron wexler on [http://www.artfacts.net/index.php/pagetype/artistinfo/artist/82934 artfacts.net]\n*artist’s [http://www.aar

[[m. s. raju]] produced this film while v. n. aditya directed the project. this film was released on may 9, 2007.<ref name=\"ourcinemas.com\">aata movie info http://www.ourcinemas.com/telugu/aata/review.php</ref>\n\n== plot ==\nsrikrishna ([[siddharth (actor)|siddharth]]) grows up watching films playing in the theatre in which his father works as a movie-projectionist in a village. satya ([[ileana d\'cruz|ileana]]) is harassed by vicky ([[munna (actor)|munna]]) - son of a politician ([[jaya prakash reddy]])- who wants to marry her. satya escapes from home and srikrishna falls in love with her the first time he meets her. as the goons and police chase satya, srikrishna protects her and drops her in the house of the politician. he wins vicky’s confidence. then, he plays a one sided game with him. at the end, the police that were working with vicky turn against him and arrest vicky and his parents. satya and srikrishna get married.\n\n== music ==\nthe music and soundtrack of the movie was composed by [[devi sri prasad]]. and the lyric

<page> <title>abadiyeh</title><text>\'\'\'abadiyeh\'\'\' is a place in [[egypt]] situated about a dozen miles west of denderch.<ref>[http://www.archive.org/stream/diospolisparvac00macegoog/diospolisparvac00macegoog_djvu.txt from page 1 of diospolis parva: the cemeteries of abadiyeh and hu, 1898-9 by william matthew flinders petrie, arthur cruttenden mace(1901)] retrieved approx 17:30 30.9.11</ref>\n\n==archaeological==\nw. m. [[flinders petrie]] was assisted with [[excavation (archaeology)|excavations]] by [[david randall-maciver]] and [[arthur cruttenden mace]], these having been done on the behalf of the [[egypt exploration society|egyptian exploration fund]] (eef). the excavations, considered in totality, consisted of sites  along the west bank of the [[nile]] in the hiw region, found to contain artifacts of a [[predynastic]] type.<ref>[http://escholarship.org/uc/item/55b9t6d7;jsessionid=e2d8b118e529ccf9534c9e6dffd9f953#page-1 article \'\'hiw (predynastic)\'\' written by thomas hikade-ucla encyclopedia of egyptology department of near eastern languages and cultures, uc los angeles(with 18 referenced sources)(12-23-2010] retrieved 21:35gmt 30.9.11)[[ucla | uc los angeles]]</ref> prehistoric [[cemeteries]] were found at abadiyas and [[hu, egypt|hu]] (diospolis parva).<ref>[http://www.archive.org/stream/diospolisparvac00macegoog#page/n16/mode/2up  from page 2 of diospolis parva: the cemeteries of abadiyeh and hu, 1898-9 by william matthew flinders petrie, arthur cruttenden mace(1901)] retrieved approx 17:42 30.9.11</ref><ref>[http://www.classics.und.ac.za/projects/pendlebury/sequence.htm  museum of classical archaeology, memorial tower building , university of natal (durban)] retrieved approx\' 17;49 30.9.11</ref>\n\n==further reading==\n* oxford university-[http://www.arch.ox.ac.uk/jr1.html school of archaeology]  from   [http://www.orinst.ox.ac.uk/staff/eanes/jrowland.html faculty of oriental studies]-retrieved 17;59 30.9.11- both showing \'\'rowland, j.m., (2007)

<page> <title>abagrotis_brunneipennis</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name               = abagrotis brunneipennis\n| image              =\n| image_width        = 204px\n| image_caption      =\n| regnum             = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum             = [[arthropod]]a\n| subphylum          = [[hexapoda]]\n| classis            = [[insect]]a\n| ordo               = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia            = [[noctuidae]]\n| tribus             =\n| genus              = \'\'[[abagrotis]]\'\'\n| species            = \'\'\'\'\'a. brunneipennis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial           = \'\'abagrotis brunneipennis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = grote, 1875\n| synonyms           =\n}}\nthe \'\'\'yankee dart\'\'\' (\'\'abagrotis brunneipennis\'\') is a [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found from [[newfoundland and labrador|newfoundland]] west to [[vancouver island]], south to west central [[oregon]], [[utah]], [[colorado]] and [[north carolina]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is 33–37&nbsp;mm. adults are on wing in august to september in one generation.\n\nthe larvae feed on various woody plants, including \'\'[[vaccinium]]\'\'. they also feed on fallen leaves during the winter.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.eeb.uconn.edu/people/wagner/usda%20noctuid%20guide%20most%20current.doc owlet caterpillars of eastern north america (lepidoptera: noctuidae)]\n*[http://www.entomology.ualberta.ca/searching_species_details.php?b=noctuoid+moths&r=543&ref=b&o=1&c=6&s=6121 species info]\n\n{{defaultsort:abagrotis brunneipennis}}\n[[category:abagrotis|brunneipennis]]\n\n\n{{noctuinae-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>abakanskoye_mine</title><text>{{infobox mine\n| name = abakanskoye mine\n| image =\n| width =\n| caption =\n| pushpin_map =\n| pushpin_label =\n| pushpin_map_caption =\n| latd = |latm = |lats = |latns =\n| longd = |longm = |longs = |longew =\n| coordinates_region =\n| display =\n| place = \n| subdivision_type = \n| state/province = [[sakha republic]]\n| country = [[russia]]\n| owner =\n| stock_exchange = none\n| stock_code = \n| official website =\n| acquisition year =\n| products = [[iron ore]]\n| financial year = \n| amount = \n| opening year = \n| closing year =\n}}\nthe \'\'\'abakanskoye mine\'\'\' is a large [[iron ore|iron]] mine located in eastern [[russia]] in the [[sakha republic]]. abakanskoye represents one of the largest [[iron ore]] reserves in [[russia]] and in the world having estimated reserves of 172.5 million tonnes of ore grading 38% iron metal.<ref name=\"muncelu\">{{cite web|url=http://www.docstoc.com/docs/26576831/mineral-deposit-models-for-northeast-asia|title=mineral deposits of northern asia|year=2012|publisher=docstoc.com|accessdate=2013-07-10}}</ref>\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{coord missing|russia}}\n\n{{defaultsort:abakanskoye mine}}\n[[category:iron mines in russia]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abani_mukherji</title><text>{{infobox person\n| name        = abaninath mukherji<br/>অবনীনাথ মুখার্জি\n| image       =\n| alt         =\n| caption     =\n| birth_name  =\n| birth_date  = {{birth date|1891|06|03|df=yes}} \n| birth_place = [[jabalpur]], central provinces, [[british india]]\n| death_date  = {{death date and age|1937|10|28|1891|06|03|df=yes}}\n| death_place = [[moscow]], [[russian sfsr]], [[soviet union]]\n| nationality = british india\n| other_names =\n| known_for   =\n| occupation  = revolutionary\n}}\n\n\'\'\'abaninath mukherji\'\'\' ({{lang-bn|অবনীনাথ মুখার্জি}}, {{lang-ru|Абанинатх Трайлович Мукерджи}},<ref>his russian name was spelt variously  Абани/Абони/Абанинатх Троилокович/Трайлович Мукерджи/Мухарджи/Мухараджи (abani/aboni/abaninath trailokovich/troilokovich/traylovich mukerdzhi/muhardzhi/muharadzi). the second part of the russian version of the name (trailokovich) is a [[patronymic]], traditional in russian appellations. [http://memory.pvost.org/pages/mukerdzhi.html abani mukherji\'s biography] {{ru icon}}</ref> 3 june 1891 - 28 october 1937) was an [[india]]n revolutionary and co-founder of the [[communist party of india]]. his name was often spelt \'\'\'abani mukherjee\'\'\'.<ref name=banerjee>banerjee, santanu, \n[http://www.hvk.org/articles/0903/287.html stalin\'s indian victims] in \'\'the indian express\'\', september 28, 2003 (accessed 16 january 2008)</ref>\n\n==early life==\nabani mukherji was born in [[jabalpur]] (in the present-day [[madhya pradesh]] state). abani mukherji\'s father was trailokyanath mukherji. after leaving school, he moved to [[ahmedabad]], where he trained as a weaver, and in 1910 he was employed as an assistant weaving master at the bangla laxmi cotton mills. in 1912, he was sent to [[japan]] and [[germany]] to study weaving. in germany, he encountere
<page> <title>abantiades_magnificus</title><text>{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'abantiades magnificus\'\' {{italic title}}\n| image = female abantiades magnificus.jpg\n| image_width = 220px\n| image_caption =\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[hepialidae]]\n| genus = [[abantiades]]\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. magnificus\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'abantiades magnificus\'\'\n| binomial_authority = t.p. lucas, 1898\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'pielus magnificus\'\'\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'abantiades magnificus\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[hepialidae]] family. it is found in southern [[new south wales]] and eastern [[victoria (australia)|victoria]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is about 12&nbsp;cm.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lepidoptera.butterflyhouse.com.au/hepi/magnif.html|title=abantiades magnificus|author=don herbison-evans & stella crossley|publisher=uts.edu.au|date=february 11, 2009|accessdate=2009-03-03}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{defaultsort:abantiades magnificus}}\n[[category:hepialidae]]\n\n\n{{hepialidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abantis_leucogaster</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = abantis leucogaster\n| image = \n| image2 = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[hesperiidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[abantis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. leucogaster\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'abantis leucogaster\'\' \n| binomial_authority = (mabille, 1890)<ref>[http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/hesperioidea/hesperiidae/pyrginae/abantis/index.html \'\'abantis\'\'], funet.fi</ref>\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'sapaea leucogaster\'\' <small>mabille, 1890</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'abantis leucogaster\'\'\'\'\', the \'\'\'streaked paradise skipper\'\'\', is a [[butterfly]] in the [[hesperiidae]] family. it is found in [[guinea]], [[sierra leone]], [[ivory coast]], [[ghana]], [[nigeria]], [[cameroon]], the [[republic of congo]], the [[central african republic]], the [[democratic republic of congo]], [[uganda]] and [[tanzania]].<ref name=atbut>[http://atbutterflies.com/downloads/hesperiidae_pyrginae.doc afrotropical butterflies: hesperiidae - subfamily pyrginae]</ref> the habitat consists of primary forests and well-developed secondary forests.\n\nadults have been recorded feeding from flowers.\n\n==subspecies==\n*\'\'abantis leucogaster leucogaster\'\' (guinea, sierra leone, ivory coast, ghana, nigeria, cameroon, congo, central african republic, democratic republic of congo)\n*\'\'abantis leucogaster iruma\'\' <small>evans, 1951</small> (eastern democratic republic of congo, western uganda, north-western tanzania)\n\n==references==\n{{commons}}\n{{wikispecies}}\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1890]]\n[[category:tagiadini]]\n\n{{pyrginae-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>abarema_centiflora</title><text>{{taxobox\n|status = vu\n|status_system = iucn2.3\n|status_ref = <ref> {{iucn2009.2 | assessors=world conservation monitoring centre | year=1998 | id=26568 | title=abarema centiflora | downloaded=9 november 2009}}</ref>\n|regnum = [[plant]]ae\n|unranked_divisio = [[angiosperms]]\n|unranked_classis = [[eudicots]]\n|unranked_ordo = [[rosids]]\n|ordo = [[fabales]]\n|familia = [[fabaceae]]\n|genus = \'\'[[abarema]]\'\'\n|species = \'\'\'\'\'a. centiflora\'\'\'\'\'\n|binomial = \'\'abarema centiflora\'\'\n|binomial_authority = [[rupert charles barneby|barneby]] & j.w.grimes\n|}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'abarema centiflora\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[legume]] in the [[fabaceae]] family. it is found only in the [[bolivia]]n [[andes]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:abarema|centiflora]]\n[[category:flora of bolivia]]\n[[category:vulnerable plants]]\n\n{{mimosoideae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abarestan</title><text>{{infobox settlement\n|official_name =abarestan\n|native_name =ابرستان\n|settlement_type        = village\n|pushpin_map            =iran\n|mapsize                =150px\n|coordinates_region     = ir\n|subdivision_type       = [[list of countries|country]]\n|subdivision_name = {{flag|iran}}\n|subdivision_type1 =[[provinces of iran|province]]\n|subdivision_name1 =[[kerman province|kerman]]\n|subdivision_type2 =[[counties of iran|county]]\n|subdivision_name2 = [[shahr-e babak county|shahr-e babak]]\n|subdivision_type3 =[[bakhsh]]\n|subdivision_name3 =[[central district (shahr-e babak county)|central]]\n|subdivision_type4 =[[rural districts of iran|rural district]]\n|subdivision_name4 =[[pa qaleh rural district|pa qaleh]]\n|leader_title           = \n|leader_name            = \n|established_title      =\n|established_date       = \n|area_total_km2           = \n|area_footnotes           = \n|population_as_of         = 2006\n|population_total =\n|population_density_km2   =auto\n|timezone               = [[iran standard time|irst]]\n|utc_offset             = +3:30\n|timezone_dst           = [[iran daylight time|irdt]]\n|utc_offset_dst         = +4:30\n|coordinates_display      = %\n|latd=30|latm=14|lats=23|latns=n\n|longd=55|longm=20|longs=18|longew=e\n|elevation_m            = \n|area_code              = \n|website                = \n|footnotes              =\n}}\n\'\'\'abarestan\'\'\' ({{lang-fa|ابرستان}}, also [[romanize]]d as \'\'\'Ābarestān\'\'\'; also known as \'\'\'Āz̄arestān\'\'\')<ref>{{geonet3|10505324|abarestan}}</ref> is a village in [[pa qaleh rural district]], in the [[central district (shahr-e babak county)|central district]] of [[shahr-e babak county]], [[kerman province]], [[iran]]. at the 2006 census, its existence was noted, but its population was not reported.<ref>{{irancensus2006|08}}</ref>  \n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{shahr-e babak county}}\n\n\n[[category:populated places in shahr-e 
<page> <title>abarta</title><text>{{distinguish2|[[abhartach]], an irish legend of similar pronunciation.}}\n\nin [[irish mythology]], \'\'\'abarta\'\'\' (possibly meaning \"doer of deeds\"<ref name=\"cotterell\"/>), was one of the [[tuatha dé danann]], and is associated with [[fionn mac cumhaill|finn maccool]].<ref name=\"cotterell\"/>\n\none tale of abarta\'s trickery is where he offered himself as a servant to finn maccool, shortly after maccool had succeeded his father as leader of the [[fianna]], a band of mighty [[milesian]] warriors.<ref name=\"cotterell\"/> in a gesture of goodwill, abarta then gave them a wild grey horse, which fourteen fianna had to mount onto its back before it would even move.<ref name=\"cotterell\"/> after abarta had mounted behind the fianna on the horse, it galloped off taking the warriors to the [[otherworld]] where the tuatha dé danann had been driven underground by the [[milesians]].<ref name=\"cotterell\"/>\n\nthe fianna, led by finn maccool\'s assistant foltor, had to acquire a magical ship to hunt down abarta\'s steed.<ref name=\"cotterell\"/> foltor, being the fianna\'s best tracker, managed to navigate into the otherworld, where abarta was made to release the imprisoned fianna warriors, and to satisfy honour, had to hold onto the horse\'s tail and be dragged back to [[ireland]].<ref name=\"cotterell\"/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist|\n<ref name=\"cotterell\">cotterell, arthur: \'\'the encyclopedia of mythology\'\', page 96. hermes house, 2007. isbn 1-84038-894-3</ref>\n}}\n\n{{irish mythology (fenian)}}\n{{irish mythology (mythological)}}\n\n{{celt-myth-stub}}\n\n[[category:fenian cycle]]\n[[category:tuatha dé danann]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abau_airport</title><text>{{infobox airport\n| name = abau airport\n| image = \n| image2 = \n| caption2 =\n| iata = abw\n| icao = \n| type =\n| owner        = \n| operator     = \n| location = [[abau]], [[papua new guinea]]\n| elevation-f = 10\n| elevation-m = 3\n| coordinates = {{coord|10|10|s|148|42|e|display=inline,title|name=abau airport}}\n| latd =  10 | latm = 10 | latns = s\n| longd= 148 | longm= 42 | longew= e\n| website = \n| pushpin_map            = papua new guinea\n| pushpin_label_position =\n| pushpin_label          = abw\n| pushpin_map_alt        =\n| pushpin_mapsize        =\n| pushpin_image          =\n| pushpin_map_caption    = location of airport in papua new guinea\n| metric-rwy = \n| r1-number = \n| r1-length-f = 2500\n| r1-length-m = \n| r1-surface = \n| stat-year = 2008\n| stat1-header = aircraft movements\n| stat1-data = \n| stat2-header = passengers\n| stat2-data = \n| footnotes = sources: <ref>[http://www.world-airport-codes.com/papua-new-guinea/abau-7.html world airport codes]</ref>\n}}\n\n\'\'\'abau airport\'\'\' {{airport codes|abw}} is an airport in [[abau]], [[papua new guinea]].\n\n==references==\n<references/>\n\n\n{{oceania-airport-stub}}\n{{papuanewguinea-geo-stub}}\n\n[[category:airports in papua new guinea]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abberley_clock_tower</title><text>{{infobox building\n| name                = abberley clock tower\n| image               = abberley clock tower.jpg\n| image_alt           = \n| image_size          = \n| caption             = \n| building_type       = clock tower\n|status = private building\n| architectural_style = \n| structural_system   = \n| cost                =  [[gbp|£]]7980\n| ren_cost            = \n| client              = john joseph jones\n| owner               = [[abberley hall school]]\n| coordinates         = {{coord|52.29745|-2.37572|display=title,inline|region:gb-wor_scale:2000}}\n| groundbreaking_date = \n| start_date          = 29 june 1883\n| completion_date     = october 1884\n| opened_date         = \n| inauguration_date   = \n| height              = {{convert|161|ft|m}}\n| architectural       =  clock by  j. b. joyce of whitchurch\n| references          = http://www.abberleyhall.co.uk/clock_tower\n| architect           =  [[james piers st aubyn]] \n| architecture_firm   = patman and fotheringham\n}}\n\n\'\'\'abberley clock tower\'\'\' is a prominent distinctive clock tower in [[abberley]], [[worcestershire]], england. built by [[james piers st aubyn]] around 1883 for [[abberley hall]]<ref name=sch>{{cite web|url=http://www.abberleyhall.co.uk/clock_tower|title=clock tower|work=abberley hall school|accessdate=1 october 2013}}</ref> it is now part of [[abberley hall school]].  it is a grade ii* [[listed building]]<ref>{{nhle |num=1082707|desc=abberley clock tower|grade=ii*|accessdate=01 october 2013}}</ref> and claimed to be visible from six counties.<ref name=sch/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n*{{cite book|last=pevsner|first=nicolas|title=the buildings of england: worcestershire|year=1968}}<!---referenced book from nhle--->\n\n[[category:clock towers in the united kingdom]]\n[[category:towers in worcestershire]]\n[[category:grade ii* listed buildings in worcestershire]]\n\n{{worcestershire-struct-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abbevillian</title><text>[[image:bifaz abbevillense.png|thumb|abbevillian biface flake from the [[douro]] river region near [[valladolid]], [[spain]]. it is unretouched and is not distinguishable from [[olduwan]]. the one small spot of smaller flaking on one edge may indicate that it is borderline between olduwan and [[acheulean]]. both are found in europe.]]\n\'\'\'abbevillian\'\'\' is a currently obsolescent name for a tool tradition that is increasingly coming to be called [[oldowan]] (or olduwan). the original artifacts were collected from road construction sites on the [[somme]] river near [[abbeville]] by a french customs officer, boucher de perthes. he published his findings in 1836.\n\nsubsequently [[louis laurent gabriel de mortillet]] (1821–1898), professor of prehistoric anthropology at the school of anthropology in [[paris]], published (1882) \"\'\'le prehistorique, antiquité de l\'homme\'\'\", in which he was the first to characterize periods by the name of a site. many of his names are still in use. his first two were [[chellean]] and [[acheulean]].\n\nchellean included artifacts discovered at the town of [[chelles, seine-et-marne|chelles]], a suburb of paris. they are similar to those found at abbeville. later anthropologists substituted abbevillian for chellean, the latter which is no longer in use.\n\n==history ==\nthe label abbevillian prevailed until the [[louis leakey|leakey]] family discovered older (yet similar) artifacts at [[olduvai gorge]] (a.k.a. [[oldupai gorge]]) and promoted the african origin of man. olduwan (or oldowan) soon replaced abbevillian in describing african and asian paleoliths. the term abbevillian is still used, but it is now restricted to europe. the label, however, continues to lose popularity as a scientific designation.\n\nmortillet had portrayed his traditions as chronologically sequential. in the abbevillian, early palaeolithic hominins used cores; in the acheulian, flakes. olduwan tools, however, ind

<page> <title>abbey_curran</title><text>{{infobox pageant titleholder\n| name=abbey curran\n| title=[[miss iowa usa]] 2008 (winner)\n| nationalcompetition=[[miss usa 2008]]\n| photo=\n| birth_place=[[kewanee, illinois]], u.s.\n| birth_name=abbey curran\n| birth_date= {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1987|07|28}}\n| height={{height|ft=5|in=5}}\n| eye_color=brown\n| hair_color=brunette\n}}\n\n\'\'\'abbey nicole curran\'\'\' (born 1987) is an american [[beauty contest|beauty pageant contestant]] from [[davenport, iowa]], who competed in the [[miss usa]] pageant in 2008. curran is the current chairman of her own non-profit pageant \"the miss you can do it pageant\" for young girls and women with special needs and challenges.{{clarifyme|date=february 2012}}<ref>[http://www.abbeyncurran.com/ abbey curran<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref>\n\n==miss usa 2008==\nabbey curran, 20, represented [[iowa]] at the [[miss usa 2008]] pageant in [[las vegas valley|las vegas]], held on april 11, 2008, where she competed against district of columbia and fifty other delegates. curran was the first contestant with a disability. curran was born with [[cerebral palsy]]. she also made an appearance on \'\'[[the ellen degeneres show]]\'\', cbs\' \'\'the early show\'\', \'\'[[inside edition]]\'\', \'\'[[access hollywood]]\'\', \'\'[[extra (tv series)|extra]]\'\', and \'\'[[cnn headline news]]\'\'. she also had an exclusive feature story in \'\'[[people magazine]]\'\'.<ref>[http://web.sau.edu/feature/abbey_curran.php abbey curran<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://ci.easterseals.com/site/pageserver?pagename=ilpr_abbeycurran easter seals peoria illinois : abbey curran - miss iowa 2008<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref>\n\n==personal life==\nabbey curran is a graduate from [[kewanee high school]] and currently{{when?|date=february 2012}} a student at [[st. ambrose university]].  abbey is a past easter seals ambassador. she received physical therapy services for [[cerebral palsy]] at the [
<page> <title>abbey_house_museum</title><text>[[image:kirkstall abbey house museum 2.jpg|thumb|abbey house museum in 2006]]\n[[file:kirkstall abbey house museum.jpg|thumb|abbey house museum]]\n\'\'\'abbey house museum\'\'\' in [[kirkstall]], [[leeds]], [[west yorkshire]], [[england]] is housed in the gatehouse of the ruined [[kirkstall abbey]], a grade ii* [[listed building]].  \n\nthe ground floor of the museum is set out as an area of [[victorian era|victorian]] streets, illustrating a range of shops and services and including original shop fittings etc.  upstairs galleries feature the history of kirkstall abbey, childhood, and leeds social history, as well as temporary exhibitions.  \n\n== external links ==\n* {{official|http://www.leeds.gov.uk/abbeyhouse/ }}\n* [http://www.bbc.co.uk/leeds/citylife/abbey_house/into_abbey.shtml bbc: abbey house museum tour]\n* {{ioe|464677}} \n* [http://www.yorkshiredailyphoto.com/2009/04/abbey-house-museum-kirkstall-leeds.html abbey house museum on leeds daily photo]\n{{commonscat}}\n{{coord|53|49|20|n|1|36|25|w|type:landmark_region:gb|display=title}}\n\n[[category:museums in leeds]]\n[[category:listed buildings in leeds]]\n[[category:grade ii* listed buildings in west yorkshire]]\n[[category:history museums in west yorkshire]]\n\n\n{{westyorkshire-struct-stub}}\n{{uk-museum-stub}}\n{{west yorkshire museums}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>abbey_of_saint_john_in_argentella</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=july 2013}}\nthe \'\'\'abbey of saint john in argentella\'\'\' (in italian \'\'abbazia di san giovanni in argentella\'\') is a site in [[palombara sabina]], in [[province of rome]], central [[italy]]. \nthe abbey, from 1963, is branch of a  the lay brotherhood of [[saint nicholas]] and [[saint sergius]].\n\n== history<ref name = \"history\" >[http://www.tibursuperbum.it/ita/escursioni/palombara/abbazias.giovanni/abbazias.giovanni.htm info].</ref> ==\n\nthe foundation of the church is attributed to   the [[lombards]], around 529. the name in argentella derives a spring of water in the near zone (maybe that of the long valley, in italian valle lunga).\n\na [[roman villa]] or  temple existed nearby, and perhaps part of its materials were re-used for the construction . \nin the 11th century the abbey was renewed. \nfrom  1284 to 1445, by order of the bishop and lord of palombara sabina jacopo savelli, the abbey was administered by the [[hermits of saint william]].\nin 1895<ref name = \"history\"/> the church was declared an italian national monument.\n\n== references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n== external links ==\n*[http://www.comune.palombarasabina.rm.it/mm/mm_p_dettaglio.php?idmonumento=1&x= information on the website of palombara sabina]\n*[http://www.tibursuperbum.it/ita/escursioni/palombara/abbazias.giovanni/index.htm information on the website of tibursuperbum]\n\n{{coord|42.0551|12.7524|type:landmark_region:it|display=title}}\n\n[[category:monasteries in lazio|saint john in argentella]]</text> </page>

<page> <title>abbot_of_cambuskenneth</title><text>the \'\'\'abbot of cambuskenneth\'\'\' or \'\'\'abbot of stirling\'\'\' (later \'\'\'commendator of cambuskenneth\'\'\') was the head of the [[arrouaise (abbey and order)|arrouaisian]] ([[augustinians|augustinian]]) monastic community of [[cambuskenneth abbey]], near [[stirling]]. the long history of the abbey came to a formal end when the abbey was turned into a secular lordship for the last commendator, alexander erskine.\n\nthe following is a list of [[abbot]]s and [[commendator]]s:\n\n==list of abbots==\n* william, 1147-1150\n* isaac, 1152x1153\n* alured, 1152x1153-1171x1178\n* nicholas, 1171x1182-1195\n* william, 1207-x 1235\n* peter, 1235-1240\n* richard, 1253-1269\n* richard grossus, 1269\n* john, 1287-1292\n* patrick, 1295-1296\n* michael, 1307\n* gilbert, 1308/1310\n* fergus, 1311\n* john, 1336\n* john de kincardine, 1336\n* william, 1342\n* adam, 1350\n* gilbert, 1362-1363\n* william de blackburn, 1390-1398\n* patrick de callendar, 1401-1434\n* david white, 1439-1443\n* david kelly (celle), 1445-1462\n* john, 1465\n* henry abercrombie, 1466-1502\n** alexander ruch (ruthven), x 1469<ref>became [[prior of inchmahome]].</ref>\n* [[david arnot]], 1503-1509\n* andrew macbreck, 1509-1511x1513\n* [[patrick paniter]] (painter), 1513-1519\n* alexander mylne, 1519-1548\n\n==list of commendators==\n* [[david paniter]], 1549-1558<ref>[[bishop of ross]] (1545-58).</ref>\n* adam erskine, 1562-1605\n** alexander livingstone, 1585\n* alexander erskine, 1608-1617\n\n==notes==\n<div class=\"references-small\">\n<references/>\n</div>\n\n==bibliography==\n* cowan, ian b. & easson, david e., \'\'medieval religious houses: scotland <small>with an appendix on the houses in the isle of man</small>\'\', second edition, (london, 1976), pp. 89-90\n* watt, d.e.r. & shead, n.f. <page> <title>abbott_family</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=october 2012}}\n{{infobox television family\n| name             = abbott\n| image            = \n| caption          = \n| series           = [[the young and the restless]]\n| type             = [[fictional]] [[family]]\n| creator          = [[william j. bell]]<br />[[lee phillip bell]] \n| origin           = \n| first_date       = {{start date|1980}}\n| last_date        = {{end date|present}}\n| first_appearance = \n| last_appearance  = \n| address          = \n| footnotes        = \n}}\nthe \'\'\'abbott family\'\'\' is a fictional family and one of the core families from the [[cbs daytime]] [[soap opera]], \'\'[[the young and the restless]]\'\'. the family is currently represented by the two sons of the late [[john abbott (the young and the restless)|john abbott]], [[jack abbott (the young and the restless)|jack abbott]] and [[billy abbott]]. john also had a daughter, [[traci abbott]], and a step-daughter, [[ashley abbott|ashley]], both of whom currently live in new york city. the family is most known for their ongoing feud with the [[newman family]], which has mostly revolved between [[victor newman]] and [[jack abbott (character)|jack abbott]].\n==family members==\n* only current spouses are shown in this article.\n* living family members appear in bold. family members that are not in bold have either passed away or have dropped off canvas.\n===first generation===\n* [[john abbott (character)|john abbott sr.]] (born 1928; died 2006) - son of robert & grandson of evan \npatriarch of the abbott family. father of [[jack abbott (character)|jack abbott]], [[traci abbott]], and step-father of [[ashley abbott]] with [[dina mergeron]]. father of [[billy abbott]] with [[jill foster abbott|jill foster]]. john founded the cosmetics company jabot. john has married numerous times over the years (include multiple marriages to the same people). john\'s former wives include: [[dina mergeron]], [[jill foster abbott|jill
<page> <title>abbottina_obtusirostris</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'abbottina obtusirostris\'\'\n| status = \n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[actinopterygii]]\n| ordo = [[cypriniformes]]\n| familia = [[cyprinidae]]\n| subfamilia = [[gobioninae]]\n| genus = [[abbottina]]\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. obtusirostris\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'abbottina obtusirostris\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[wu hsien-wen|h. w. wu]] & [[wang king-fu|ki. fu. wang]], 1931)\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'abbottina obtusirostris\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[ray-finned fish]] in the genus \'\'[[abbottina]]\'\' who are found in the upper [[yangtze river]] in [[szechwan]], china.<ref>http://fishbase.sinica.edu.tw/summary/speciessummary.php?id=55143</ref>\n\n== footnotes ==\n* {{fishbase|abbottina|obtusirostris}}\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n[[category:abbottina]]\n\n{{cyprinidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abchanchu</title><text>\'\'abchanchu\'\' ou \'\'achanchu\'\' são vampiros da bolívia que habitam cavernas montanhosas.o anchanchu é mostrado na forma de um homem velho e gentil, careca, obeso e sorridente. alguns descrevem vestindo roupas antigas bordadas em ouro e prata, tendo um chapéu de abas largas. suas características principais, pelo menos aqueles que são viajantes de alerta do planalto, estão com a cabeça e um sorriso gelado, perpétua, congelado em seus lábios. o abchanchu é um vampiro , que sempre aborda suas vítimas através do engano.a tática mais comum é como um velho em apuros com afirmações grandiosas pedidos de assistência aos viajantes com um problema em casa. aqueles que entram no covil de anchanchu nunca mais verão a luz do dia. modernos estudos de folclore boliviano  revelam os tons profundos da lenda abchanchu .suas roupas indicam uma linhagem divina, ou seja, pertencente ao quechua remoto panteão reduzido e exilado pelo avanço do cristianismo. de qualquer forma, o anchanchu não só ataca o sangue de estrangeiros.bolivianos  a todo o custo evitam as grutas e cavernas das montanhas, temendo ouvir os passos ameaçadores perseguindo o abchanchu . mesmo aqueles que sobrevivem os seus ataques, dizem os mais velhos, logo morrem de uma infecção por algo estranho que a medicina não foi capaz de detectar. na verdade, esses vampiros se converteram um nome: anchanchun uñkata  .no início do século xviii abchanchu foi preso, mitologicamente, nas regiões mais inacessíveis da montanha. um século mais tarde, o anchanchu reapareceu em aldeias e municípios da bolívia. de vampiro tornou-se insaciável campo de estrangulamento, causando incêndios e mortes suspeitas em fazendas, na verdade: o anchanchu tornou-se um demônio atmosférica, uma criatura que tem poder sobre os ventos e as tempestades. os anciãos sugeriram o seguinte encantamento se um encontro suspeito no vento montanha: entra, entra anchancliu, não faz ma
<page> <title>abdalla_people</title><text>\'\'\'abdalla\'\'\' refers to nomadic [[somali people|somali]] [[pastoralists]] living in the [[ijara district]] and [[garissa district]] of the [[north eastern province (kenya)|north eastern province]] (currently administered by kenya), and the badaade district of south-eastern [[somalia]]. they belong to the [[ogaden clan]] of the somali [[darod]], and are [[sunni islam|sunni muslims]].\n\n== references ==\n\n* antipa, r. s, ali, m. h. and hussein, a. a. (2007) [http://www.terranuova.info/file_download/49 preservation and maintenance of biological diversity related knowledge of indigenous diversity and local communities with traditional lifestyles boni forest, ijara district]. national environmental management authority of kenya.\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.nema.go.ke/about.html national environmental management authority of kenya].\n\n[[category:ethnic groups in kenya]]\n[[category:muslim communities in africa]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdallah_guennoun</title><text>{{moroccan literature}}\n\'\'\'abdallah guennoun\'\'\' (born in 1908 in [[fes]] - died 9 july 1989 in [[tangier]]) was a famous, and influential moroccan essayist.<ref>literatura marroqui [http://www.literaturamarroqui.edu.es/autores/ghennun,%20abdallah%20(1908-1989).pdf] (retrieved feb. 13, 2009)</ref> in 1927 and 1928, he wrote a three-volume book titled \'\'an nubûgh al maghribi\'\' (\"the genius of morocco\"), where he assesses the excellence of moroccan literature and philosophy.\n\nguennoun taught at the universities of [[cairo]], [[damascus]], [[baghdad]], and [[amman]].\n\n==on guennoun==\n*chaybi, ahmed. \'\'al-dirâsa al `adabiyya fî al-magrib: al-ustâdh `abd`allâh kanűn numudhadj\'\',\ntánger: madrasa al-malik fahd al-uliyâ li-l-tardjuma, 1991.\n*hababi, fatima al-djamiya al. \'\'abd allâh kanűn\'\', mohammedia: mat:ba`a fadhâla, 1991.\nabstract: abdallah guennun. estudio biográfico y literario.\n*hababi, fatima al-djamiya al. \'\'abd allâh kanűn\'\', casablanca: mu`asasas Űnâ, 1997.\n\n==notes==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==references==\n*\'\'memoirs of important men of morocco: ibn battuta, rabat:islamic educational, scientific and cultural organisation, 1996\n*\'\'dhikrayat mashahir rijal al-maghrib: ahmad zarruq, 1954\n*mohammed tozy, zakya daoud, \'\'abdallah guennoun ou le dernier des lettrés. lamalif (188), 1987:05, 13-16\n*rom landau, \'\'portrait of tangier\'\', ed. hale, 1952, chapter 30: \"guennoun\"\n\n==external links==\n*afrique info (in french) [http://www.africinfo.org/index.asp?navig=personalite&no=16372&table=personnes&code=ma] (retrieved feb. 13, 2009)\n*tangier.free.fr (in french) [http://tangier.free.fr/documents/abdallah_guennoun.htm] (retrieved feb. 13, 2009)\n\n{{authority control|viaf=118464479}}\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = guennoun, abdallah\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     = 1908\n| place

were not all [[prisoners of war]]. he condemned human rights violations by us and allied troops in the [[combined joint task force 7]]. he called for victims to be paid compensation.<ref>[http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/?id=7850 iraq\'s turki criticises coalition \'violations\'], \'\'[[middle east online]]\'\', 18 november 2003</ref>\n\nafter the emergence of the [[abu ghraib torture and prisoner abuse]] scandal in may 2004, turki stated that he had complained to [[paul bremer]], the us head of the [[coalition provisional authority]] in november 2003 of human rights violations in iraqi jails but had \"received no answer\".<ref>[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2004/05/04/1083635114111.html six reprimanded over abuse], \'\'[[the age]]\'\', 4 may 2004</ref>\n\nabdel basit turki al-sae\'ed is now iraq\'s acting central bank governor, and simultaneously the head of the country\'s supreme audit board. this questionable appointment was followed after he led an audit in september 2012 of the central bank currency auctions convincing him that $800 million is \"transferred illegally under false pretenses\" outside of the country every week. this was related in the october 31st 2012 report from the us government\'s [[special inspector general for iraq reconstruction]] (sigir). \"turki was not available for comment on his report\".<ref>[http://www.csmonitor.com/world/backchannels/2012/1101/repor

<page> <title>abdel_nasser_ould_ethmane</title><text>{{orphan|date=july 2013}}\n\n\'\'\'abdel nasser ould ethmane\'\'\' is one of the founding members of sos slaves. he along with boubacar messaoud founded the human rights organization to abolish slavery in [[mauritania]].\n\n==life==\nas a 7 year old abdel, was given the choice between gifts, and he choose to assume ownership of yebawa ould keihel, a young dark skinned boy. despite their bond, formed from childhood and nursing together, the two boys had been thrust into a master-slave relationship, and were prevented from fraternizing.<ref name=cnn>{{cite web|last=sutter|first=john|title=slave master becomes an abolotionist|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/03/17/world/africa/mauritania-slave-owner-abolitionist/index.html|work=article|publisher=cnn|accessdate=2012-05-17}}</ref>\n\nwhile studying in [[nouakchott]], abdel received a thorough education while living a nomadic life style. one notable aspect ofabdel\'s education, was his quirky european tutor who assigned abdel to the french cultural center, to supplement his education. while studying there, he became enamored by something he read in a text about the french revolution:\n\n{{quote box\n |quote  = \'\'\"men are born and remain free and equal in rights.\"\'\'\n |align  = center\n}}\n\nthis saying would soon take on greater significance to nasser over the next few years, as it began an awakening that would forever alter his values. after a period of reflection, he consulted with his father for advice. abdel discovered that his father not only encouraged his dissent from this custom, but in the past had tried to free his slaves, only to be met with resistance from the slaves themselves.<ref name=cnn />\n\nabdel, now able to contextualize the circumstances which allow for slavery to be perpetuated in his country, began to denounce slavery. he trained himself to do the basics, everyday tasks which were once performed by his slaves.\n\n===international work===\nabdel

<page> <title>abdinli</title><text>{{coord|38|55|19|n|48|09|27|e|display=title}}\n{{infobox settlement\n|official_name =abdinli\n|native_name = \n|pushpin_map            =azerbaijan\n|pushpin_mapsize                =300\n|coordinates_region     = az\n|subdivision_type       = country\n|subdivision_name       = {{flag|azerbaijan}}\n|subdivision_type1      = [[administrative divisions of azerbaijan|rayon]]\n|subdivision_name1      =[[yardymli rayon|yardymli]]\n|subdivision_type2      = municipality\n|subdivision_name2      =[[yeni abdinli]]\n|leader_title           = \n|leader_name            = \n|established_title      =\n|established_date       = \n|area_total_km2           = \n|area_footnotes           = \n|population_as_of         = \n|population_total =\n|population_density_km2   =\n|timezone =[[azerbaijan time|azt]]\n|utc_offset             = +4\n|timezone_dst           =[[azerbaijan time|azt]] \n|utc_offset_dst         = +5\n|latd=38 |latm=55 |lats=19 |latns=n\n|longd=48|longm=09 |longs=27 |longew=e\n|elevation_m            = \n|area_code              = \n|website                = \n}}\n\'\'\'abdinli\'\'\' (also, \'\'\'abidinli\'\'\', \'\'\'abdınlı\'\'\', \'\'\'abdunly\'\'\', and \'\'\'abdynly\'\'\') is a village in the [[yardymli rayon]] of [[azerbaijan]].  the village forms part of the municipality of [[yeni abdinli]].<ref>[http://www.belediyye.org/index.php?con=qanun&bkod=3637 belediyye informasiya sistemi] {{dead link|date=january 2013}}</ref>\n\n\n\n\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n*{{geonet2|32fa8815238b3774e0440003ba962ed3|abdinli (as abdınlı)}}\n\n==external links== \n*[http://www.maplandia.com/azerbaijan/azerbaydzhan-territor/abdinli/ satellite map at maplandia.com] \n\n\n{{yardymli rayon}}\n\n[[category:populated places in yardymli district]]\n\n\n\n\n{{yardymli-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdolhamid_rigi</title><text>{{infobox military person\n|image= \n|name=abdolhamid rigi (abdulhamid rigi)\n|birth_date= 1979<ref name=\"www2.irna.ir\">http://www2.irna.ir/fa/news/view/menu-273/8812030116104455.htm</ref>\n|death_date= may 24, 2010 (aged 31)\n|birth_place= [[sistan and baluchestan province|sistan & balochistan]], [[iran]]\n|death_place= zahedan, [[sistan and baluchestan province|sistan & balochistan]], [[iran]]\n||caption=\n|nickname= rigi\n|allegiance= [[jundallah (iran)|jundallah]] (\'\'soldier of god\'\')\n|serviceyears= 1998–2005\n|rank= [[brother of commander-in-chief]]\n|commands=\n|unit=\n|battles=[[balochistan conflict]]\n|awards=\n|laterwork=\n}}\n\'\'\'abdolhamid rigi\'\'\' ({{lang-fa|\'\'\'عبدالحمید ریگی\'\'\'}}) (also spelt \'\'abdul-hamid rigi\'\' or \'\'abdulhamid rigi\'\') (c. 1979 – may 24, 2010) was the elder brother of the detained leader of [[jundallah (iran)|jundallah]], [[abdolmalek rigi]].<ref>[http://www.handsoffcain.info/news/index.php?iddocumento=13308537 iran: abdolhamid rigi hanged in zahedan]</ref> like his brother, he too was a member of the [[sunni]] [[islamist]] militant group.\n\nhe was executed by [[hanging]] in prison on may 24, 2010.\n\n==detention==\nrigi was arrested by pakistani forces and transferred to iranian officials in 2008 with 13 other militants. he was tried through the iranian judiciary system, and was convicted of membership in the \"terrorist group,\" jundollah (god\'s soldiers); insurgency; smuggling; participating in the bombing and killing of civilians and police, including the [[revolutionary guards]]; as well as being \'\'[[mohareb]]\'\' (at war with god). he was sentenced to death through [[capital punishment]].\n\n===culpability===\nin june 2009, during an interview with [[press tv]], he confessed to killing his wife and his brother-in-law. he also condemned his brother\'s acts.<ref>[http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=97427&sectionid=351020101 rigi confesses to n
<page> <title>abdominal_surgery</title><text>{{refimprove|date=october 2013}}\nthe term \'\'\'\'\'abdominal surgery\'\'\'\'\' broadly covers surgical procedures that involve opening the [[abdomen]].  surgery of each abdominal organ is dealt with separately in connection with the description of that organ (see [[stomach]], [[kidney]], [[liver]], etc.) diseases affecting the abdominal cavity are dealt with generally under their own names (e.g. [[appendicitis]]).\n\n== types ==\nthe most common abdominal surgeries are described below.\n\n*[[appendectomy]]—surgical opening of the abdominal cavity and removal of the [[vermiform appendix|appendix]].  typically performed as definitive treatment for appendicitis, although sometimes the appendix is prophylactically removed incidental to another abdominal procedure.\n*[[caesarean section]] (also known as c-section) is a surgical procedure in which one or more incisions are made through a mother\'s abdomen (laparotomy) and uterus (hysterotomy) to deliver one or more babies, or, rarely, to remove a dead fetus.\n*[[inguinal hernia surgery]] - this refers to the repair of an [[inguinal hernia]].\n*exploratory [[laparotomy]]—this refers to the opening of the [[abdominal cavity]] for direct examination of its contents, for example, to locate a source of bleeding or [[physical trauma|trauma]]. it may or may not be followed by repair or removal of the primary problem.\n*[[laparoscopy]]—a [[minimally invasive]] approach to abdominal surgery where rigid tubes are inserted through small incisions into the abdominal cavity. the tubes allow introduction of a small camera, surgical instruments, and gases into the cavity for direct or indirect visualization and treatment of the abdomen. the abdomen is inflated with carbon dioxide gas to facilitate visualization and, often, a small video camera is used to show the procedure on a monitor in the operating room.  the surgeon manipulates instruments within the abdominal cavity to perform p
<page> <title>abdou_diouf</title><text>{{infobox president\n|image=abdou diouf.jpg\n|name=abdou diouf\n|order=2nd [[list of presidents of senegal|president of senegal]]\n|term_start=january 1, 1981\n|term_end=april 1, 2000\n|primeminister=[[habib thiam]]\n|predecessor=[[léopold sédar senghor]]\n|successor=[[abdoulaye wade]]\n|birth_date={{birth date and age|1935|9|7|mf=y}}\n|birth_place=[[louga]], [[senegal]]\n|party=[[socialist party of senegal]]\n|alma_mater= [[pantheon-sorbonne university]]\n|religion=[[sunni islam]] ([[maliki]]-[[ash\'ari]], [[tijani]])\n|spouse = elizabeth diouf\n}}\n\n\'\'\'abdou diouf\'\'\' ({{pronunciation|en-us-abdou diouf from senegal pronunciation (voice of america).ogg}} {{respell|ahb|doo}} {{respell|d-yoo-f|\'}};{{need-ipa}} [[serer language|serer]]: {{lang|srr|\'\'abdu juuf\'\'}}; born september 7, 1935<ref name=ps>[http://www.partisocialiste.sn/ps_vie/bioabdou.htm biography at socialist party website] {{fr icon}}.</ref>) is a [[senegal]]ese politician, and served as the second [[list of presidents of senegal|president]] of [[senegal]] from 1981 to 2000.  diouf is notable both for coming to power by peaceful succession, and leaving willingly after losing the [[senegalese presidential election, 2000|2000 presidential election]] to [[abdoulaye wade]]. he has been the secretary-general of [[francophonie|la francophonie]] since 2003.\n\n== early life ==\ndiouf was born in [[louga]], senegal, the child of an hal [[pulaar]] mother and a [[serer people|serere]] father.  he went to primary and secondary school at the lycée faidherbe in [[saint-louis, senegal|saint-louis]], and studied law at [[dakar]] university and then at the [[sorbonne]], [[paris]].  diouf graduated in 1959.<ref name=\"rake\"/>\n\n== political career ==\nafter graduation, diouf returned to senegal, where in september 1960 he was appointed director of international technical cooperation. in november 1960 he became assistant of the secretary-general of the government, and

olympics|represented afghanistan]] at the [[1996 summer olympics]] in [[atlanta]]. he injured his leg (hamstring muscle) before the [[marathon]], but took part nonetheless.<ref>[http://www.rediff.com/sports/2004/aug/27oly-ath9.htm \"the true spirit of the games\"], reuters, august 27, 2004</ref> he completed the race despite his injury, after limping the whole way, with a time of 4:24:17, well short of his personal best of two hours and thirty-three minutes.<ref name=\"taleban hope to get ban revoked\">[http://www.rediff.com/sports/2000/aug/17tal.htm \"taleban hope to get ban revoked\"], reuters, august 17, 2000</ref><ref>[http://books.google.fr/books?id=qd6a9zruxksc&pg=pa24&lpg=pa24&dq=%22abdul+baser+wasigi%22&source=web&ots=whf06_iwho&sig=qz2jzpyye7hmg7kkrjy_uobqxjk&hl=fr&sa=x&oi=book_result&resnum=6&ct=result \'\'olympic track and field\'\'], brian belval, 2007, isbn 1-4042-0971-9, p.24</ref> he finished 111th and last, nearly an hour and a half behind the second-slowest competitor. wasiqi reached the stadium and found \"workmen [...] preparing the arena for the closing ceremony\" and \"tarpaulin being laid across the running track\".<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/htmlcontent.jhtml?html=/archive/1996/08/05/spcomm05.html \"britain stuck in time warp as the world races further ahead\"], \'\'the telegraph\'\', august 5, <page> <title>abdul_hafiz_mansoor</title><text>\'\'\'abdul hafiz mansoor\'\'\' (mansour) was born in 1963 in the [[panjsher valley]] of [[afghanistan]]. he is a member of the [[jamiat-e islami]]. after the fall of the taliban in 2001, mansoor served as the first director of state radio and television in afghanistan. as director, he was criticized for some of his conservative decisions, which included a ban on showing female singers on tv. \n\nmansoor was a candidate to chair the [[2003 loya jirga]], but got fewer votes then [[sibghatullah mojaddedi]]. he also ran for president in the [[afghan presidential election, 2004|election of october 2004]], but only received 0.2% of the vote. mansoor has been highly critical of president karzai, and has accused him of trying to form a dictatorship.<ref>[http://www.afghan-web.com/bios/today/others.html#mansoor mansoor bio on afghan web]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = abdul hafiz mansoor\n| alternative names =\n| short description = first director of state radio and television in afghanistan in the post-taliban era.\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:jamiat-e islami politicians]]\n\n\n{{afghanistan-politician-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>abdul_quddoos_khan</title><text>{{for|dr. abdul qadeer khan, the pakistani scientist and metallurgical engineer involved in nuclear weapons technology proliferation|abdul qadeer khan}}\n\n\'\'\'abdul quddoos khan\'\'\' ([[urdu language|urdu]]: عبدالقدوس خان) is a [[pakistan]]i [[microbiologist]].<ref name=wapo20030323>\n{{cite news\n| url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/06/09/ar2006060900918.html\n| title=al qaeda near biological, chemical arms production\n| pages=page a1\n| publisher=[[washington post]]\n| author=[[barton gellman]]\n| date= march 23, 2003\n| accessdate=2011-08-19\n}}</ref>  [[khalid sheikh mohammed]], widely considered one of the masterminds of the september 11, 2001 [[al qaeda]] attacks in the united states, was captured in khan\'s home on march 1, 2003.  \n\naccording to an article published in the [[washington post]] on march 23, 2003 unnamed officials believe \"handwritten documents and computer hard drives\" found in khan\'s home suggest that al qaeda had a program to develop [[biological weapon]]s.<ref name=wapo20030323/>  the washington post reported that khan had \"disappeared\".<ref name=wapo20030323/>\n\n==references==\n<references/>\n{{wotprisoners|state=collapsed}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = khan, abdul quddoos\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:khan, abdul quddoos}}\n[[category:pakistani people]]\n[[category:pakistani microbiologists]]\n[[category:living people]]\n\n\n{{pakistan-scientist-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdul_rahman_hashim</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=september 2010}}\n[[malay titles#tan_sri|tan sri]] \'\'\'abdul rahman hashim\'\'\' (7 july 1925- 7 june 1974) was [[malaysia]]\'s [[inspector-general of police]] from 1 february 1973 to 7 june 1974. \n\n==life==\nabdul rahman hashim was born in [[yan]], [[kedah]] on 7 july 1925. he went to school at the malay school in sungai limau dalam, yan, kedah. next he study at [[sultan abdul hamid college]] in alor star and pass the [[senior cambridge]] in december 1940.\n\n==police career==\nafter completing his studies, he became a police officer of kedah (october 17, 1941), kuala nerang police chief; ocpd baling (1948) criminal investigation officer (1949); assistant superintendent of police (january 1952); assistant chief district police kulai, johor; officer in charge of police range in batu gajah; head of the special branch of penang (1960), deputy director of the special branch (1963); director of special branch (1971), deputy inspector general of police (1972) and the inspector-general of police (february 1st, 1973-7 jun 1974).\n\nhe was sent to attend the criminal investigation course for 3 months in millmeece stafford, united kingdom (april 1953) and senior officers course for six months in rynton-on-dunsmore or bramshill police college in the united kingdom (1957).\n\n==assassination==\non 7 june 1974, he was shot dead by the [[communist party of malaya|communist subversive]] who the one leader of [[royal malaysian police]] murdered by the communist at mounbatten road (now [[jalan tun perak]]) and weld road (now  [[jalan raja chulan]]), [[kuala lumpur]] and he died at this spot. on 8 june 1974, he was given a police heroes funeral and was laid to rest at [[jalan ampang muslim cemetery]], [[kuala lumpur]]. after his death, his was succeed by [[hanif omar|tun hanif omar]].\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = hashim, abdul rahman\n| alternative names =\n| short description = malaysia\'s inspector-ge
<page> <title>abdul_rahman_mokhtar</title><text>{{improvereferences |date=july 2013}} \n\n\'\'\'abdul rahman mokhtar\'\'\' (died june 26, 2013) was a malaysian politician. he was [[terengganu]] state representative for [[kuala besut]].\n\n\n==death==\nmokhtar died of lung cancer on june 26, 2013 at the age of 55.<ref>[http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2013/06/26/umnos-kuala-besut-state-rep-dies/ umno\'s kuala besut state rep dies]</ref>\n\n\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = mokhtar, abdul rahman \n| alternative names = \n| short description = malaysian politician\n| date of birth     = \n| place of birth    = \n| date of death     = june 26, 2013\n| place of death    = \n}}\n\n{{defaultsort:mokhtar, abdul rahman}}\n{{malaysia-politician-stub}}\n[[category:2013 deaths]]\n[[category:malaysian politicians]]\n[[category:year of birth missing]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdul_samad_rohani</title><text>[[image:rohani.jpg|thumb|200px|abdul rohani]]\n\n\'\'\'abdul samad rohani\'\'\' (born 1982 or 1983, died june 7 or 8, 2008) was an [[afghanistan|afghan]] [[journalist]] who worked for the [[british broadcasting corporation]] (bbc) and the afghan news agency [[pajhwok]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=27370 |title=bbc journalist killed in the south of the country |publisher=reporters without borders |date=2008-06-08}}</ref> he was [[kidnapping|abducted]] in [[helmand province]], [[afghanistan]], on june 7, 2008, and found [[murder]]ed the following day in [[lashkar gah]].<ref name=\"bbc afghan reporter is shot dead\">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7442772.stm |title=bbc afghan reporter is shot dead |publisher=bbc news |date=2008-06-08}}</ref><ref>[http://ukpress.google.com/article/aleqm5i5kvdtsl-bn5ytks7i6pqui7hxra \"bbc afghan journalist shot in head\"], the press association, june 8, 2008{{dead link|date=november 2012|bot=legobot}}</ref> \'\'[[reporters without borders]]\'\' stated that he had apparently been [[torture]]d and then shot three times.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=27370 |title=bbc journalist killed in the south of the country |publisher=reporters without borders |date=2008-06-08}}</ref>\n\nrohani had worked in helmand as the head of the bbc world service\'s [[pashto language|pashto]] service. the bbc issued a statement praising his \"courage and dedication\".<ref name=\"bbc afghan reporter is shot dead\"/>\n\nthe [[taliban]] reportedly denied involvement in his murder.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/homepagecrisis/idukisl36744._ch_.242020080608 \"afghan reporter for bbc killed in helmand\"], reuters, june 8, 2008</ref>\n\nrohani was abducted on the same day that bbc reporter [[nasteh dahir]] was murdered in [[somalia]].<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2008/world/africa/06/07/somalia.journalist/ \"leading somali journalist
<page> <title>abdul_sattar_khan_niazi</title><text>{{refimprove|date=september 2010}}\n\'\'\'abdul sattar khan niazi\'\'\' (october 1, 1915-may 2, 2001)<ref>http://www.senate.gov.pk/showmemberdetail.asp?membercode=300&catcode=0&catname=</ref> was a religious and political leader of [[pakistan]]. he was born at [[isakhel]] in district [[mianwali]]. after initial education, he opted for religious education in [[lahore]]. he obtained his master\'s degree from [[islamia college (lahore)|islamia college,lahore]], and was later appointed the dean of islamic studies at the same college. he remained at that position until 1947, after which he joined active politics.\n\nabdus sattar khan niazi was an active participant in the political struggle for the creation of pakistan. he was elected the president of punjab [[muslim students federation]] in 1938. he then took the position of the president of the provincial (punjab) [[all-india muslim league|muslim league]] until the creation of [[pakistan]] in 1947. abdus sattar khan niazi was elected as secretary general of the [[bangladesh awami league|all-pakistan awami muslim league]] in 1950 under the presidentship of [[huseyn shaheed suhrawardy]]. he was briefly arrested along with [[abul ala maududi]] by the [[pakistan army]] for purportedly inciting the [[lahore riots of 1953]] against the [[ahmadiyya]]. he worked as the secretary general of the central [[jamiat ulema-e-pakistan]] from 1973 to 1989 and was elected as the president of the central [[jamiat ulema-e-pakistan]] in 1989. he was elected member of the [[national assembly of pakistan]] twice, in 1988 and 1990. he was elected to the [[senate of pakistan]] in 1994 for a six years term.\n\nabdus sattar khan niazi never married and devoted his life to his political and religious career.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = niazi, maulana abdul sattar khan\n| alternative names =\n| short descrip
<page> <title>abdul_wahab_khan</title><text>{{blp sources|date=february 2009}}\n{{infobox officeholder\n|name        = abdul wahab khan\n|office      = [[speaker of the national assembly of pakistan|speaker of the national assembly]]\n|deputy      = [[c. e. gibbon]]\n|term_start  = 12 august 1955\n|term_end    = 7 october 1958\n|predecessor = [[maulvi tamizuddin khan]]\n|successor   = [[maulvi tamizuddin khan]]\n|birth_date  = \n|birth_place = \n|death_date  = \n|death_place = \n|party       = [[muslim league (pakistan)|muslim league]]\n}}\n\'\'\'abdul wahab khan\'\'\' was the 3rd speaker of the [[national assembly of pakistan]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.na.gov.pk/h_speaker.html |title=speakers / presidents |publisher=[[national assembly of pakistan]] |accessdate=5 march 2011 }}</ref> he was preceded and succeeded by [[maulvi tamizuddin khan]]. he was born into a middle-class [[muslim]] family in [[east pakistan]]. in later years, he became a bengali nationalist. he is the grandfather of [[salman khan (educator)|salman khan]], founder of the [[khan academy]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{s-start}}\n{{s-off}}\n{{s-bef|before=[[maulvi tamizuddin khan]]}}\n{{s-ttl|title=[[speaker of the national assembly of pakistan|speaker of the national assembly]]|years=1955–1962}}\n{{s-aft|after=[[maulvi tamizuddin khan]]}}\n{{s-end}}\n\n{{speaker national assembly pakistan}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = khan, abdul wahab\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:khan, abdul wahab}}\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:pakistani politicians]]\n[[category:speakers of the national assembly of pakistan]]\n[[category:year of birth missing (living people)]]\n\n\n{{pakistan-politician-stub}}</text> </page>
