<page> <title>abdulai_seidu</title><text>{{infobox football biography\n| name= abdul seidu\n| image = \n| fullname = abdulai nassar seidu \n| image    = \n| birth_date  = {{birth date and age|1992|09|08}} \n| birth_place = [[tamale]], [[ghana]]\n| height = {{height|m=1.78}}\n| currentclub  = [[berekum arsenal]]\n| clubnumber = 3\n| position = defender\n| youthyears1 = 2007\n| youthclubs1 = semereka\n| years1 = 2008 \n| years2 = 2008-\n| clubs1 = [[tema youth]] \n| clubs2 = [[berekum arsenal]]\n| caps1 =  \n| caps2 =  \n| goals1 =  \n| goals2 =\n| pcupdate =\n}}\n\'\'\'abdulai nassar seidu\'\'\' (born 8 september 1992 in [[ghana]]) is a [[ghana]]ian [[soccer|football]] player currently playing for [[ghana telecom premier league]] side [[berekum arsenal]].\n\n== career ==\nseidu began his career with semereka and joined than to [[tema youth]], after one year signed on 26 april 2008 for [[berekum arsenal]].<ref>[http://www.ghanafa.org/2008registration/arsenal.pdf registered players globacom premier league 2008]</ref>\n\n== international career ==\nhe was a part of [[ghana national under-17 football team]] in [[2007 fifa u-17 world cup]] in [[korea republic]], but didn\'t play any match in the tournament.<ref>[http://de.fifa.com/worldfootball/statisticsandrecords/players/player=274960/index.html fifa.com - fifa spielerstatistik abdulai seidu]</ref>\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = seidu, abdulai\n| alternative names =\n| short description = ghanaian footballer\n| date of birth     = 8 september 1992\n| place of birth    = [[tamale]], [[ghana]]\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:seidu, abdulai}}\n[[category:1992 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:ghanaian footballers]]\n[[category:berekum arsenal players]]\n[[category:tema youth players]]\n\n\n{{ghana-footy-bio-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdulaziz_alsibyani</title><text>{{orphan|date=november 2012}}\n\n{{infobox football biography\n| name= abdulaziz alsibyani \n| fullname = abdulaziz alsibyani ayash<ref name=\"profile\">{{cite web|title=alsibiyani profile #full name|url=http://www.gz2010.cn/info/eng/zb/zbb101a_fb@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@eng_number=246751.htm|publisher=ittihad fc|date=24 july 2009|accessdate=28 august 2011}}</ref>\n| image = \n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|4|12}}\n| birth_place = [[saudi arabia]]\n| height = {{height|m=1.71}}\n| currentclub  = [[al-qadisiyah fc|al-qadisiyah]]\n| clubnumber = 3\n| position = [[forward (association football)|forward]]\n| youthyears1 =   \n| youthclubs1 =   \n| years1 =   2008-2011\n| years2 =   2011-\n| clubs1 =   [[al-ittihad (jeddah)|al-ittihad]]\n| clubs2 =   [[al-qadisiyah fc|al-qadisiyah]]\n| caps1 =    15  \n| goals1 =  1 \n| caps2 =    7  \n| goals2 =  0 \n| nationalyears1 =   \n| nationalteam1 =   \n| nationalcaps1 =      \n| nationalgoals1 =    \n| pcupdate = 6/2/2012\n| ntupdate = 24/8/2011}}\n\'\'\'abdulaziz al-subyani\'\'\' (born april 12, 1989) is a [[saudi arabia]]n [[association football|football]]er, playing for  [[al-ittihad (jeddah)|al-ittihad]] club.  he plays as a [[forward (association football)|forward]] or [[winger (sports)|winger]]. he is known for his speedily attack playing-style.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist|colwidth=30em}}\n\n{{al-ittihad squad}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = alsibyani, abdulaziz\n| alternative names =\n| short description = footballer\n| date of birth     = april 12, 1989\n| place of birth    = [[saudi arabia]]\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:alsibyani, abdulaziz}}\n[[category:1989 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:saudi arabian footballers]]\n[[category:ittihad fc players]]\n[[category:association football forwards]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdullah_mahmud_hendropriyono</title><text>{{underlinked|date=december 2012}}\n\n{{more footnotes|date=june 2009}}\n\'\'\'abdulah mahmud hendropriyono\'\'\' {{audio-ipa|en-us-a.m. hendropriyono from indonesia pronunciation (voice of america).ogg|pronunction}} {{respell|hehn|dro|pree-o|noh|\'}} {{need-ipa}} (born 7 may 1945 in [[yogyakarta]]) is a retired four-star general from kopassus (indonesia\'s special force).\n\n==career==\nhe is a former director of indonesia\'s national intelligence agency (badan intelijen negara) between 2001 and 2004, and minister of transmigration and resettlement of forest nomads between 1998 and 1999. \n\nhendropriyono claims that in 1998 indonesian intelligence agents discovered al-qaida and osama bin laden\'s plans to attack the us.  \nafter september 11, he claimed \"[w]e had intelligence predicting the september 11 attacks three years before it happened but nobody believed us.\"  \nuntil october 2002, he was the only man fighting terror in indonesia while most of the indonesian officials rejected claims of the existence of the islamic extremists group.\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.xs4all.nl/~endi/hendro-bio.htm biography]\n* [http://www.hendropriyono.com am hendropriyono website]\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              =hendropriyono, abdullah mahmud\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     = 7 may 1945\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:hendropriyono, abdullah mahmud}}\n[[category:1945 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:people from yogyakarta]]\n[[category:terrorism in indonesia]]\n[[category:indonesian generals]]\n\n\n{{indonesia-mil-bio-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abdullah_musawi_shirazi</title><text>{{other people2|shirazi (disambiguation){{!}}shirazi}}\n\'\'{{infobox person\n| name =          grand [[ayatollah]] sayyed abdullah al-shirazi\n| other_names =\n| image =\n| imagesize =     214px\n| caption =       {{ffdc|1=al-shirazi (3).gif|log=28 april 2010|date=december 2012}}\n| birth_date =    {{birth date|1892|2|25|mf=y}}\n| birth_place =   [[shiraz]], [[iran]]\n| death_date =    {{death date and age|1984|9|29|1892|2|25|mf=y}}\n| death_place =   [[mashhad]], [[iran]]\n| religion  =     [[twelver]] [[shia islam]]\n}}\n\'\'\'grand ayatollah sayyed abdullah al-musawi al-shirazi\'\'\' (february 25, 1892 &ndash; september 29, 1984) was a [[grand ayatollah]] of [[twelver]] [[shi\'a]] [[islam]].\n\n==life==\ngrand ayatollah haj sayyed abdullah al-shirazi was born in [[shiraz, iran|shiraz]], [[iran]]. at the age of 15 he was sent into exile with his father, ayatollah sayyed muhammad tahir al-shirazi, for resisting the [[qajar dynasty|qajar]] and [[united kingdom|british]] colonial rule in southern iran. his father was a nationally renowned cleric who was known for his resistance against the british government.\n\nin 1914 he was sent to [[najaf]], [[iraq]] to study advanced islamic jurisprudence under shaikh na\'ini.\n\nal-shirazi was sentenced to 4 years in prison in 1935, during the famous [[goharshad mosque]] uprising in the city of [[mashad]] against the anti-religious policies of [[reza shah|reza shah pahlavi]]. after his release, he returned to najaf, and soon became one of the [[marja\'|marja]] of taqleed of shi\'a there. the marja of taqleed are clerics that have the authority to declare [[fatwa]]s and decrees into all matters of islamic jurisprudence. only a few exist at any given time.\n\nin 1975 al-shirazi returned to iran and joined the movement against the last [[pahlavi dynasty|shah of iran]], [[mohammad reza pahlavi]], until his government was overthrown in 1979. by then he had ascended to the rank of g
<page> <title>abdullah_sahib</title><text>{{orphan|date=september 2012}}\n\n[[image:abdullah sahib.jpg|thumb|abdullah sahib, father of [[qudrat ullah shahab]]]]\n\'\'\'abdullah sahib\'\'\' was the governor of [[gilgit, pakistan|gilgit]] during [[dogra]] rule and was one of the earliest graduates of [[mao college|aligarh]]. he was the father of eminent [[pakistan]]i writer [[qudrat ullah shahab]].\n\n==life==\nhe was born in [[punjab (british india)|punjab]], [[british india]], and at the age of six became orphan. after seeing the loss of his father\'s property in loan servicing he decided to build a property unable to be taken by anyone. he dedicated his life to education and became the first [[muslim]] student who topped [[matriculation]] exam in [[ambala district]], punjab province, this was during the early period of the [[aligarh movement]] led by [[sir syed ahmed khan]]. abdullah sahib soon joined [[mao college|aligarh college]] where he excelled in [[english language|english]], [[arabic language|arabic]], [[persian language|persian]], [[philosophy]], and [[mathematics]]. when he finished his [[bachelor of arts|ba]] he was one of the earliest graduates of [[mao college|aligarh]]. \n\nsir syed arranged a scholarship for sahib to take the [[indian civil service]] exam in [[england]], which he refused due to his mother\'s request. sir syed was and he expelled him from aligarh and asked him not to show his face to him again. abdullah sahib honoured his words and became a [[clerk (position)|clerk]] at [[gilgit]], a far off place even today. he was soon made [[governor]] of the province. he spent eighteen to twenty years in gilgit, and all his children, three sons and three daughters were born there. he was a close associate of [[partab singh of kashmir|maharaja pratap singh]], and was an expert on international relations especially with [[russia]] and [[china]].\n\n==see also==\n*[[qudrat ullah shahab]], his son\n*[[aligarh muslim university]]\n\n==references==\n\'\
<page> <title>abdullah_wabran</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=september 2012}}\n{{infobox football biography\n| name        = abdullah wabran\n| image       =\n| fullname    = abdullah wabran saihan al-rasheedi\n| birth_date  = {{birth date and age|1971|7|2|df=y}}\n| birth_place = [[kuwait]]\n| height = \n| currentclub = [[retired]]\n| clubnumber  = 11\n| position    = [[midfield (association football)|midfielder]]\n| youthyears1 = –\n| youthclubs1 = [[al tadamun sc (kuwait)|al tadamun sc]]\n| years1 = 1989–1995\n| years2 = 1995–1996\n| years3 = 1996–2000\n| years4 = 2000–2005\n| years5 = 2005–2007\n| clubs1 = [[al tadamun sc (kuwait)|al tadamun sc]]\n| clubs2 = [[al-arabi sc (kuwait)|al-arabi sc]]\n| clubs3 = [[al rayyan sports club|al rayyan sc]]\n| clubs4 = [[al tadamun sc (kuwait)|al tadamun sc]]\n| clubs5 = [[al-arabi sc (kuwait)|al-arabi sc]]\n| caps1= \n| caps2 = \n| goals1 = \n| goals2 = \n| nationalyears1 = 1992–2007\n| nationalteam1  = [[kuwait national football team|kuwait]]\n| nationalcaps1  = \n| nationalgoals1 = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'abdullah wabran saihan\'\'\' (born 2 july 1971) is a former [[kuwait]]i [[association football|footballers]], he played for [[kuwait national football team]]. he participated in two editions of the [[football at the summer olympics|olympic games]] (1992, 2000) and in two editions of the [[afc asian cup]] (1996, 2000).\n\n==honours==\n\n===personal===\n* best player of the [[1996 gulf cup of nations]] in [[oman]]\n\n===club===\n* winner twice the [[kuwait emir cup]] in 1996, 2006 with [[al-arabi sc (kuwait)|al-arabi sc]]\n* winner twice the [[kuwait crown prince cup]] in 1996, 2007 with [[al-arabi sc (kuwait)|al-arabi sc]]\n* winner once the \'\'\'sport united cup\'\'\' in 1996 with [[al-arabi sc (kuwait)|al-arabi sc]]\n* winner once the [[emir of qatar cup]] in 1999 with [[al rayyan sports club|al rayyan sc]]\n\n===national===\n* winner twice of the [[gulf cup of nations]] 1996 in [[oman]] and 1998 in [[bahrain]]\n

<page> <title>abdussalam_al_qadi</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=february 2013}}\n{{infobox minister\n| name = abdussalam al qadi\n| image   = \n| imagesize = \n| office1 = \n| primeminister1 = \n| predecessor1 =\n| successor1 = \n| term_start1 = \n| term_end1 = \n| office = [[cabinet of libya|third deputy prime minister of libya]]\n| president = \n| primeminister=[[ali zeidan]]\n| predecessor =\n| successor =  \n| term_start =november 2012\n| term_end = \n| birth_date = \n| birth_place =\n| death_date = \n| death_place      = \n| restingplace     = \n| party = \n| residence = \n| alma_mater = [[sebha university]]\n| spouse = \n| nationality = libyan\n| religion= \n| children = \n| website = \n| footnotes = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'abdussalam al qadi\'\'\' is a libyan politician and third deputy prime minister.\n\n==education==\nqadi received a bachelor’s degree in science from [[sebha university]].<ref name=lheral3nov12>{{cite news|title=curriculum vitae of ali zeidan’s government ministers|url=http://www.libyaherald.com/2012/11/03/curriculum-vitae-of-ali-zeidans-government-ministers/|accessdate=17 february 2013|newspaper=libya herald|date=3 november 2012}}</ref> then he obtained a master\'s degree in olive oil extraction technology from [[spain]].\n\n==career==\nqadi worked in the sectors of agriculture and industry as a manager.<ref name=lbbc>{{cite web|title=the curriculum vitae|url=http://www.lbbc.org.uk/market_intelligence.php|publisher=lbbc|accessdate=17 february 2013}}</ref> in november 2012, qadi was appointed by prime minister [[ali zeidan]] as the third deputy prime minister.<ref name=ukborder>{{cite web|title=background information|url=http://www.ecoi.net/file_upload/1226_1357114114_lby-cr-dec12-ukba.pdf|publisher=uk border agency|accessdate=17 february 2013}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = abdussalam al qadi\n| alternative names =\n| short description = libyan politician\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth   
<page> <title>abe_attell</title><text>{{infobox boxer\n| name = abe attell\n| realname = abraham washington attell\n| image = abe attell loc.jpg\n| nickname = \n| nationality = {{flagicon|united states}} american\n| weight = [[featherweight]]\n| birth_date = february 22, 1883\n| birth_place =  [[san francisco]], [[california]]\n| death_date = {{death date and age|1970|2|7|1883|2|22|mf=y}} \n| death_place = [[new paltz (village), new york|new paltz, new york]]\n| style = [[orthodox stance|orthodox]]\n| total = 172\n| wins = 125\n| ko = 51\n| losses = 18\n| draws = 21\n| no contests = 8\n}}\n\'\'\'abraham washington \"abe\" attell\'\'\' (february 22, 1883 – february 7, 1970), known in the [[boxing]] [[world]] as \'\'\'abe \"the little hebrew\" attell\'\'\', was a [[boxing|boxer]] who became known for his record-setting six-year reign as world featherweight champion.  said to be a friend of the gangster [[arnold rothstein]], attell was charged with game fixing in the [[black sox scandal]] in 1919, but the charges were dismissed before trial. he also was implicated in other sports controversies.<ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=arrange to give up attel. attorneys for him and \"sport\" sullivan see replogic as to bail |url=http://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=f70614fc355411738dddab0894d9415b808ef1d3 |quote= attorneys representing abe attel and john j. (sport) sullivan, indicted as members of the crooked gambling who bribed eight white sox ball players to throw the ... |newspaper=[[new york times]] |date=november 2, 1920 |accessdate=2010-12-16 }}</ref>\n\n==life and career==\nattell was born in [[san francisco, california]], the son of [[jewish]] parents. many sources give his year of birth as 1884, but in an article published in the october 1961 issue of cavalier magazine, he stated that he had turned 78 that year. there also is an extant copy of his passport that gives his birth year as 1883. and the 1900 u.s. census gives his age as 17. growing 
<page> <title>abe_no_yoritoki</title><text>{{japanese name|abe}}\n{{infobox military person\n| name          = abe no yoritoki<br />安倍 頼時\n| birth_date          = ?\n| death_date          = {{date|1057|08|28}}\n| allegiance    = [[abe clan]]\n| rank          = \'\'[[chinjufu shogun]]\'\'\n| relations     = son: [[abe no sadato]]\n}}\n{{nihongo|\'\'\'abe no yoritoki\'\'\'|安倍頼時}} (died 28 august 1057) was the head of the [[abe clan]] of [[emishi]] who were allowed to rule the six emishi districts (iwate, hienuki, shiwa, isawa, esashi and waga) in the kitakami basin from morioka to hiraizumi in what is now iwate prefecture. \n\n==background==\nthe clan emerged from the appi river basin in what is now hachimantai city, iwate prefecture, early in the 9th century. they provided a number of generals and governors throughout the 9th and 10th centuries. by monopolizing the gold, iron and horse trade in northern honshū the family became enormously wealthy. they were also innovative in designing a new type of stockade which could withstand a long siege.\n\nthe 9th and 10th centuries saw a weakening of central power as a new land management system of tax-immune estates, or shoen, took hold. \n\n==campaign==\nyoritoki and the abes came into conflict with the minamoto clan as it began to expand north into abe territory. the abe clan began to raid territories south of their border. in 1051 yoritoki led an army of emishi into northern miyagi and defeated a government army at onikiribe that had been sent to stop the raids. this event triggered the former nine years\' war ([[zenkunen war]]).\n\n[[minamoto no yoriyoshi]] was then deputized as the new \'\'[[chinjufu shogun]]\'\' and sent to chastise yoritoki in 1053. in 1056 yoritoki\'s eldest son, sadato, began skirmishing with the minamotos. war erupted in 1057 and yoritoki was killed in battle by a stray arrow.<ref>ackroyd, joyce. (1982). lessons from history: the tokushi yoron, p. 120.</ref> \n\nyoritoki\'s sons co
<page> <title>abeed</title><text>\'\'\'abid\'\'\' ({{lang-ar|عبد}}, plural \'\'\'abeed\'\'\' عبيد or \'\'\'el abeed\'\'\' العبيد) is a [[derogatory term]] in [[arabic]] meaning \"[[slave]]\" and is usually applied as an insult to [[black people]] to invoke [[stereotypes]].  the name has been explained as an allusion to the submission that [[muslim]]s owe to [[allah]].  meyer dismisses this as \"efforts by propagandists [to] explain the term away [that are] at the least, disingenuous\".<ref>{{cite book|title=war and faith in sudan|author=gabriel meyer|pages=131|date=2005|publisher=wm. b. eerdmans publishing|id=isbn 0-8028-2933-3}}</ref>\n\n==sudan==\nit is commonly used by the northern [[sudan|sudanese]] to refer to southern sudanese, and the southern sudanese in turn [[stereotype]] the northerners as \'\'\"mundukuru\"\'\' and \'\'\"minga\"\'\'.{{awkward|date=september 2013}}{{elucidate|date=september 2013}}<ref>{{cite book|pages=52|title=the lost boys of sudan: an american story of the refugee experience|author=bixler, mark|date=2005|publisher=university of georgia press|id=isbn 0-8203-2499-x}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|title=the southern sudan: the problem of national integration|editor=dunstan m. wai|author=peter russell and storrrs mccall|chapter=can secession be justified?|date=1973|publisher=routledge|id=isbn 0-7146-2985-5|pages=105}}</ref> according to professor mahmood mamdani however, conflicts in sudan are not compatible with western pre-conceptions of \"race\".<ref>[http://www.islamonline.net/servlet/satellite?c=article_c&cid=1234631424592&pagename=zone-english-muslim_affairs/maelayout#**1 analyzing darfur\'s conflict of definitions: interview with professor mahmood mamdani]</ref>\n\n[[francis deng]] described the north-south division imposed by the british on [[anglo-egyptian sudan]] as the british saying to the northerners: \"you northerners are slave traders and you treat the southerners like abeed.  don\'t call them abeed! they are slaves no l
<page> <title>abegweit_passage</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=december 2009}}\n\'\'\'abegweit passage\'\'\' is the narrowest part of the [[northumberland strait]], comprising the 13-kilometre wide portion between [[cape tryon, prince edward island]], and [[cape tormentine, new brunswick]].  tidal currents in this area can reach up to 4 [[knot (unit)|knots]]. this portion of the strait is now spanned by the [[confederation bridge]].\n\nthe word \'\'abegweit\'\' is derived from the [[mi\'kmaq language|mi\'kmaq]] word for [[prince edward island]], \'\'epekwit\'k\'\', meaning \"cradled (or cradle) on the waves.\"\n\n{{coord|46|11|n|63|43|w|scale:500000|display=title}}\n\n<br clear=all>\n\n[[category:bodies of water of prince edward island]]\n[[category:bodies of water of new brunswick]]\n[[category:prince county, prince edward island]]\n[[category:geography of westmorland county, new brunswick]]\n[[category:staits of canada]]\n\n\n{{princeedwardisland-geo-stub}}\n{{newbrunswick-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abeille_de_perrin</title><text>[[file:abeilledeperrin.jpg|thumb|230px|elzéar emmanuel arène abeille de perrin in [[algeria]]n costume]] \n\n\'\'\'elzéar emmanuel arène abeille de perrin\'\'\' ( 3 january 1843, [[marseille]] – 9 october 1910, marseille)\nwas a [[france|french]] [[entomologist]].\n\nabeille de perrin was a [[lawyer]] in marseille. he gave all his free time to entomology and was a member of the \n[[société entomologique de france]] for twenty years. he was especially interested in the [[cave insects|cave species]] of the \n[[pyrenees]].his best known publications are \'\'monographie des malachites\'\' (1869), \'\'Études sur les coléoptères cavernicoles, suivies de la description de 27 coléoptères nouveaux français\'\' (1872), \'\'notes sur les leptodirites\'\'\n(1878), and \'\'synopsis critique et synonymique des chrysides de france\'\' (1878). \n\nhis collection of [[palearctic]], [[coleoptera]], [[hymenoptera]], [[diptera]], and [[orthoptera]] is conserved \nin [[muséum national d\'histoire naturelle]] in paris.\n\n==references==\n*ancey, f. 1910 [abeille de perrin, e.] \'\'ann. soc. hist. nat. toulon\'\'  97-98, portrait.\n*buysson, h. du 1925 [abeille de perrin, e.]  \'\'misc. entomol\'\'. 28(12) 92.\n*caillol, h. 1911 [abeille de perrin, e.] \'\'ann. soc. ent. fr.\'\' 80: 492-502 <ref>annales de la société entomologique de france [http://www.biodiversitylibrary.org/item/96849 t. 80]</ref>\n*constantin, r. 1992 \'\'memorial des coléopteristes francaise\'\'. bull. liaison assoc. col. reg. parisienne, paris (suppl. 14) : 1-92 7, portrait.\n*gouillard, j. 1991 biography in \'\'hist. entomologistes francais\'\'  14 <ref>[http://www.zin.ru/animalia/coleoptera/eng/france1.htm j. gouillard: histoire des entomologistes francais]</ref>\n*lhoste, j. 1987 \'\'les entomologistes français. 1750-1950. [[institut national de la recherche agronomique|inra]] (institut national de la recherche agronomique ) , paris : 1-355.\n*pic, m.
<page> <title>abel_and_mary_nicholson_house</title><text>{{infobox nrhp \n  | name =abel and mary nicholson house\n  | nrhp_type = nhl\n  | image = nicholson (abel) house, elsinboro (salem county, new jersey).jpg\n  | caption = \n  | nearest_city= 127 fort elfsborg-hancocks bridge road, [[salem, new jersey]]\n  | coordinates = {{coord|39|31|10|n|75|29|11|w|format=dms|display=inline,title|type:landmark_region:us-nj}}\n  | locmapin = usa new jersey salem county\n  | area =\n  | built =1722\n  | architect= [[john mason (architect)|john mason]]\n  | architecture= [[georgian architecture|georgian]]\n  | designated_nrhp_type = february 16, 2000<ref name=\"nhlsum\">{{cite web|url=http://tps.cr.nps.gov/nhl/detail.cfm?resourceid=-1163242582&resourcetype=building|title=nicholson, abel and mary house|date=2008-06-23|work=national historic landmark summary listing|publisher=national park service}}</ref>\n  | added = january 16, 1997\n  | governing_body = private\n  | refnum=96001548<ref name=\"nris\">{{nrisref|2007a}}</ref>\n  | designated_other1_name = new jersey register of historic places\n  | designated_other1_abbr = njrhp\n  | designated_other1_link = new jersey register of historic places\n  | designated_other1_date = april 10, 1996\n  | designated_other1_number = 3437<ref name=njrhp>{{cite web | title=new jersey and national registers of historic places - <page> <title>abele</title><text>{{other uses}}\n{{redirect-distinguish|abeele|Àbéélé|van abeele|van den abeele}}\n[[file:abele - view 1.jpg|thumb|<center>view on abele]]\n\n\'\'\'abele\'\'\' (also spelled \'\'\'abeele\'\'\') is a small [[village]] or [[hamlet (place)|hamlet]] in the city of [[poperinge]], in the [[belgium|belgian]] province of [[west-flanders]]. the village is located on the territory of poperinge proper and its \"[[deelgemeente]]\" [[watou]], but is also partly located on [[france|french]] territory. abele has about 600 inhabitants, of whom about 100 are french. the main street coincides with the border between belgium and france, so houses located on different sides of the street are located in a different country.\n\nthe [[church (building)|church]] of abele is located on french territory, but the services are organized by the [[roman catholic diocese of bruges]]. the {{ill|nl|kerkfabriek}} of watou and the local authorities of [[boeschepe]] are responsible for its maintenance.\n\nabele used to be an import [[border crossing]]. in 1713, a [[toll house|tollhouse]] was set up, but it disappeared during the [[french revolution]]. the old belgian customs office was renovated and now serves as a retro-café with a small exhibition.\n\n[[abeele aerodrome military commonwealth war graves commission cemetery]] is outside the village, on the site of a [[world war i]] military airfield.\n\n==gallery==\n<gallery>\nfile:abeele aerodrome military cemetery on the belgian side of the french border - redvers.jpg|[[abeele aerodrome military commonwealth war graves commission cemetery|abeele aerodrome military cemetery]]\nfile:abele - onze-lieve-vrouw onbevlekt ontvangenkerk 2.jpg|the [[immaculate conception]] r c church\n</gallery>\n\n==external links==\n{{commons category|abele}}\n*[http://www.abele.be/ abele website]\n\n{{coord |50.8222|n|2.669|e|region:be_type:city|display=title}}\n\n[[category:populated places in belgium]]\n[[category:poperinge]]</text>

<page> <title>aberaeron</title><text>{{infobox uk place|\n|country =                 wales\n|welsh_name=\n|map_type=\n|latitude             = 52.24204\n|longitude            = -4.25921\n|constituency_welsh_assembly= [[ceredigion (assembly constituency)|ceredigion]]\n|official_name=             aberaeron\n|static_image_name=aberaeronhouses.jpg\n|static_image_width=250\n|static_image_caption=houses on the quay\n|static_image_alt=<!-- see [[wp:alt]] -->\n|static_image_2_name=\n|static_image_2_width=\n|static_image_2_caption=\n|static_image_2_alt=<!-- see [[wp:alt]] -->\n|unitary_wales=           [[ceredigion]]\n|lieutenancy_wales=        [[dyfed]]\n|constituency_westminster=      [[ceredigion (uk parliament constituency)|ceredigion]]\n|post_town=        aberaeron\n|postcode_district =       sa46\n|postcode_area=            sa  \n|dial_code=      01545\n|os_grid_reference=     sn458628\n|population=        1,520\n }}\n\'\'\'aberaeron\'\'\' ({{etymology|cy|aberaeron|mouth of the [[river aeron]]}}, [[aeron (celtic mythology)|aeron]] being a welsh god of war<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/wales/whatsinaname/sites/placenametool/?q=aberaeron&search.x=0&search.y=0 bbc wales—what\'s in a name?]</ref>) is a [[seaside resort]] [[town]] in [[ceredigion]], [[wales]]. situated between [[aberystwyth]] and [[cardigan, ceredigion|cardigan]], it is home to the headquarters of [[ceredigion|ceredigion county council]]. the population was 1520 in 2001.<ref>[http://www.neighbourhood.statistics.gov.uk/dissemination/viewfulldataset.do;jsessionid=ac1f930c30d5b0975d9516744e64bcdae8b9d547c691?instanceselection=03070&productid=779&$ph=60_61&datasetinstanceid=3070&startcolumn=1&numberofcolumns=4&containerareaid=790566 office for national statistics : \'\'census 2001 : parish headcounts : ceredigion\'\']</ref>\n\n==history and design==\nthe present town was planned and developed from 1805 by the rev. alban thomas jones gwynne. the [[harbour]] he built operated as a [[port]] and supported a [[shipbuil
<page> <title>aberdeen_attack</title><text>{{aba team\n| color1        = \n| color2        = \n| logo          = \n| pixels        = \n| founded       = 2011\n| league        = [[american basketball association (2000-present)|american basketball association]]\n| history       = aberdeen attack (2011-present)\n| arena         = tbd\n| city          = [[aberdeen, south dakota]]\n| colors        = \n| owner         = marcus robinson, hub city sports llc\n| coach         = marcus robinson\n| championships = 0\n| titles        = 0\n| cheerleaders  =\n| dancers       =\n| mascot        =\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'aberdeen attack\'\'\' is an franchise of the [[american basketball association (2000)|american basketball association]] which began play in the [[2011-12 aba season]]. based in [[aberdeen, south dakota]], attack are planning to announce their home venue in the coming weeks. they will play six games this season including one home game.<ref>{{cite news |last=deal |first=ryan |title=pro basketball: aberdeen attack to compete this winter |date=december 3, 2011 |newspaper=[[the american news]] |url=http://articles.aberdeennews.com/2011-12-03/sports/30473353_1_aba-web-site-facebook-page-aberdeen-civic-arena |accessdate=april 4, 2012}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* http://abalive.com/conferences/expansion/aberdeen-attack/\n\n\n{{aba teams}}\n\n\n[[category:american basketball association (2000–present) teams]]\n[[category:sports clubs established in 2011]]\n[[category:basketball teams in south dakota]]\n[[category:aberdeen, south dakota]]</text> </page>

<page> <title>aberdeen_and_asheboro_railroad</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=march 2007}}\n\nthe \'\'\'aberdeen and asheboro railroad\'\'\' was the conglomeration of two previous railroads built by the page family of [[aberdeen, north carolina|aberdeen]], [[north carolina]] at the turn of the 20th century.\n\nthe first railroad built by the pages, known as the [[aberdeen and west end railroad]], had been a logging railroad since about 1887.  it was extended from aberdeen to [[star, north carolina|star]], nc and was completed in 1895.\n\nabout the same time, the pages were nearing completion of the [[asheboro and montgomery railroad]], which extended from [[asheboro, north carolina|asheboro]], nc southward to star.\n\nin 1897, the two lines merged to form the aberdeen and asheboro railroad, which then became part of the [[norfolk southern railroad (1883-1891, 1910-1942)|norfolk southern railroad]] in 1912.\n\n{{defaultsort:aberdeen asheboro  railroad}}\n[[category:defunct north carolina railroads]]\n[[category:predecessors of the norfolk southern railway (1942-1982)]]\n[[category:railway companies established in 1897]]\n[[category:railway companies disestablished in 1912]]\n\n\n{{us-rail-transport-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aberdeen_scandal</title><text>{{inappropriate tone|date=august 2008}}\n<!-- reading through the lead and first section, still don\'t know what this is actually about, e.i. what allegedly happened. needs to be rewritten with a decent synopsis at the front. -->\nthe \'\'\'aberdeen scandal\'\'\' was a military sex scandal in 1996 at [[aberdeen proving ground]], a [[united states army]] base in  [[maryland]]. the army brought charges against 12 commissioned and non-commissioned male officers for [[sexual assault]] on female trainees under their command.\n\n==charges brought against the officers==\n[[captain (u.s. army)|captain]] derrick robertson and [[staff sergeant|sergeants]] delmar simpson and nathanael beech were accused of participating in the army\'s biggest sex abuse scandal on record. robertson and simpson faced [[rape]] charges and beech was charged with [[adultery]].<ref name=http://www.cnn.com/us/9612/06/aberdeen.arraign/index.html>[http://www.cnn.com/us/9612/06/aberdeen.arraign/index.html three soldiers arraigned in u.s. army sex scandal]</ref> \n\narmy secretary [[togo west]] accused those charged of abusing their power, and ordered all soldiers to undergo [[sexual harassment]] training so they could learn the army\'s \"[[zero tolerance]]\" policy towards sexual harassment.\n\nthe men accused felt that statements made by west and other officials within the army were prejudging the case and would result in an unfair trial. robertson\'s attorney, jerome murphy, asked the judge, military [[judge]] linda webster, to enact a [[gag order]] on west and others, but she deferred judgment. however, she did order prospective jurors not to follow media coverage of the case to avoid interference with their judgment.<ref name=\"http://www.cnn.com/us/9612/06/aberdeen.arraign/index.html\"/> \n\nothers charged included staff sergeants loren taylor and anthony fore, sergeant george blackley, a captain, two other sergeants, and four other [[non-commissioned off
<page> <title>aberedw_castle</title><text>{{infobox military structure\n|name=aberedw castle\n|partof=\n|location= [[powys]], [[wales]]\n|coordinates=\n|image=[[file:still standing - geograph.org.uk - 1328127.jpg|240px]]\n|caption=the best preserved part of aberedw castle\n|type= castle\n|code=\n|built= 1093\n|builder=\n|materials=\n|height=\n|used=\n|demolished= partially demolished in the 19th century\n|condition= ruined\n|ownership=\n|controlledby=\n|garrison=\n|commanders=\n|occupants=\n|battles=\n|events=\n}}\n\nthe remains of \'\'\'aberedw castle\'\'\', also known as \'castle in elfael uwch mynydd\',<ref name=\"gatehouse_aberedw_castle\">{{cite web\n|url=http://www.gatehouse-gazetteer.info/welshsites/827.html\n|title=aberedw castle\n|publisher=the gatehouse\n|author=philip davis\n|date=2007-01-20\n|accessdate=2007-05-03\n}}</ref> are located at the small village of [[aberedw]] in the county of [[powys]], mid-[[wales]].\n\n==history==\nthe [[castle]] was signed to walter heckelutel, as a license of the crenellate, by king [[edward i of england]] on november 24, 1284.  this license to [[crenellate]] was thought of as a way for central authority to exert power over the lords, although this is not confirmed.<ref>{{cite web\n|url=http://www.gatehouse-gazetteer.info/ltocren.html\n|title=english licences to crenallate some analysis\n|publisher=the gatehouse\n|date=2007-01-20\n|accessdate=2007-05-03}}</ref>  it is also suggested however, that the castle dates back to 1093 when the [[normans]] invaded south wales.<ref>{{cite web\n|url=http://www.fforestfields.co.uk/information/about_us.htm\n|title=fforest fields\n|publisher=fforestfields.co.uk\n|date=2006-08-03\n|accessdate=2007-02-14\n|archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20061208214643/http://fforestfields.co.uk/information/about_us.htm <!-- bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2006-12-08}}</ref>\n\nat the time of the construction of aberedw, castles were built for a certain symbolism.  the license to crennell
<page> <title>abergwili_railway_station</title><text>{{infobox uk disused station\n|name      =  abergwili\n|image_name = abergwili station (remains) geograph-3224140-by-ben-brooksbank.jpg\n|caption   = abergwili station remains (1992)\n|locale    = [[abergwili]]\n|borough   = [[carmarthenshire]]\n| original    = [[llanelly railway]]\n| pregroup    = [[london and north western railway]]\n| postgroup   = [[london, midland and scottish railway]]\n|platforms = 1\n|latitude  = \n|longitude = \n|gridref   = \n|years     = 1 june 1865\n|events    = opens as abergwilli\n|years1    = april to june  1880\n|events1   = station closes \n|years2     = 28 july 1893\n|events2    = renamed abergwili \n|years3    = 9 september 1963\n|events3   = station closes \n}} \n\'\'\'abergwili railway station\'\'\' served the village of [[abergwili ]] in [[wales]]. it was the first station after [[gwili junction]], the point where the line through it divided from the [[carmarthen aberystwyth line|carmarthen to aberystwyth line]].\n\n==history==\n\nopened by the [[llanelly railway]], the station was  absorbed into the [[london and north western railway]] as part of its ownership of the [[central wales line]]. becoming part of the [[london, midland and scottish railway]] during the [[railways act 1921|grouping]] of 1923, it passed on to the [[london midland region of british railways]] on [[nationalisation]] in 1948. later transferred to the [[western region of british railways]], it was closed by the [[british railways board]].\n\n==the site today==\n\nthe site is now lost under a spur of carmarthen\'s new bypass road.\n\n== references ==\n\n*{{cite book|author=r.v.j.butt, |title= the directory of railway stations  |publisher=patrick stephens ltd   |year=1995}} (llanelly railway and dock company)[ht
<page> <title>aberration</title><text><!--note: wikipedia is not a dictionary. do not list meanings here, unless there is a corresponding article.-->\n{{wiktionary|aberration}}\nan \'\'\'aberration\'\'\' is something that deviates from the normal way. \n\n\'\'\'aberration\'\'\' may refer to:\n\n==optics and physics==\n*[[optical aberration]], an imperfection in image formation by an optical system\n**[[spherical aberration]], which occurs when light rays strike a lens or mirror near its edge\n**[[chromatic aberration]], caused by differences in refractive index for different wavelengths of light\n**[[defocus aberration]], which occurs when a system is out of focus\n*[[aberration of light]], which produces an apparent motion of celestial objects\n*[[relativistic aberration]], at high velocities\n\n==genetics==\n*[[chromosome abnormality]], or aberration, a disruption in the normal chromosomal content of a cell\n\n==entertainment==\n*[[aberration (dungeons & dragons)|aberration (\'\'dungeons & dragons\'\')]], a creature type in the role-playing game\n*[[aberration (film)|\'\'aberration\'\' (film)]], a horror movie\n*[[aberration (ep)]]\n\n==see also==\n*[[aberrant]], a superhero roleplaying game by white wolf game studio\n\n{{disambiguation}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aberthaw_lime_works</title><text>[[image:limeworkssm.jpg|thumb|right|aberthaw lime works]]\n\'\'\'aberthaw lime works\'\'\' is a derelict structure, located on the [[south wales]] coast, between fontygary bay and [[aberthaw power station]]. the structure is a grade ii listed building.<ref>[http://www.valeofglamorgan.gov.uk/files/living/planning/policy/listed_buildings/listed_buildings_10_06.pdf vale of glamorgan listed buildings 10/06]</ref>\n \nthe aberthaw lime works was opened on 22 december 1888, by the aberthaw pebble limestone company.<ref>[http://www.cbyc.co.uk/club/documents/be0205.pdf cardiff yacht club newsletter]</ref>  it was built to utilise the huge number of limestone pebbles that had previously been taken inland or been moved by boat. the lime works operated until 1926.<ref name=\"valeofglamorgan.gov.uk\">[http://www.valeofglamorgan.gov.uk/files/living/planning/policy/county_treasures/rhoose.pdf vale of glamorgan council - county treasures - rhoose]</ref><ref>[http://www.coflein.gov.uk/en/site/40673/details/aberthaw+lime+works+and+cement+works%2c+aberthaw/ royal commission on the ancient and historical monuments of wales]</ref>\n\nthe local limestone and brick structure is still largely intact, although it is missing most of its wooden components. it contains 2 vertical pot draw kilns each holding up to 300 tons each, which could produce up to 40 tons of burnt lime a day.<ref>[http://www.glamorganwalks.com/lime_kilns.htm glamorgan walks website]</ref>  next to the main structure, there are 2 pot kilns which are also largely intact. these kilns were built later than the main structure, but also ceased operation in 1926.<ref name=\"valeofglamorgan.gov.uk\"/>\n\nthe lime works were originally served by a tramway, which ran from the direction of [[rhoose]] (east of the lime works). it passed either side of the now demolished winch house. a tramway ramp (again demolished) allowed carts containing pebbles between 3 & {{convert|4|in|mm}} in di

<page> <title>abha_mahato</title><text>{{infobox indian politician\n| name = abha mahato\n| image =\n| caption =\n| birth_date ={{birth date and age|1964|10|27|df=y}}\n| birth_place =[[deogarh district|deogarh]], [[jharkhand]], [[india]]\n| residence = new delhi\n| death_date =\n| death_place =\n| constituency = [[jamshedpur (lok sabha constituency)|jamshedpur]]\n| office = [[member of parliament]]\n| office2 =\n| term =\n| predecessor  = [[nitish bharadwaj]]\n| successor =[[suman mahato]]\n| predecessor2 =\n| successor2 =\n| party =[[bharatiya janata party]]\n| religion = \n| spouse = [[shailender mahato]] (m. 1988)\n| children = two\n| website =\n| footnotes =\n| date = \n| year =  \n| source =  http://parliamentofindia.nic.in/ls/lok12/biodata/12bi50.htm\n}}\n\n\'\'\'abha mahato\'\'\', (born 27 october 1964) is an indian parliamentarian from jamshedpur, jharkhand.<ref>[http://parliamentofindia.nic.in/ls/lok12/biodata/12bi50.htm biography at parliament of india.]</ref>\n\n==personal life==\nmahato was born in [[deogarh district|deogarh]] (then in [[bihar]] state) in 1964.  she was educated at deoghar college (bhagalpur university) from where she graduated with b.a.(hons.) in political science.\n\nshe married shri shailender mahato, a labour activist and former member of lok sabha ion 27 june 1988. they have two sons.\n\n==political career==\nmahato was elected to the [[12th lok sabha|12th]] and [[13th lok sabha]] from [[jamshedpur (lok sabha constituency)|jamshedpur]]  as a member of [[bharatiya janata party]]. she has been a member of various parliamentary committees on commerce, coal, textiles, women\'s empowerment and on laws relating to women. \n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = <page> <title>abhinav_farmers_club</title><text>\'\'\'abhinav farmers club\'\'\' is a national award winning group farming initiative located in [[mulshi taluka]], of [[pune district]] of [[maharashtra]] a state in india. the club started with 850 farmers in maharashtra cultivating about 143 [[hectare]]s of land. it was conceptualised by [[nabard]], in april 2012, the club had 4,600 members belonging to the states of maharashtra, [[madhya pradesh]], [[gujarat]] and [[uttar pradesh]].<ref name=\"et-20120418\">{{cite news|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2012-04-18/news/31361476_1_polyhouse-exotic-vegetables-land-rates|title=polyhouse farming takes root in pimpri-chinchwad|last=kulkarni|first=prachee|date=2012-04-18|work=economic times|accessdate=23 november 2012|location=mumbai}}</ref> the club was set up in 2004.<ref name=\"bs`20121217\">{{cite news|url=http://www.business-standard.com/india/news/pune-farmers-join-hands-to-improve-earnings/12/16/343422/|title= pune farmers join hands to improve earnings|last=godbole|first=pravada |date=2008-12-17|work=business standard|accessdate=23 november 2012}}</ref> it received a national award for its activities in 2008.<ref name=\"afc-20121123\">{{cite web|url=http://www.abhinavfarmersclub.org/about%20us.html|title=about us|accessdate=23 november 2012|publisher=abhinav farmers club|location=pune}}</ref> <ref name=\"ctara`20120918\">{{cite web|url=http://www.ctara.iitb.ac.in/fieldvisits/2010-11/talegaon_sept18-2010.pdf|title=field trip to htc, talegaon and abhinav farmers’ club,  hinjewadi pune|date=2010-09-18|publisher=centre for technology alternatives in rural areas|accessdate=23 november 2012|location=mumbai}}</ref> the club was started by dyneshwar bodke,<ref name=\"rediff-20121227\">{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/business/slide-show/slide-show-1-the-rags-to-riches-story-of-a-farmer/20101227.htm|title=the inspiring, rags-to-riches story of a farmer |date=2012-12-27|work=rediff business|accessdate=2
<page> <title>abhishek_raghuram</title><text>{{infobox musical artist\n|name            = abhishek raghuram\n|image           = \n|caption         = \n|image_size      =\n|background      = solo_singer\n|birth_name      =\n|alias           =\n|birth_date      = {{birth year and age|1986}}\n|birth_place     = [[india]]\n|death_date      = \n|death_place     = \n|origin          = [[india]]\n|instrument      =\n|genre           = [[carnatic classical music|indian classical music]]\n|occupation      = classical vocalist\n|years_active    = 2001–present\n|label           = \n|spouse          = \n|associated_acts =\n|website         =\n|current_members =\n|past_members    =\n|religion        = [[hindu]]\n}}\n\'\'\'abhishek raghuram\'\'\' (born 1986) is an indian [[carnatic music|carnatic]] [[vocalist]].<ref>http://www.thehindu.com/arts/music/managing-time-is-prime/article1027192.ece</ref><ref>http://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/chennai/chen-downtown/brahmothsavam-at-ananthapadmanabhaswamy-temple/article4421782.ece</ref>\n\n==life==\n[[file:abhishek raghuram et al 31a.jpg|thumb|abhishek raghuram]]\nhis mother is the niece of violin maestro lalgudi jayaraman while veena exponent jayanti kumaresh is his maternal aunt. he is the grandson of the mridangam legend sangeeta kalanidhi sri.palghat raghu. he started learning music in his early age  with learning mrindangam & khanjira from harishankar. later he shifted to vocal music under the guidance of his guru sri p. s. narayana swami of semmanagundi school.\n\nat the age of 7, abhishek was awarded gold medal for mridangam in the  mazhalai medhai contest. he also won first prize in pallavi singing competition organized by s.balachandar trust, madras in 1996<ref>http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/the-heir-apparent/article4438720.ece</ref>\n\n==awards==\n*  sangeet natak akademi’s ustad bismillah khan yuva puraskar 2013\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:carnatic singers]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[categ
<page> <title>abid_ali_kazi</title><text>{{other people|abid ali}}\n\n\'\'\'abid ali kazi\'\'\' is a [[cricket statistics|cricket statistician]] and historian based in [[pakistan]].\n\nabid ali kazi\'s major contribution to cricket is compiling the history of pakistan cricket and the scorecards of many [[first-class cricket|first-class matches]] which remained largely undocumented till the 1990s.  kazi\'s efforts appear as five volumes in the series \'\'first class cricket in pakistan\'\' which cover the period 1947-48 to 1974-75. \n\nkazi is a founder member of the pakistan association of cricket statisticians and scorers and is the pakistan correspondent of [[wisden cricketers almanack]]. he also contributed to the \'pakistan book of test cricket\' in 1982.\n\n==references==\n* [http://www.jang.com.pk/thenews/jun2003-weekly/nos-29-06-2003/spo.htm#2 the man who has delivered pakistan cricket\'s holy grail, by sohaib alvi]\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.hindu.com/2004/04/12/stories/2004041204582000.htm news report on award to abid ali kazi]\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = kazi, abid ali\n| alternative names =\n| short description = pakistani cricketer\n| date of birth     = 20th july 1961\n| place of birth    = karachi, pakistan\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:kazi, abid ali}}\n[[category:cricket historians and writers]]\n[[category:pakistani statisticians]]\n[[category:living people]]\n\n\n{{pakistan-cricketbio-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abie_philbin_bowman</title><text>{{blp sources|date=january 2011}}\n\n{{infobox comedian\n| name              = abie philbin bowman\n| image             = abiephilbinbowman.jpg\n| imagesize         = \n| caption           = performing eco-friendly jihad\n| pseudonym         = \n| birth_name        = \n| birth_date        =\n| birth_place       = dublin\n| death_date        = \n| death_place       = \n| medium            = \n| nationality       = irish\n| active            = \n| genre             = \n| subject           = \n| influences        = \n| influenced        = \n| spouse            = \n| notable_work      = \'\'jesus: the guantanamo years\'\', \'\'eco-friendly jihad\'\'\n| signature         = \n| website           = www.abielaughs.com\n| footnotes         = \n| current_members   = \n| past_members      = \n}}\n\'\'\'abie philbin bowman\'\'\' is an [[irish people|irish]] comedian and journalist. his works include \'\'jesus: the guantanamo years\'\' and \'\'eco-friendly jihad\'\'.\n\nhe is the writer/director/performer of \'\'jesus: the guantanamo years\'\', which was staged in 2006 in the [[project arts centre]] ([[temple bar, dublin]]) and the [[underbelly (venue)|underbelly]] ([[cowgate]], [[edinburgh]]) as part of the [[edinburgh fringe]]. the show was widely reported in the media and sold out - \'\'[[the scotsman]]\'\' referred to him as \"the face of this year\'s fringe\". in 2007, the show toured to london\'s west end, [[jimmy tingle]]\'s off broadway theater in [[boston]], theatres across ireland and the [[world performing arts festival]] in [[lahore]], [[pakistan]]. performances in belfast in autumn 2007, were boycotted by [[ian paisley]]\'s [[democratic unionist party]].\n\nphilbin bowman followed this up with further performances at the underbelly for the 2008 festival, as well as his show \'\'eco-friendly jihad\'\'. in november 2008 he began working in radio full-time. on the night [[barack obama]] was elected us president, philbin bo
<page> <title>abies_holophylla</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = manchurian fir\n| status = lr/lc | status_system = iucn2.3\n| image = abies holophylla.jpg\n| image_width = 240px \n| image_caption = foliage on young tree\n| regnum = [[plant]]ae\n| divisio = [[pinophyta]]\n| classis = [[pinophyta|pinopsida]]\n| ordo = [[pinales]]\n| familia = [[pinaceae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[fir|abies]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. holophylla\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'abies holophylla\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[carl maximowicz|maxim.]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'manchurian fir\'\'\' (\'\'abies holophylla\'\', [[chinese language|zh]]: 杉松), also called \'\'\'needle fir\'\'\', is a species of [[fir]] native to mountainous regions of northern [[korea]], southern [[primorsky krai|ussuriland]], and [[china]] in the provinces of [[heilongjiang]], [[jilin]], and [[liaoning]].\n\nit is an [[evergreen]] [[conifer]]ous [[tree]] growing to 30 m tall and 1 m in trunk diameter with a narrowly conical crown of horizontal spreading branches. the [[bark]] is scaly and gray-brown with resin blisters. the [[leaf|leaves]] (\"needles\") are flattened, 2-4&nbsp;cm long and 1.5-2.5&nbsp;mm thick, spread at right angles from the shoot, and end in a point. <ref name=\"iucn06\" /> \n\nthey spread on two sides, but not flat like for example in [[abies alba|silver fir]]. usually they more or less rise up forming with the shoot a v-shape empty compartment above it. unlike in silver fir, the leaves here are sharp and prickly, without any indentation at the top. <ref name=\"seneta81\" />\n\nthey are bright green above and whitish-green below with 2 whitish strips, each of which is formed by 7-10 [[wax]]-covered [[stoma]]tal bands. the shoots are glabrous, shiny yellow-gray when young and turning gray-brown. the [[conifer cone|cones]] are 12-14&nbsp;cm long by 4-5&nbsp;cm wide, yellow-brown, and slightly tapering with a bluntly rounded apex. the scale bracts are hidden under the cone scales. the [[seed]]s

<page> <title>abigail_mccarthy</title><text>\'\'\'abigail quigley mccarthy\'\'\' (april 16, 1915, [[wabasha, minnesota]] – february 1, 2001, [[washington, d.c.]]) was an american academic and writer, best known as the wife of politician and presidential contender [[eugene mccarthy]]. she predeceased her estranged husband by almost five years.\n\nthey met as teachers in [[mandan, north dakota]] and were wed on june 5, 1945 in [[st. paul, minnesota]]. their first home was in [[watkins, minnesota]] at an agriculture commune formed by catholic couples. in later years, following their separation (see [[eugene mccarthy]]), they lived separately, however they never divorced. she had an apartment in [[washington, d.c.]] on connecticut avenue, which is where she died in 2001, aged 85.\n\n== children ==\neugene and abigail mccarthy had four children: michael benet mccarthy, ellen mccarthy, margaret alice mccarthy and the late mary abigail mccarthy (died july 28, 1990).\n\n== education ==\nabigail quigley graduated as a [[phi beta kappa]] from college of st. catherine (now [[st. catherine university]]) in [[st. paul, minnesota]] in 1936. she received her m.a. from the [[university of minnesota]] in 1942 and did post-graduate work at the [[university of chicago]] and the middlebury school of english.\n\n== career ==\nabigail quigley mccarthy was a catholic author, educator, and activist. she wrote several successful books and was a regular columnist for \'\'[[commonweal]]\'\', a liberal catholic magazine, from 1974-1999. she wrote reviews for \'\'[[the new york times]]\'\' and\n\'\'[[the washington post]]\'\'. she founded and was first president of \'\'\'church women united\'\'\', a lay catholic group.\n\n== legacy ==\n\'\'\'the abigail quigley mccarthy center for women\'\'\' was established at her alma mater, st. catherine university, in her honor.\n\n== external links ==\n* [http://www.stkate.edu/centerforwomen st catherine university, minnesota]\n* [http://findarticles.com

school\" or abbreviated \"a.b.s\"), was formed in 2005 by [[takanori nishikawa]], or t.m.revolution, who originally named the band abs after [[ebisu, shibuya|ebisu]], [[tokyo, japan]]{{#tag:ref|in japanese, ebisu has approximately the same pronunciation as the letters a-b-s|group=n}} and later changed the band\'s name to abingdon boys school, a school formerly attended by members of [[radiohead]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nipponproject.com/en/article.php?id=164|title=interview with takanori from abingdon boys school|date=december 22, 2009|publisher=nippon <page> <title>abismo_ouro_grosso</title><text>\'\'\'abismo ouro grosso\'\'\' ([[english language|english]]: \'\'thick gold\'\') (sp-054), also \'\'\'gruta ouro grosso\'\'\', is a {{convert|192|m|ft|adj=mid|-deep}} shaft consisting of waterfalls and natural pools. it was created by the capture of surface rivers by carbonate rocks with subterranean drainage systems in an advanced stage of evolution.<ref name=karmann-ferrari>{{cite book|last=ivo karmann|first=jose antonio ferrari|title=carste e cavernas do paruqe estadual turistico do alto ribeira (petar), sp|publisher=sigesp|pages=412|url=http://sigep.cprm.gov.br/sitio043/sitio043.pdf}}</ref> first explored by the [[germany|german]] [[naturalist]] and spelunker [[michel le bret]] in the 1970s,<ref name=perez>{{cite journal|last=perez|first=ricardo|coauthors=sociedade brasileira de espeleologia|title=1 travesia da gruta ouro grosso com metodo de recuperacao de cordas|journal=sbe noticias|date=3|year=2006|month=july|volume=19|pages=1|url=http://www.sbe.com.br/sbenoticias/sbenoticias_019.pdf|accessdate=1 january 2012}}</ref> it is located at the nucleo ouro grosso, within the borders of the [[alto ribeira state and tourist park]], in the municipality of [[iporanga]], {{convert|350|km|mi}} from [[sao paulo]], [[brazil]].\n\n==see also==\n*[[list of caves in brazil]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www4.icmbio.gov.br/cecav//index.php?id_menu=228 base de dados do ministerio do meio hambiente] governo federal - icmbio official website\n\n{{coord|24.5446|s|48.6795|w|source:kolossus-nowiki|display=title}}\n\n{{defaultsort:abismo ouro grosso}}\n[[category:caves of brazil]]\n[[category:geography of são paulo (state)]]\n[[category:wild caves]]\n\n\n{{caving-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>abkot</title><text>{{infobox settlement\n|official_name =abkot\n|native_name =آب کت\n|settlement_type        = village\n|pushpin_map            =iran\n|mapsize                =150px\n|coordinates_region     = ir\n|subdivision_type       = [[list of countries|country]]\n|subdivision_name = {{flag|iran}}\n|subdivision_type1 =[[provinces of iran|province]]\n|subdivision_name1 =[[lorestan province|lorestan]]\n|subdivision_type2 =[[counties of iran|county]]\n|subdivision_name2 = [[khorramabad county|khorramabad]]\n|subdivision_type3 =[[bakhsh]]\n|subdivision_name3 =[[zagheh district|zagheh]]\n|subdivision_type4 =[[rural districts of iran|rural district]]\n|subdivision_name4 =[[razan rural district (lorestan province)|razan]]\n|leader_title           = \n|leader_name            = \n|established_title      =\n|established_date       = \n|area_total_km2           = \n|area_footnotes           = \n|population_as_of         = 2006\n|population_total =72\n|population_density_km2   =auto\n|timezone               = [[iran standard time|irst]]\n|utc_offset             = +3:30\n|timezone_dst           = [[iran daylight time|irdt]]\n|utc_offset_dst         = +4:30\n|coordinates_display      = %\n|latd=33|latm=33|lats=07|latns=n\n|longd=48|longm=55|longs=00|longew=e\n|elevation_m            = \n|area_code              = \n|website                = \n|footnotes              =\n}}\n\'\'\'abkot\'\'\' ({{lang-fa|آب کت}}, also [[romanize]]d as \'\'\'Ābkot\'\'\' and \'\'\'Āb-i-kūt\'\'\'; also known as \'\'\'Āb kot-e pā’īn\'\'\', \'\'\'Āb kot-e soflá\'\'\', \'\'\'Ābkowt-e pā’īn\'\'\', and \'\'\'Ābkūt-e soflá\'\'\')<ref>{{geonet3|-3051518|abkot}}</ref> is a village in [[razan rural district (lorestan province)|razan rural district]], [[zagheh district]], [[khorramabad county]], [[lorestan province]], [[iran]]. at the 2006 census, its population was 72, in 14 families.<ref>{{irancensus2006|15}}</ref>  \n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{khorramabad 
<page> <title>abla_kamel</title><text>{{infobox person\n| image = \n| imagesize = \n| caption =  \n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1967|07|13|mf=yes}} \n| birth_name = abla kamel mohamed afifi\n| birth_place = [[cairo, egypt]]\n| spouse = \n| occupation = actress\n| years_active = 1982-2011\n}}\n\'\'\'abla kamel mohamed afifi\'\'\' ({{lang-ar|عبلة كامل محمد عفيفى}}&nbsp; {{ipa-arz|ˈʕæblæ ˈkæːmel mæˈħæmmæd ʕæˈfiːfi|pron}}; 1967 in cairo, egypt) is an [[egypt]]ian actress, who in 2011 announced that she would resign from acting.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.albawaba.com/entertainment/abla-kamel-resigns-394510|title=abla kamel resigns|date=september 30, 2011|accessdate=june 6, 2012}}</ref>\n\n==biography==\ngraduated abla kamel mohammed afifi from the faculty of arts department of libraries in 1990, started in theater vanguard and was the first work to participate in mono drama, a heart health centers, then with mohamed sobhi in the play point of view, however, lenin sand in plays many of them gripe brain and episode,shined in many telenovelas such as papillary nights, i will not live in robe, my father, shahd and tears, hoanm garden city and other, she married actor ahmad kamal, who bore him two daughters and then she married actor mahmoud el gendy.\n\n==filmography==\n{| class=\"wikitable\" style=\"width:90%\"\n|-\n! width=\"10%\" | year\n! width=\"30%\" | title\n! width=\"20%\" | role\n|-\n|1982\n|\'\'iftah ya simsim\'\'\n|khoka\n|-\n|1988\n|\'\'yom mor... yom helw\'\'\n|\n|-\n|1990\n|\'\'iskanderija, kaman oue kaman\'\'\n|\n|-\n|1993\n|\'\'sawwaq el hanem\'\'\n|\n|-\n|1994\n|\'\'sarek al-farah\'\'\n|\n|-\n|1996\n|\'\'hysteria\'\'\n|\n|-\n|1998\n|\'\'arak el-balah\'\'\n|\n|-\n|1999\n|\'\'el medina\'\'\n|bannoura\n|-\n|rowspan=2|2002\n|\'\'ellembi\'\'\n|faransa\n|-\n|\'\'ayna qalbi\'\'\n|wesal\n|-\n|rowspan=2|2003\n|\'\'elly baly balak\'\'\n|doctor\n|-\n|\'\'kallem mama\'\'\n|\n|-\n|rowspan=2|2004\n|\'\'[[khalty faransa]]\'\'\n|f
<page> <title>abloux</title><text>{{nofootnotes|date=may 2009}}\n{{infobox river | river_name = abloux\n  | image_name = \n  | caption = \n  | origin = bazelat<br>  {{coord|46|21|23|n|01|31|23|e|display=inline}}\n  | mouth = [[anglin]]<br> {{coord|46|30|42|n|01|15|04|e|display=inline,title}}\n  | basin_countries = [[france]]\n  | length_km = 49.6\n  | elevation = \n  | elevation_m = 300\n  | mouth_elevation_m = 105\n  | discharge_m3/s = \n  | watershed_km2 = \n}}\nthe \'\'\'abloux\'\'\' is a {{convert|49.6|km|mi|abbr=on}} long [[river]] in the [[creuse]] and [[indre]]  \'\'[[departments of france|départements]]\'\', central [[france]]. its source is at [[bazelat]]. it flows generally northwest. it is a [[right tributary]] of the [[anglin]] into which it flows at [[prissac]].\n\n==communes along its course==\nthis list is ordered from source to mouth: \n*creuse: [[bazelat]], [[azerables]], [[saint-sébastien, creuse|saint-sébastien]], \n*indre: [[parnac, indre|parnac]], [[Éguzon-chantôme]], [[bazaiges]], [[vigoux]], [[saint-gilles, indre|saint-gilles]], [[chazelet]], [[saint-civran]], [[sacierges-saint-martin]], [[prissac]], \n\n== notes ==\n\n{{empty section|date=july 2010}}\n==references==\n*http://www.geoportail.fr\n*[http://sandre.eaufrance.fr/app/chainage/courdo/htm/l55-030-.php?cg=l55-030- the abloux at the sandre database]\n\n[[category:rivers of france]]\n[[category:geography of creuse]]\n[[category:geography of indre]]\n[[category:loire basin]]\n[[category:rivers of centre (french region)]]\n[[category:rivers of limousin (region)]]\n\n\n{{creuse-geo-stub}}\n{{indre-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>abner_concklin_house</title><text>{{infobox nrhp\n  | name = abner concklin house\n  | nrhp_type = \n  | image = \n  | caption = \n  | location= closter rd., [[palisades, new york]]\n  |
