<page> <title>acraea_perenna</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = acraea perenna\n| image = acraeaspecies54.jpg\n| image_caption = \'\'acraea perenna\'\' and related species\n| image2 = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[nymphalidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acraea (genus)|acraea]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. perenna\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acraea perenna\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[edward doubleday|doubleday]], 1847<ref name=funet>[http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/papilionoidea/nymphalidae/heliconiinae/acraea/index.html \'\'acraea\'\'], site of markku savela</ref>\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'acraea (actinote) perenna\'\'\n*\'\'acraea polydectes\'\' <small>ward, 1871</small>\n*\'\'acraea thesprio\'\' <small>oberthür, 1893</small>\n*\'\'acraea perenna ab. usagara\'\' <small>strand, 1913</small> \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acraea perenna\'\'\'\'\', the \'\'\'falcate acraea\'\'\', is a [[butterfly]] in the [[nymphalidae]] family. it is found in [[senegal]], [[sierra leone]], [[liberia]], [[ivory coast]], [[ghana]], [[togo]], [[nigeria]], [[cameroon]], the [[republic of congo]], [[angola]], the [[democratic republic of congo]], [[uganda]], [[kenya]], [[ethiopia]], [[tanzania]], [[malawi]] and [[zambia]].<ref name=atbut>[http://atbutterflies.com/downloads/nymphalidae_acraeini.doc afrotropical butterflies: nymphalidae - tribe acraeini]</ref> the habitat consists of forests and forest-savanna mosaic in hilly country.\n\nit is thought to be the main mimicry model for  \'\'[[graphium ridleyanus]]\'\'.\n\nthe larvae feed on \'\'[[kolobopetalum chevalieri]]\'\', \'\'[[olobopetalum]]\'\', \'\'[[mikania]]\'\' (including \'\'[[mikania saggitifera]]\'\'), \'\'[[bridelia]]\'\' (including \'\'[[bridelia micrantha]]\'\'), \'\'[[adenia]]\'\' and \'\'[[urera]]\'\' species.\n\n==subspecies==\n*\'\'acraea perenna perenna\'\' (senegal, sierra leone, liberia, ivory coast, gh
<page> <title>acraea_rahira</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = mabillegrandidierhistoireplate11.jpg\n| image_width = 240px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[nymphalidae]]\n| tribus = [[acraeini]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acraea]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. rahira\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acraea rahira\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[jean baptiste boisduval|boisduval]], 1833\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'hyalites rahira\'\' <small>(boisduval, 1833)</small>\n*\'\'telchinia rahira\'\' <small>(boisduval, 1833)</small>\n*\'\'acraea rahira uasingishuensis\'\' <small>stoneham, 1943</small>\n*\'\'acraea (actinote) rahira\'\'\n*\'\'acraea rahira f. melanoradiata\'\' <small>stoneham, 1943</small>\n*\'\'acraea rahira f. crippsi\'\' <small>stoneham, 1943</small>\n}}\nthe \'\'\'marsh acraea\'\'\' (\'\'acraea rahira\'\') is a [[butterfly]] of the [[nymphalidae]] family. it is found in southern [[africa]]. in south africa it is found from the west cape along the coast to the east cape and [[kwazulu-natal]], then inland to [[mpumalanga]], [[gauteng]], the [[limpopo province]] and the [[north west province]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is 35–40&nbsp;mm for males and 40–50&nbsp;mm for females. adults are on wing year round in warmer areas, with a peak from september to april. in cooler areas it is only found in the hot summer months.<ref>woodhall, s. field guide to butterflies of south africa, cape town: struik publishers, 2005.</ref>\n\nthe [[larva]]e feed on \'\'[[persicaria attenuata|persicaria attenuata africana]]\'\' and \'\'[[conyza canadensis]]\'\'.\n\n==subspecies==\n*\'\'acraea rahira rahira\'\' (s.africa, zimbabwe, mozambique to malawi, southern tanzania, zambia, southern zaire (shaba), angola, western kenya, uganda)\n*\'\'acraea rahira mufindi\'\' <small>kielland, 1990</small> (tanzania)\n\n==references==<!-- molecular phylogenetics and evolution 46 (2008) 515–531 -->\
<page> <title>acrapex_metaphaea</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = acrapex metaphaea\n| image = acrapex metaphaea.jpg\n| image_caption = \n| image_width = 100px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[noctuidae]]\n| familia_authority =\n| subfamilia_authority = \n| genus = \'\'[[acrapex]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. metaphaea\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrapex metaphaea\'\'\n| binomial_authority = hampson, 1910\n| synonyms = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrapex metaphaea\'\'\'\'\' <ref>poole, r. w. (1989). \'\'[http://www.sel.barc.usda.gov:591/spod/catalogue/search.html lepidopterorum catalogus (new series) fascicle 118, noctuidae]\'\'. crc press. isbn 0-916846-45-8, isbn 978-0-916846-45-9.</ref> is a species of [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found in [[africa]], including [[zimbabwe]] and [[south africa]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is about 26 mm. <ref>sir george f. hampson, bart. (1910) \'\'[http://www.archive.org/stream/catalogueoflepid09british/catalogueoflepid09british_djvu.txt catalogue of the lepidoptera phalænæ in the british museum]\'\'.</ref>\n\n==description==\nhead and thorax ochreous tinged with rufous and mixed with some black-brown; palpi dark brown; abdomen dorsally dark brown, ventrally ochreous tinged with rufous. fore wing rufous, the costal area, median nervure and veins arising from it, and inner margin suffused with dark brown, slight white points in and beyond lower angle of cell; traces of a subterminal series of black points, a slight oblique dark shade from termen below apex; a terminal series of black points. hind wing dark reddish brown, the cilia with fine pale line at base; the underside greyish suffused and irrorated with fuscous. <ref>sir george f. hampson, bart. (1910) \'\'[http://www.archive.org/stream/catalogueoflepid09british/catalogueoflepid09british_djvu.txt catalogue of the lepidoptera phalænæ in the british museum]\'\'.</ref>\n\n==re
<page> <title>acrefair</title><text>{{infobox uk place \n|country=                     wales\n|welsh_name=\n|constituency_welsh_assembly= [[wrexham (assembly constituency)|wrexham]]\n|official_name=               acrefair\n|community_wales= [[cefn (community)|cefn]]\n|unitary_wales=               [[wrexham (county borough)|wrexham]]\n|lieutenancy_wales=           [[clwyd]]\n| population = \n| population_ref = \n |constituency_westminster=    [[clwyd south (uk parliament constituency)|clwyd south]]\n|post_town=                   wrexham\n|postcode_district=           ll14\n|postcode_area=               ll \n|dial_code=                   01978\n|os_grid_reference=           sj2725242839\n|latitude=                    52.977941 \n|longitude=                   -3.084887\n|static_image=                \n|static_image_caption=        \n}}\n\n\'\'\'acrefair\'\'\' ({{ipa-cy|ˌakrɛˈvɑɪr}}) is a village in the county borough of [[wrexham (county borough)|wrexham]], [[wales]]. it was formerly part of the ancient parish of [[ruabon]], and is located between the towns of [[wrexham]] and [[llangollen]].  it is close to the villages of trefor, [[cefn mawr]], [[ruabon]] and plas madoc. the name acrefair originates from the welsh word for acres - \'\'acrau\'\', or acre in the local welsh dialect - and mair, the welsh name for mary. we therefore have acre-mair, which leads to acre-fair, as there is a soft mutation on the second element of a composite word. the english meaning of acrefair is mary\'s acres.\n\nparts of acrefair have beautiful views across the [[river dee, wales|river dee]] and the dee valley. acrefair has a newsagents, a petrol station, a post office, a chemist and two chinese take-aways. it boasts many buildings built from \"ruabon red\" brick, including several chapels which are now closed and converted.(citation)\n\nedward lloyd rowland established an ironworks here in c.1817. following his bankruptcy in 1825 the works were bought by the [[british iron company]]
<page> <title>acridone</title><text>{{chembox \n| verifiedfields = changed\n| verifiedrevid = 477241172\n|imagefile=acridone.png\n|imagesize=\n|iupacname=10h-acridin-9-one\n|othernames=\n|section1={{chembox identifiers\n|  chemspiderid_ref = {{chemspidercite|correct|chemspider}}\n| chemspiderid = 10188539\n| inchi = 1/c13h9no/c15-13-9-5-1-3-7-11(9)14-12-8-4-2-6-10(12)13/h1-8h,(h,14,15)\n| inchikey = fzeyvtfcmjsgmp-uhfffaoyai\n| smiles1 = o=c1c3ccccc3nc2ccccc12\n| chembl_ref = {{ebicite|correct|ebi}}\n| chembl = 436589\n| stdinchi_ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}}\n| stdinchi = 1s/c13h9no/c15-13-9-5-1-3-7-11(9)14-12-8-4-2-6-10(12)13/h1-8h,(h,14,15)\n| stdinchikey_ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}}\n| stdinchikey = fzeyvtfcmjsgmp-uhfffaoysa-n\n| casno_ref = {{cascite|changed|??}}\n| casno=578-95-0\n|  pubchem=2015\n|  chebi_ref = {{ebicite|correct|ebi}}\n| chebi = 50756\n| smiles=c1=cc=c2c(=c1)c(=o)c3=cc=cc=c3n2\n  }}\n|section2={{chembox properties\n|  c=13 | h = 9 | n = 1 | o = 1\n|  appearance=\n|  density=\n|  meltingpt=\n|  boilingpt=\n|  solubility=\n  }}\n|section3={{chembox hazards\n|  mainhazards=\n|  flashpt=\n|  autoignition=\n  }}\n}}\n\'\'\'acridone\'\'\' is an organic compound based on the [[acridine]] skeleton, with a carbonyl group at the \'\'9\'\' position. it may be synthesized by the self-condensation of [[n-phenylanthranilic acid|\'\'n\'\'-phenylanthranilic acid]].<ref>{{orgsynth | title = acridone | author = c. f. h. allen and g. h. w. mckee | collvol = 2 | collvolpages = 15 | prep = cv2p0015 | year = 1943}}</ref>\n\n==derivatives==\nacridone constitutes the scaffold of some synthetic compounds with various pharmacological activities. most recent derivatives still in its development stage, including 3-chloro-6-(2-diethylamino-ethoxy)-10-(2-diethylamino-ethyl)-acridone, have shown some promise as a potential [[antimalarial drug]]s.<ref>{{cite journal | journal = antimicrobial agents and chemotherapy | year = 1989 | pages = 6–9 |vol
<page> <title>acro_dance</title><text>[[image:elbowstand.jpg|right|thumb|an \'\'elbow stand\'\', performed as part of an acro dance routine.]]\n\n\'\'\'acro dance\'\'\' is a style of [[dance]] that combines classical dance technique with precision [[acrobatic]] elements. it is defined by its athletic character, its unique [[choreography (dance)|choreography]], which seamlessly blends dance and acrobatics, and its use of acrobatics in a dance context.<ref name=industrydef>{{cite web\n  | author = jim lamberson\n  | title = \'\'acro dance as defined by the competitive dance industry\'\'\n  | url = http://www.westsideacademy.com/perfco/forum/viewtopic.php?t=26\n  | accessdate = 2008-04-03 | archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20080503101413/http://www.westsideacademy.com/perfco/forum/viewtopic.php?t=26| archivedate= 3 may 2008 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> it is a popular dance style in amateur [[competitive dance]] as well as in professional dance theater and in [[contemporary circus]] productions such as those by [[cirque du soleil]]. this is in contrast to [[acrobatic gymnastics|acrobatic]], [[artistic gymnastics|artistic]] and [[rhythmic gymnastics]], which are sports that employ dance elements in a gymnastics context under the auspices of a governing gymnastics organization (such as [[fédération internationale de gymnastique|fig]]) and subject to a [[code of points (artistic gymnastics)|code of points]]. acro dance is known by various other names including \'\'acrobatic dance\'\' and \'\'gymnastic dance\'\', though it is most commonly referred to simply as \'\'acro\'\' by dancers and dance professionals.\n\nacro is an especially challenging [[list of dance style categories|dance style]] for dancers as it requires them to be trained in both dance and acrobatic skills. acro dancers must be in excellent physical condition as well, because acro is a physically demanding activity.\n\n==history==\n\n[[image:ray wollbrinck vaudeville sm.jpg|right|thumb|a vaude
<page> <title>acrobasis_amplexella</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. amplexella\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis amplexella\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ragonot, 1887<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/pyraloidea/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis/index.html |title=\'&#39;acrobasis\'&#39; at funet.fi |publisher=nic.funet.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrobasis amplexella\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by ragonot in 1887, and is known from eastern [[canada]] and the [[united states]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu/species.php?hodges=5654 |title=mothphotographersgroup |publisher=mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n\nthe larvae feed on laurel species,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marylandmoths.com/html/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis_amplexella.html |title=the moths of maryland |publisher=marylandmoths.com |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref> including \'\'[[kalmia angustifolia]]\'\' and \'\'[[kalmia latifolia]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1887]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrobasis_caryae</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. caryae\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis caryae\'\'\n| binomial_authority = grote, 1881<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/pyraloidea/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis/index.html |title=\'&#39;acrobasis\'&#39; at funet.fi |publisher=nic.funet.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'acrobasis caryaevorella\'\' <small>dyar, 1908</small>\n}}\nthe \'\'\'hickory shoot borer\'\'\' (\'\'acrobasis caryae\'\') is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by grote in 1881, and is known from southeastern [[ontario]], [[canada]], and the eastern [[united states]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu/species.php?hodges=5664 |title=mothphotographersgroup |publisher=mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n\nthe larvae feed on \'\'[[carya]]\'\' species, including \'\'[[carya cordiformis]]\'\', \'\'[[carya tomentosa]]\'\', \'\'[[carya pallida]]\'\', \'\'[[carya glabra]]\'\', \'\'[[carya ovata]]\'\' and \'\'[[carya carolinae-septentrionalis]]\'\'. they feed within the shoots of their host plant.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1881]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrobasis_comptella</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. comptella\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis comptella\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ragonot, 1887<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/pyraloidea/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis/index.html |title=\'&#39;acrobasis\'&#39; at funet.fi |publisher=nic.funet.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'rhodophaea kofa\'\' <small>opler, 1977</small>\n*\'\'rhodophaea fria\'\' <small>opler, 1977</small>\n*\'\'rhodophaea neva\'\' <small>opler, 1977</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrobasis comptella\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by ragonot in 1887, and is known from the western [[united states]].\n\nthe larvae feed on \'\'[[quercus dumosa]]\'\', \'\'[[quercus douglasii]]\'\', \'\'[[quercus garryana]]\'\', \'\'quercus x turbinella ajoensis\'\' and \'\'[[chrysolepis sempervirens]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1887]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrobasis_homoeosomidia</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. homoeosomidia\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis homoeosomidia\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (hampson, 1901)<ref name=\"pyraloidea db\">{{cite web|url=http://globiz.pyraloidea.org/pages/reports/taxonreport.aspx |title=world pyraloidea database |publisher=globiz.pyraloidea.org |date= |accessdate=2011-10-07}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'numonia homoeosomidia\'\' <small>hampson, 1901</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrobasis homoeosomidia\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by hampson, 1901. it is found in [[peninsular malaysia]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1901]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrobasis_juglanivorella</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. juglanivorella\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis juglanivorella\'\'\n| binomial_authority = neunzig, 1986<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/pyraloidea/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis/index.html |title=\'&#39;acrobasis\'&#39; at funet.fi |publisher=nic.funet.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrobasis juglanivorella\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by neunzig in 1986, and is known from [[wisconsin]], [[united states|u.s.a]].\n\nthe larvae feed on \'\'[[juglans nigra]]\'\'. they mine the buds of their host plant shortly after bud break in spring. they cause further damage by mining out new shoots.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fhm.fs.fed.us/fhh/fhh-97/wi_97.htm |title=1997 forest health highlights, wisconsin |publisher=fhm.fs.fed.us |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1986]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrobasis_romanella</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = acrobasis_romanella.jpg\n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| image2 = acrobasis_romanella2.jpg\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. romanella\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis romanella\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (millière, 1870)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/pyraloidea/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis/index.html |title=\'&#39;acrobasis\'&#39; at funet.fi |publisher=nic.funet.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'rhodophaea romanella\'\' <small>millière, 1870</small>\n*\'\'acrobasis predotai\'\' <small>hartig, 1941</small>\n*\'\'acrobasis singularis\'\' <small>staudinger, 1876</small>\n*\'\'phycita omanella guilhemella\'\' <small>d. lucas, 1909</small>\n*\'\'acrobasis predotai\'\' <small>hartig, 1941</small>\n*\'\'eurhodope guelbenella\'\' <small>rungs, 1979</small>\n*\'\'acrobasis quilhemella\'\' <small>d. lucas, 1909</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrobasis romanella\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by millière, in 1870. it is found in [[france]], [[spain]], [[portugal]] and [[italy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=442177 |title=fauna europaea |publisher=faunaeur.org |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n[[image:acrobasis_romanella_larva1.jpg|thumb|left|200px]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1870]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrobasis_texana</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. texana\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrobasis texana\'\'\n| binomial_authority = neunzig, 1986<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nic.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/pyraloidea/pyralidae/phycitinae/acrobasis/index.html |title=\'&#39;acrobasis\'&#39; at funet.fi |publisher=nic.funet.fi |date= |accessdate=2011-12-16}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrobasis texana\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[acrobasis]]\'\'. it was described by neunzig in 1986, and is known from [[texas]], [[united states|u.s.a.]], from which its [[specific name (zoology)|species epithet]] is derived.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1986]]\n[[category:acrobasis]]\n\n{{acrobasis-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>acrocalymma_medicaginis</title><text>{{taxobox\n| regnum = [[fungi]]\n| divisio = [[ascomycota]]\n| classis = [[dothideomycetes]]\n| ordo = [[pleosporales]]\n| familia = [[lophiostomataceae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocalymma]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. medicaginis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocalymma medicaginis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = alcorn & j.a.g.irwin (1987)\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocalymma medicaginis\'\'\'\'\' is a plant pathogen that causes [[root rot|root]] and [[crown rot]] in [[alfalfa]]. it is found in [[australia]].<ref name=\"alcorn 1987\"/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist|refs=\n\n<ref name=\"alcorn 1987\">{{cite journal |author=alcorn jl, irwin jag. |title=\'\'acrocalymma medicaginis\'\' gen. et sp.nov. causing root and crown rot of \'\'medigo sativa\'\' in australia |journal=transactions of the british mycological society |year=1987|volume=88 |issue=2 |pages=163–7 |url= }}</ref>\n\n}}\n\n== external links ==\n*{{indexfungorum|130085}}\n\n{{defaultsort:acrocalymma medicaginis}}\n[[category:lophiostomataceae]]\n[[category:plant pathogens and diseases]]\n[[category:fungi described in 1987]]\n[[category:fungi of australia]]\n[[category:fungi native to australia]]\n[[category:fungi naturalized in australia]]\n\n\n{{pleosporales stub}}\n{{plant-disease-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_argocosma</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| class = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| infraordo [[heteroneura]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. argocosma\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops argocosma\'\'\n| binomial_authority = meyrick, 1915<ref name=\"gtd\">[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/738 acrocercops amethystopa meyrick, 1915] at the global taxonomic database of gracillariidae.</ref>\n| synonyms =\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocercops argocosma\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family, known from [[ecuador]].<ref name=\"gtd\"/> it was described by e. meyrick in 1915.<ref>meyrick, e. 1915c. descriptions of south american micro-lepidoptera. - transactions of the entomological society of london (2):201–256.</ref>\n \n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_auricilla</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| class = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| infraordo [[heteroneura]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. auricilla\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops auricilla\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (stainton, 1859)<ref name=\"gtd\">[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/746 acrocercops auricilla (stainton, 1859)] at the global taxonomic database of gracillariidae.</ref>\n| synonyms =\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocercops auricilla\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family, known from [[west bengal]], [[india]].<ref name=\"gtd\"/> the hostplant for the species is \'\'[[swietenia mahagoni]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_chionosema</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = acrocercops chionosema\n| image = leaf miner on macadamia.jpg\n| image_width = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| infraordo [[heteroneura]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. chionosema\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops chionosema\'\'\n| binomial_authority = turner, 1940<ref>[http://www.environment.gov.au/biodiversity/abrs/online-resources/fauna/afd/taxa/201c0f20-f4fe-4ec1-b870-6a0e49e0d943 australian faunal directory]</ref>\n| synonyms =\n}}\nthe \'\'\'macadamia leaf miner\'\'\' (\'\'acrocercops chionosema\'\') is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family. it is known from [[queensland]] and [[new south wales]].<ref>[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/768 global taxonomic database of gracillariidae (lepidoptera)]</ref>\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is about 6 mm. adults have dark forewings with three white bars across per wing. the hind wings are very narrow and have an extensive plume of hairs along the inner margin.<ref>[http://lepidoptera.butterflyhouse.com.au/grac/chionos.html australian insects]</ref>\n\nthe [[larva]]e feed on \'\'[[macadamia]]\'\' species (including \'\'[[macadamia integrifolia]]\'\' and \'\'[[macadamia tetraphylla]]\'\') and \'\'[[stenocarpus]]\'\' species (including \'\'[[stenocarpus salignus]]\'\'). they [[leaf miner|mine]] the leaves of their host plant. the mine has the form of a large blotch mine on the upperside of the leaf. older larvae leave the mine to pupate in a cocoon nearby.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_dinosticha</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| infraordo [[heteroneura]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. dinosticha\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops dinosticha\'\'\n| binomial_authority = meyrick, 1936<ref name=\"gtd\">[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/817 acrocercops dinosticha meyrick, 1936] at the global taxonomic database of gracillariidae.</ref>\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocercops dinosticha\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family, known from [[java]], [[indonesia]].<ref name=\"gtd\"/> it was described by [[edward meyrick]] in 1936.<ref>meyrick, e. 1936. exotic microlepidoptera. - exotic microlepidoptera (marlborough) 5(1–2):1–64.</ref> the larvae feed on [[euphorbiaceae]] species.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_eurhythmopa</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| infraordo [[heteroneura]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. eurhythmopa\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops eurhythmopa\'\'\n| binomial_authority = meyrick, 1934<ref name=\"gtd\">[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/831 acrocercops eurhythmopa meyrick, 1934] at the global taxonomic database of gracillariidae.</ref>\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocercops eurhythmopa\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family, known from [[java]], [[indonesia]], as well as [[sierra leone]].<ref name=\"gtd\"/> it was described by [[edward meyrick]] in 1934.<ref>meyrick, e. 1934a. exotic microlepidoptera. - exotic microlepidoptera (marlborough) 4(15):449–480.</ref> the hostplant for the species is \'\'[[cola nitida]]\'\' and \'\'[[sterculia]]\'\' species.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]\n[[category:moths of sierra leone]]\n\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_ochronephela</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| infraordo [[heteroneura]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. ochronephela\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops ochronephela\'\'\n| binomial_authority = meyrick, 1908<ref name=\"gtd\">[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/776 acrocercops ochronephela meyrick, 1908] at the global taxonomic database of gracillariidae.</ref>\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocercops ochronephela\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family, known from [[meghalaya]], [[india]].<ref name=\"gtd\"/> it was described by [[edward meyrick]] in 1908.<ref>meyrick, e. 1908a. descriptions of indian micro-lepidoptera. viii. - journal of the bombay natural history society 18(4):806–832.</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrocercops_scoliograpta</title><text>{{italic title}}{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'acrocercops scoliograpta\'\'\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[gracillariidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrocercops]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. scoliograpta\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrocercops scoliograpta\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[edward meyrick|meyrick]], 1922\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrocercops scoliograpta\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[gracillariidae]] family. it is known from [[india]] (punjab).<ref>[http://gc.bebif.be/species/show/980 global taxonomic database of gracillariidae (lepidoptera)]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:acrocercops]]\n[[category:butterflies and moths of asia]]\n[[category:animals described in 1922]]\n\n\n{{acrocercops-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrodermatitis</title><text>{{infobox disease\n | name           = {{pagename}}\n | image          = \n | caption        = \n | diseasesdb     = \n | icd10          = l30.8 \n | icd9           = \n | icdo           = \n | omim           = \n | medlineplus    = 001446\n | emedicinesubj  = \n | emedicinetopic = \n | meshid         = d000169\n}}\n\'\'\'acrodermatitis\'\'\' /ac·ro·der·ma·ti·tis/<ref name=thefreedictionary>{{cite web|title=acrodermatitis : definition on dorland\'s medical dictionary for health consumers|url=http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/acrodermatitis|publisher=thefreedictionary|accessdate=17 february 2013}}</ref>  is a [[childhood]] form of [[dermatitis]] selectively affecting the [[hands]] and [[foot|feet]] and may be accompanied by mild [[symptoms]] of [[fever]] and [[malaise]]. it may also be associated with [[hepatitis b]] and other [[virus|viral]] [[infections]].<ref name=medlineplus>{{cite web|title=acrodermatitis|url=http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/001446.htm|publisher=medlineplus|accessdate=16 february 2013}}</ref> \n\nit is a [[diffuse]] [[chronic (medicine)|chronic]] skin disease usually confined to the [[limb (anatomy)|limbs]], seen mainly in [[woman|women]] in [[northern europe|northern]], [[northern europe|central]], and [[eastern europe|eastern]] [[europe]], and characterized initially by an [[erythema|erythematous]], [[edema|oedematous]], [[itch|pruritic]] phase followed by [[sclerosis (medicine)|sclerosis]] and [[atrophy]]. it is caused by infection with \'\'[[borrelia burgdorferi]]\'\'.<ref name=\"thefreedictionary miller-keane\">{{cite web|title=acrodermatitis : definition on miller-keane encyclopedia and dictionary of medicine, nursing, and allied health, seventh edition|url=http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/acrodermatitis|publisher=thefreedictionary|accessdate=17 february 2013}}</ref> \n\n==types==\ntypes include:\n* [[acrodermatitis enteropathica]]\n* [[acropustulosi
<page> <title>acrodus</title><text>{{italictitle}}{{taxobox\n| image = acrodus nobilis exhibit museum of natural history.jpg\n| fossil_range = {{fossil_range|triassic}}\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[chordate|chordata]]\n| classis = [[chondrichthyes]]\n| ordo = †[[hybodontiformes]]\n| familia = [[acrodontidae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'acrodus\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = agassiz, 1837\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'acrodus\'\'\'\'\' is an extinct genus of [[cartilaginous fish]] from the [[triassic]].\nthe species \'\'acrodus anningiae\'\' was named in honor of pioneering paleontologist [[mary anning]].\n\n==sources==\n* fossils (smithsonian handbooks) by david ward (page 199)\nthe prehistoric shark was related to the bull shark that we see today.\n\n[[category:prehistoric sharks]]\n[[category:triassic fish]]\n\n\n{{triassic-fish-stub}}\n{{paleo-cartilaginous-fish-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrokeratosis_verruciformis</title><text>{{infobox disease\n | name           = {{pagename}}\n | image          = \n | caption        = \n | diseasesdb     = 3467\n | icd10          = {{icd10|q|82|8|q|82}}\n | icd9           = \n | icdo           = \n | omim           = 101900\n | medlineplus    = \n | emedicinesubj  = article\n | emedicinetopic = 1055892\n | meshid         = d007644\n}}\n\'\'\'acrokeratosis verruciformis\'\'\' (also known as \"acrokeratosis verruciformis of hopf\"<ref name=\"bolognia\">{{cite book |author=rapini, ronald p.; bolognia, jean l.; jorizzo, joseph l. |title=dermatology: 2-volume set |publisher=mosby |location=st. louis |year=2007 |pages= |isbn=1-4160-2999-0 |oclc= |doi= |accessdate=}}</ref>{{rp|1666}}) is a rare [[autosomal dominant]] disorder appearing at birth or in early childhood, characterized by [[skin lesion]]s that are small, verrucous, flat [[papule]]s resembling warts.<ref name=\"fitz2\">freedberg, et al. (2003). \'\'fitzpatrick\'s dermatology in general medicine\'\'. (6th ed.). mcgraw-hill. isbn 0-07-138076-0.</ref>{{rp|527}}<ref name=\"andrews\">james, william; berger, timothy; elston, dirk (2005). \'\'andrews\' diseases of the skin: clinical dermatology\'\'. (10th ed.). saunders. isbn 0-7216-2921-0.</ref>{{rp|568}}\n\nlike [[darier\'s disease]], it is associated with [[atp2a2]].<ref name=\"pmid12542527\">{{cite journal |author=dhitavat j, macfarlane s, dode l, \'\'et al.\'\' |title=acrokeratosis verruciformis of hopf is caused by mutation in atp2a2: evidence that it is allelic to darier\'s disease |journal=j. invest. dermatol. |volume=120 |issue=2 |pages=229–32 |year=2003 |month=february |pmid=12542527 |doi=10.1046/j.1523-1747.2003.t01-1-12045.x }}</ref>\n\n== see also ==\n* [[list of cutaneous conditions]]\n* [[list of genes mutated in cutaneous conditions]]\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{genodermatoses-stub}}\n{{ion pump disorders}}\n[[category:genodermatoses]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acrolepia_bythodes</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 250px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[acrolepiidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrolepia]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. bythodes\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrolepia bythodes\'\'\n| binomial_authority = meyrick, 1919\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrolepia bythodes\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[acrolepiidae]] family. it was described by [[edward meyrick]] in 1919. it is found in [[south america]].<ref>[http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/research/projects/lepindex/search/detail.dsml?taxonno=127954.0&userid=&username=&&listpageurl=list%2edsml%3fsort%3dscientific%255fname%255fon%255fcard%26scientific%5fname%5fon%5fcardqtype%3dstarts%2bwith%26scientific%5fname%5fon%5fcard%3daureella%26reclimit%3d30&searchpageurl=index%2edsml%3fscientific%5fname%5fon%5fcardqtype%3dstarts%2bwith%26sort%3dscientific%255fname%255fon%255fcard%26scientific%5fname%5fon%5fcard%3daureella%26reclimit%3d30 lepindex]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1919]]\n[[category:acrolepiidae]]\n\n{{yponomeutoidea-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>acrolophus_micromacha</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 250px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[acrolophidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrolophus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. micromacha\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrolophus micromacha\'\'\n| binomial_authority = meyrick, 1932\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acrolophus micromacha\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[acrolophidae]] family. it is found in [[costa rica]].<ref>[http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/research/projects/lepindex/search/detail.dsml?taxonno=129641.0&userid=&username=&&listpageurl=list%2edsml%3fbeginindex%3d180& lepindex]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1932]]\n[[category:acrolophidae]]\n\n{{moth-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>acromantis_satsumensis</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 250px\n| image_caption = \'\'acromantis satsumensis\'\'\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[mantodea]]\n| familia = [[mantidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acromantis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'a. satsumensis\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acromantis satsumensis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = matsumura, 1913\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acromantis satsumensis\'\'\'\'\' is a [[species]] of [[praying mantis]] native to [[japan]]. <ref> [http://insects.tamu.edu/research/collection/hallan/arthropoda/insects/mantodea/family/hymenopodidae.txt] texas a&m university </ref>\n\n==see also==\n*[[list of mantis genera and species]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{defaultsort:acromantis satsumensis}}\n[[category:acromantis]]\n[[category:insects of asia]]\n\n\n{{hymenopodidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acronicta_afflicta</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = acronicta afflicta\n| image = acronicta_afflicta1.jpg\n| image_width = 200px\n| image2 = acronicta_afflicta2.jpg\n| image2_width = 200px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[noctuidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acronicta]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. afflicta\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acronicta afflicta\'\'\n| binomial_authority = grote, 1864\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'acronycta dolens\'\'\n*\'\'acronicta schmalzriedi\'\'\n}}\nthe \'\'\'afflicted dagger moth\'\'\' (\'\'acronicta afflicta\'\') is a [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found in [[canada]] ([[nova scotia]], [[quebec]] and [[ontario]]), the [[united states]] (including [[alabama]], [[north carolina]], [[oklahoma]], [[georgia (u.s. state)|georgia]], [[maryland]], [[new york]] and [[ohio]]) as well as northern [[mexico]].\n[[image:acronicta afflicta.jpg|thumb|left|150px|illustration]]\n[[image:acronicta_afflicta4.jpg|thumb|left|200px|larva]]\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is about 36&nbsp;mm. adults are on wing from may to september depending on the location.\n\nthe [[larva]]e feed on various \'\'[[quercus]]\'\' species.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.oardc.ohio-state.edu/rb1192/single.asp?id=686 lepidoptera of wayne county, ohio]\n\n[[category:acronicta]]\n\n\n{{acronictinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acronicta_dinawa</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = acronicta dinawa\n| image = \n| image_width = 100px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[noctuidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acronicta]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. dinawa\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acronicta dinawa\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (bethune-baker, 1906)\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'acronycta dinawa\'\' <small>bethune-baker, 1906</small>\n*\'\'thalatha dinava\'\' <small>hampson, 1909</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acronicta dinawa\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found in [[queensland]] and [[papua new guinea]].\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.environment.gov.au/biodiversity/abrs/online-resources/fauna/afd/taxa/acronicta_dinawa australian faunal directory]\n*[http://caterpillar.ento.csiro.au/gallery/moths/slideshow.php?set_albumname=acronictadinawa&slide_index=1&slide_loop=0&slide_pause=3&slide_full=1&slide_dir=1&mode=low image]\n\n[[category:acronicta]]\n\n\n{{acronictinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acronicta_tristis</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = acronicta tristis\n| image = \n| image_width = 240px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[noctuidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acronicta]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. tristis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acronicta tristis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = smith, 1911\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acronicta tristis\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found from [[ontario]], [[quebec]] and [[new brunswick]], south to [[maryland]], [[pennsylvania]] and [[ohio]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is about 34&nbsp;mm. adults are on wing from june to july.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.natureserve.org/explorer/servlet/natureserve?searchname=acronicta+tristis species info]\n*[http://mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu/species.php?hodges=9247 image]\n*[http://www.marylandmoths.com/html/noctuidae/acronictinae/acronictini/acronicta_tristis.html moths of maryland]\n\n[[category:acronicta]]\n\n\n{{acronictinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>across_suez</title><text><!-- unsourced image removed: [[image:across_suez.jpg|right]] -->\n\'\'\'\'\'across suez\'\'\'\'\' is a [[board game]] simulating [[operational level]] ground combat between [[egypt]] and [[israel]] at the battle of chinese farm during the [[1973 arab-israeli war]].  the game is an introductory level product with an emphasis on playability over [[simulation]] value.\n\n[[simulations publications, inc.]] (spi) in [[1980 in games|1980]] issued across suez in a 1\" accordion box with a paper map.  [[decision games]] in [[1995 in games|1995]] reissued \'\'across suez\'\' with additional [[counter (board wargames)|counters]] for new variants and scenarios.\n\n== game play ==\nthe israeli player seeks to establish a [[bridgehead]] across the [[suez canal]] while the egyptian player attempts to block this.  israeli units are generally quicker, stronger, better supported, and able to push egyptian forces back, but stringent victory conditions maintain game balance.  games are usually concluded in 1–2 hours.\n\nplay is divided into seven turns governed by the standard move-shoot sequence, [[zone of control|zones of control]], a terrain effects chart, and a differential [[combat results table]] (crt).  [[artillery]] fire is abstract.  air and naval power are not simulated.  units begin the game at set locations and both sides later receive reinforcements.  night game-turns (turns one, four, and seven) slow movement and disallow artillery use.  both sides may achieve combined arms effects, which result in a column shift on the crt, for a specific attack by attacking with [[armoured forces|armor]] units and [[infantry]] or [[mechanized infantry]].\n\nthe israeli side achieves victory if at the end of the seventh turn the player has installed a bridge over the suez canal, has crossed at least six israeli units over the canal, and maintains a clear line of communication (loc) back to the israeli starting point.  if not, the egyptian player
<page> <title>acrossocheilus</title><text>{{italictitle}}{{taxobox\n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[actinopterygii]]\n| ordo = [[cypriniformes]]\n| familia = [[cyprinidae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'acrossocheilus\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = [[matsumitsu Ōshima|Ōshima]], 1919\n| subdivision_ranks = [[species]]\n| subdivision = \n24, see [[#species|text]].\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'acrossocheilus\'\'\'\'\' is a [[genus]] of [[ray-finned fish]]es in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[cyprinidae]].\n\n== morphology ==\nmaximum length of the fishes of this species varies from 8 to 20 cm. most of the fishes of this genus are found in [[southeast asia]], in [[china]] and [[vietnam]].\n\n== species ==\nit contains the following [[species]], with new ones being described occasionally:<ref>fishbase [2009]</ref>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus aluoiensis]]\'\' <small>([[nguyễn hữu dực|h. d. nguyễn]], 1997)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus baolacensis]]\'\' <small>[[nguyễn vӑn hảo|v. h. nguyễn]], 2001</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus beijiangensis]]\'\' <small>[[wu hsien-wen|h. w. wu]] & [[lin ren-duan|r. d. lin]], 1977</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus clivosius]]\'\' <small>([[lin shu-yen|s. y. lin]], 1935)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus fasciatus]]\'\' <small>([[franz steindachner|steindachner]], 1892)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus hemispinus]]\'\' <small>([[john treadwell nichols|nichols]], 1925)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus iridescens]]\'\' <small>([[john treadwell nichols|nichols]] & [[clifford h. pope|c. h. pope]], 1927)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus jishouensis]]\'\' <small>[[zhao jun (ichthyologist)|j. zhao]], [[chen xiang-lin|x. l. chen]] & [[li wen-wei|w. w. li]], 1997</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus kreyenbergii]]\'\' <small>([[charles tate regan|regan]], 1908)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus lamus]]\'\' <small>([[mai Đinh yên|Đ. y. mai]], 1978)</small>\n* \'\'[[acrossocheilus longipinnis]]\'\' <small>([[wu hsien-wen|h. w. wu]], 
<page> <title>acrossocheilus_iridescens</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'acrossocheilus iridescens\'\'\n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[actinopterygii]]\n| ordo = [[cypriniformes]]\n| familia = [[cyprinidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[acrossocheilus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. iridescens\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'acrossocheilus iridescens\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[john treadwell nichols|nichols]] & [[clifford h. pope|c. h. pope]], 1927)<ref>{{fishbase|acrossocheilus|iridescens}}</ref>\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'acrossocheilus iridescens\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[ray-finned fish]] in the genus \'\'[[acrossocheilus]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:acrossocheilus]]\n\n{{cyprinidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>act_three</title><text>{{about|the g4 album||act iii (disambiguation)}}\n{{infobox album <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = act three\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[g4 (band)|g4]]\n| cover       = actthree.jpg\n| released    = 27 november 2006\n| recorded    = \n| genre       = [[popera]]\n| length      = \n| label       = [[sony bmg]]\n| producer    = [[graham stack (record producer)|graham stack]]\n| last album  = \'\'[[g4 & friends]]\'\'<br>(2005)\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'act three\'\'\'\'\'<br>(2006)\n| next album  = \'\'the hits\'\'<br>(2007)\n}}\n{{album ratings\n| rev1 = [[allmusic]]\n| rev1score = {{rating|2|5}}<ref>{{allmusic|class=album|id=r939182|pure_url=yes}}</ref>\n| noprose = yes\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'act three\'\'\'\'\' was the third and final album to be released by \'\'[[the x factor (uk)|x factor]]\'\' runners-up [[g4 (band)|g4]].  the album included a duet with [[stephen gately]] on the song \"[[no matter what (boyzone song)|no matter what]]\", gately having sung the lead on the original version of the song with his band [[boyzone]].  this was the third album of rock, pop and traditional classics sung in [[operatic pop]] style by the tenors. being released in the same week as the third album by the similar band [[il divo]], \'\'act three\'\' peaked at #21 in the uk charts with first week sales of 37,487.\n\n==track listing==\n# \"[[volare (song)|volare]]\"\n# \"[[somebody to love (queen song)|somebody to love]]\"\n# \"[[danny boy]]\"\n# \"[[o sole mio]]\"\n# \"[[amazing grace]]\"\n# \"[[no matter what (boyzone song)|no matter what]]\" (with [[stephen gately]])\n# \"[[i don\'t like mondays]]\"\n# \"[[crazy (gnarls barkley song) |crazy]]\"\n# \"cavatina\"\n# \"toreador\"\n# \"old and wise\"\n# \"[[we\'ll meet again]]\"\n# \"[[silent night]]\"\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:2006 albums]]\n[[category:g4 (band) albums]]\n\n{{2000s-pop-album-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>acta_arithmetica</title><text>{{italic title}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acta arithmetica\'\'\'\'\' (print: {{issn|0065-1036}}, online: {{issn|1730-6264}}) is a [[scientific journal]] of [[mathematics]] publishing papers on [[number theory]]. it was established in 1935 by [[salomon lubelski]] and [[arnold walfisz]]. the journal is published by the institute of mathematics of the [[polish academy of sciences]].\n\n==external links==\n* {{official|http://journals.impan.gov.pl/aa/}}\n* [http://matwbn.icm.edu.pl/spis.php?wyd=6&jez= online archives]\n\n[[category:mathematics journals]]\n[[category:publications established in 1935]]\n[[category:polish academy of sciences academic journals]]\n[[category:multilingual journals]]\n[[category:biweekly journals]]\n\n\n{{math-journal-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acta_diurna</title><text>\'\'\'acta diurna\'\'\' ([[latin]]: \'\'daily acts\'\' sometimes translated as \'\'daily public records\'\') were daily [[ancient rome|roman]] [[official notice]]s, a sort of daily [[gazette]]. they were carved on stone or metal and presented in message boards in public places like the [[roman forum|forum]] of [[rome]]. they were also called simply \'\'acta\'\' or \'\'diurna\'\' or sometimes \'\'acta popidi\'\' or \'\'acta publica\'\'. \n\nthe first form of \'\'acta\'\' appeared around 131 bce during the [[roman republic]]. their original content included results of legal proceedings and outcomes of trials. later the content was expanded to public notices and announcements and other noteworthy information such as prominent births, marriages and deaths. after a couple of days the notices were taken down and archived (though no intact copy has survived to the present day).\n\nsometimes [[scribe]]s made copies of the \'\'acta\'\' and sent them to [[roman province|provincial]] [[governor]]s for information. later emperors used them to announce royal or senatorial decrees and events of the court.  \n\nother forms of \'\'acta\'\' were legal, municipal and military notices. [[acta senatus]] were originally kept secret, until then-[[consul]] [[julius caesar]] made them public in 59 bc. later rulers, however, often [[censorship|censored]] them.\n\npublication of the \'\'acta diurna\'\' stopped when the seat of the emperor was moved to [[constantinople]].\n\nthe \'\'acta diurna\'\' to some extent filled the place of the modern [[newspaper]] and of the government [[gazette]].  today, there are many [[academic journal|academic periodical]]s with the word \'\'acta\'\' in their titles (the publisher [[elsevier]] has 64 such titles).\n\nacta diurna introduced the expression “publicare et propagare”, which means \"make public and propagate.\" this expression was set in the end of the texts and proclaimed a release to both roman citizens an
<page> <title>acta_linguistica_hungarica</title><text>{{infobox journal\n| title = acta linguistica hungarica\n| cover = [[file:acta linguistica hungarica.jpg]]\n| editor = ferenc kiefer\n| discipline = [[linguistics]]\n| language = english, german, french\n| abbreviation = acta linguistica hung.\n| publisher = [[akadémiai kiadó]]\n| country = hungary\n| frequency = quarterly\n| history = 1951–present\n| openaccess = \n| license =\n| impact = 0.062\n| impact-year = 2011\n| website = http://akkrt.hu/19/journals/products/linguistics/acta_linguistica_hungarica_eng\n| link1 = http://www.akademiai.com/content/119702/\n| link1-name = online access\n| link2 = \n| link2-name = \n| jstor = \n| oclc = 320493650\n| lccn = 94640314\n| coden = \n| issn = 1216-8076\n| eissn = 1588-2624\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'acta linguistica hungarica\'\'\'\'\' is a quarterly [[hungary|hungarian]] [[peer review|peer-reviewed]] [[academic journal]] in the field of [[linguistics]]. it is published by [[akadémiai kiadó]] and the current [[editor-in-chief]] is ferenc kiefer ([[hungarian academy of sciences]]).\n\n== aims and scope ==\nthe scope of the journal is wider than general linguistics, including such areas as [[psycholinguistics|psycho-]] and [[neurolinguistics]], discourse analysis, and [[language typology]]. the main emphasis is placed on [[finno-ugric languages]], in particular [[hungarian language|hungarian]]. apart from research papers, both theoretical and practical, the journal has a book and dissertation review section.<ref name=aims>{{cite web |title=acta linguistica hungarica |publisher=akadémiai kiadó |date=2010 |url=http://akkrt.hu/19/journals/products/linguistics/acta_linguistica_hungarica_eng |accessdate=2010-12-25}}</ref>\n\n== abstracting and indexing ==\nthe journal is abstracted and indexed in:<ref name=\"aims\" />\n* [[arts and humanities citation index]]\n* [[linguistic bibliography|linguistic bibliography/bibliographie linguistique]]\n* international bibliographies ibz an
<page> <title>acta_triadis_thaumaturgae</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'acta triadis thaumaturgae\'\'\'\'\' or \'\'the acts of a wonder-working triad\'\'<ref>the full title is \'\'triadis thaumaturgæ, seu divorum patricii, columbæ, et brigidæ, trium veteris et majoris scotiæ, seu hiberniæ, sanctorum insulæ, communium patronorum acta, a variis, iisque pervetustis ac sanctis, authoribus scripta, ac studio r.p.f. joannis colgani, in conventu f.f. minor. hibernor, stritior, observ., lovanii, s. theologiæ lectoris jubilati, ex variis bibliothecis collecta, scholiis et commentariis illustrata, et pluribus appendicibus aucta; complectitur tomus secundus sacrarum ejusdem insulæ antiquitatum, nunc primum in lucem prodiens\'\'</ref> is a [[hagiography]] of the irish saints, [[saint patrick]], [[brigid of kildare]], and [[columba|st columba]]. \n\nit was published at [[leuven]] in 1647 by [[john colgan]], [[o.f.m.]], mainly at the expense of [[thomas fleming (archbishop)|thomas fleming]], [[archbishop of dublin (roman catholic)|archbishop of dublin]].<ref>{{cathency|wstitle=acta triadis thaumaturgæ}}</ref>  due to a lack of money not all colgan\'s writings could be published, and a catalogue of manuscripts found in his cell after his death, included detailed lives of [[ireland|irish]] missionaries in [[england]], [[scotland]], [[belgium]], [[alsace]], [[lorraine (province)|lorraine]], [[burgundy (region)|burgundy]], [[germany]], and [[italy]]. a small remnant of these unpublished volumes is now in the franciscan library, dublin.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{catholic|wstitle=acta triadis thaumaturgæ}}\n\n[[category:17th-century christian texts]]\n[[category:christian hagiography]]\n[[category:irish literature]]\n[[category:christianity in ireland]]\n\n\n{{christian-book-stub}}\n{{rc-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>actia_tarsata</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[fly|diptera]]\n| familia = [[tachinidae]]\n| subfamilia = [[tachininae]]\n| tribus = [[siphonini]]\n| genus = \'\'[[actia (genus)|actia]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. tarsata\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'actia tarsata\'\'\n| binomial_authority = richter, 1980<ref name=\"soós\">{{cite book |last=soós |first=Á |last=papp |first=l |title=catalogue of palaearctic diptera. |volume=11 anthomyiidae - tachinidae |year=1993 |publisher=hung. nat. hist. mus., |location=budapest |isbn=963-05-3910-1  |pages=1–624}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'actia tarsata\'\'\'\'\' is an eastern [[palearctic ecozone|palearctic]] [[species]] of [[fly]] in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[tachinidae]]. <ref name=\"soós\"/>\n\n==distribution==\n[[chita oblast|chita]] in eastern [[siberia]].<ref name=\"soós\"/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:actia|tarsata]]\n[[category:diptera of asia]]\n[[category:animals described in 1980]]\n{{tachinidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>actidesmium</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'actidesmium\'\'\n| domain = [[eukaryota]]\n| regnum = [[plantae]]\n| divisio = [[chlorophyta]]\n| classis = [[chlorophyceae]]\n| ordo = [[chlorococcales]]\n| familia = [[characiaceae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'actidesmium\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = reinsch 1875\n| type_species = \'\'actidesmium hookeri\'\'\n| subdivision_ranks = [[species (biology)|species]]<ref name=\"algaebase\">{{cite web | url = http://www.algaebase.org/browse/taxonomy/?id=6073 | publisher = \'\'algaebase version 4.2\'\' world-wide electronic publication, national university of ireland, galway | accessdate = 2007-09-25 | title = genus: \'\'actidesmium\'\' taxonomy browser | author = guiry, m.d. & guiry, g.m. | year = 2007 }}</ref>\n| subdivision = \n* \'\'[[actidesmium hookeri|a. hookeri]]\'\'\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'actidesmium\'\'\'\'\' is a [[genus (biology)|genus]] of [[algae]], in the family [[characiaceae]].<ref name=\"algaebase\"/>\n\n==references==\n\n{{reflist|1}}\n\n==external links==\n\n===scientific references===\n{{taxonomic references|taxon=actidesmium}}\n\n===scientific databases===\n{{taxonomic links|ncbi_taxid=220630|taxoname=actidesmium}}\n\n* [http://www.algaebase.org/search/genus/ algaebase]\n* [http://www.algaterra.org/atdb/names/namesmain.cfm algaterra database]\n* [http://ravenel.si.edu/botany/ing/ingform.cfm index nominum genericorum]\n\n{{chlorophyceae-stub}}\n\n[[category:algae genera]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acting_president_of_the_quorum_of_the_twelve_apostles</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=april 2008}}\n<!-- deleted image removed: [[image:boyd k packer.jpg|framed|acting president boyd k. packer]] -->\n\'\'\'acting president of the quorum of the twelve apostles\'\'\' is a [[priesthood (lds church)|priesthood]] calling in [[the church of jesus christ of latter-day saints]] (lds church). \n\nin general, the position of acting president of the quorum of the twelve apostles is only filled when the [[president of the quorum of the twelve apostles|president]] of the [[quorum of the twelve apostles (lds church)|quorum of the twelve apostles]] is called as a counselor in the [[first presidency (lds church)|first presidency]] of the church. in such instances, the man who holds this calling is the most senior [[apostle (latter day saints)|apostle]] who is \'\'not\'\' serving in the first presidency. additionally, a person may be called as the acting president of the quorum when the actual president of the quorum is unable to perform his duties due to ill health or incapacitation.\n\nthe formal calling of acting president of the quorum has been held six times by five men: [[rudger clawson]], [[joseph fielding smith]], [[spencer w. kimball]], [[howard w. hunter]] and [[boyd k. packer]]. additionally, two earlier apostles — [[orson hyde]] and [[brigham young, jr.]] — have acted as [[president of the quorum of the twelve apostles]] when they were \'\'not\'\' the second-most senior apostle in the church, and therefore may be said to have played the role of an acting president of the quorum before this specific title was created by the church. to date, every former acting president of the quorum has eventually gone on to serve as the president of the quorum.\n\n==duties==\nas the acting president of the quorum, the person with this calling performs all of the duties that would normally be performed by the [[president of the quorum of the twelve apostles|president o
<page> <title>actinobiology</title><text>{{orphan|date=december 2012}}\n\n\'\'\'actinobiology\'\'\' is the study of the effects of [[radiation]] upon living organisms. because there is an abundance of radiation in space that could be used as an energy source, this field is applicable to the future of space travel.\n\nradiations are the most important physical mutagens. h.j. muller who used x-rays for the first time to increase the rate of mutation in \'\'drosophila\'\', opened an entirely new field in inducing mutations. so muller is considered as the \'father of actinobiology\'.\n\nin 2002, russian scientists found melanin-rich fungi growing near [[ground zero]] at [[chernobyl disaster|chernobyl]]. it was soon discovered that these fungi were using radiation as an energy source in much the same way that plants use the sun for [[photosynthesis]].<ref>{{cite web| title=chernobyl fungus feeds on radiation| last=melville| first=kate| publisher=science a gogo| date=2007-05-23| accessdate=2012-05-28| url=http://www.scienceagogo.com/news/20070422222547data_trunc_sys.shtml}}</ref> radiotrophic bacterium have also been discovered deep underground, feeding on [[uranium]] emissions.\n\n\n==see also==\n*[[radiotrophic fungus]]\n*[[radiobiology]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:radiobiology]]\n\n\n\n{{biology-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>action_movement_for_renewal</title><text>the \'\'\'action movement for renewal\'\'\' (\'\'mouvement action renouveau\'\') is a [[political party]] in the [[republic of the congo]]. its founder was [[jean-baptiste tati loutard]], who was president of the mar until his death in 2009 and also served in the government as minister of state for hydrocarbons. the party supports president [[denis sassou nguesso]]<ref name=lobe>daniel lobé diboto, [http://www.congopage.com/article4415.html \"congrès constitutif du mouvement action renouveau (m.a.r)\"], congopage.com, 5 january 2007 {{fr icon}}.</ref> and its current president is [[roland bouiti-viaudo]], the mayor of [[pointe-noire]].\n\nmar held its constitutive congress in late december 2006, marking its transformation into a political party; 342 delegates attended the congress.<ref name=lobe/> in the [[republic of the congo parliamentary election, 2007|parliamentary election]] held on 24 june and 5 august 2007, the party won five out of 137 seats.<ref>for detailed results see [[republic of the congo parliamentary election, 2007]] and [http://www.jeuneafrique.com/pays/congo_brazza/article_depeche.asp?art_cle=xin70027lalliseriat0 \"l\'alliance présidentielle occupe 125 des 137 sièges parlementaires\"], xinhua (jeuneafrique.com), 25 august 2007 {{fr icon}}.</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{republic of the congo political parties}}\n\n\n{{rcongo-party-stub}}\n\n[[category:political parties in the republic of the congo]]</text> </page>

bougaroun\'\'\', or the \'\'\'attack on convoy kmf-25a\'\'\' was a [[luftwaffe]] action against an [[allies of world war ii|allied]] naval convoy off the coast of [[algeria]] during [[world war ii]]. the convoy of [[united states|american]], [[united kingdom|british]], [[greece|greek]] and [[netherlands|dutch]] ships was attacked on november 6, 1943 by twenty-five [[nazi germany|german]] land based aircraft. six allied vessels were sunk or damaged and six german aircraft were destroyed. german forces achieved a tactical victory though the allied warships involved received credit for defending their convoy and reacting to their losses quickly. the quick response led to the rescue of over 6,000 service men and civilians without further loss of life.\n\n==background==\n\nconvoy kmf-25a consisted of twenty-six transports escorted by fifteen w

generator called \"spec2app\".  the \"spec2app\" processor converts specifications written in [[xml]] into integrated active agenda modules utilizing [[php]] and [[mysql]]. the code generator enables <page> <title>active_format_description</title><text>{{more footnotes|date=november 2011}}\n\nin [[television]] technology, \'\'\'active format description\'\'\' (\'\'\'afd\'\'\') is a standard set of codes that can be sent in the [[moving picture experts group|mpeg]] video stream or in the baseband [[serial digital interface|sdi]] video signal that carries information about their aspect ratio and active picture characteristics. it has been used by television broadcasters to enable both [[4:3]] and [[16:9]] television sets to optimally present pictures transmitted in either format. it has also been used by broadcasters to dynamically control how down-conversion equipment formats widescreen 16:9 pictures for 4:3 displays. \n\nstandard afd codes provide information to video devices about where in the coded picture the active video is and also the \"protected area\" which is the area that needs to be shown. outside of the protected area, edges at the sides or the top can be removed without the viewer missing anything significant. video decoders and display devices can then use this information, together with knowledge of the display shape and user preferences, to choose a presentation mode.\n\nafd can be used in the generation of [[widescreen signaling]], although mpeg alone contains enough information to generate this. afds are not part of the core mpeg standard; they were originally developed within the [[digital tv group]] in the uk and submitted to [[digital video broadcasting|dvb]] as an extension, which has subsequently also been adopted by [[advanced television systems committee|atsc]] (with some changes). [[society of motion picture and television engineers|smpte]] has also adopted afd for baseband [[serial digital interface|sdi]] carriage as standard smpte 2016-1-2007, \"\'\'format for active format description and bar data\'\'\".\n\n\'\'\'active format description\'\'\' is occasionally incorrectly referred to as \"active format descriptor\".  there is no \"de
<page> <title>active_citizenship</title><text>{{for|the left-wing political coalition in san marino|active citizenship (political coalition)}}\n\n\'\'\'active citizenship\'\'\' refers to a [[philosophy]] espoused by organizations and educational institutions which advocates that members of companies or [[nation-state]]s have certain roles and responsibilities to [[society]] and the [[natural environment|environment]], although those members may not have specific governing roles.\n\nactive citizenship can be seen as an articulation of the debate over [[rights]] versus [[moral responsibility|responsibilities]]. if a body gives rights to the people under its remit, then those same people might have certain responsibilities to uphold. this would be most obvious at a [[country]] or nation-state level, but could also be wider, such as [[global citizenship]]. the implication is that an active citizen is one who fulfills both their rights and responsibilities in a balanced way.\n\na problem with this concept is that although rights are often written down as part of law, responsibilities are not as well defined, and there may be disagreements amongst the citizens as to what the responsibilities are. for example, in the [[uk|united kingdom]], citizens have the right to free health care, but [[voting]] in [[elections]] is not compulsory, even though many people would define this as a responsibility.\n\nwriting a clear definition of responsibilities for an active citizen is much more problematic than writing a list of rights. for example, although voting might be considered a basic responsibility by many people, there are some who through [[disability]] or other issues are not able to [[participation (decision making)|participate]] fully in the voting process.\n\nan active citizen is someone who takes a role in the community. the term has been identified with volunteering by writers such as jonathan tisch, who wrote in the \'\'[[huffington post]]\'\' in 2010 advocating that bus
<page> <title>active_networking</title><text>\'\'\'active networking\'\'\' is a communication pattern that allows packets flowing through a [[telecommunications network]] to dynamically modify the operation of the network.\n\n== how it works ==\n\nactive network architecture is composed of execution environments (similar to a [[unix shell]] that can execute active packets), a [[node (networking)|node]] [[operating system]] capable of supporting one or more execution environments.\nit also consists of active hardware, capable of routing or switching as well as executing code within active packets.\nthis differs from the traditional network architecture which seeks robustness and stability by attempting to remove complexity and the ability to change its fundamental operation from underlying network components.  [[network processor]]s are one means of implementing active networking concepts. active networks have also been implemented as [[overlay network]]s.\n\n== what does it offer? ==\n\nactive networking allows the possibility of highly tailored and rapid \"real-time\" changes to the underlying network operation.\nthis enables such ideas as sending code along with packets of information allowing the data to change its form (code) to match the channel characteristics.\nthe smallest program that can generate a sequence of data can be found in the definition of [[kolmogorov complexity]].\nthe use of real-time [[genetic algorithm|genetic algorithms]] within the network to compose network services is also enabled by active networking.\n\n== fundamental challenges ==\n\nactive network research addresses the nature of how best to incorporate extremely dynamic capability within networks.<ref>bush, s. f., a simple metric for ad hoc network adaptation ieee journal on selected areas in communications journal, 2005, 23, 2272–2287 [http://www.research.ge.com/~bushsf/pdfpapers/01546098.pdf]</ref>\n\nin order to do this, active network research must address the problem of optima
<page> <title>active_safety</title><text>{{refimprove|date=may 2009}}\n\nthe term \'\'\'active safety\'\'\' can be used in two distinct ways. \n\nthe first, mainly used in the us, refers to safety systems that help avoid accidents, such as good steering and brakes. in this context, passive safety refers to features that help reduce the effects of an accident, such as seat belts, airbags and strong body structures. this use is essentially interchangeable with the terms primary and secondary safety that tend to be used in the uk.\n\nhowever, active safety is increasingly being used to describe systems that use an understanding of the state of the vehicle to both avoid and minimise the effects of a crash. these include braking systems, like [[brake assist]], [[traction control system]]s and electronic stability control systems, that interpret signals from various sensors to help the driver control the vehicle.\nadditionally, forward-looking, sensor-based systems such as [[advanced driver assistance systems]] including [[adaptive cruise control]] and collision warning/avoidance/mitigation systems are also considered as active safety systems under this definition.\n\nthese forward-looking technologies are expected to play an increasing role in collision avoidance and mitigation in the future. most major component suppliers, such as delphi, trw and bosch, are developing such systems. however, as they become more sophisticated, questions will need to be addressed regarding driver autonomy and at what point these systems should intervene if they believe a crash is likely.\n\nin [[engineering]], \'\'\'active safety\'\'\' systems are systems activated in response to a safety problem or abnormal event. such systems may be activated by a human operator, automatically by a [[computer]] driven system, or even mechanically. in [[nuclear engineering]], active safety contrasts to [[passively safe|passive safety]] in that it relies on operator or computer automated intervention, wher
