<page> <title>actuarial_society_of_malaysia</title><text>\'\'\'actuarial society of malaysia\'\'\' (persatuan aktuari malaysia), also known as \'\'\'asm\'\'\' was founded on 5 october 1978. asm is the only representative body for the [[actuarial]] profession in [[malaysia]]. thus, it is the platform for members of the [[actuarial]] profession to raise and discuss technical and public interest issues related to the practice of the profession; to communicate such issues to relevant parties including the public, industry regulators and corporate stakeholders; to provide educational support to actuarial students and professional development to qualified actuaries; and to provide space for members of the profession to build relationships.\n\nasm became a full member association of the [[international actuarial association]] on 20 october 2003. \n\n==see also==\n*[[actuary]]\n*[[actuarial science]]\n*[[actuarial notation]]\n\n==actuarial organizations==\na list of actuarial organisations worldwide could be found here: [[:category:actuarial associations]]\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.actuaries.org.my official site of the actuarial society of malaysia]\n\n==references==\n{{cite web\n | url = http://www.actuaries.org.my/?p=1\n | title = actuarial society of malaysia\n | accessdate = 2007-08-31\n|archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070929161111/http://www.actuaries.org.my/?p=1 <!-- bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-09-29}}\n\n[[category:actuarial associations]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>actus_pontificum_cenomannis</title><text>the \'\'\'actus pontificum cenomannis\'\'\' is a series of short biographies of [[roman catholic diocese of le mans|bishops of the city of le mans]], starting with the first bishop [[julian of le mans|julian]], one of the [[seventy disciples]]. the core text was written in the middle ninth century, probably by a cleric or clerics of the cathedral of le mans, though it had several subsequent continuations into the central middle ages. much of the information this core contains, including several charters and diplomas, is partly or wholly fictitious. \n\nthe \'\'actus\'\' were probably part of an ambitious campaign to extend the bishop\'s rights over neighbouring monasteries, particularly the benedictine abbey of [[saint-calais]], though the attempt collapsed at the royal council of [[verberie]] in 863. the text is important as evidence for late carolingian episcopal ideology.\n\n==references==\n\n*english-language discussion of the text can be found in w. goffart, the \'\'le mans forgeries : a chapter from the history of church property in the ninth century \'\' (cambridge, mass, 1966).\n*the best and most recent edition of the \'\'actus\'\' and related texts, superseding all previous, is m. weidemann,\'\' geschichte des bistums le mans von der spätantike bis zur karolingerzeit : actus pontificum cenomannis in urbe degentium und gesta aldrici\'\' (mainz, 2000).\n\n[[category:9th-century books]]\n[[category:9th-century christian texts]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acumen_nation</title><text>{{cleanup|date=december 2008}}\n\'\'\'acumen nation\'\'\' is an [[industrial rock]] band based in [[chicago, illinois|chicago]], [[illinois]].\n\n==history==\nformed in the late 1980s as acumen by [[jason novak]] and ethan novak, the band released several cassette demos before self-releasing the cd demo \"[[transmissions from eville]]\" in 1994. the two along with bassist greg lopez put the record out themselves under the robot records moniker. during shows for this period, the band added guitarist/engineer jamie duffy. duffy greatly improved the band\'s sound onstage{{citation needed|date=september 2010}} and rounded the group into a tight fourpiece helping them to get noticed by upstart independent industrial label [[fifth colvmn records]] who signed the band and reissued [[transmissions from eville]] worldwide.\n\n==hits==\n{{peacock|section|date=may 2013}}\nwith breakaway dancefloor hits like \"matador\" and the irresistibly punchy \"gun lover\" acumen was starting to get noticed amongst industrial/gothic music fans. national tours with [[the clay people]] and [[16 volt]] soon resulted and in an effort to capitalize on the buzz they had created, the band headed back to chicago trax studios to record their follow-up entitled [[territory=universe]]. more mature, polished, harder and reflective of a specific moment in the band\'s career, territory=universe showed that acumen had a dense multi-layered sound that could pulse on the dancefloor and was underscored with emotion. standout tracks included \"mike\", \"queener\" and \"you deal with this\". with heads now turning towards their latest, acumen was invited to go out on a national tour with industrial rock pioneers [[chemlab]] and enjoyed shorter stints supporting industrial rock legends [[kmfdm]] and monster voodooo machine.\n\n==popularity==\nalthough the glory days of the industrial rock scene in chicago had faded by the time acumen emerged as a national act, through c
<page> <title>acushnet_heights_historic_district</title><text>{{infobox_nrhp | name =acushnet heights historic district\n  | nrhp_type = hd\n  | image = linden street, new bedford ma.jpg\n  | caption = linden street\n  | location= [[new bedford, massachusetts]]\n  | lat_degrees = 41\n  | lat_minutes = 38\n  | lat_seconds = 52\n  | lat_direction = n\n  | long_degrees = 70\n  | long_minutes = 55\n  | long_seconds = 53\n  | long_direction = w\n  | locmapin = massachusetts\n  | area =\n| architect= multiple\n| architecture= mid 19th century revival, colonial revival, late victorian\n | added = december 1, 1989\n | governing_body = local\n | refnum=89002035\n<ref name=\"nris\">{{nrisref|2008a}}</ref>\n}}\n\n\'\'\'acushnet heights historic district\'\'\' is a historic district roughly bounded by summer, weld, purchase, pope, county, and robeson street in [[new bedford, massachusetts]].\n\nthe district features mid-19th century revivals, [[colonial revival]]s, and late [[victorian architecture]]. the area was added to the [[national register of historic places]] in 1989.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{registered historic places}}\n\n[[category:historic districts in massachusetts]]\n\n\n{{bristolma-nrhp-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>acuson</title><text>{{cleanup|date=march 2008}}\n\'\'\'acuson corporation\'\'\' was a [[sonography]] equipment company specializing in high quality medical ultrasound equipment. founded in 1979 by sam maslak, rob younge and amin hanafy with the first product (the acuson 128) shipped in 1983, acuson pioneered many aspects related to medical ultrasound, most significantly the first fully computerized ultrasound system. in 1996 acuson introduced the sequoia 512 and sequoia c256 systems (the latter for cardiac imaging). the principal architect of the sequoia was nelson wright, who was acuson\'s vice president of advanced development. wright also led the engineering team that developed the sequoia. the sequoia quickly became the biggest selling ultrasound system (by dollar volume) and it was manufactured in various versions until december 2008.\n\nin 2000, acuson was acquired by [[siemens| siemens medical engineering group]] for approximately $700 million after which acuson corporation no longer existed, however siemens continues to use the acuson brand name. siemens\' ultrasound division headquarters was located at the original acuson facility in mountain view california until moving to a new facility also in mountain view in april 2012.\n\nacuson was important enough in evolution of the obstetric ultrasound that the [[national museum of american history]] took time in 1997 to document the history, development, commercialization and applications of the diagnostic ultrasound. an acuson 128 and an acuson sequoia system are part of the smithsonian\'s permanent collection.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/ultrasound/acuson-s-family-workflow-automation  acuson\'s official page at siemens]\n\n\n{{siemens}}\n[[category:medical equipment manufacturers]]\n\n{{med-company-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>ad_carter</title><text>[[file:adcarterkids.jpg|left|thumb|190px]]\n[[file:mushadhannah52453.jpg|right|thumb|300px|hannah and ad carter\'s \'\'mush stebbins and his sister\'\' (may 24, 1953). in 1950, the title of \'\'just kids\'\' changed to \'\'mush stebbins and his sister\'\'.]]\n\'\'\'august daniel carter\'\'\' (1895–1957) was an american [[comic strip]] cartoonist who created the long-running \'\'just kids\'\' strip. he was known as \'\'\'ad carter\'\'\', the signature he used on his strips.\n\nborn in [[baltimore|baltimore, maryland]], carter was 11 years old when his mother died, a situation which led him into the work force as a youth.<ref name=lam>[http://www.lambiek.net/artists/c/carter_a.htm lambiek]</ref> while employed as a \'\'[[brooklyn eagle]]\'\' reporter, he met the cartoonist [[clare briggs]], who encouraged him to submit a comic strip to a syndicate. in 1916, carter drew \'\'our friend mush\'\', a strip about a gang of kids.<ref name=lam/>\n\n==\'\'just kids\'\'==\nin 1922, carter was hired by [[william randolph hearst]] to create similar kid characters for a new strip, \'\'just kids\'\'. it was launched as a daily july 23, 1923, with the [[sunday strip]] following during the next month. later that decade, carter began another strip, \'\'nicodemus o\'malley\'\', which also featured kids as the main characters. in 1950, the title of \'\'just kids\'\' changed to \'\'mush stebbins and his sister\'\'.<ref name=lam/><ref name=strip/> comics historian [[don markstein\'s toonopedia|don markstein]] described the \'\'just kids\'\' gang:\n:mush stebbins continued as part of an ensemble cast... other regulars included mush\'s pals, fatso dolan and pat chan, the latter adding a touch of racial diversity back before diversity was cool. the group functioned as a kid gang operating in and around a small town called barnsville, sort of like the later archie and his pals, but younger, did in riverdale... his specific source of inspiration was \'\'r
<page> <title>ad_rutschman</title><text>{{infobox college coach\n| name          = ad rutschman\n| image         = \n| caption       = \n| birth_date   = october 30, 1931\n| birth_place    = [[hillsboro, oregon]]\n| death_date   = \n| death_place    = \n| sport         = [[american football|football]], [[baseball]]\n| current_team       = [[linfield college]]\n| current_title         = [[head coach]]\n| overall_record = 183-48-3 (.788) - football\n| awards        = 3 time division ii football coach of the year <br> 2 time kodak district 8 football coach of the year <br> 5 time oregon\'s slats gill man of the year <br> linfield alumnus of the year <br> member of linfield\'s hall of fame <br> member of oregon sports hall of fame\n| championships = football: <br> 1982 [[naia national football championship|naia division ii national championship]] <br> 1984 [[naia national football championship|naia division ii national championship]] <br> 1986 [[naia national football championship|naia division ii national championship]] <br> ___________________________________________ <br> baseball: <br> 1971 [[naia baseball world series|naia national championship]]\n| cfbdwid       = \n| coach_years    = 1968-1991 <br>1971-1983 <br> 2001-present\n| coach_teams    = [[linfield college]] <small>(football)</small> <br> [[linfield college]] <small>(baseball)</small><br> [[linfield college]] (ac)<small>(football)</small>\n| cfbhof_year   = 1998\n| cfbhof_id  = 80015\n}}\n\n\'\'\'ad rutschman\'\'\' (born october 30, 1931) is an [[united states|american]] coach of [[college football|football]] and [[baseball]] in the state of [[oregon]]. he was a head football coach for 24 seasons, head baseball coach for 13 seasons, and served as athletic director for 25 years  at [[linfield college]]. he is the first athletic director emeritus in the history of the college. he also served as head coach of football and baseball at his alma mater, [[hillsboro high school (oregon)|hillsboro high school]].\n\n
<page> <title>ad_sanctam_beati_petri_sedem</title><text>[[file:c o a alessandro vii.svg|thumb|120px|coat of arms of pope [[alexander vii]]]]\n\'\'\'ad sanctam beati petri sedem\'\'\' is a [[papal bull]] issued by pope [[alexander vii]] in october, 1656, during his second year of pontificate.<ref name=hubrt>\'\'a history of christian doctrine\'\' by hubert cunliffe-jones 2006 isbn 0-567-04393-2 page 430</ref><ref name=cathe>[http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/01128b.htm catholic encyclopedia]</ref>\n\nthe bull is aimed at rejecting [[jansenism]] and specifically condemns five propositions in the works of [[cornelius jansenius]], also condemned by the constitution of pope [[innocent x]].<ref name=cathe/> \n\'\'ad sanctam beati petri sedem\'\' specifically declares each of the five jansen propositions as [[heretical]].<ref name=cathe/>\n\nalexander vii continued this condemnation in 1664 by issuing \'\'[[regiminis apostolici]]\'\' which required all clergy to condemn the five propositions and the teachings of jansen.<ref name=hubrt/><ref>\'\'from altar-throne to table\'\' by joseph dougherty 2010 isbn 0-8108-7164-5 page 15</ref>\n\n==sources==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{rc-document-stub}}\n\n[[category:jansenism]]\n[[category:17th-century papal bulls]]\n[[category:documents of pope alexander vii]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>ad_hominem</title><text>{{selfref|\"personal attacks\" redirects here. for the wikipedia policy, see [[wikipedia:no personal attacks]].}}\n{{italic title}}\n[[image:graham\'s hierarchy of disagreement1.svg|thumb|right|375px|[[paul graham (computer programmer)|paul graham]]\'s hierarchy of disagreement lists ad hominem as the second worst type of argument in a disagreement.]]\nan \'\'\'\'\'ad hominem\'\'\'\'\' ([[latin]] for \"to the man\" or \"to the person\"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/ad%20hominem|title=ad hominem|work=the free merriam-webster dictionary|publisher=merriam-webster, incorporated|accessdate=19 february 2013}}</ref>), short for \'\'\'\'\'argumentum ad hominem\'\'\'\'\', is a general category of [[fallacy|fallacies]] in which a claim or argument is rejected on the basis of some irrelevant fact about the author of or the person presenting the claim or argument.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://aphilosopher.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/42-fallacies.pdf |title=42 fallacies: ad hominem |author=dr. michael c. labossiere |date=2002&ndash;2010 |page=2 |accessdate=2013-10-17}}</ref> \'\'ad hominem\'\' reasoning is normally categorized as an [[informal fallacy]],<ref name=\"one\">{{cite book |author=[[doug walton|walton, douglas]] |title=informal logic: a pragmatic approach |year=2008 |publisher=cambridge university press |page=190}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last1=bowell|first1=tracy|last2=kemp|first2=gary|title=critical thinking: a concise guide|year=2010|publisher=routledge|location=abingdon, oxon|isbn=0-415-47183-4|pages=210–213}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|first=irving m.|last=copi|title=informal logic|isbn=0-02-324940-4|publisher=macmillan|year=1986|pages=112–113}}</ref> more precisely as a [[genetic fallacy]],<ref>kelley l. ross,  [http://www.friesian.com/genetic.htm \"forms of the genetic fallacy\"]</ref> a subcategory of  [[fallacies of irrelevance]].<ref name=drury>{{cite web|url=http://www.drury.edu/ess/logic/inform

<page> <title>adam_aptowitzer</title><text>\'\'\'adam aptowitzer\'\'\' is a tax and charity lawyer in ottawa, canada. he studied at the university of ottawa law school and subsequently opened his own law firm in toronto, canada in 2002. after three years, he merged his firm with the renowned drache llp charity tax law firm in ottawa, canada, where he currently practices law.\n\nin 2009, his study on the potential success for an independent charities commission was published by the cd howe institute. following this publication, aptowitzer was invited to speak to several non-profit organizations across canada. \n\naptowitzer is the former [[ontario]] chairman of [[b\'nai brith canada]]’s institute for international affairs.\n\nhe was criticized by supporters of [[mohammed elmasry]] after he made statements on the october 19, 2004 broadcast of the \'\'[[michael coren show]]\'\' defending the bulldozing of palestinian terrorist\'s homes as a means of deterring further suicide bombings.  aptowitzer argued that such actions were permissible when used to prevent deaths.\n\nthe criticism of aptowitzer came in the wake of demands by b\'nai brith that the president of the [[canadian islamic congress]],  mohamed elmasry, resign for comments he made on the same program that all jewish adults were legitimate targets of palestinian terrorism because they could all potentially become members of the israeli military.<ref name=sellar>sellar, don, \"arab group got the rest of the story\", \'\'toronto star\'\', november 6, 2004</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n|name=aptowitzer, adam\n|alternative names=\n|short description=canadian lawyer\n|date of birth=\n|place of birth=\n|date of death=\n|place of death=\n}}\n\n{{defaultsort:aptowitzer, adam}}\n[[category:jewish canadian politicians]]\n[[category:year of birth missing (living people)]]\n[[category:living people]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adam_beyer</title><text>\'\'\'adam beyer\'\'\' (born 1976 in [[stockholm]], [[sweden]]) is a swedish [[techno music|techno]] producer and [[disc jockey|dj]]. he is the founder of [[drumcode records]], [[truesoul records]], [[code red recordings|code red]] and [[mad eye recordings]]. he is one of several [[sweden|swedish]] [[techno]] artists to emerge in the mid-1990s along the likes of [[cari lekebusch]], [[joel mull]], [[jesper dahlback]], [[alexi delano]], [[christian smith (singer)|christian smith]] and more.\n\nbeyer is the partner of fellow swedish dj [[ida engberg]]. in 2011, their first child was born.<ref>{{cite web|title=q+a {{!}} adam beyer|url=https://halcyonline.com/2012/qa-adam-beyer/|accessdate=26 november 2012}}</ref>\n\n== selected discography ==\n* \'\'adam beyer: decoded\'\', 1996\n* \'\'adam beyer: ignition key\'\', 2002\n* \'\'[[fabric 22]]\'\', 2005\n\n== external links ==\n* [http://www.drumcode.se/ drumcode records]\n* [http://www.truesoulrecords.com/ truesoul records]\n* [http://www.myspace.com/adambeyer myspace page]\n* [http://www.discogs.com/artist/adam+beyer adam beyer] at [[discogs]]\n* [http://www.beatsandbeyond.com/interviews/bnb-interview-adam-beyer.html bnb interview adam beyer]\n* [http://swedishtechno.com swedishtechno.com]\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{authority control|viaf=12101160}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = beyer, adam\n| alternative names =\n| short description = swedish dj\n| date of birth     = 1974\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:beyer, adam}}\n[[category:1976 births]]\n[[category:swedish djs]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:techno musicians]]\n\n\n{{dj-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adam_bowden</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=july 2013}}\n\'\'\'adam bowden\'\'\' (born 5 august 1982) is a british international [[triathlete]] and former international runner who specialized in the [[3000 metres steeplechase]].\n\n==early life and education==\nadam is originally from [[watford]], [[hertfordshire]] and was educated at [[st. michael\'s catholic high school]]. he was a national level swimmer as a teenager before concentrating on athletics.\n\n==athletics==\nas an athlete, adam represented great britain on the [[road running|road]], [[cross country running|cross country]] and [[track and field|track]]. he is a member of [[london borough of harrow|harrow]] athletic club<ref>{{cite web |title= harrow athletic club |url=http://www.harrowac.co.uk}}</ref> and holds the club records for 3,000 metres steeplechase and [[10,000 metres]]. in 2001 he represented great britain in the world junior cross country championships and finished 6th in the european junior cross country championships later that year behind [[mohammed farah]] (who finished second). in 2006 he competed in the [[2006 commonwealth games|commonwealth games]] (finishing 9th) and [[2006 european athletics championships|european championships]] steeplechase. after missing 2007 through injury, adam won the 2008 uk olympic steeplechase trials.\n\n==triathlon==\nsince 2008, adam has been a professional [[triathlete]]. he is part of the british triathlon world class development program<ref>{{cite web |title= triple celebrations in chile |url= http://www.britishtriathlon.org/news/article.php?id=11009}}</ref> and competed in the 2011 [[itu triathlon world championships|itu world championship series]]. his highest placing in the series was 7th<ref>{{cite web |title= jenkins sixth in yokohama and bowden breaks through |url=http://www.britishtriathlon.org/news/article.php?id=11379}}</ref> in japan. as of june 2013, he has a world ranking of 11th.\n\n==personal bests<ref>{{cite web |title = p
<page> <title>adam_colonia</title><text>[[file:adam de colone31.jpg|thumb|right|village fire by night, ca. 1660, by colonia after [[egbert van der poel]]]]\n\'\'\'adam colonia\'\'\' (12 august 1634 &ndash; september 1685) was a [[dutch golden age]] painter active in london.\n\n==biography==\ncolonia was born in [[rotterdam]]. according to the rkd he was the son of [[isaac colonia]], though coming from a painting family and running an art dealership in rotterdam, may not have been his primary teacher.<ref name=rkd>[http://www.rkd.nl/rkddb/dispatcher.aspx?action=search&database=choiceartists&search=priref=17823 adam colonia] in the [[rkd]]</ref> his work was influenced by [[jan daemen cool]] and egbert van der poel, either of whom may have been his teacher.<ref name=rkd/> he married in rotterdam in 1661 and travelled to london in 1670, where he stayed until his death.<ref name=rkd/> he is known for italianate landscapes and religious works.<ref name=rkd/> \n\nhe sometimes painted landscapes and figures in the manner of [[nicolaes pietersz. berchem|berchem]]. in the [[statens museum for kunst|copenhagen museum]] there is a picture by him of \'noah building the ark\'; and the [[palais des beaux-arts de lille|lille museum]] has \'the angel appearing to the shepherds\' attributed to him.\n\n{{commons category|adam colonia}}\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n{{bryan|article=colonia, adam}}\n*[http://www.artnet.com/artists/adam+de-colonia/past-auction-results adam colonia] on [[artnet]]\n\n{{authority control|bpn=21195215}}\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = colonia, adam\n| alternative names =\n| short description = dutch golden age painter\n| date of birth     = 1634\n| place of birth    = rotterdam\n| date of death     = 1685\n| place of death    = london\n}}\n{{defaultsort:colonia, adam}}\n[[category:1634 births]]\n[[category:1685 deaths]]\n[[category:dutch golden age painters]]\n[[category:people from rotterdam]]</text> </
<page> <title>adam_cracknell</title><text>{{use mdy dates|date=december 2011}}\n{{infobox ice hockey player\n| image = \n| caption =\n| image_size = 230px\n| team = [[st. louis blues]]\n| league = [[national hockey league|nhl]]\n| prospect_team = <!--[[peoria rivermen (ahl)|peoria rivermen]]\n| prospect_league = [[american hockey league|ahl]]-->\n| former_teams = \n| position = [[winger (ice hockey)|right wing]]\n| shoots = right\n| height_ft = 6\n| height_in = 2\n| weight_lb = 211\n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1985|07|15}}\n| birth_place = [[prince albert, saskatchewan|prince albert]], [[saskatchewan|sk]], [[canada|can]]\n| draft = 279th overall\n| draft_year = 2004\n| draft_team = [[calgary flames]]\n| career_start = 2006\n}}\n\'\'\'adam cracknell\'\'\' (born july 15, 1985) is a [[canada|canadian]] professional [[ice hockey]] [[winger (ice hockey)|right winger]] currently playing for the [[st. louis blues]] of the [[national hockey league]] (nhl).\n\n==playing career==\ncracknell played [[junior ice hockey|junior hockey]] for the [[kootenay ice]] in the [[western hockey league]] (whl). has was a member of the [[2004–05 whl season|2004–05]] whl regular season champions with the kootenay ice. in his final year, [[2005–06 whl season|2005–06]], cracknell lead the kootenay team in goals (42), assists (51) and points (93); was ranked second in the whl in total points; and was named to the whl west second all-star team.<ref>{{cite book |last=national hockey league|title=the national hockey league official guide & record book/2011|year=2010 |publisher= triumph books |page= 287|isbn= 978-1-60078-422-4}}</ref>\n\nnoticed by professional scouts for his size and work ethic, cracknell was drafted by the [[calgary flames]] in the final round of the 2004 draft.<ref>{{citeweb| url = http://www.hockeysfuture.com/prospect/adam_cracknell | title =  adam cracknell player profile | publisher = \'\'hockeysfuture.com\'\' | date = 2010-10-02 | accessdate = 2010-10-02}}</re
<page> <title>adam_deadmarsh</title><text>{{infobox ice hockey player\n| image = adam deadmarsh.jpg\n| image_size = 230px\n| position = [[winger (ice hockey)|right wing]]\n| shoots = right\n| height_ft = 6\n| height_in = 0\n| weight_lb = 205\n| played_for = [[quebec nordiques]]<br>[[colorado avalanche]]<br>[[los angeles kings]]\n| ntl_team = united states\n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1975|5|10|mf=y}}\n| birth_place = [[trail, british columbia|trail]], [[british columbia|bc]], [[canada|can]] \n| career_start = 1994\n| career_end = 2003\n| draft = 14th overall\n| draft_year = 1993\n| draft_team = [[quebec nordiques]]\n}}\n\'\'\'adam richard deadmarsh\'\'\' (born may 10, 1975) is a former [[canadian-american]]  professional [[ice hockey]] player who played in the [[national hockey league|nhl]] with the [[quebec nordiques]], [[colorado avalanche]] and the [[los angeles kings]]. deadmarsh was later a video coordinator and assistant coach with the avalanche,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.denverpost.com/avalanche/ci_12652479|title=former avs join sacco staff | publisher =denverpost.com | date = 2009-06-20 | accessdate = 2009-06-20 | first=adrian | last=dater| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20090623182934/http://www.denverpost.com/avalanche/ci_12652479| archivedate= 23 june 2009 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> before concussion issues forced him to step down after the {{nhly|2011}} season, nine years after his playing career ended for the same reason.\n\n==playing career==\ndeadmarsh was drafted by the [[quebec nordiques]] in the [[1993 nhl entry draft]], first round, fourteenth overall, from the [[portland winterhawks]] of the [[western hockey league]]. he played for the avalanche team that won the [[stanley cup]] in [[1995–96 nhl season|1996]]. his name was initially misspelled \"deadmarch\" on the cup, but was later corrected; it was the first time a misspelling on the stanley cup had ever been corrected.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nhl.com/cup

<page> <title>adam_fitzroy</title><text>\'\'\'adam fitzroy\'\'\' was a natural son of king [[edward ii of england]]. the identity of adam\'s mother is not known. he accompanied his father in the scottish campaigns of 1322, and died shortly afterwards on september 18, 1322.\n\nadam is named as \'\'ade filio domini regis bastardo\'\' (\"adam, bastard son of the lord king\") in edward ii\'s wardrobe account of 1322. between 6 june and 18 september that year, adam was given a total of thirteen pounds and twenty-two pence to buy himself \"equipment and other necessaries\" (\'\'armatura et alia necessaria\'\') to take part in edward\'s scottish campaign that autumn. this suggests he was somewhere in his teens, born between about 1305 and 1310.\n\nthe money was paid in five instalments, either to adam directly or to his \'magister\' (tutor) [[hugh chastilloun]]. adam died during the campaign, of unknown causes, and was buried at [[tynemouth priory]] on 30 september 1322; his father paid for a silk cloth with gold thread to be placed over his body. \n\nno other references to him have yet been discovered.\n\n==sources==\n* seymour phillips, edward ii (2010), pp.&nbsp;102, 428-9\n* f.d. blackley, \'adam, the bastard son of edward ii\', bulletin of the institute of historical research, xxxvii (1964), pp.&nbsp;76–7.\n* british library stowe ms 553.\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = fitzroy, adam\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = 1322\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:fitzroy, adam}}\n[[category:1322 deaths]]\n[[category:illegitimate children of english monarchs]]\n[[category:14th-century english people]]\n[[category:year of birth unknown]]\n[[category:edward ii of england]]</text> </page>

<page> <title>adam_grant_horne</title><text>\'\'\'adam grant horne\'\'\' (1829 – august 10, 1901) was a [[hudson\'s bay company]] employee at the [[colony of vancouver island]], a municipal politician and a businessman. he was born in [[edinburgh, scotland]] and died at [[nanaimo, british columbia]]. he married elizabeth bate whose brother, mark bate, also an hbc employee, was the first mayor of nanaimo.\n\nhorne arrived in [[british columbia]] as a labourer in 1851 aboard the immigrant ship [[tory (ship)|\'\'tory\'\']] <ref name=mackie>{{cite book   | last =mackie   | first =richard somerset  | title =the wilderness profound, victorian life on the gulf of georgia | location=victoria, bc   | publisher =sono nis press   | year =1995  | isbn = 1-55039-058-9}}</ref>{{rp|39}} and was in charge of the company store in [[nanaimo, british columbia|nanaimo]] when, in 1862, the company sold out.  after operating a business on his own account in nanaimo, he took further employment with the hbc first at its [[fort simpson (columbia department)|fort simpson]] post and then took charge of its [[comox]] operation from 1865 to 1878 when the post there was closed as well.  at that time horne returned to business on his own account in nanaimo where he also served as an alderman.\n\nin 1856 horne led what is thought to have been the first crossing of [[vancouver island|mid-vancouver island]] by a european.  he was to ascertain whether a trail existed from the present location of [[qualicum beach, british columbia]], on vancouver island\'s east coast in the hopes of establishing  trade with the [[nuu-chah-nulth people|nuu-chah-nulth]] who lived on the west coast.  at the mouth of the [[qualicum river]], horne\'s party and their native guides observed a large fleet of [[haida people|haida]] canoes approaching and hid in trees unable to warn the villagers of the impending attack.  afterwards, they observed the attackers as they left holding human heads.  when they came to the mouth of
<page> <title>adam_harvey</title><text>{{infobox musical artist\n| image             = adam harvey.jpg\n| imgcaption      = photo by bruce howlett, 2arm fm92.1, armidale, new south wales\n| name            = adam harvey\n| background      = solo_singer\n| birth_name      = \n| birth_date            = {{birth date and age|1974|12|21|df=yes}}\n|birth_place =[[geelong, victoria]], [[australia]]\n| death_date            = \n| origin          = [[geelong, victoria]]\n| genre           = [[country music|country]]\n| occupation      = [[singer]], [[songwriter]]\n| years_active    = 1984–present\n| label           = open road<br />universal<br />[[abc music]]<br />[[sony music]]\n| associated_acts =\n|website              = http://www.adamharvey.com.au\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adam harvey\'\'\' is an australian [[country music]] singer. harvey has been nominated three times for an [[aria music awards|aria music award]] and is a multiple [[country music awards of australia|cmaa award]] winner.\n\n==biography==\nadam harvey got his start musically learning country classics on the guitar as a small boy. his first gig came at the age of ten, and by his school years he was performing rock covers at a club when he was discovered and went off on tour as support for [[tania kernaghan]].<ref>{{cite web|url={{allmusic|class=artist|id=p698129|pure_url=yes}}|title=adam harvey|publisher=[[allmusic]]|last=true|first=chris|accessdate=29 january 2010}}</ref> in 1998 harvey won his first [[country music awards of australia|country music (cmaa) award]] for \'vocal collaboration of the year\' with [[tanya self]] for \"drive away\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.country.com.au/index.cfm?page_id=1134|title=country music awards of australia 1990-1999|publisher=[[country music association of australia|cmaa]]|accessdate=29 january 2010}} {{dead link|date=october 2010|bot=h3llbot}}</ref>  in 2001 he won another cmaa award for \'vocal collaboration of the year\' this time with [[beccy cole]], [[darren coggan]
<page> <title>adam_hecktman</title><text>{{orphan|date=december 2008}}\n\'\'\'adam hecktman\'\'\' (born 1966 in [[chicago, illinois]]) is the director for the [[microsoft]] technology center[http://www.microsoft.com/mtc] in chicago, located at the [[aon center (chicago)|aon center]]. he has been with the mtc since its inception in september 2001.  he has served on the board of directors for the [[chicago children\'s museum]][http://www.chichildrensmuseum.org] since 2003, and has been involved in an advisory capacity in a number of community organizations in and around chicago for much of the last decade.\n\nprior to this position, adam managed the technology specialist program for microsoft’s largest sales district, the midwest district. he has been with microsoft since 1991.\n\nprior to microsoft, adam was a consultant with [[andersen consulting]] for three years.   while at andersen consulting, adam worked with clients including those in financial services, government, and utilities.  adam received a bachelor of science in commerce and business administration from the [[university of illinois at urbana-champaign]]. he also holds a [[master of business administration]] degree.\n\nhecktman plays banjo.\n\nmr. hecktman was awarded the dan steinman humanity award from the indiana university mike chase foundation for his research on the 386 grabber file.  this patented technology allowed ms-dos 5.0 applications to utilize shared ram on the 80386 architecture introduced by the intel corporation.\n\nadam hecktman serves on the board of directors for the family institute at northwestern university.\n\non january 22nd adam and his wife bore their 1st and only child, a daughter named haley csl hecktman. haley currently attends latin school of chicago and murdered philip j. ring, which has sparked controversy due to ring\'s relationship with adam\'s niece erica hecktman.\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = hecktman, adam\n|

<page> <title>adam_kidron</title><text>{{refimprove|date=april 2013}}\n\'\'\'adam kidron\'\'\' is a british-born ex-[[music producer]], serial entrepreneur, and the ex-[[chief executive officer]] of urban box office (ubo), a [[reggaeton]] and [[urban culture|urban]] [[latino]] [[record label]] based in new york city. he is currently a managing partner of 4food, a fast-healthy food concept launched in new york in 2009. 4food\'s mission is to bring fast, fresh, nutritious and delicious food (from local farms and producers) to as many people, of as many different age groups, lifestyles, income-levels, and ethnicities as possible. adam is also the president of 4food4life inc. – a non-profit organization committed to the promotion and sustainability of community growth and revitalization through nutrition and wellness education, vocational training, and economical development. adam is currently under the public eye within various tech blogs over the failure of beyond oblivion and the boinc platform.\n\n== overview ==\n\nadam kidron began his working life as a steward at the [[roundhouse]] in london in 1978. in 2006, kidron, together with [[eduardo reyes (music producer)|eduardo reyes]], produced \"[[nuestro himno]]\" — the controversial spanish-language version of \"[[the star-spangled banner]]\". it was dubbed by the media as \"the spanish star-spangled banner\". the recording was closely based on the u.s. government\'s own, sanctioned translation in 1919 of a famous poem by [[francis scott key]], that would twelve years later become the national anthem of the united states. it was recorded to give recent spanish-language immigrants that have not yet learned english an equal opportunity to understand \"the star-spangled banner\" and ideals of freedom that the u.s. flag represents.{{cn|date=april 2013}}\n\nthe controversy surrounding the recording received blanket media coverage around the globe, including a [http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/

<page> <title>adam_lingner</title><text>{{blp sources|date=january 2013}}\n{{no footnotes|date=january 2013}}\n{{infobox gridiron football person\n|image= <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[wp:nonfree]] -->\n|birth_date={{birth date and age|1960|11|2|mf=y}}\n|birth_place= [[indianapolis, indiana]]\n|death_date=\n|college=[[university of illinois at urbana-champaign|illinois]]\n|position=[[center (american football)|center]]<br>[[guard (american football)|guard]] \n|number=51, 62, 63\n|draftedyear=1983\n|draftedround=9 / pick 231\n|probowls=\n|databasefootball=lingnada01\n|pfr=\n|years=1983-1986<br>1987<br>1988<br>1989-1995\n|teams=[[kansas city chiefs]]<br>[[buffalo bills]]<br>[[kansas city chiefs]]<br>[[buffalo bills]]\n|cbs=\n}}\n\'\'\'adam james lingner\'\'\' (born november 2, 1960 in [[indianapolis]], [[indiana]]) is a former [[american football]] [[offensive lineman]] who played thirteen seasons in the [[national football league]] with the [[kansas city chiefs]] and the [[buffalo bills]]. lingner was drafted in 1983 in the 9th round by the kansas city chiefs, and was the lowest draft pick to make the squad. he was a member of buffalo\'s teams in four consecutive [[super bowl]] games: [[super bowl xxv]], [[super bowl xxvi]], [[super bowl xxvii]] and [[super bowl xxviii]].\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = lingner, adam\n| alternative names =\n| short description = american football player\n| date of birth     = november 2, 1960\n| place of birth    = [[indianapolis, indiana]]\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:lingner, adam}}\n[[category:1960 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:american football offensive linemen]]\n[[category:kansas city chiefs players]]\n[[category:buffalo bills players]]\n[[category:illinois fighting illini football players]]\n\n\n{{offensive-lineman-1960s-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adam_newland</title><text>{{infobox cricketer\n|                name = adam newland\n|               image = \n|             country = england\n|            fullname = adam newland\n|            nickname = \n|          birth_date = 1719\n|         birth_place = [[slindon]], [[sussex]], england\n|             batting = unknown\n|             bowling = unknown (underarm)\n|                role = batsman\n|               club1 = [[slindon cricket club]]\n|               year1 = c.1740 &ndash; c.1760\n|               club2 = \n|               year2 = \n|                date = 5 september\n|                year = 2009\n|             columns = 0\n|              source = [timothy j mccann]\n}}\n\'\'\'adam newland\'\'\' (born 1719 at [[slindon]], [[sussex]]; details of death unknown) was an english professional [[cricket]]er who played [[first-class cricket]] during the 1740s for [[slindon cricket club]] and [[sussex county cricket teams|sussex]].  he made 8 known first-class appearances plus two more in [[single wicket]].\n\nhe was the younger brother of [[richard newland|richard]] and [[john newland (cricketer)|john newland]]; and an uncle of [[richard nyren]].<ref>[http://www.cricketarchive.com/archive/players/77/77412/77412.html cricketarchive].  retrieved on 5 september 2009.</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* [http://web.archive.org/web/20110629140138/http://www.jl.sl.btinternet.co.uk/stampsite/cricket/ladstolords/1741.html#newlanda from lads to lord\'s; the history of cricket: 1300 – 1787]\n* {{cricketarchive|ref=/archive/players/77/77412/77412.html}}\n\n==bibliography==\n* [[arthur haygarth]], \'\'scores & biographies\'\', volume 1 (1744–1826), lillywhite, 1862\n* [[timothy j mccann]], \'\'sussex cricket in the eighteenth century\'\', sussex record society, 2004 \n* [[david underdown]], \'\'start of play\'\', allen lane, 2000\n\n{{persondata\n|name=newland, adam\n|alternative names=\n|short description=english cricketer\n
<page> <title>adam_osgodby</title><text>\'\'\'adam osgodby\'\'\' (died 1316) was an english lawyer and administrator. he was born in [[osgodby, selby]], and although his early life and career are fairly unknown it is known that he acted as a lawyer for [[william hamilton (lord chancellor)|william hamilton]] among others.<ref name=\"odnb\">{{cite web|url=http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/20889|title=oxford dnb article:osgodby, adam (subscription needed)|year=2004|publisher=[[oxford university press]]|accessdate=2009-06-02}}</ref> between 1295 to 1316 he served as [[master of the rolls|keeper of the rolls of chancery]], and from 1307 he was the master of the [[domus conversorum]].<ref name=\"odnb\"/> osgodby also held several ecclesiastical positions - he was [[canon (priest)|canon]] of york from 1289, [[parson]] of gargrave from 1293 and [[prebendary|prebend]] of ulfshelf. he died in 1316.<ref name=\"odnb\"/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{s-start}}\n{{s-legal}}\n{{succession box | before=[[john langton]]| title=[[master of the rolls]] | years=1295&ndash;1316| after= [[william airmyn (judge)|william airmyn]]}}\n{{end}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = osgodby, adam\n| alternative names =\n| short description =english lawyer and administrator\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = 1316\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:osgodby, adam}}\n[[category:year of birth missing]]\n[[category:1316 deaths]]\n[[category:masters of the rolls]]\n[[category:english lawyers]]\n[[category:english civil servants]]\n[[category:14th-century english people]]\n\n\n{{england-law-bio-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adam_tooze</title><text>\'\'\'adam tooze\'\'\' (born in 1967) is a [[united kingdom|british]] historian and was reader in modern european economic history at the [[university of cambridge]]. in 2002, he was awarded a [[philip leverhulme prize]] for modern history.  as of summer 2010, he is a professor of history at [[yale university]].\n\nafter graduating in economics from [[university of cambridge|cambridge]], tooze studied at [[free university of berlin|fu berlin]] before moving to [[london school of economics|lse]] for a doctorate in economic history.<ref name = \"yale bio\">{{cite web |title= faculty: adam tooze |url= http://www.yale.edu/history/faculty/tooze_a.html |publisher= [[yale university|yale.edu]] |accessdate= 15 november 2012 }}</ref>\n\nhe is currently best known for his economic study of the [[third reich]], \'\'[[the wages of destruction]]\'\', which was one of the winners of the [[wolfson history prize]] for 2006.\n\n==publications==\n*(2001), \'\'statistics and the german state, 1900-1945: the making of modern economic knowledge\'\' (cambridge studies in modern economic history), cambridge: cambridge university press, 2001. isbn 0-521-80318-7\n*(2006), \'\'[[the wages of destruction|the wages of destruction: the making and breaking of the nazi economy]]\'\', london: allen lane, 2006. isbn 0-7139-9566-1\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.yale.edu/history/faculty/tooze_a.html faculty page] - <page> <title>adam_veyde</title><text>{{use mdy dates|date=april 2012}}\n\'\'\'adam adamovich veyde\'\'\' ({{lang-ru|link=no|Адам Адамович Вейде}}) (1667 – january 26, 1720) was a [[russia]]n [[infantry]] general and a close associate of [[peter the great]].\n\nadam veyde began his military career in the so-called [[poteshnye voiska]]. he participated in both of the [[azov campaigns]], being a major of [[preobrazhensky lifeguard regiment]] in charge of engineer works during the siege of the [[azov]] fortress. enjoying peter the great\'s great confidence, adam veyde was frequently sent abroad on different important assignments and accompanied the [[tsar]] during all of his trips. for example, veyde was dispatched to [[hungary]] and [[saxony]] in 1696 to notify their leaders of the falling of azov. in 1698, he was sent to france and england to study military science. upon his return, adam veyde presented a military charter composed by him (Воинский устав, also known as the veyde charter), in which he had set forth administrative and military rules for infantry regiments under formation, responsibilities of all military ranks (from [[private (rank)|private]] to [[commander-in-chief]] inclusively), the rules of conduct for all ranks under any circumstances, and [[drill]] procedures. adam veyde composed his charter under the influence of [[louis xiv]]\'s legal provisions of military nature and organization of [[eugene of savoy]]\'s army, which had already earned fame by that time. the veyde charter formed the basis for the peter the great\'s charter of 1716. upon the disbandment of the [[streltsy]] regiments, general [[avtonom golovin]] and adam veyde were ordered to form 18 infantry and 2 [[dragoon]] regiments in moscow in the fall of 1699. also, veyde was put in charge of teaching the marching drill to [[stolnik]]s, \'\'stryapchiys\'\' ([[butler]]s), and \'\'zhiltsys\'\' (lowest category of the [[service class people]]). during the [[gre
<page> <title>adam_wade</title><text>\'\'\'adam wade\'\'\' may refer to:\n\n*[[adam wade (drummer)]] (born 1968), american drummer\n*[[adam wade (singer)]] (born 1937), american singer, drummer and television actor\n\n{{hndis|wade, adam}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adam_of_ross</title><text>\'\'\'adam of ross\'\'\' was an irish [[cistercian]] monk who fl. 1279.\n\nan [[anglo-irish]] native of [[new ross]], [[county wexford]], adam is believed to have been a member of the [[cistercian]] monastery at [[dunbrody]], county wexford. he was the author of a translation into [[french language|french]] of the \'\'vision of st. paul\'\'. he was a severe moralist, encouraging the use of french in [[ireland]] for religious purposes. adam wrote his translations for the benefit of his brothers in religion, specifically on how to avoid going to [[hell]].\n\n==references==\n\n* \'\'hiberno-norman literature\'\', [[evelyn mullally]], in \'\'settlement and socity in medieval ireland: studies presented to f.x. martin\'\', dublin, 1988.\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = adam of ross\n| alternative names =\n| short description = medieval irish writer\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:adam of ross}}\n[[category:medieval irish writers]]\n[[category:13th-century writers]]\n[[category:people from county wexford]]\n[[category:13th-century books]]\n[[category:manuscripts]]\n[[category:irish writers]]\n[[category:translators to french]]\n[[category:anglo-normans in ireland]]\n[[category:medieval writers]]\n[[category:13th-century irish people]]\n[[category:cistercians]]\n[[category:year of birth unknown]]\n[[category:year of death missing]]\n\n\n{{ireland-writer-stub}}\n{{translator-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adams_lake_provincial_park</title><text>[[image:adams lake.jpg|thumb|200px|right|[[adams lake]] seen from the park]]\n\'\'\'adams lake provincial park\'\'\' is a [[provincial park]] in [[british columbia]], [[canada]]. it encompasses three distinct parks: [[adams lake]] ([[bush creek]] site) provincial park, adams lake marine provincial park (poplar point site), and adams lake marine provincial park (spillman beach site).\n\nthe parks are located east of [[kamloops, british columbia|kamloops]], and 30 kilometres north of [[chase, british columbia|chase]], or north of kamloops and 48 kilometres east of louis creek. the closest communities, towns and cities to this park are [[scotch creek, british columbia|scotch creek]], [[sorrento, british columbia|sorrento]], [[salmon arm, british columbia|salmon arm]], barriere, chase and [[kamloops]].\n\n== adams lake provincial park (bush creek site) ==\nthe park protects beaches and shoreline on adams lake as well as mixed forests of [[aspen]], [[birch]], [[willow]], [[douglas-fir]] and [[thuja plicata|western redcedar]]. the area was established as a recreation area in 1988 and designated as a provincial park in 1997. the park is 56 hectares in size and is located on the southwestern shores of adams lake.\n\n== adams lake marine provincial park (poplar point site) ==\nthe park protects a portion of adams lake beach and an upland forest of douglas-fir, western redcedar and [[populus sect. aegiros|cottonwood]]s. established april 30, 1996. the park is 32 hectares in size and is located on the east side of adams lake, where bugcamp creek enters the lake.\n\n== adams lake marine provincial park (spillman beach site) ==\nthe park encompasses beach frontage along adams lake and the lower portion of spillman creek. the park contains mixed douglas-fir and [[lodgepole pine]] forests, cottonwood, birch, and western red cedar. spillman creek contains wild [[rainbow trout]] with possible spawning habitat. potential [[sockeye

<page> <title>adanarsa</title><text>{{taxobox\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'adanarsa\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = heinrich, 1956<ref name=\"pyraloidea db\">{{cite web|url=http://globiz.pyraloidea.org/pages/reports/taxonreport.aspx |title=world pyraloidea database |publisher=globiz.pyraloidea.org |date= |accessdate=2011-10-07}}</ref>\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. intransitella\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'adanarsa intransitella\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (dyar, 1907)\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'rhodophaea intransitella\'\' <small>(dyar, 1905)</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'adanarsa \'\'\'\'\' is a genus of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the subfamily [[phycitinae]]. it was described by heinrich in 1956.<ref name=\"pyraloidea db\"/> it contains the species \'\'adanarsa intransitella\'\', which was originally described as \'\'rhodophaea intransitella\'\' by dyar, in 1905. it is found in [[north america]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu/species.php?hodges=5708 |title=mothphotographersgroup |publisher=mothphotographersgroup.msstate.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-10-07}}</ref> including [[arizona]], [[new mexico]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.archive.org/stream/bulletinunited2071956unit/bulletinunited2071956unit_djvu.txt |title=checklist of american phycitinae |publisher=archive.org |date= |accessdate=2011-10-07}}</ref> and [[california]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:phycitinae]]\n[[category:monotypic arthropod genera]]\n\n\n{{phycitinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adapisoriculidae</title><text>{{taxobox\n | name = \'\'adapisoriculidae\'\'\n | status = fossil\n | fossil_range = {{fossil range|paleocene|earliest=late cretaceous}}\n<small>possible [[late cretaceous]] record</small>\n | regnum = [[animal]]ia\n | phylum = [[chordata]]\n | classis = [[mammalia]]\n | infraclassis = [[eutheria]]\n | superordo = [[euarchontoglires]]\n | unranked_familia = [[euarchonta]]\n | familia = \'\'\'adapisoriculidae\'\'\'\n | familia_authority = [[leigh van valen|van valen]] (1967)\n | subdivision_ranks = [[genus|genera]]\n | subdivision =\n*\'\'[[adapisoriculus]]\'\'\n*\'\'[[afrodon]]\'\'<ref>{{cite web|url=http://paleodb.org/cgi-bin/bridge.pl?a=basictaxoninfo&taxon_no=118856 |title=paleobiology database: afrodon |publisher=paleodb.org |date= |accessdate=2011-11-02}}</ref>\n*\'\'[[bustylus]]\'\'<ref>{{cite journal |doi=10.1111/j.1365-3121.1991.tb00200.x |title=bustylus (eutheria, adapisoriculidae) and the absence of ascertained marsupials in the palaeocene of europe |year=1991 |last1=gheerbrant |first1=emmanuel |journal=terra nova |volume=3 |issue=6 |pages=586–92}}</ref>\n*?\'\'[[deccanolestes]]\'\'\n*\'\'[[garatherium]]\'\'<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.paleocene-mammals.de/pal2.htm |title=genera and species of paleocene mammals - part 2 |publisher=paleocene-mammals.de |date= |accessdate=2011-11-02}}</ref>\n*?\'\'[[remiculus]]\'\'<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.paleocene-mammals.de/pal-eu.htm |title=paleocene mammal faunas of europe |publisher=paleocene-mammals.de |date= |accessdate=2011-11-02}}</ref>\n*?\'\'[[sahnitherium]]\'\'\n*?\'\'[[wyonycteris]]\'\'\n}}\n\'\'\'adapisoriculidae\'\'\' is an extinct [[family (biology)|family]] of [[placental mammals]] present during the [[paleocene]] and possibly [[cretaceous]]. they were once thought to be members of the order [[erinaceomorpha]],<ref>{{cite book\n | title = [[mammoths, sabertooths, and hominids: 65 million years of mammalian evolution in europe]] <!--- | url = http://www.am
<page> <title>adaptation_to_extrauterine_life</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=june 2013}}\nat the end of [[pregnancy]], the [[fetus]] must take the journey of [[childbirth]] to leave the [[reproductive]] [[female]] mother.\nupon its entry to the air-breathing world, the [[newborn]] must begin to adjust to life outside the [[uterus]].\n\n==breathing and circulation==\nperfusing its body by [[breath]]ing independently instead of utilizing [[placenta]]l [[oxygen]] is the first challenge of a newborn. at birth, the baby\'s lungs are filled with amniotic fluid and are not inflated.<ref name=about/> the newborn is expelled from the birth canal, its central nervous system reacts to the sudden change in temperature and environment.<ref name=about/> this triggers it to take the first breath, within about 10 seconds after delivery.<ref name=about>[http://adam.about.com/encyclopedia/changes-in-the-newborn-at-birth.htm about.com > changes in the newborn at birth] review date: 27 november 2007. reviewed by: deirdre oreilly, md</ref> with the first breaths, there is a fall in [[pulmonary vascular resistance]], and an increase in the surface area available for [[gas exchange]]. over the next 30 seconds the pulmonary blood flow increases and is oxygenated as it flows through the alveoli of the lungs. oxygenated blood now reaches the left atrium and ventricle, and through the descending aorta reaches the umbilical arteries. oxygenated blood now stimulates constriction of the umbilical arteries resulting in a reduction in placental blood flow. as the pulmonary circulation increases there is an equivalent reduction in the placental blood flow which normally ceases completely after about three minutes. these two changes result in a rapid redirection of blood flow into the [[pulmonary blood flow|pulmonary vascular]] bed, from approximately 4% to 100% of [[cardiac output]]. the increase in pulmonary [[vein|venous]] return results in [[left atrium|left atrial]] pressure being slightly h
<page> <title>adaptive_coding</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=june 2009|bot=yes}}\n\'\'\'adaptive coding\'\'\' refers to variants of [[entropy encoding]] methods of [[lossless data compression]]. they are particularly suited to streaming data, as they adapt to localized changes in the characteristics of the data, and don\'t require a first pass over the data to calculate a probability model. the cost paid for these advantages is that the encoder and decoder must be more complex to keep their states synchronized, and more computational power is needed to keep adapting the encoder/decoder state.\n\nalmost all [[data compression]] methods involve the use of a \'\'model\'\', a prediction of the composition of the data.  when the data matches the prediction made by the model, the encoder can usually transmit the content of the data at a lower information cost, by making reference to the model.\nthis general statement is a bit misleading as general data compression algorithm would include the popular [[lzw]] and [[lz77]] algorithms,\nwhich are hardly comparable to compression techniques typically called \'\'adaptive\'\'.\n[[run length encoding]] and the typical [[jpeg]] compression with run length encoding and predefined huffman codes do not transmit a model.\na lot of other methods adapt their model to the current file and need to transmit it in addition to the encoded data, because both the encoder and the decoder need to use the model.\n\nin adaptive coding, the encoder and decoder are instead equipped with a predefined meta-model about how they will alter their models in response to the actual content of the data, and otherwise start with a blank slate, meaning that no initial model needs to be transmitted.  as the data is transmitted, both encoder and decoder adapt their models, so that unless the character of the data changes radically, the model becomes better-adapted to the data its handling and compresses it more efficiently approaching the efficiency of the sta

<page> <title>adare_peninsula</title><text>[[file:adare peninsula map.jpg|thumb|adare peninsula]]\n\'\'\'adare peninsula\'\'\' ({{coord|71|40|s|170|30|e|display=inline,title}}), sometimes called \'\'\'cape adare peninsula\'\'\', is a high ice-covered [[peninsula]], {{convert|40|mi|-1}} long, in the northeast part of [[victoria land]], extending south from [[cape adare]] to [[cape roget]]. the peninsula is considered the southernmost point of the [[borchgrevink coast]], named for [[carsten borchgrevink]] (1864-1934). named by the [[new zealand antarctic place-names committee]]for nearby cape adare.\n\n{{usgs-gazetteer|id=76}}\n\n[[category:peninsulas of antarctica]]\n[[category:landforms of victoria land]]\n[[category:borchgrevink coast]]\n[[category:pennell coast]]\n\n\n{{borchgrevinkcoast-geo-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adavi_jayatirthacharya</title><text>{{engvarb|date=october 2013}}\n{{use dmy dates|date=october 2013}}\n{{orphan|date=march 2013}}\n\n\'\'\'adavi jayatirthacharya\'\'\' / \'\'\'jaya-tirtha\'\'\' alias \'\'\'vishnu tirtha\'\'\' (1756–1806) was a [[hindu]] seer, scholar, writer, philosopher and exponent of [[madhvacharya]]\'s works and [[dvaita]] school of thought.<ref name=a>{{cite book|title=a history of the dvaita school of vedānta and its literature: from the ...  by b. n. krishnamurti sharma|page=part viii, chapter xli|url=http://books.google.co.in/books?id=fvtpfmpmulcc&pg=pa545&dq=vishnu+tirtha+adavi&hl=en&sa=x&ei=fygjublynspsrafkhydoaw&ved=0cc0q6aewaa#v=onepage&q=vishnu%20tirtha%20adavi&f=false}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|title=history of indian philosophy (vol.4) by s. n. dasgupta|year=128|url=http://books.google.co.in/books?id=dh0vmd8ghdmc&pg=pa128&dq=vishnu+tirtha&hl=en&sa=x&ei=9y4iueewd8wgrafg74ciaw&ved=0cdyq6aewag#v=onepage&q=vishnu%20tirtha&f=false}}</ref>\n\n==personal life==\nhe is said to be born in siddhapur near [[savanur]] and taken [[sanyasa]] from his [[guru]], satyavarta tirtha.\n\nhe is taken to have pilgrimage to [[vrindavana]] and have entered vrindavana at [[madanur]], six miles from [[koppal]], where his [[samadhi]] is also situated.\n[[file:vishnu teertharu, madnuru.jpg|thumb|right|[[samadhi]] of jayatirthacharya alias vishnu tirtha at madanur near [[koppal]].]]\n\n==notel scholarly works==\nhe has written more than nineteen books and among his noted scholarly works are :-\n*\'\'bhagvada-sarodhara\'\' – an anthology of 367 select verses from [[bhagavata purana|bhagvada]]\n*\'\'ajnapatra\'\'\n*\'\'atmasukhabodhini\'\'\n*\'\'sodasi\'\' – a theological book\n*\'\'caturdasi\'\' – a theological book\n*\'\'adhyatmamtra-tarangini\'\' – a book on [[strota]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = jayatirthacharya, adavi\n| alternative names =\n| short description = hindu seer and scholar\n| date of
<page> <title>addas</title><text>{{islam}}\n\'\'\'addas\'\'\' was a young [[christian]] slave boy who lived in [[taif]], a mountainous area south of [[mecca]], during the times of [[muhammad]]. he was the first person from the western province of taif to convert to the new religion of [[islam]]. he was originally from [[nineveh]].<ref>[http://www.sahaba.net/modules.php?name=news&file=print&sid=203 an unpleasant welcome in taa\'if]</ref><ref>[http://islambyquestions.net/prophets/divinepurpose.htm what is the divine purpose for sending prophets?]</ref>\n\n==see also==\n*[[list of non-arab sahaba]]\n*[[sunni view of the sahaba]]\n\n== references ==\n*\"traditions of the prophet\" by ibn hisham.\n*[http://books.google.com.au/books?id=fqzvvl8zi0sc&pg=pt1&dq=addas+sahaba&as_brr=3#v=onepage&q=addas%20sahaba&f=false addas mosque]\n\n==notes==\n<references/>\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = addas\n| alternative names =\n| short description = male sahaba\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:addas}}\n[[category:male sahabah]]\n\n\n{{islam-bio-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>added_worker_effect</title><text>{{orphan|date=march 2011}}\n\nthe \'\'\'added worker effect\'\'\' refers to an increase in the [[labor supply]] of married women when their husbands become unemployed. underlying the theory is the assumption that married women are secondary workers with a less permanent attachment to the labor market than their partners. as statistics show, married women do not always behave as secondary workers; therefore, the effect is not a universal phenomenon.\n[[file:awe model.png|thumb|simple model of the added worker effect after shelly lundberg\'s (1985)]]\n\n== origin of idea ==\n\nthe concept of “additional workers” first appears in empiric studies on unemployment in the united states during the great depression conducted in 1940 by economists [[wladimir s. woytinsky]] and don d. humphrey (humphrey, 1940, p.&nbsp;412). humphrey\'s study did not find any observable added worker effect, but it did not deny that added workers participated in the market (humphrey, p.&nbsp;415). he challenged the validity of woytinsky\'s study in the absence of a [[time series analysis]].\n\n== relation to income and substitution effects ==\n\nthe added worker effect results when the income effect dominates the substitution effect in an individual\'s decision whether or not to participate in the labor market. specifically, in the added worker effect married women increase their labor supplied as a response to a loss of [[real income]] despite the price of leisure dropping in relation to the wage rate. the income and substitution effects are important concepts in the [[consumer choice theory]] of microeconomics. \n\nthe model used to study the added worker effect views the family as a decision making unit and leisure time as a [[normal good]]. with this understanding, a married woman may chose to enter the labor market to offset the loss of income her family faces when her husband loses his job. since family wages are pooled and the price of co
<page> <title>adderstone_with_lucker</title><text>{{infobox uk place\n|country = england \n|official_name = adderstone with lucker\n|latitude = 55.567\n|longitude = -1.782\n|population=195\n|population_ref=(2001 census)<ref name=nhs/>\n|shire_district = \n|region = north east england\n|shire_county = [[northumberland]]\n|constituency_westminster =\n|post_town =\n|postcode_area =\n|postcode_district =\n|dial_code = \n|os_grid_reference = nu138303\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adderstone with lucker\'\'\' is a [[civil parish]] in [[northumberland]], [[england]].  the parish includes the villages of [[adderstone]], [[lucker]], [[warenford]], [[rosebrough]], [[newstead, northumberland|newstead]], [[bellshill, northumberland|bellshill]] and [[bradford, northumberland|bradford]], and has a population of 195.<ref name=nhs>[http://www.neighbourhood.statistics.gov.uk/dissemination/viewfulldataset.do?instanceselection=03070&productid=779&$ph=60_61&datasetinstanceid=3070&startcolumn=1&numberofcolumns=8&containerareaid=790477 census 2001]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==  external links ==\n{{commons category inline|adderstone with lucker}}\n*[http://www.durham.gov.uk/durhamcc/k2p.nsf/k2pdetail?readform&prn=n12977 local history]\n\n[[category:civil parishes in northumberland]]\n\n{{northumberland-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>addie_land</title><text>{{multiple issues|\n{{notability|biographies|date = august 2009}}\n{{blp sources|date = august 2009}}\n}}\n\n{{infobox person\n| image =\n| imagesize =\n| caption = addie land at sundance 2004.\n| birth_date      =  {{birth date and age|1988|4|28}}\n| birth_place     =  [[seattle, washington]], [[united states|u.s.]]\n| death_date      =\n| death_place     =\n| occupation = actress\n| yearsactive = 2004 – present\n| birthname =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'addie land\'\'\' (born april 28, 1988) is an american actress.\n\n==personal life==\naddie land was born in [[seattle, washington]], where she attended nova high school.\nduring an interview for evergreen, land stated \"i have been taking drama classes since i was in, like [[2nd grade]]. but they have all been for the stage, none for the film. and i never considered film.\" she later stated \"i never thought it was an option, because so many great actors don\'t ever get a chance. and also, i just... love the stage and didn\'t think i wanted to do film.\".<ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oklvsvtcq6k</ref>\n\n== career ==\nin 2004, land made her movie debut in the [[drama film]] [[evergreen (2004 film)|evergreen]]. she would later appear in [[the sasquatch gang]] (aka the sasquatch dumpling gang) and most recently fortune hunters.\n\naddie had spent many years training at the nationally prominent [[seattle children\'s theatre]] when she was recommended to the director, enid zentelis, as a possible fit for the lead role in an indie movie to be filmed in the pacific northwest. addie then won the part in the open audition. the movie, evergreen, was in the dramatic competition at the 2004 [[sundance film festival]], and later was released to theater via an unusual direct to amc theater release, and was the first film widely distributed to theaters via satellite.\naddie won much praise for her portrayal of the lead character.<ref>http://www.parentmap.com/content/view/182</ref><ref>http://evergr
<page> <title>addington_village_tram_stop</title><text>{{london tram stations\n | name = addington village\n | image = addington village tramstop western entrance.jpg\n | caption = the tram stop and bus station (in background)\n | manager = [[tramlink]]\n | locale = [[addington, london|addington village]]\n | borough = [[london borough of croydon]]\n | start = 2000\n | platforms = 2\n | zone = [[travelcard|3,4,5,6]]\n | ctbat0910 = 0.532\n | ctbat1011 = 0.549\n}}\n{{coord|51.356252|-0.032966|display=title|type:railwaystation}}\n\n\'\'\'addington village tram stop\'\'\', also known as \'\'\'addington interchange\'\'\', is a [[light rail]] stop and associated bus station serving [[addington, london|addington village]] in the [[london borough of croydon]] in the southern suburbs of [[london]].\n\nthe tram stop is served by [[tramlink]] [[tramlink route 3|route 3]], which connects [[wimbledon, london|wimbledon]] with nearby [[new addington]] via central [[croydon]].\n\nthe bus station provides interchange with the following bus services (as of march 2011):<ref name=spidbha>{{cite web | title = buses and trams from addington village | publisher = transport for london | url = http://www.tfl.gov.uk/tfl/gettingaround/maps/buses/pdf/addingtonvillage-2004.pdf | accessdate = 2011-03-13}}</ref>\n\n* [[london buses route 64|64]] – new addington – [[croydon]] – [[thornton heath]] pond;\n* [[london buses route 130|130]] – new addington – addington village - [[norwood junction]];\n* [[london buses route 314|314]] – new addington – [[bromley]] – [[eltham, london|eltham]];\n* [[london buses route 353|353]] – addington village – locksbottom - [[orpington]] (ramsden estate);\n* [[london buses route 359|359]] – addington village – monks hill - [[selsdon]];\n* [[london buses route 466|466]] – addington village – [[croydon]] – [[purley, london|purley]] – [[caterham on the hill]];\n* [[london buses route t31|t31]] – [[new addington]] – addington village 
<page> <title>addyme_inductalis</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pyralidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[addyme]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. inductalis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'addyme inductalis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (walker, 1863)<ref name=\"pyraloidea db\">{{cite web|url=http://globiz.pyraloidea.org/pages/reports/taxonreport.aspx |title=world pyraloidea database |publisher=globiz.pyraloidea.org |date= |accessdate=2011-09-29}}</ref>\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'acrobasis inductalis\'\' <small>walker, 1863</small>\n*\'\'addyme occultans\'\' <small>walker, 1863</small>\n*\'\'hypochalcia inferalis\'\' <small>walker, 1863</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'addyme inductalis\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[pyralidae|snout moths]] in the genus \'\'[[addyme]]\'\'. it was described by walker in 1863.<ref name=\"pyraloidea db\"/>  it is found in [[taiwan]], [[japan]], [[india]], [[sri lanka]], [[borneo]], [[sumatra]], [[sulawesi]] and [[australia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bioone.org/doi/pdf/10.3157/0002-8320%282007%29133%5b143:aroagc%5d2.0.co%3b2 |title=a review on addyme-calguia-coleothrix genera complex (lepidoptera: pyralidae: phycitinae), with one new species from china |publisher=bioone.org |date=1970-01-01 |accessdate=2011-09-29}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1863]]\n[[category:phycitini]]\n\n{{phycitini-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adeebul_hasan_rizvi</title><text>doctor \'\'\'adeebul hasan rizvi\'\'\' (also spelled: adibul hasan rizvi) is head of [[sindh institute of urology and transplantation]] (siut).<ref name=\"siut3\">{{cite web|url=http://www.dawn.com/2009/01/13/local3.htm|title=karachi: experts back ban on organ ‘donation’ to foreigners\n|accessdate=2010-04-30|publisher=www.dawn.com}} {{dead link|date=november 2010|bot=h3llbot}}</ref> siut started as an eight bed ward at [[civil hospital]], [[karachi]], and has grown to be [[pakistan]]\'s leading & largest urology and transplantation institute.<ref name=\"siut1\">{{cite web|url=http://www.siut.org/histroy.htm|title=prof dr. adeebul hasan rizvi\n|accessdate=2010-05-03|publisher=www.siut.org}} {{dead link|date=october 2010|bot=h3llbot}}</ref>\n\nrizvi is the president of the [[transplant society of pakistan]].<ref>[http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?id=27849 \"zardari donates all body organs\"], \'\'[[the news international]]\'\', march 18, 2010.</ref> in 2003, rizvi led a team of siut surgeons that performed the first successful liver transplant on an infant in pakistan.<ref>[http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2003/11/30/1000166.htm \"pakistan performs first successful liver transplant on an infant\"], [[abc.net.au]], november 30, 2003</ref>\n\nin 2001, police arrested \"a gang that \'was planning to murder\'\" rizvi.<ref>{{cite doi|10.1016/s0140-6736(02)08332-0}}</ref>\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.siut.org/ official website of siut]\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = rizvi, adeebul hasan\n| alternative names =\n| short description = pakistani doctor\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:rizvi, adeebul hasan}}\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:pakistani medical doctors]]</text> </page>

<page> <title>adekunle_ajasin_university</title><text>the \'\'\'ondo state university\'\'\', now \'\'\'adekunle ajasin university\'\'\' was established as a state-owned [[list of nigerian universities|university]] in december 1999 by the governor of [[ondo state]] in western [[nigeria]], chief [[adebayo adefarati]].\nit is named after [[michael adekunle ajasin]], the ondo state governor and educator who signed the law establishing the ondo state university in 1982.<ref>{{cite web\n |url=http://www.news.dailytrust.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=3312:akingbola-is-pro-chancellor-adekunle-ajasin-university&catid=26:business&itemid=153\n |title=akingbola is pro-chancellor, adekunle ajasin university\n |date=27 july 2009\n |publisher=daily trust\n |accessdate=2009-12-29}}</ref>\n\nit is located in [[akungba akoko]], a small town near [[ikare-akoko]]. it was established primarily to improve the educational status of the people of the state, nigeria and any applicant interested in gaining applicable university knowledge from any part of the world.it offers courses in [[business]], law, science, education and [[art]]s and it is funded to provide university education that rank up to the highest world standard. adekunle ajasin university is also good in sports as it is among the five that represented nigeria in the 2005 west africa football games taking a good place after the competition. more than 40% of the academic staff are professors who have done sabbatical and seminars in major universities of the world. the junior ones have done and are doing phd and postdoctorals in renowned universities throughout the world. the university has commenced to produce quality graduates,of which some are undergoing postgraduate education in europe and north america. the university was rated as the best state university in academic teaching in nigeria by the nigerian national university commission (nuc) in years 2004 and 2005.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.ajasin.ed
<page> <title>adel_emara</title><text>general \'\'\'adel emara\'\'\' is an egyptian general. he is deputy defence minister of egypt, and a member of the [[supreme council of the armed forces]] (scaf) which has ruled egypt since the resignation of [[hosni mubarak]] in february 2011.<ref name=ahramonline>sherif tarek, [http://english.ahram.org.eg/news/29715.aspx scaf: intelligence points to plan to burn parliament building], \'\'[[ahram online]]\'\', 19 december 2011</ref>\n\non 19 december 2011 adel emara held a press conference in which he justified army violence against protestors in egypt, and blamed \"evil forces [which] wanted to drag egypt into a chaos, putting army into confrontation with the people.\"<ref>[http://uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/topnews/iduktre7bg00820111219 egypt clashes move into 4th day, u.s. worried], \'\'[[reuters]]\'\', 19 december 2011</ref> responding to a journalist demanding the army apologize to egyptian women for brutality towards female protestors, he interrupted the conference to read an intelligence brief claiming that \"unknown assailants were planning to set the parliament on fire\" that day.<ref name=ahramonline/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = emara, adel\n| alternative names =\n| short description = egyptian general\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:emara, adel}}\n[[category:year of birth missing (living people)]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:members of the supreme council of armed forces]]\n[[category:egyptian generals]]\n\n\n{{egypt-bio-stub}}</text> </page>
