<page> <title>adelaide_festival_of_ideas</title><text>{{coord|-34.91898|138.599986|display=title}}\nthe \'\'\'adelaide festival of ideas\'\'\' has been held every two years since 1999, over a period of three or four days. from 1999-2010 it was held in july, and since 2011 it is held in october. it is held at venues throughout [[adelaide]] in the alternative years to those of the long-established [[adelaide festival of arts]].\n\n==description==\nthe festival features a range of talks and panel discussions with national and international speakers, loosely organised around the common theme of ideas, and contemporary debates are given greater space for exploration. it is a space where an intelligent [[general public|public]] can engage with some of the best thinkers across a wide range of intellectual endeavour. the festival has gained popularity, harnessing ideas, experience and intellect and attracting attendance from all states of australia, and from overseas.\n\nthe 2005 festival took the theme \"what is to be done\". speakers included [[peter c. doherty]], [[germaine greer]] and [[stephen schneider]].\n\npresentations from the festival have been periodically broadcast on [[radio adelaide]] on sunday mornings, and were available on the festival\'s website.\n\n==external links== \n*[http://www.adelaidefestivalofideas.com.au/ adelaide festival of ideas]\n\n{{adelaide festivals}}\n\n{{defaultsort:adelaide festival of ideas}}\n[[category:festivals in adelaide|ideas]]\n[[category:recurring events established in 1999]]\n\n{{adelaide-stub}}\n{{festival-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adelaide_remand_centre</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=march 2011}}\n{{infobox prison\n| prison_name     = adelaide remand centre\n| location        = currie street [[adelaide, south australia]]\n| coordinates     = {{coord|34|55|28|s|138|35|25|e|display=inline,title}}\n| status          = operational\n| classification  = maximum\n| capacity        = 267 (male only)\n| opened          = 1986\n| closed          =\n| managed_by=south australian, department for correctional services\n|}}\n\nthe \'\'\'adelaide remand centre\'\'\' is a maximum-security [[prison]] facility located in [[adelaide, south australia|adelaide]], [[south australia]], used to hold prisoners on [[detention of suspects|remand]] pending [[trial (law)|trial]].\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.corrections.sa.gov.au/prisons/adelaide_remand_centre.htm adelaide remand centre]\n\n{{southaustralianprisons}}\n\n[[category:prisons in south australia]]\n[[category:prisons in adelaide]]\n\n\n{{adelaide-stub}}\n{{australia-prison-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adelaide_symphony_orchestra</title><text>{{infobox orchestra\n| name                = adelaide symphony orchestra (aso)\n| image                 = file:aso logo.jpg\n| caption = adelaide symphony orchestra logo\n| founded        = 1936\n| former_name = south australian symphony orchestra\n| principal_conductor = [[arvo volmer]]\n| website                 = {{url|www.aso.com.au}}\n| current_members     = \'\'\'chief conductor and music director\'\'\'\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'adelaide symphony orchestra\'\'\' (also known as \'\'the aso\'\') was founded as a 17 player radio ensemble in 1936, in [[adelaide]], [[south australia]]. the [[orchestra]] reformed in 1949 as the 55 member south australian symphony orchestra. it reverted to its original and present title, the adelaide symphony orchestra, in late 1974,<ref name=namechange>[http://www.asoheritage.com/abc%201974%20media%20release%2016.htm abc media release]</ref> and currently comprises 74 permanent members.  its music director since 2004 has been [[arvo volmer]].\n\neach year the orchestra undertakes over 100 performances across a diverse musical spectrum. the aso provides the orchestral support for all productions of the [[state opera of south australia]], for adelaide performances of the [[the australian ballet|australian ballet]] and [[opera australia]], and is the most prolific contributor to the [[adelaide festival of arts|adelaide festival]]. the popular annual tradition of symphony under the stars, the outdoor alfresco series, the innovative education program, aso on tour, the east end rush hour chamber series, and the entertaining showtime series are just some concerts bringing live orchestral music to south australians each year.\n\nthe aso won acclaim in 1998 with australia\'s first production since 1913<ref>the ring was first performed in australia at her majesty\'s theatre in melbourne in august 1913 (\'\'das rheingold\'\', 19 august; \'\'die walkure\'\', 22 august; \'\'siegfried\'\', 25 august; 
<page> <title>adelantado</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'adelantado\'\'\'\'\' ({{ipa-es|aðelanˈtaðo}}) was a title held by spanish nobles in service of their respective kings during the middle ages. it was later used as a military title held by some [[spain|spanish]] \'\'[[conquistador]]es\'\' of the 15th, 16th and 17th centuries.\n\n\'\'adelantados\'\' were [[charter|granted]] directly by the monarch the right to become [[governor]]s and [[judge|justices]] of a specific region, which they were charged with conquering, in exchange for funding and organizing the initial explorations, settlements and pacification of the target area on behalf of the [[crown of castile]]. these areas were usually outside of the jurisdiction of an existing \'\'[[audiencia real|audiencia]]\'\' or [[viceroy]], and \'\'adelantados\'\' were authorized to communicate directly with the [[council of the indies]].<ref>fisher, lillian estelle. \'\'viceregal administration in the spanish american colonies\'\'. berkeley, university of california press, 1926, 81.</ref>\n\n==the \'\'reconquista\'\'==\nthe term has its origins in the \'\'[[reconquista]]\'\'. the term comes from the phrase \'\'por adelantado\'\' ([[spanish language|spanish]]: \"in advance\", although translations stating \"one who goes before\" and \"the forward man\" are also found), which in turn is a [[calque]] of the [[arabic language|arabic]] term \'\'al-muqaddám\'\'. as early as the 11th century a few castilian and [[kingdom of navarre|navarrese]] documents use the word, but do not specify the powers or duties of the office.\n\nthe earliest definitely known \'\'adelentado\'\' was appointed by [[alfonso x of castile|alfonso x]] in 1253 in the recently conquered territory of \"\'\'la frontera\'\'\" ([[andalusia]]). however the office had precedents in the duties and rights held by some officers of the navarrese dynasty of castile and león, and [[Álvar fáñez]] or [[fortún sánchez]] in the ebro valley performed similar services in d
<page> <title>adelbert_van_de_walle</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=october 2013}}\n{{infobox person\n| name        = adelbert van de walle\n| image       = avdwalle.jpg\n| image_size  = 250px\n| alt         =\n| caption     =\n| birth_name  =\n| birth_date  = {{birth date|df=yes|1922|08|11}}\n| birth_place = [[oudenaarde]], belgium\n| death_date  = {{death date and age|df=yes|2006|06|28|1922|8|11}}\n| death_place = [[ghent]], belgium\n| nationality = {{bel}}\n| other_names =\n| known_for   =\n| occupation  = architect, art historian, professor at the university of ghent\n}}\n\n[[file:kromstaf ename.jpg|right|200px|thumb|roman crook of ename]]\n\n\'\'\'adelbert van de walle\'\'\' was a [[flemish]]-[[belgian]] architect, [[art historian]] and professor in the [[history of art]] and [[archaeology]] at the [[university of ghent]] (ugent).\n\n==life==\nvan de walle obtained successively [[academic degree]]s in architecture, [[master\'s degree|master]]’s and doctorate in the history of art and archaeology, specialising in the [[middle ages]], at ugent. during his studies, his tutors in history were prof. dr. françois-louis ganshof, prof. dr. hans van werveke and prof. dr. jan dhondt. in the history of art, he was taught by prof. arch. dr. broeder firmin desmidt and prof. dr. jozef duverger, prof. dr. herman bouchery and prof. dr. r. roggen.\n\nin addition, he trained in the physics and chemistry of artworks with prof. dr. eng. coremans, at ugent. he was also a scientific worker in this speciality for the official founding of the [[royal institute for cultural heritage]] in [[brussels]].\n\neven as a young architect he displayed a particular interest in the study, preservation and restoration of mediaeval and post-mediaeval [[cultural heritage|heritage]]. later on, he would also be active in contemporary architecture, interior design, furniture, [[industrial arts|industrial art]] and [[industrial design]]. in his scientific research at ugent, he specialised in mediae
<page> <title>adele_astaire</title><text>{{infobox person\n| name        = adele astaire\n| image       = adele astaire in 1919.jpg\n| caption     = adele astaire, 1919\n| birth_date  = {{birth date|1896|09|10}}\n| birth_place = [[omaha, nebraska]], u.s.\n| death_date  = {{death date and age|1981|01|25|1896|09|10}}\n| death_place = [[scottsdale, arizona]], u.s.\n| occupation  = [[dancer]], [[entertainer]]\n| spouse      = [[lord charles arthur francis cavendish|lord charles cavendish]] <br><small>(m.1932–1944; his death)</small> <br>[[kingman douglass]] <br><small>(m.1947–1971; his death)</small>\n| children    = 3\n}}\n\'\'\'adele astaire\'\'\' (born \'\'\'adele marie austerlitz\'\'\'; september 10, 1896&nbsp;– january 25, 1981)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nndb.com/people/090/000107766/|title=nndb: adele astaire|accessdate=2008-07-11|publisher=[[notable names database]]}}</ref><ref>her birthdate was often given as 1897 or 1898, but the 1900 u.s. census showed her birth year as 1896.</ref> was an american dancer and entertainer. she was [[fred astaire|fred astaire\'s]] elder sister, and his partner in a 27-year career in vaudeville and theater, beginning when he was five and she was eight.<ref name=\"nyt\">{{cite news |last=bentley |first=toni |title=two-step: ‘the astaires,’ by kathleen riley |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/03/books/review/the-astaires-by-kathleen-riley.html?_r=1&nl=books&emc=booksupdateema4_20120601&pagewanted=all |newspaper=[[the new york times book review]] |date=june 3, 2012 |page=br32}}</ref>\n\n==early life and stage career==\nadele was born adele marie austerlitz in [[omaha, nebraska]], the daughter of johanna \"ann\" ([[married and maiden names|née]] geilus), an [[united states|american]]-born [[lutheran]] of [[germany|german]] descent, and frederic \"fritz\" emanuel austerlitz (september, 1868–1924), an [[austria]]n [[roman catholic]] brewer of [[jewish]] descent from [[vienna]]. adele became an [[episcopal church in the
<page> <title>adele_fifield</title><text>\'\'\'adele fifield\'\'\' (born 1966) is a recipient of the [[order of ontario]], and was a director of the [[the war amps|war amps]]\' [[national amputee centre]]. in feb. 2008 she became ceo of the [canadian association of radiologists].<ref>{{cite news|title=cdn association of radiologists announces new ceo|url=http://www.canhealth.com/news808.html|accessdate=22 november 2010}}</ref>\n\nborn in [[trinity east, newfoundland and labrador|trinity east]], [[newfoundland and labrador|newfoundland]], [[canada]], fifield enrolled in the war amps child amputee (champ) program after losing a leg to [[cancer]] at the age of 13. she soon became a junior counsellor, offering assistance and advice to younger champs, and in 1989 began full-time employment with the war amps after graduating from [[memorial university]] in [[st. john\'s, newfoundland and labrador|st. john\'s]], newfoundland with a [[bachelor of arts]] and [[bachelor of education]].\n\nfifield became a member of the [[order of ontario]] on september 20, 2005 for her dedicated advocacy for canadian [[amputee]]s and [[veteran]]s in [[ontario]]. fifield currently makes her residence in [[nepean, ontario]].\n\nfifield directed the war amps national amputee centre, which educates canadian amputees, their families and the public on all aspects of amputation. she is also president of the war amps operation legacy.\n\n==honours==\n\n* 2003 - queen\'s golden jubilee medal\n* 2005 - order of ontario\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==see also==\n\n* [[list of people of newfoundland and labrador]]\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              =fifield, adele\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     = 1966\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:fifield, adele}}\n[[category:members of the order of ontario]]\n[[category:people from ottawa]]\n[[category:canadian amputees]]\n[
<page> <title>adelegg</title><text>{{about|the mountain range in bavaria|the hamlet near kempten|wiggensbach}}\n{{infobox mountain range|range\n|name=adelegg\n|map=germany baden-württemberg\n|map_relief=1\n|map_caption=\n|photo=adelegg 2008.jpg\n|photo_caption=view from ne slope of the [[laubenberg]] across the [[eistobel]] valley and municipality of [[maierhöfen]] looking ne towards the adelegg\n|country=germany\n|state=baden-württemberg\n|state1=bavaria\n|parent=[[allgäu alps]]\n|location=\n|geology=\n|period=\n|area_km2=112\n|orogeny=\n|highest=[[ursersberg]]\n|elevation_m=1129\n|height_datum=de-nn\n|length_km=\n|range_lat_d=47.6925\n|range_long_d=10.12556\n|format=dms\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'adelegg\'\'\' is a forested, mountain range, up to {{höhe|1129|de-nn|link=true}}{{geoquelle|de|bfn-karten}} and 112&nbsp;km²<ref name=\"bfn-steckbriefe\">[http://www.bfn.de/0311_landschaft.html?landschaftid=3400 landschaftssteckbrief] des [[bundesamt für naturschutz|bfn]] – adelegg</ref> in area,<nowiki/> which is part of the northern foothills of the [[alps]], within the [[westallgäu]] in the south german districts of [[landkreis ravensburg|ravensburg]] and [[landkreis oberallgäu|oberallgäu]].\n\n== geography ==\n=== location ===\nthe adelegg forms the northernmost foothills of the [[allgäu alps]] in the southeastern part of the [[bavarian alps]] and extend a long way out into the [[alpine foreland]]. they lie between the [[untere argen]] near [[isny im allgäu|isny]] to the southwest and west, and [[leutkirch im allgäu|leutkirch]] to the northwest (both in the baden-württemberg district of ravensburg), and between [[altusried]] to the northeast, [[wiggensbach]] to the east, [[buchenberg]] to the southeast and the wengener argen near [[weitnau]] to the south (all in the bavarian district of oberallgäu).\n\nthe name adelegg is generally only used for that part of the range located in württemberg, but the landscape unit of the same name <ref name=\"bfn-geoinfo\">[ht
<page> <title>adelicia_acklen</title><text>[[image:equestrian.jpg|thumb|right|portrait by william browning cooper]]\n\'\'\'adelicia acklen\'\'\' (1817 &ndash; 1887) was the widow of a [[plantation]] <page> <title>adelidae</title><text>__notoc__{{taxobox\n| name = fairy longhorn moths\n| image=unidentified animal 007 (aka).jpg\n| image_width = 240px\n| image_caption= adult of an unidentified fairy longhorn moth<br/>from [[chemnitz]] (germany)<br/> (possibly \'\'[[nemophora metallica]]\'\')\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| subordo = [[glossata]]\n| infraordo = [[heteroneura]]\n| superfamilia = [[incurvarioidea]]\n| familia = \'\'\'adelidae\'\'\'\n| familia_authority = bruand, 1851\n| diversity = 2 [[subfamilies]], 5 genera and 294 species<ref>[http://www.mapress.com/zootaxa/2011/f/zt03148p221.pdf animal biodiversity: an outline of higher-level classification and survey of taxonomic richness - lepidoptera]</ref>\n| diversity_link = #subfamilies\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'adelidae\'\'\' or \'\'\'fairy longhorn moths\'\'\' are a [[family (biology)|family]] of [[monotrysia]]n [[moth]]s in the [[lepidoptera]]n [[infraorder]] [[heteroneura]]. most [[species]] have at least partially metallic patterns coloration and are [[diurnality|diurnal]], sometimes swarming around the tips of branches with an undulating flight. others are [[crepuscular]] and have a drab coloration. fairy longhorn moths have a wingspan of 4-28 millimeters, and males often have especially long [[antenna (biology)|antenna]]e, 1-3 times as long as the [[forewing]].\n\nthey are widespread across the world and can be found over much of [[north america]] and [[eurasia]] from april to june. about 50 species occur in [[europe]], of which most widely noted is the [[green longhorn]] (\'\'adela reaumurella\'\') which can sometimes reach great abundance;  due to [[climate change]]<ref>kuchlein & ellis (2004)</ref> its peak flying season is shifting towards spring. in general, they are more plentiful in the [[northern hemisphere]], but the family occurs in the [[neotropics]], [[sub-saharan africa]], [[south-east asia]] and [[australia]] too.<ref>edwa
<page> <title>adeline_dutton_train_whitney</title><text>{{refimprove|date=december 2011}}\n\'\'\'adeline dutton train whitney\'\'\' (15 september 1824–20 march 1906)<ref name=cne>{{cite collier\'s|whitney, adeline dutton (train)}}</ref> was an [[united states|american]] [[poet]] and prolific writer, publishing more than 20 books for girls. her books expressed a traditional view of women\'s roles and were popular throughout her life.\n\n==biography==\nwhitney was born adeline dutton train in [[boston]], [[massachusetts]], the daughter of enoch train and adeline train (née dutton). her father founded a line of [[packet ship]]s that sailed between boston and [[liverpool]], a major port of trade and emigration.   \n\nadeline was educated at private schools; she studied at the school of [[george b. emerson]] in boston from 1837 to 1842. her cousin [[george francis train]] was a successful entrepreneur, a founder of the union pacific railroad, and an adventurer, making three round-the-world trips.  \n\n===marriage and family===\non 7 november 1843, adeline at the age of 19 married seth dunbar whitney, a wealthy merchant who was twenty years older than she. they lived in [[milton, massachusetts|milton]], where they raised their family. \n\nadeline whitney started writing seriously in her thirties, after her children started school. she first published poems and stories in local journals. in 1859, she published her first book, \'\'mother goose for grown folks\'\'.  she wrote mainly for young girls and supported conservative values. she promoted the message of the era that a woman\'s happiest place is in the home, the source of all goodness. as this was popular among parents, her books sold extremely well throughout her life.\n\nwhitney privately opposed [[women\'s suffrage]], and took no part in public life (in accordance with the traditional approach for women expressed in her books.) she [[patent]]ed a set of alphabet blocks for children.  \n\nshe died in milton at the
<page> <title>adeline_software_international</title><text>{{refimprove|date=september 2009}}\n{{infobox company\n| name             = adeline software international\n| logo             = [[image:adeline software international.png]]\n| type             = [[privately held company|private]] (subsidiary of [[delphine software international]])\n| fate             = bankruptcy\n| predecessor      = \n| successor        = [[no cliché]]\n| foundation       = {{start date|1993|02}}\n| founder          = \n| defunct          = {{end date|2004|07}}\n| location_city    = [[lyon]]\n| location_country = [[france]]\n| key_people       = [[frédérick raynal]]\n| industry         = [[video game industry]]\n| products         = [[video game]]s\n| revenue          = \n| operating_income = \n| net_income       = \n| assets           = \n| equity           = \n| owner            = \n| num_employees    = 21\n| homepage         = [http://www.adelinesoftware.com www.adelinesoftware.com] (defunct)\n| footnotes        = \n| intl             = yes\n}}\n\'\'\'adeline software international\'\'\' was a [[video game developer]] founded in february 1993 as a subsidiary company of [[delphine software international]], and based in [[lyon]], [[france]]. the team mostly came from [[infogrames]], another french video game company, after a disagreement about sequels of the \'\'[[alone in the dark (video game)|alone in the dark]]\'\' bestseller.\n\n== history ==\nthe company employed 21 people including graphic artists, developers and musicians. five members made up the core of the team: [[frédérick raynal]] (creative director), yaël barroz (computer artist in charge of scenery), didier chanfray (artistic director), serge plagnol (technical director), and laurent salmeron (resource manager).\n\nafter the release of \'\'[[little big adventure 2]]\'\' in 1997, the company slowly went quiet, and in july, the core team was sold to [[sega]], becoming [[no cliché]]<ref>{{cite web | title = company | url
<page> <title>adelosebastes_latens</title><text>{{taxobox \n| name = \n| status = \n| status_system = iucn3.1\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[actinopterygii]]\n| ordo = [[scorpaeniformes]]\n| familia = [[sebastidae]]\n| genus = \'\'adelosebastes\'\'\n| genus_authority = [[william n. eschmeyer|eschmeyer]], [[tokiharu abe|t. abe]] & [[soji nakano|nakano]], 1979\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. latens\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'adelosebastes latens\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[william n. eschmeyer|eschmeyer]], [[tokiharu abe|t. abe]] & [[soji nakano|nakano]], 1979\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'adelosebastes latens\'\'\'\'\' is a [[species]] of [[sebastidae|rockfish]] native to the northern [[pacific ocean]] where it is found on the [[emperor seamounts]] at depths of from {{convert|900|to|1200|m|ft}}.  this species grows to a length of {{convert|30|cm|in}} [[fish measurement|sl]].  this species is the only known member of its [[genus]].<ref>{{fishbase species |genus= adelosebastes|species= latens| month = december | year = 2012}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:sebastidae]]\n[[category:monotypic fish genera]]\n\n{{scorpaeniformes-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adenaria</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n|regnum = [[plant]]ae\n|unranked_divisio = [[angiosperms]]\n|unranked_classis = [[eudicots]]\n|unranked_subclassis = [[rosids]]\n|ordo = [[myrtales]]\n|familia = [[lythraceae]]\n|subfamilia = [[lythroideae]]\n|genus = \'\'\'\'\'adenaria\'\'\'\'\'\n|genus_authority = [[carl sigismund kunth|kunth]]\n|species = \'\'\'\'\'a. floribunda\'\'\'\'\'\n|binomial = \'\'adenaria floribunda\'\'\n|binomial_authority = kunth\n|synonyms = \'\'adenaria griseleoides\'\'<br>\'\'adenaria lanceolata\'\'<br>\'\'adenaria parviflora\'\'<br>\'\'adenaria parvifolia\'\'<br>\'\'adenaria purpurata\'\'\n|}}\n\'\'\'\'\'adenaria\'\'\'\'\' is a [[monotypic taxon|monotypic genus]] of plants in the family [[lythraceae]] containing the single species \'\'\'\'\'adenaria floribunda\'\'\'\'\'.<ref>[http://www.theplantlist.org/browse/a/lythraceae/adenaria/ \'\'adenaria\'\'.] the plant list.</ref> its common names include \'\'\'\'\'fruta de pavo\'\'\'\'\'.<ref>[http://biogeodb.stri.si.edu/herbarium/species/19773/ \'\'adenaria floribunda\'\'.] smithsonian tropical research institute herbarium.</ref> it is native to [[mexico]], the [[dominican republic]], [[haiti]], and parts of central and south america.<ref>[http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/npgs/html/taxon.pl?450449 \'\'adenaria floribunda\'\'.] germplasm resources information network (grin).</ref>\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n{{myrtales-stub}}\n[[category:lythraceae]]\n[[category:monotypic plant genera]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adenophorus_periens</title><text>{{taxobox\n| status = g1\n| status_system = tnc\n| regnum = [[plant]]ae\n| divisio = [[pteridophyta]]\n| classis = [[polypodiopsida]]/<br>pteridopsida (disputed)\n| ordo = [[polypodiales]]\n| familia = [[polypodiaceae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[adenophorus]]\'\' \n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. periens\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'adenophorus periens\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[david bishop (botanist)|bishop]]\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'adenophorus periens\'\'\'\'\' is a rare species of [[fern]] known by the common name \'\'\'pendant kihi fern\'\'\'. it is [[endemism|endemic]] to [[hawaii]], where it is known from one population in [[puna, hawaii|puna]] on the island of [[hawaii (island)|hawaii]] and a few occurrences on [[kauai]] and [[molokai]]. the fern occurs in wet mountain forests on volcanic slopes. it grows on trees. there are perhaps 2000 individual plants remaining.<ref name=tnc>[http://www.natureserve.org/explorer/servlet/natureserve?searchname=adenophorus+periens the nature conservancy]</ref> this is a federally listed [[endangered species]] of the united states.\n\nthis fern is easily distinguished from others in its genus, with its long, hanging fronds that may exceed 40 centimeters in length, twice as long as other \'\'adenophorus\'\'.<ref name=ranker>ranker, t. a., et al. (2003). [http://rydberg.biology.colostate.edu/seminarpdfs/ranker_september_26.pdf molecular phylogenetics and evolution of the endemic hawaiian genus \'\'adenophorus\'\' (grammitidaceae).] \'\'molecular phylogenetics and evolution\'\' 26 337-47.</ref> the leaflets on the fronds are twisted at an angle to the [[rachis]] and the leaf edges are lined with unique hairs.<ref name=ranker/> [[genetic analysis]] reveals that the fern has a high [[genetic diversity]] for such a rare species.<ref name=ranker2>ranker, t. a. (1994). evolution of high genetic variability in the rare hawaiian fern adenophorus periens and implications for conservation management. \'\'biologic

<page> <title>adermatoglyphia</title><text>\'\'\'adermatoglyphia\'\'\' is a rare medical condition which causes a person to have no [[fingerprint]]s. it is also known as \"immigration delay disease\". there are only four known extended families worldwide which are affected by this condition.\n\nrecently, the description of a case of a person from [[switzerland]] lacking fingerprints as an isolated finding was published.<ref>{{cite journal |author=burger b, fuchs d, sprecher e, itin p |title=the immigration delay disease: adermatoglyphia-inherited absence of epidermal ridges |journal=j. am. acad. dermatol. |volume=64 |issue=5 |pages=974–80 |year=2011 |month=may |pmid=20619487 |doi=10.1016/j.jaad.2009.11.013 |url=http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/s0190-9622(09)01475-3}}</ref> the [[phenotype]] was mapped to [[chromosome]] 4q22. in the splice-site of a 3\' exon of the gene for smarcad1-[[helicase]], a [[point mutation]] was detected. it results in a shortened form of the skin-specific [[protein]]. the [[heterozygous]] mode of [[mutation]] suggests an [[autosomal dominant#autosomal versus sex-linked dominance|autosomal dominant]] mode of inheritance.<ref>{{cite journal |author=nousbeck j, burger b, fuchs-telem d, \'\'et al.\'\' |title=a mutation in a skin-specific isoform of smarcad1 causes autosomal-dominant adermatoglyphia |journal=am. j. hum. genet. |volume=89 |issue=2 |pages=302–7 |year=2011 |month=august |pmid=21820097 |doi=10.1016/j.ajhg.2011.07.004 |url=http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/s0002-9297(11)00298-9}}</ref>\n\nother conditions can cause a lack of fingerprints, but unlike them, adermatoglyphia has no other side effects.<ref>{{cite news |author=kaufman, rachel |title=mutated dna causes no-fingerprint disease |newspaper=national geographic news |date=august 9, 2011 |url=http://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2011/08/110809-fingerprints-skin-disease-health-science-weird/}}</ref> mutations in helicases are in involved in other rare ge

ambrose afolahan\'\'\' (born 26 december 1949) was appointed the first administrator of [[taraba state]], [[nigeria]] in august 1991 after the state was created from part of the old [[gongola state]] during the military regime of general [[ibrahim babangida]].\nhe handed over to the elected civilian governor [[jolly nyame]] in january 1992 at the start of the [[nigerian third republic]].<ref name=wstate>{{cite web\n |url=http://www.worldstatesmen.org/nigeria_federal_states.htm\n |title=nigerian states\n |publisher=worldstatesmen\n |accessdate=2010-05-28| archiveurl= 1949 in [[ibadan]], [[oyo state]]. he studied in nigeria and the [[united kingdom]].\nposts included deputy commandant, national war college, abuja, chief of naval operations and chief of naval plans.<ref>{{cite web\n |url=http://www.newswatchngr.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1584&itemid=34\n |title=in the news\t\n |author=pita ochai and gift uwaezuoke\t\n |date=6 december 2009\n |accessdate=2010-05-28}}</ref>\n\nspeaking at a seminar in lagos in may 2000, afolahan called on nigerian youths to abstain from sex or at least use condoms to ensure an aids-free <page> <title>adgur_kharazia</title><text>{{infobox mayor\n| name=adgur rafet-ipa kharazia<br>Адгəыр Рафеҭ-иҧа Харазиа\n| image=\n| order=acting [[mayor of sukhumi]]\n| term_start=november 5, 2004 \n| term_end=february 16, 2005\n| president=\n| predecessor=[[leonid lolua]]\n| successor=[[astamur adleiba]]\n| birth_date=\n| birth_place=\n| party=\n| religion=\n| spouse=\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adgur rafet-ipa kharazia\'\'\' ({{lang-ab|\'\'Адгəыр Рафеҭ-иҧа Харазиа\'\'}}) is a deputy of the [[people\'s assembly of abkhazia|people\'s assembly]] of [[georgia (country)|georgia]]\'s breakaway republic of [[abkhazia]].\n\n==mayor of sukhumi==\n\nadgur kharazia was head of the [[gulripsh district]] assembly before he was appointed acting mayor of [[sukhumi]] by president [[vladislav ardzinba]] on 5 november 2004, in the heated aftermath of the [[abkhazian presidential election, 2004|2004 presidential election]], succeeding [[leonid lolua]]. during his first speech he called upon the two leading candidates, [[sergei bagapsh]] and [[raul khadjimba]], to both withdraw.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hri.org/cgi-bin/brief?/news/balkans/rferl/2004/04-11-10.rferl.html#21|title=mayor suggests abkhaz presidential rivals should withdraw|publisher=rfe/rl|date=november 10, 2004|accessdate=2008-07-01}}</ref>\n\non february 16 of 2005, newly elected president bagapsh replaced kharazia with [[astamur adleiba]] as mayor of sukhumi.\n\n==member of the people\'s assembly of abkhazia==\n\nin the [[abkhazian parliamentary election, 2007|2007 parliamentary elections]] adgur kharazia successfully stood as candidate in the dranda precinct no. 24, winning a majority in the first round. he forms part of the opposition.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nregion.com/txt.php?i=11457|title=В Абхазии возросло влияние турецкого лобби|publisher=Новый Регион|date=april 1, 2007|accessdate=2008-07-01}}</ref> during the assembly\'s first 
<page> <title>adhisaya_manithan</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=january 2013}}\n{{use indian english|date=january 2013}}\n{{infobox film|\n| name = adhisaya manithan\n| banner = \n| caption =\n| director = velu prabhakaran\n| writer = jayadevi<br>r.p. visvam (dialogues)\n| starring = [[gouthami]]\n| producer = thakkali c. seenivasan\n| music = premi<br>seeni\n| cinematography = velu prabhakaran\n| editing = shyam\n| studio = perfect cine arts\n| released = 6 july 1990 <ref>http://www.cinesouth.com/cgi-bin/filmography/newfilmdb.cgi?name=adhisaya%20manithan</ref>\n| runtime =\n| country = india\n| language = [[tamil language|tamil]]\n| budget =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'adhisaya manithan\'\'\'\'\' ({{lang-ta|அதிசய மனிதன்}}),({{lang-en|surprising human}}) is a 1990 tamil horror film produced by thakkali c seenivasan  and directed by v prabhakar. it is a sequel to [[nalaya manithan]]. the film has [[gouthami]] in the lead role along with bunch of known faces. the film released to highly negative reviews and was commercial disaster at the box office prompting the producer to halt any further sequel.\n\n==plot==\ngowthami and her friends come to a deserted mansion and slowly encounter horror in the form of the devil man who would come alive and kill one by one until gouthami escapes from the devil. the ending shows that the movie would continue hinting a third sequel. however due to heavy losses incured, the movie did not have any further sequel.\n\n==cast==\n* [[gouthami]]\n* [[nizhalgal ravi]]\n* [[kovai sarala]]\n* [[chinni jayanth]]\n* [[kuyili]]\n* [[anand (actor)|anand]]\n* [[raja (tamil actor)|raja]]\n* [[silk smitha]]\n* [[radha ravi]]\n* [[charan raj]]\n\n==reception==\nthe movie was panned by critics and was a commercial and a critical disater at the box office. \n\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:1990 films]]\n[[category:indian films]]\n[[category:tamil films of 1990]]\n[[category:tamil-language films]]\n\n\n{{1990s-tamil-film-stub}}</text> </page>

her to prolong this affair as he wanted his daughter not to marry a man from a lower caste. seetha gets married to a bank employee much against her wish. by the time the couple understand and like each other seetha loses her husband in a road mishap. kuruppu, the determined man he is, arranges her next marriage with narayanan, a widower, who already had two children from his first marriage. seetha had to agree and gets married to narayanan. she makes herself happy by spending time with narayanan\'s children. after a few days, her husband, who was a heart patient, dies. she had to leave <page> <title>adi_bichman</title><text>\'\'\'adi maia bichman\'\'\' ({{lang-he|עדי מאיה ביכמן}}; born february 5, 1983) is an israeli former olympic [[swimming (sport)|swimmer]].<ref name=\"jis\">{{cite web|url=http://www.jewsinsports.org/olympics.asp?id=146|title=adi bichman|publisher=jews in sports online|accessdate=september 29, 2010}}</ref> \n\nshe participated in the [[2000 summer olympics]] in sydney, where she swam in the 400m and 800m freestyle, as well as the 400m medley.<ref>[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/bi/adi-bichman-1.html profile from sports-reference]</ref> she attended [[rice university]] on an [[athletic scholarship]].<ref name=jis/>\n\n==see also==\n*[[list of jews in sports#swimming|list of select jewish swimmers]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = bichman, adi\n| alternative names =\n| short description = swimmer\n| date of birth     = february 5, 1983\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:bichman, adi}}\n[[category:1983 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:rice owls athletes]]\n[[category:college women\'s swimmers in the united states]]\n[[category:israeli swimmers]]\n[[category:olympic swimmers of israel]]\n[[category:swimmers at the 2000 summer olympics]]\n\n\n{{israel-swimming-bio-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adi_ignatius</title><text>\'\'\'adi ignatius\'\'\' (born in [[burbank, california]]) is [[editor-in-chief]] of \'\'[[harvard business review]]\'\'. he joined the magazine in january 2009.<ref>[http://www.boston.com/business/ticker/2009/01/harvard_busines_4.html boston globe, january 6, 2009]</ref>\n\npreviously, he was deputy managing editor for \'\'[[time (magazine)|time]]\'\', where he was responsible for many of time’s special editions, including the [[time person of the year|person of the year]] and [[time 100]] franchises. before that, ignatius served as executive editor of time starting in 2002, responsible for the magazine’s business and international coverage. he wrote frequently for the magazine, including cover stories on [[google]] and the 2007 person of the year profile of russian leader [[vladimir putin]].<ref>[http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1697396,00.html time magazine, december 20, 2007]</ref> ignatius joined time as deputy editor of time asia in 1996, based in [[hong kong]], and was named editor of that edition in 2000.\n\nprior to joining time, ignatius worked for many years at\'\' [[the wall street journal]]\'\', serving as the newspaper’s bureau chief in [[beijing]] and later in [[moscow]]. he later served as managing editor of the central european economic review and business editor of the \'\'[[far eastern economic review]]\'\', publications owned by [[dow jones & company|dow jones, inc.]].\n\nignatius was awarded a zuckerman fellowship at [[columbia university]]’s school of international and public affairs in 1990. he received his ba in history in 1981 from [[haverford college]] in [[pennsylvania]]. he is a member of the [[council on foreign relations]] and the [[asia society]] and sits on the advisory board of the journalism school at [[suny stony brook]].\n\n==book projects==\nignatius is coeditor, with bao pu and renee chiang, of the book [[prisoner of the state: the secret journal of premier zhao ziy
<page> <title>adiantum_raddianum</title><text>{{refimprove|date=january 2012}}\n{{taxobox\n| image = starr 030807-0143 adiantum raddianum.jpg\n| regnum = [[plant]]ae\n| divisio = [[pteridophyta]]\n| classis = [[pteridopsida]]\n| ordo = [[polypodiales]]<ref name=christenhusz-2011/>\n| familia = [[pteridaceae]]<ref name=christenhusz-2011/>\n| subfamilia = \'\'[[vittarioideae]]\'\'<ref name=christenhusz-2011/>\n| genus = \'\'[[adiantum]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. raddianum\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'adiantum raddianum\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[carl borivoj presl|c.presl]]\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'adiantum raddianum\'\'\'\'\' also known as maidenhair fern is one of the most popular [[fern]]s to grow indoors. its common name comes from its shiny, dark leafstalks that resembles [[human hair]]. the triangular [[frond]]s are semi-erect in the beginning then droop gracefully as they age and can be up to {{convert|8|in|cm}} long by {{convert|6|in|cm}} wide.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist|refs=\n<ref name=christenhusz-2011>{{cite journal | first1=maarten j. m. | last1=christenhusz  | authorlink1=maarten j. m. christenhusz | first2=xian-chun | last2=zhang | first3=harald | last3=schneider |year=2011 |title=a linear sequence of extant families and genera of lycophytes and ferns |journal=[[phytotaxa]] |volume=19 |pages=7–54 |url=http://www.mapress.com/phytotaxa/content/2011/f/pt00019p054.pdf |format=[[portable document format|pdf]]}}</ref>\n}}\n\n==external links==\n*{{commons category-inline|adiantum raddianum|\'\'adiantum raddianum\'\'}}\n\n[[category:adiantum|raddianum]]\n[[category:fern species]]\n[[category:plants described in 1836]]\n\n\n{{fern-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adidas_stan_smith</title><text>[[image:adidas stan smith (made in france).jpg|thumb|[[adidas]] stan smith (made in france)|300px|right]]\n[[image:stan smith white and green.png|thumb|[[adidas]] stan smith ii|300px|right]]\n[[image:adidas stan smith 80s.jpg|thumb|[[adidas]] stan smith 80s|300px|right]]\n\n\'\'\'\'\'adidas stan smith\'\'\'\'\' is a [[tennis]] shoe made by [[adidas]]. however, nowadays, the shoe is not used for tennis, but as [[sneakers (footwear)|sneakers]].\n\n[[stan smith]] is an american tennis player, who was active between the end of the 1960s and the beginning of the 1980s. adidas approached him to endorse the so-called \'\'haillet\'\' shoe in 1971.\n\n== introduction ==\n\nthe shoe, usually made with a white leather [[shoe#upper|upper]] and [[shoelaces|laces]], has a simple design. unlike most adidas shoes, it does not have the external [[three stripes]]. instead there are three rows of [[perforations]] (or punched ventilation holes) on both sides of each shoe\'s leather upper in the same pattern that should symbolize the three ordinary stripes.<ref name=\"trainers\">neal heard, \'\'trainers – over 300 classics from rare vintage to the latest designs\'\', carlton books (london, 2003), isbn 1-84442-571-1.</ref><ref name=\"sneakers\">unorthodox styles, \'\'sneakers – the complete collectors\' guide\'\', thames & hudson (london, 2005), isbn 0-500-51215-9.</ref> there is sometimes a sketched picture of stan smith on the tongue of the shoe. in some sense, the adidas branding is minimal on the shoe.<ref>giles metcalfe, \"adidas stan smith\", modculture (september 6, 2011), see http://www.modculture.co.uk/adidas-stan-smith-by-giles-metcalfe/ retrieved 2013-02-14.</ref> the design and form of the shoe has basically stayed the same since it was introduced, but several new versions and colorways have appeared during the years.<ref name=\"trainers\" /><ref name=\"sneakers\" />\n\n[[image:adidas stan smith, details.jpg|thumb|details of th

<page> <title>adirondack_frostbite</title><text>[[image:adirondackfrostbite.png|right|200px]]\n\nthe \'\'\'adirondack frostbite\'\'\' were a professional [[ice hockey]] team in the [[united hockey league]].  they played their home games at the [[glens falls civic center]] in [[glens falls, new york]].\n\nuhl action came to glens falls in 1999, when the [[american hockey league]]\'s [[adirondack red wings]] disbanded. in 2000, hockey returned to the area with the relocation of the [[winston-salem icehawks]] from [[winston-salem, north carolina]] to glens falls to become the adirondack icehawks. the team was renamed adirondack frostbite in 2004. in 2004, [[espn]] \'\'[[sportscenter]]\'\' anchor [[steve levy]] and [[nhl]] analyst [[barry melrose]] became the team\'s owners and the team changed its name to the \'\'frostbite\'\'.  \n\non january 13, 2006, head coach [[marc potvin]] was found dead in his hotel room in [[kalamazoo, michigan]] hours before his team was to play the [[kalamazoo wings]].\n\nthe frostbite suspended operations on june 12, 2006 after the team could not come to a lease agreement with the glens falls civic center. professional hockey would not return to the adirondack region until 2009, when the [[adirondack phantoms]] (formerly the [[philadelphia phantoms]]) of the ahl relocated to the arena.\n\n==references==\n*{{cite book|first=jon c.|last=scott|title=hockey night in dixie: minor pro hockey in the american south|year=2006|publisher=heritage house publishing company ltd.|pages=17–200|isbn=1-894974-21-2}}\n*[http://hockeydb.com/ihdb/stats/teamseasons.php?tid=3568 adirondack frostbite on hockeydb]\n\n{{ihl}}\n\n[[category:defunct united hockey league teams]]\n[[category:ice hockey teams in new york]]\n[[category:defunct ice hockey teams in the united states]]\n[[category:2000 establishments in new york]]\n[[category:2006 disestablishments in new york]]\n\n\n{{us-icehockey-team-stub}}</text> </page>

(2010). “[http://www.latridiidae.de/downloads/checklist-latridiidae-and-merophysiinae-world-.pdf checklist latridiidae & merophysiinae of the world.]” issn 1868-2168. retrieved on 15 may 2012.</ref>\n\n* \'\'[[adistemia bicarinata]]\'\' <small>(belon, 1897)</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia chilenisi]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1974</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia ciliata]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1967</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia convexa]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1967</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia jeanneli]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1960</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia microphthalma]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1967</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia minuta]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1967</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia petiti]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1960</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia prenanti]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1960</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia pubescens]]\'\' <small>dajoz, 1967</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia rileyi]]\'\' <small>hinton, 1941</small>\n* \'\'[[adistemia watsoni]]\'\' <small>(wollaston, 1871)</small>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:cucujoidea]]\n\n{{latridiidae-stub}}</text> </page>

lahiri]</ref>\n\n==early life==\nshe was educated at the [[bethune college]], and later at the [[university of calcutta]].<ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata-/rejected-by-cu-a-star-at-oxford/articleshow/7531584.cms rejected by cu, a star at oxford]</ref> her first job was as a newscaster for [[doordarshan]].\n\n==career==\nshe earned two doctorates from the [[university of calcutta]] in comparative [[philology]] and in [[linguistics]] from [[brown university]].<ref name=about_lahiri>[http://web.mit.edu/lsa2005/people/bios/lahiri.html about lahiri]</ref>\n\nshe has taught at the [[university of california at los angeles]] and at the [[university of california at santa cruz]], and would later work as a research scientist at the [[max planck institute for psycholinguistics]] in the netherlands\n.<ref name=about_lahiri/>\n\nshe has till recently been a professor at the [[university of konstanz]].<ref>[http://ling.uni-konstanz.de/pages/proj/sfb471/mitglieder/lahiri.html homepage]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see <page> <title>adjoint</title><text>\nin mathematics, the term \'\'\'\'\'adjoint\'\'\'\'\' applies in several situations. several of these share a similar formalism: if \'\'a\'\' is adjoint to \'\'b\'\', then there is typically some formula of the type\n:(\'\'ax\'\', \'\'y\'\') = (\'\'x\'\', \'\'by\'\').\n\nspecifically, \'\'\'adjoint\'\'\' or \'\'\'adjunction\'\'\' may mean:\n*[[adjoint endomorphism]] of a lie algebra\n*[[adjoint functors]] in category theory\n*[[hermitian adjoint]] (adjoint of a linear operator) in functional analysis\n*for adjoint of a linear map, see [[transpose#adjoint|transpose]]\n*[[adjoint representation of a lie group]]\n*[[adjunction (category theory)]]\n*[[adjunction (field theory)]]\n*[[adjunction formula (algebraic geometry)]]\n*[[adjunction space]] in topology\n*[[conjugate transpose]] of a matrix in linear algebra\n*[[adjugate matrix]], related to its inverse\n*[[adjoint equation]]\n*the upper and lower adjoints of a [[galois connection]] in order theory\n*for the adjoint of a differential operator with general polynomial coefficients see [[differential operator#operator methods|differential operator]] \n*[[kleisli adjunction]]\n*[[monoidal adjunction]]\n*[[quillen adjunction]]\n\n[[category:mathematical terminology]]\n\n{{mathdab}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adjumani_airport</title><text>{{infobox airport \n| name         = adjumani airport\n| nativename   = \n| image        = \n| caption      = \n| iata         = <!--none-->\n| icao         = huaj\n| type         = public\n| owner        = [[adjumani|adjumani town council]]\n| operator     = \n| city-served  = [[adjumani]], [[uganda]]\n| location     = <!--if different than above-->\n| elevation-f  = 2,611 \n| elevation-m  = 796 \n| website      = \n| latd  =  03 | latm  = 20 | lats  = 19 | latns  = n\n| longd = 031 | longm = 46 | longs = 08 | longew = e\n| coordinates_region     = ug\n| pushpin_map            = uganda\n| pushpin_relief         = yes\n| pushpin_map_caption    = location of airport in uganda\n| pushpin_label          = \'\'\'huaj\'\'\'\n| pushpin_label_position = bottom\n| metric-rwy   = y\n| r1-number    = 09/27\n| r1-length-m  = 1,130\n| r1-length-f  = 3,710\n| r1-surface   = unpaved\n| footnotes    = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'adjumani airport\'\'\' {{airport codes||huaj}} is an airport in [[uganda]]. it is located in [[adjumani district]], [[west nile sub-region|west nile sub-region]], [[northern region, uganda|northern uganda]], in the town of [[adjumani]], close to the international border with [[south sudan]]. the geographic coordinates of adjumani airport are: {{coord|3.33850|n|31.76900|e|format=dms}}. its location is approximately {{convert|376|km|mi}}, by air, north of [[entebbe international airport]], the country’s largest civilian and military airport.<ref>[http://distancecalculator.globefeed.com/uganda_distance_result.asp?fromplace=adjumani%20()&toplace=entebbe%20airport%20()%20&fromlat=3.3613889&tolat=0.042386&fromlng=31.8097222&tolng=32.443503 flight distance between entebbe airport and adjumani airport with map]</ref>\n\nadjumani airport is one of the forty-six (46) airports in the country.<ref>[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/ug.html uganda has 46 airports]</ref> it is a small [[civilian]] airport th
<page> <title>adjuvant</title><text>{{distinguish|adjuvant therapy}}\n\nan \'\'\'adjuvant\'\'\' (from latin, \'\'adiuvare:\'\' to aid) is a [[pharmacology|pharmacological]] and/or [[immunology|immunological]] agent that modifies the effect of other agents. adjuvants are inorganic or organic chemicals, macromolecules or entire cells of certain killed bacteria, which enhance the immune response to an antigen. they may be included in a vaccine to enhance the recipient\'s [[immune response]] to the supplied [[antigen]], thus minimizing the amount of injected foreign material.<ref name=abcnews>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/health/swineflunews/story?id=8296948 |title=abc news: swine flu vaccine: what the heck is an adjuvant, anyway? (2009) |publisher=abcnews.go.com |date=2009-08-11 |accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref><ref name=cancergov>{{cite web|url=http://www.cancer.gov/dictionary/?cdrid=43987 |title=definition of immunological adjuvant -- nci dictionary of cancer terms |publisher=www.cancer.gov |accessdate=2010-08-27}}</ref> adjuvants are also used in the production of antibodies from immunized animals. the most commonly used adjuvants include aluminum hydroxide and paraffin oil.<ref name=abcnews /><ref name=cancergov />\n\n== immunologic adjuvants ==\n{{main|immunologic adjuvant}}\n\nimmunologic adjuvants are added to [[vaccines]] to stimulate the [[immune system]]\'s response to the target [[antigen]], but do not in themselves confer [[immunity (medical)|immunity]]. adjuvants can act in various ways in presenting an antigen to the immune system. adjuvants can act as a depot for the antigen, presenting the antigen over a long period of time, thus maximizing the immune response before the body clears the antigen. examples of depot type adjuvants are oil [[emulsion]]s. adjuvants can also act as an irritant which causes the body to recruit and amplify its immune response.<ref name=\"benchmarkbiolabs1\">{{cite web |title=adjuvants as stabilizing agents |url=http://bench
<page> <title>adler_trumpf</title><text>{{infobox automobile\n| image = adler trumpf cabriolet 1935.jpg\n| caption = adler trumpf cabriolet (1935)\n|name = adler trumpf\n|aka = 1932-34: adler trumpf 1.5 liter<br> 1933–36: adler trumpf 1.7 liter<br> 1933–35: adler trumpf  sport <br><br> 1936-38: adler trumpf 1.7 ev\n|manufacturer = [[adler (automobile)|adlerwerke]]\n|production = 1932-36: 18,600 units<br>1936-38: 7,003 units\n |assembly = [[frankfurt am main]]\n|successor =\n |body_style = “limousine” ([[sedan (automobile)|2/4 door saloon]])<br>2/4 door cabriolet<br>sports roadster\n |engine = 1932-34: 1,504&nbsp;cc  4 cylinder in-line side-valve engine<br>1933-38: 1,645&nbsp;cc  4 cylinder in-line side-valve engine\n|layout=[[ff layout]]\n|transmission = 4-speed manual. <br>no synchromesh.\n|length = 1932-36:  {{convert|4150|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}   <br>1936-38:  {{convert|4540|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} \n|width =  {{convert|1600|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} \n|height =  {{convert|1580|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}   <br>  {{convert|1550|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}   (sport)\n|weight = \n|wheelbase = 1932-35:  {{convert|2825|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}  <br>1936-38:  {{convert|2920|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} \n|track = \n|related = \n|designer = [[:de: hans gustav röhr|hans gustav röhr]]\n}}\nthe \'\'\'adler trumpf\'\'\' is a small family car introduced by the [[frankfurt am main|frankfurt]] based auto-maker, [[adler (automobile)|adler]] in march 1932, though trumpf production only got under way in the late summer of that year.<ref name=\"#oswald|oswald, p 19\">[[#oswald|oswald]], p 19</ref>    in a move reminiscent of [[british leyland]] [[morris marina|in]] [[austin allegro|the]] 1970s, adler launched two similarly sized cars in the same year, one of which followed the then new trend set by [[dkw f2|dkw]] for [[front-wheel drive]], and one respecting the conventional [[rear-wheel drive]] configuration still used by the market leader, [[:de: opel 1,2 liter/opel 6|opel]].\n\nthe trumpf was the second of these two smalle
<page> <title>adlerhorn</title><text>{{infobox mountain\n| name = adlerhorn\n| photo = strahlhorn, adlerhorn (cropped).jpg\n| photo_caption = [[strahlhorn]]/adlerhorn, from rothorn, at the top of the sunnega ski area\n| elevation_m = 3988\n| elevation_ref =\n| prominence_m = 58\n| prominence_ref = <ref>retrieved from the [[swisstopo]] maps and [[google earth]]. the key col is located east of the summit at 3,930 metres.</ref>\n| parent_peak = [[strahlhorn]]\n| map = switzerland relief\n| map_caption = location in switzerland\n| map_size =\n| label_position = right\n| location = [[valais]], [[switzerland]]\n| range = [[pennine alps]]\n| lat_d = 46 | lat_m = 0 | lat_s = 32.8 | lat_ns = n\n| long_d = 7 | long_m = 53 | long_s = 20.5 | long_ew = e\n| region = ch\n| coordinates_ref =\n| first_ascent =\n| easiest_route =\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'adlerhorn\'\'\' is a [[mountain]] of the swiss [[pennine alps]], located east of [[zermatt]] in the canton of [[valais]]. it lies west of the [[strahlhorn]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n{{commonscat}}\n* [http://www.hikr.org/dir/adlerhorn_16/ adlerhorn on hikr]\n* [http://www.mountwiki.com/wiki/view/adlerhorn the adlerhorn on mount wiki]\n\n[[category:pennine alps]]\n[[category:alpine three-thousanders]]\n[[category:mountains of valais]]\n\n{{valais-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adlestrop_railway_station</title><text>{{infobox uk disused station\n|name      = adlestrop\n|image_name= adlestrop railway station 2035200 e31995d3.jpg\n|caption   = adlestrop station in 1961.\n|locale    = [[adlestrop]]\n|borough   = [[cotswold (district)|cotswold]]\n|original  = [[oxford, worcester and wolverhampton railway]]\n|pregroup  = [[great western railway]] \n|postgroup = great western railway <br> [[western region of british railways]]\n|platforms = 2\n|latitude  = 51.9360\n|longitude = -1.6591\n|gridref   = sp235264\n|years     = 4 june 1853\n|events    = station opens as \'\'addlestrop and stow road\'\'\n|years1    = 1 march 1862\n|events1   = station renamed \'\'addlestrop\'\'\n|years2    = 1 july 1883\n|events2   = station renamed \'\'adlestrop\'\'\n|years3    = 3 january 1966\n|events3   = station closed\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adlestrop railway station\'\'\' was a [[railway station]] which served the village of [[adlestrop]] in [[gloucestershire]], [[england]], between 1853 and 1966. it was on what is now called the [[cotswold line]]. the station was immortalised in the poem \'\'adlestrop\'\' by  [[edward thomas (poet)|edward thomas]] after his train stopped there on 24 june 1914.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.poetsgraves.co.uk/classic%20poems/thomas%20e/adlestrop.htm |work=poets\' graves |title=adlestrop by edward thomas}}</ref><ref>[[#refanneharv|harvey]], p.11.</ref>\n\n==history==\nadlestrop station was opened on 4 june 1853 by the [[oxford, worcester and wolverhampton railway]] (ow&w) as part of the {{convert|40|mi|km|abbr=on}} section of the [[cotswold line]] from wolvercot junction to {{rws|evesham}}.{{sfnp|potts|1985|p=5}}{{sfnp|butt|1995|p=13}}  the line was originally [[dual gauge|mixed gauge]] single track throughout with a [[narrow gauge]] [[passing loop]] at {{rws|charlbury}}.{{sfnp|potts|1985|p=5}} the line through adlestrop was dualled on 2 august 1858, after the sections between wolvercot - <page> <title>adlumia_fungosa</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = adlumia fungosa drawing.png\n| regnum = [[plant]]ae\n| unranked_divisio = [[angiosperms]]\n| unranked_classis = [[eudicots]]\n| ordo = [[ranunculales]]\n| familia = [[papaveraceae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[adlumia]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. fungosa\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'adlumia fungosa\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[william aiton|aiton]]) [[edward lee greene|greene]] ex [[nathaniel lord britton|britton]], [[emerson ellick sterns|sterns]] & [[justus ferdinand poggenburg i|poggenb.]]\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'a. cirrhosa\'\'\n*\'\'fumaria fungosa\'\'\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'adlumia fungosa\'\'\'\'\' is a species in the [[papaveraceae]] that is commonly known as the \'\'\'allegheny vine\'\'\', \'\'\'climbing fumitory\'\'\', or \'\'\'mountain fringe\'\'\'. it is a [[herbaceous]], creeping, [[flowering plant]] and is closely related to the fumitory [[genus]], \'\'[[fumaria]]\'\'.\n\n\'\'adlumia fungosa\'\' is a biennial climbing plant with very slender stems. the leaves are several times pinnately divided, prehensile, and feathery in texture. the white or pinkish flowers grow in large clusters and appear in summer. the plant grows on wet and wooded slopes, and is native to north america, particularly the [[allegheny mountains]] area. it is a threatened or endangered species throughout its range in northeastern north america, where it has not been completely extirpated. this vine can grow up to twelve feet in length on wooded and rocky slopes.\n\nthe species name \'\'fungosa\'\' means \'spongy\' in [[latin]].\n\n==references==\n* {{cite book | author=[[l. h. bailey|bailey, l. h.]] | title=manual of gardening (second edition).  | url=http://www.gutenberg.org/etext/9550 | year=2005 | publisher=[[project gutenberg|project gutenberg literary archive foundation]]}}\n* {{cite book | author=[[neltje blanchan|blanchan, neltje]] | title=[[wild flowers: an aid to knowledge of our wild flowers and their insect visitors]] | year
<page> <title>admetula_cornidei</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=july 2013}}\n{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'admetula cornidei\'\'\n| image =\n| image_caption =\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[mollusca]]\n| classis = [[gastropoda]]\n| unranked_superfamilia= clade [[caenogastropoda]]<br/>clade [[hypsogastropoda]]<br/>clade [[neogastropoda]]\n| superfamilia = [[cancellarioidea]]\n| familia = [[cancellariidae]]\n| subfamilia =\n| genus = \'\'[[admetula]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. cornidei\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'admetula cornidei\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (altimira, 1978)\n| synonyms_ref = <ref name=\"worms\" />\n| synonyms =\n* \'\'brocchinia cornidei\'\' (altimira, 1978) (currently placed in genus \'\'admetula\'\')\n* \'\'bonellitia cornidei\'\' (altimira, 1978)\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'admetula cornidei\'\'\'\'\' is a [[species]] of [[sea snail]], a marine [[gastropod]] [[mollusk]] in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[cancellariidae]], the nutmeg snails.<ref name=\"worms\">{{wrms species|341242|\'\'admetula cornidei\'\' (altimira, 1978)||29 october 2010}}</ref>\n\n==description==\nthe size of the thin, ovately oblong shell varies between 9&nbsp;mm and 12&nbsp;mm. the color of the shell goes from brown to whitish. the [[protoconch]] is paucispiral with its axis slightly deviated from the main axis. the [[teleoconch]] consists of 3 ¼ rounded [[whorl (mollusc)|whorls]], axially crossed by 15 to 20 broad, rounded ribs, less conspicuous at the margin of the oblong aperture ([[peristome]]). the outer lip is slightly crenulated and contains six [[lira (mollusc)|lirae]] (fine linear elevations of shelly material). the [[columella (gastropod)|columella]] is abaxially inclined and shows three folds with the siphonal fold displaying a noticeable tooth. the shell lacks an [[umbilicus (mollusc)|umbilicus]]. the [[periostracum]] is covered with very short hairs along the spiral lines.<ref name=\"verhecken\">[http://www.mnhn.fr/museum/front/medias/publication

<page> <title>administrator_of_tokelau</title><text>{{politics of tokelau}}\n\nthe \'\'\'administrator of tokelau\'\'\' is an official of the [[new zealand government]], responsible for supervising the government of the [[dependent territory]] of [[tokelau]].\n\n==powers and functions==\ncertain of the administrator\'s powers and functions are set forth in the [[tokelau act 1948]], as amended from time to time. (the office of administrator is not, however, created by this act.) the most important power of the administrator is the power to disallow any rule passed by the [[general fono]]; this must, however, be done within 30 days after the administrator is sent a copy of the rule.\n\nthe administrator is assisted by a permanent staff of civil servants, which form the \'\'office of the administrator of tokelau\'\', a part of the [[ministry of foreign affairs and trade (new zealand)|ministry of foreign affairs and trade]]. the office coordinates new zealand government activity relating to tokelau, especially economic assistance; provides expert policy advice and assistance to the tokelau government, also arranging for administrative assistance and training to the tokelau public service; and represents the tokelau public service in new zealand, especially to the resident tokelauan community. besides these roles, the office is presently assisting tokelau to develop appropriate legal, governance and administration structures as tokelau moves towards greater autonomy.\n\nthe administrator formally acts as a representative, not of the [[queen of new zealand|queen]] personally, but of the new zealand government. the administration of tokelau may also be overruled by the new zealand parliament, or by regulations made by the [[governor-general of new zealand|governor-general]] in council.\n\n==appointment==\nthe administrator is appointed by the [[new zealand minister of foreign affairs]].\n\n==history==\n\nthe region of the [[pacific ocean]] in which tokelau lies was declare
<page> <title>admissibility</title><text>{{wiktionary}}\n\'\'\'admissibility\'\'\' may refer to:\n* [[admissible evidence]], evidence which may be introduced in a court of law.\n* [[admissible decision rule]], in statistical decision theory, a rule which is never dominated.\n* [[admissible rule]], in logic, a type of rule of inference.\n* [[admissible heuristic]], in computer science, is a heuristic which is no more than the lowest-cost path to the goal.\n* [[admissible set]], in mathematical logic, a transitive set satisfying the axioms of [[kripke-platek set theory]].\n\n{{disambiguation}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>admont</title><text>{{infobox ort in Österreich\n|art                = marktgemeinde\n|name               = admont\n|wappen             = aut admont coa.svg\n|lat_deg            = 47 | lat_min = 34 | lat_sec = 23\n|lon_deg            = 14 | lon_min = 27 | lon_sec = 40\n|bundesland         = steiermark\n|bezirk             = liezen\n|höhe               = 640\n|fläche             = 75.96\n|einwohner          = 2694\n|stand              = 2005-12-31\n|plz                = 8911\n|vorwahl            = 03613\n|kfz                = li\n|gemeindekennziffer = 6 12 01\n|nuts               = at222\n|straße             = hauptstraße 36\n|website            = [http://www.admont.at www.admont.at]\n|bürgermeister      = günther posch\n|partei             = Övp\n|gemeinderatanzahl  = 15\n|gemeinderat        = 9 Övp 6 [[spÖ]]\n|wahljahr           = 2005\n}}\n\n\'\'\'admont\'\'\' is a town in [[styria]], [[austria]], with a population of 2775 ({{as of|2001|lc=on}}). it is historically most notable for [[admont abbey]], a monastery founded in 1074.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.admont.at official site]\n\n[[image:admont um 1840.1.jpg|thumb|left|painting of admont in 1840 by anton schiffer.]]\n\n{{liezen}}\n\n{{styria-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>admontite</title><text>{{infobox mineral\n| name = admontite\n| category = [[nesoborates]]\n| boxwidth = \n| boxbgcolor = \n| image = \n| caption = \n| formula = mgb<sub>6</sub>o<sub>10</sub>·7h<sub>2</sub>o<ref name=hb/> or <br/>[[magnesium|mg]][[boron|b]]<sub>6</sub>[[oxygen|o]]<sub>7</sub>(o[[hydrogen|h]])<sub>6</sub>·4h<sub>2</sub>o<ref name=mindat/>\n| molweight = \n| strunz = 06.fa.15\n| dana = 26.6.3.1\n| symmetry = \n| unit cell = \n| color = colorless\n| habit = \n| system = [[monoclinic]]\n| twinning = \n| cleavage = absent\n| fracture = \tconchoidal - fractures developed in brittle materials characterized by smoothly curving surfaces, (e.g. quartz)\n| tenacity = \n| mohs = 2 - 3 - gypsum-calcite\n| luster = \n| refractive = \tn<sub>α</sub> = 1.442 n<sub>γ</sub> = 1.504\n| opticalprop = biaxial (-)\n| birefringence = δ = 0.062\n| pleochroism = \n| 2v = \n| dispersion = none\n| streak = white\n| gravity = \n| density = 1.82 - 1.87, average = 1.84 \n| melt = \n| fusibility = \n| diagnostic = \n| solubility = \n| diaphaneity = \n| other = \n| references = <ref name=mindat>[http://www.mindat.org/min-27.html mindat.org]</ref><ref name=hb>[http://rruff.geo.arizona.edu/doclib/hom/admontite.pdf handbook of mineralogy]</ref><ref name=webmin>[http://www.webmineral.com/data/admontite.shtml webmineral data]</ref>\n}}\n\n\'\'\'admontite\'\'\' is a [[magnesium]] [[borate mineral]] with formula mgb<sub>6</sub>o<sub>10</sub>·7h<sub>2</sub>o.  \n\noccurrence -  in a gypsum deposit.\nassociations: [[gypsum]], [[anhydrite]], [[hexahydrite]], [[löweite]], [[eugsterite]], [[pyrite]], [[quartz]].\n\nit is named after [[admont]], [[austria]].  its [[mohs scale of mineral hardness|mohs scale]] rating is 2 to 3.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:magnesium minerals]]\n[[category:nesoborates]]\n\n{{mineral-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adolf_bernhard_christoph_hilgenfeld</title><text>{{infobox scientist\n|name              = adolf hilgenfeld\n|image             = \n|image_size        = \n|caption           = \n|birth_date        = 2 june 1823\n|birth_place       = stappenbeck near salzwedel, germany\n|death_date        = 12 january 1907\n|death_place       = [[jena|jena, germany]]\n|residence         = \n|citizenship       = \n|nationality       = german\n|ethnicity         = \n|field             = [[theology]]<br />[[new testament]]\n|tradition_movement= [[tübingen school]]\n|work_institutions = [[university of jena]]\n|alma_mater        = [[humboldt university of berlin|friedrich wilhelm university, berlin]]<br />[[university of halle]]\n|doctoral_advisor  =\n|doctoral_students = \n|known_for         = \n|influences        = \n|influenced        = \n|prizes            = \n|religion          = [[protestant]]\n|footnotes         =\n|main_interests    =\n|notable_works     = \n}}\'\'\'adolf bernhard christoph hilgenfeld\'\'\' (2 june 1823 – 12 january 1907) was a  [[germany|german]] [[protestant]] theologian.\n\n==biography==\nhe was born at [[stappenbeck]] near [[salzwedel]] in the [[province of saxony]].\n\nhe studied at the [[humboldt university of berlin|friedrich wilhelm university]] in [[berlin]] and the [[university of halle]], and in 1890 became \'\'professor ordinarius\'\' of [[theology]] at the [[university of jena]]. he belonged to the [[tübingen school]]. fond of emphasizing his independence of [[ferdinand christian baur]], he still, in all important points, followed in the footsteps of his master; his method, which he is wont to contrast as \'\'literarkritik\'\' with baur\'s \'\'tendenzkritik\'\', \"is nevertheless essentially the same as baur\'s.\"<ref>otto pfleiderer, \'\'the development of theology in germany since kant: and its progress in great britain since 1825,\'\' tr. j. frederick smith (london; new york: s. sonnenschein & co.; macmillan & co., 1890), 239.</r
<page> <title>adolf_hitler_schools</title><text>{{expand german|adolf-hitler-schule|date=december 2011}}\n\n\'\'\'adolf hitler schools\'\'\' (ahs) was an association of 10, ultimately 12, \"[[national socialist]] schools\", which [[hitler]] allowed on 15 january 1937 to bear his name (as he earlier had other schools).  their founding was based on [[robert ley]]\'s plan to erect a \"gauburg\" ([[citadel]]) in every [[gau (country subdivision)|gau]], thereby creating an [[nsdap]] school system.  this would also have transformed the state-supported national-political educational institutes.  education minister [[bernhard rust]], however, agreed only to boarding school \"aufbauschulen\" (advanced grade schools with some college preparation), supported by the party, to educate future party leaders.  neither plan was realized.  until 1941, the adolf hitler schools were supported by the financial office of the [[german labor front]].  built up class by class, the schools were housed with the similarly financed [[ordensburg#ns-ordensburgen_.28national_socialist_germany|order fortresses]] until 1941.  responsibility for the schools\' structure was assumed not by the nsdap but by the [[reichsjugendführer]].\n\nthe ahs were to set an example for the \"revolution in education\":\n\n{{cquote|the responsibility of youth for itself is also possible in school.\n— [[baldur von schirach]]}}\n\nthus the [[hitler youth]] (hj) announced its intent to transform schooling.  yet in practice the ahs achieved hardly more than the education institutes\' model of a duplicate leadership structure for the boarding schools.  hj leaders and order fortress teachers were employed as \"school leaders\" ({{lang-de|schulführer}}); all had hj ranks and were addressed familiarly with \"du\".  a [[gauleiter]] did not supervise schools in his territory; this was done by a \"commander\" (\'\'kommandeur\'\') from the youth leadership.  thus with varied ambitions and usually little expertise, the \"educat
<page> <title>adolf_martens</title><text>\'\'\'adolf martens\'\'\' (adolf karl gottfried martens), 6 march 1850 – 24 july 1914, was a german [[metallurgist]] and the namesake of the [[steel]] structure [[martensite]] and the martensitic transformation, a type of [[diffusionless transformation|diffusionless]] [[phase transition]] in the solid state.<ref name=portella>{{cite web|title=adolf martens and his contributions to materials engineering|url=http://www.msm.cam.ac.uk/phase-trans/2002/martens.pdf|publisher=federal institute for materials research and testing (bam)|author=p.d. portella|year=2006}}</ref><ref name=ahlers>{{cite journal|title=the martensitic transformation|journal=revista matéria|year=2004|volume=9|issue=3|pages=169–183|url=http://www.materia.coppe.ufrj.br/sarra/artigos/artigo10308/|author=manfred ahlers|issn=1517-7076}}</ref> \n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{germany-engineer-stub}}\n{{defaultsort:martens, adolf}}\n[[category:german engineers]]\n[[category:1850 births]]\n[[category:1914 deaths]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adolf_reeb</title><text>{{infobox military person\n| name = adolf reeb\n| image = bundesarchiv bild 146-2005-0056, adolf reeb.jpg\n| caption =\n| birth_date = 22 august 1920\n| death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|1944|12|25|1920|8|22}}\n| birth_place = [[spirkelbach]], [[germany]]\n| death_place = killed in action, [[manhay]], [[eifel]]\n| nickname =\n| allegiance = {{flagicon|nazi germany}} [[nazi germany]]\n| branch = [[image:flag schutzstaffel.svg|23px]] [[waffen ss]]\n| serviceyears = 1939–1944\n| rank = [[obersturmführer]]\n| unit = [[2 ss|2nd ss panzer division \'\'das reich\'\']]\n| commands =\n| battles = [[world war ii]]\n| awards = [[knight\'s cross of the iron cross]]<br />[[iron cross]] 1st class<br />[[iron cross]] 2nd class<br />[[wound badge]] in silver<br />[[panzer badge]] in silver \n| relations =\n| laterwork =\n}}\n\'\'\'adolf reeb\'\'\' was an [[obersturmführer]] (first lieutenant), in the [[waffen ss]] during [[world war ii]] who was awarded the [[knight\'s cross of the iron cross]]; which was awarded to recognize extreme battlefield bravery or successful military leadership by nazi germany during world war ii.\n\n==biography==\n\nadolf reeb was born on 22 august 1920 at [[spirkelbach]]. he volunteered to join the ss and was posted to the [[2 ss|\'\'das reich\'\' division]].  he became a platoon commander in the 7th company, 2nd ss panzer regiment and was awarded the knight\'s cross during the [[battle of the bulge|ardennes offensive]].{{citation needed|date=january 2012}}\n\nreeb was killed in action on 25 december 1944, at [[manhay]], [[eifel]], belgium.\n\n==notes==\n{{reflist|2}}\n\n==references==\n*{{cite book | last = mattson | first = gregory louis | title = ss—das reich: the history of the second ss division, 1939–45 | publisher = spellmount | year = 2002 |isbn = 1-86227-144-5}}\n*{{cite book | last = fellgiebel | first = walther-peer | title =die träger des ritterkreuzes des eisernen kreuzes 1939–1945 | lo
<page> <title>adolfo_caminha</title><text>{{infobox writer\n| name         = adolfo caminha\n| image        = adolfo ferreira caminha.jpg\n| imagesize    = 200px\n| alt          = \n| caption      = a photograph depicting caminha\n| pseudonym    = félix guanabarino\n| birth_name    = adolfo ferreira caminha\n| birth_date    = {{birth date|1867|5|29|df=y}}\n| birth_place   = [[aracati]], [[ceará]], [[brazil]]\n| death_date    = {{death date and age|1897|1|1|1867|5|29|df=y}}\n| death_place   = [[rio de janeiro|rio de janeiro city]], [[rio de janeiro (state)|rio de janeiro]], [[brazil]]\n| occupation   = [[novel]]ist, [[short story]] writer, [[poet]]\n| nationality  = {{flagicon|brazil}} brazilian\n| ethnicity    =\n| citizenship  =\n| education    =\n| alma_mater   =\n| period       =\n| genre        =\n| subject      =\n| movement     = [[naturalism (literature)|naturalism]]\n| notableworks = \'\'[[a normalista]]\'\', \'\'[[bom-crioulo]]\'\'\n| spouse       =\n| partner      =\n| children     =\n| relatives    =\n| influences   = [[Émile zola]]\n| influenced   = \n| awards       =\n| signature    =\n| website      =\n| portaldisp   =\n}}\n\'\'\'adolfo ferreira caminha\'\'\' (may 29, 1867 — january 1, 1897) was a [[brazil]]ian [[naturalism (literature)|naturalist]] novelist, famous for his polemical novel \'\'[[bom-crioulo]]\'\', which deals with [[homosexuality]].\n\n==life==\ncaminha was born in [[aracati]] in 1867, to raimundo ferreira dos santos and maria firmina caminha. orphaned when he was 10 years old, he went to live with his uncle in [[fortaleza]]. in 1883, he moved to [[rio de janeiro]], where another relative of his matriculated him in a naval school. in 1886, he published his first book: \'\'voos incertos\'\' (\'\'uncertain flights\'\'). in the same year, he made an instruction trip to the [[united states]].\n\nin 1887 he was promoted to [[second lieutenant]] and published the [[short story]] books \'\'judite\'\' and \'\'lágrimas de um crente\'\' (\
