<page> <title>adolph_coors_iii</title><text>\'\'\'adolph coors iii\'\'\' (january 12, 1916 – february 9, 1960) was the grandson of [[adolph coors]] and heir to the [[coors brewing company|coors]] [[beer]] empire.\n\n==biography==\nhe was born on january 12, 1916 and attended [[phillips exeter academy]] in [[new hampshire]]. like most of his family, including brother [[joseph coors]], adolph graduated from [[cornell university]], where he was president of the [[quill and dagger]] society and a member of the [[kappa alpha society]]. \n\non february 9, 1960, he was murdered at the age of 44 in a foiled kidnapping attempt while on his way to work by escaped murderer [[joseph corbett, jr.]] in [[colorado]].<ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title= denver brewer coors missing; fear kidnap. deserted car, motor on, found |url=http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/latimes/access/446145522.html?dids=446145522:446145522&fmt=abs&fmts=abs:ai&type=historic&date=feb+10,+1960&author=&pub=los+angeles+times&desc=denver+brewer+coors+missing;+fear+kidnap&pqatl=google |quote=adolph coors iii, wealthy brewer and industrialist, vanished from his blood-flecked car on a rural road yesterday, touching off a vast manhunt in the [[rocky mountain]] foothills west of denver... |work=[[los angeles times]] |date=february 10, 1960 |accessdate=2010-07-15 }}</ref> in september, the remains of coors were found by hunters in a remote area around [[pikes peak]]. the subject of an international manhunt, corbett was captured in [[vancouver]], [[british columbia]] in october of that year.<ref>[http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/latimes/access/478938722.html?dids=478938722:478938722&fmt=abs&fmts=abs:ai&type=historic&date=oct+30%2c+1960&author=&pub=los+angeles+times&desc=fbi+seizes+suspected+coors+killer+in+canada&pqatl=google fbi captures joseph corbett in canada]</ref>\n\n==legacy==\nan avid skier, he was inducted into the colorado ski and snowboard hall of fame in 1998.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.coloradoskihall
<page> <title>adolph_otto</title><text>\'\'\'adolph otto\'\'\' was a printer of [[gustrow]], mecklenburg-schwerin who printed the first stamps of transvaal of 1870.<ref name=sgsthaf>\'\'stanley gibbons stamp catalogue: southern africa\'\'. 2nd edition. london: [[stanley gibbons]], 2007, p. 62. isbn 0852596545</ref>\n\nlater, otto printed additional stamps from the original plates for sale to dealers for his own profit. he also applied fake cancels to the stamps and prepared new plates without permission to print additional stamps for his own benefit. the practices only stopped after he was visited by an official of the transvaal government in 1882 and plates and stamps were seized. the forged stamps were sold through the hamburg dealer [[julius goldner]].<ref name=tyler>[[varro eugene tyler|tyler, varro e.]] (1991) \'\'philatelic forgers: their lives and works\'\'. revised edn. sidney, ohio: linn\'s stamp news, amos press, pp. 88-89.</ref>\n\n==see also==\n*[[postage stamps and postal history of transvaal]]\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==further reading==\n*curle, j.h. & a.e. basden. (1940) \'\'transvaal postage stamps\'\'. london: [[royal philatelic society]].\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.bl.uk/onlinegallery/onlineex/philrar/t/010za0000001870u00001000.html transvaal: 1870 imperforate 1/- deep green, an unused tête-bêche pair.] [[british library philatelic collections]]\n{{commons category|philatelic fakes and forgeries}}\n{{commons category|stamps of transvaal}}\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = otto, adolph\n| alternative names =\n| short description = german stamp forger\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:otto, adolph}}\n[[category:year of birth unknown]]\n[[category:year of death unknown]]\n[[category:philately of south africa]]\n[[category:german printers]]\n[[category:stamp forgers]]\n\n\n{{philately-stub}}\n{{germany-
<page> <title>adolphe_abrahams</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=november 2012}}\n\'\'\'sir adolphe abrahams\'\'\' [[obe]] [[fellow of the royal college of physicians|frcp]] (6 february 1883 to 11 december 1967) was a british medical doctor, considered the founder of british sports science.  he was the elder brother of the athletes [[harold abrahams]] and [[sidney abrahams]], and was knighted in 1939.\n\n== references ==\n\n* ‘abrahams, sir adolphe’, who was who, a & c black, 1920–2008; online edn, oxford university press, dec 2007 [http://www.ukwhoswho.com/view/article/oupww/whowaswho/u52767, accessed 18 aug 2012]\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = abrahams, adolphe\n| alternative names =\n| short description = british medical doctor\n| date of birth     = 1883\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = 1967\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:abrahams, adolphe}}\n[[category:1883 births]]\n[[category:1967 deaths]]\n[[category:officers of the order of the british empire]]\n[[category:knights bachelor]]\n[[category:british medical doctors]]\n\n\n{{uk-bio-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adolphe_mengotti</title><text>{{medaltop}}\n{{medalsport | men\'s [[football at the summer olympics|football]]}}\n{{medalsilver| [[1924 summer olympics|1924 paris]] | [[football at the 1924 summer olympics|team competition]]}}\n{{medalbottom}}\n\n\'\'\'adolphe mengotti\'\'\' (born 12 november 1901, in [[valladolid]], [[spain]] - date of death unknown) was a [[switzerland|swiss]] [[football (soccer)]] player who competed in the [[1924 summer olympics]].\n\nhe was a member of the swiss team, which won the silver medal in the football tournament.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.databaseolympics.com/players/playerpage.htm?ilkid=mengoado01 profile]\n\n{{use dmy dates|date=february 2011}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              =mengotti, adolphe\n| alternative names =\n| short description = footballer\n| date of birth     = 12 november 1901\n| place of birth    = valladolid, spain\n| date of death     = unknown\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:mengotti, adolphe}}\n[[category:1901 births]]\n[[category:year of death missing]]\n[[category:people from valladolid]]\n[[category:swiss footballers]]\n[[category:footballers at the 1924 summer olympics]]\n[[category:olympic footballers of switzerland]]\n[[category:olympic silver medalists for switzerland]]\n[[category:switzerland international footballers]]\n[[category:olympic medalists in football]]\n\n\n{{switzerland-footy-bio-stub}}\n{{switzerland-olympic-medalist-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adolphe_millot</title><text>{{orphan|date=january 2011}}\n\n\'\'\'adolphe philippe millot\'\'\' (paris, 1 may 1857 – \'\'ibidem\'\', 18 december 1921) was a [[france|french]] naturalist [[illustrator]].\n\nhe worked for the \'\'[[grand larousse encyclopédique]]\'\'.\n\n==external links==\n*{{fr icon}} [http://www.larousse.fr/encyclopedie/article/millot_adolphe/11000967  www.larousse.fr]\n*[http://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=special%3asearch&search=adolphe+millot wikimedia commons]\n{{use dmy dates|date=january 2011}}\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = millot, adolphe\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     = 1 may 1857\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = 18 december 1921\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:millot, adolphe}}\n[[category:french illustrators]]\n[[category:artists from paris]]\n[[category:1857 births]]\n[[category:1921 deaths]]\n\n{{france-artist-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adolphe_schneider</title><text>{{infobox person\n| name = adolphe schneider\n| image = schneider, adolphe.jpg\n| alt =\n| caption =\n| birth_name = françois antoine adolphe schneider\n| birth_date = {{birth date|1802|10|23|df=y}}\n| birth_place = [[nancy, france|nancy]], meurthe, france\n| death_date = {{death date and age|1845|08|03|1802|10|23|df=y}}\n| death_place = creusot, saône-et-loire, france\n| nationality = french\n| other_names =\n| occupation = industrialist\n| known_for = \n}}\n\'\'\'adolphe schneider\'\'\' (23 october 1802 - 3 august 1845) was a french financier and industrialist who developed a major metalworking enterprise at [[le creusot]], the parent of today\'s [[schneider electric]].\n\n==early years==\n\nadolphe schneider was born in [[nancy, france]], on 23 october 1802.\nhe was the son of antoine schneider (1759-1828), châtelain de bidestroff, and catherine duran.{{sfn|adolphe schneider: geneanet}}\nhis cousin was [[antoine virgile schneider]] (1779-1847), who was known for his military service in greece. virgile married a polish heiress who brought a considerable dowry. he was elected a deputy for sarreguemines in 1834, became minister of war and was involved with construction of the fortifications of paris.{{sfn|fontaine|2010|p=19}}\n\nin 1821, at the age of nineteen, adolphe schneider entered the seillière bank. \nschneider had been recommended to françois seillière by his cousin virgile.{{sfn|fontaine|2010|p=20}}\nseillière was from a catholic family from lorraine that had moved to paris. the bank specialized in helping companies involved in iron-making and metallurgy such as ignace-françois de wendel.{{efn|the [[de wendel family]] had established a forge and foundry at [[hayange]] in lorraine.{{sfn|landes|1999|p=272}} }}{{sfn|landes|1999|p=272}} \nschneider quickly showed he had a strong business sense with exceptional qualities of listening, understanding, analysis and improvisation. \nin 1829 seillière began to giv
<page> <title>adolphus_william_young</title><text>\'\'\'adolphus william young\'\'\' (1814 – 4 november 1885) was an english solicitor who spent some years in [[new south wales]] and became involved in local politics. he  returned to england where he was a [[liberal party (uk)|liberal party]] politician who sat in the [[house of commons of the united kingdom|house of commons]] variously between 1857 and 1880.\n\nyoung was the son of adolphus young of [[hare hatch]] lodge, in the parish of [[wargrave]], [[berkshire]] and his wife frances haggard daughter of william haggard, of braham hall, norfolk. young went to [[new south wales]] where he practised for some years as a solicitor in sydney. he was [[high sheriff]] of new south wales from 1842 to 1849 and was a representative for the  [[port phillip district]] in the [[new south wales legislative council|legislative council]] before victoria was formed into a separate colony.<ref name=nsw>{{cite web| title =mr adolphus william young (1814 - 1885) | work =members of parliament| publisher =[[parliament of new south wales]]| url =http://www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/1fb6ebed995667c2ca256ea100825164/b8379b5875e269d4ca256f34000264f4| accessdate = 18 october 2010 }}</ref>  he returned to england and was a [[justice of the peace|j.p.]] and [[deputy lieutenant]] for berkshire.<ref name=debrett>[http://www.archive.org/stream/debrettshouseo1870londuoft#page/296/mode/2up debretts house of commons and the judicial bench 1870]</ref><ref>{{australian dictionary of biography\n|last=pike \n|first= a. f. \n|coauthors=\n|year=1988\n|id=a020580b\n|title= young, adolphus william (1814 - 1885) \n|accessdate=18 october 2010 }}</ref>\n\nyoung was first elected [[member of parliament]] (mp) for [[great yarmouth (uk parliament constituency)|great yarmouth]]  in 1857 but lost the seat in 1859. he was elected mp for  [[helston (uk parliament constituency)|helston]] at the [[united kingdom general election, 1865|1865 gene
<page> <title>adoni_maropis</title><text>{{infobox person\n| image =\n| caption =\n| birth_date      =  {{birth date and age|1963|7|20}}\n| birth_place     =  [[pittsburgh, pennsylvania]], [[united states|u.s.]]\n| occupation = actor\n| yearsactive = 1996–present\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adoni maropis\'\'\' (born july 20, 1963) is an american [[actor]].\n\nmaropis was born in [[pittsburgh, pennsylvania]], the middle of three sons. he is best known for playing [[quan chi]] in \'\'[[mortal kombat: conquest]]\'\'. he also played [[general hassan]] in \'\'[[command & conquer: tiberian sun]]\'\' as well as sakr in \'\'[[hidalgo (film)|hidalgo]]\'\'.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.google.ca/newspapers?id=2o8naaaaibaj&sjid=v3adaaaaibaj&pg=4900,143061&dq=adoni-maropis&hl=en|title=local actor thriving |date=march 11, 2004|publisher=\'\'[[pittsburgh post-gazette]]\'\'|accessdate=february 9, 2010}}</ref> he appeared in a recurring role as terrorist leader [[abu fayed]] in season six of \'\'[[24 (tv series)|24]]\'\'<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/07019/755004-237.stm|title=films and tv up the ante on graphic torture scenes|date=january 19, 2007|publisher=\'\'pittsburgh post-gazette\'\'|accessdate=february 9, 2010}}</ref> and as an assassin in the season three premier of the television series \'\'[[chuck (tv series)|chuck]]\'\'.\n\nmaropis is also a world class [[table tennis]] player, preferring the \"orthodox styles\" of [[hardbat]] and [[sandpaper table tennis]]. as of this writing (july 2012) he holds titles as world and us champion for [[sandpaper table tennis]] and also won the [[hardbat]] class of the us championship in 2011.  maropis is currently working on a feature film project entitled \"the last palikari\" written by himself and his father, petro maropis.  a short version of the project was completed in 2012 with vertex media in los angeles, ca.\n\n==filmography==\n*\'\'[[mortal kombat: conquest]]\'\' (1999) .. quan chi\n*\'\'[[passion cove]]\'\' .. matt\n

<page> <title>adrenalina</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=february 2009}}\n{{infobox album\n| name        = adrenalina\n| type        = studio\n| artist      = [[finley (band)|finley]]\n| cover       =adrenalina.jpeg\n| released    = june 2008 ([[italy]])\n| recorded    = 2008\n| length      = 41:33\n| genre       = [[rock music|rock]], [[pop punk]], [[pop rock]]\n| label       = [[emi]]\n| chronology  = [[finley (band)|finley]]\n| last album  = [[tutto è possibile]] (2006)\n| this album  = adrenalina (2007)\n| next album  = [[adrenalina 2]] (2008)\n}}\n\'\'\'adrenalina\'\'\' is [[finley (band)|finley]]\'s second studio album. ir was released on june 15, 2008 by [[emi]].\n\nthey have already been released three singles from this cd: \'\'adrenalina\'\', \'\'domani\'\' and \'\'questo sono io\'\'. \'\'niente da perdere\'\' was played for the first time as anticipating the album adrenalina at the mtv trl awards 2007, which took place in milan, on april 14, in piazza duomo, followed by a medley of \'\'fumo e cenere\'\', \'\'tutto è possibile\'\' and \'\'diventerai una star\'\'. during the tour on trl, in bari and in roma they played the song \'\'domani\'\', the second single from the album. on friday 28 september 2007 for the first time it was sent their second exclusive video of \'\'domani\'\' in the television broadcast trl. in addition, mtv choose finley with their video of \'\'domani\'\' to open from 1 october 2007 pulse, a new digital channel. on 1 december 2007 they performed live to the kids\' choice awards their third single, \'\'questo sono io\'\'.\n\n==track listing==\n\n{{tracklist\n| collapsed       = no\n| all_writing     = [[marco pedretti]], [[carmine ruggiero]], [[stefano mantegazza]] and [[danilo calvio]]\n| extra_column    = main vocalist\n| title1  = niente da perdere\n| length1 = 3:30\n| extra1  = pedro\n| title2  = [[adrenalina (song)|adrenalina]]\n| length2 = 2:55\n| extra2  = pedro\n| title3  = c\'è qualcosa che non va\n| length3 = 3:12\n| extra
<page> <title>adrenarche</title><text>\'\'\'adrenarche\'\'\' is an early [[sexual maturation]] stage in some higher [[primate]]s that in [[human]]s typically occurs at around 6 to 8 years of age. during adrenarche the [[adrenal cortex]] secretes increased levels of [[androgen]]s such as [[dhea]] and [[dheas]], but without  increased [[cortisol]] levels. adrenarche is the result of the development of a new zone of the adrenal cortex, the [[zona reticularis]].<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = parker | first1 = ln | title = adrenarche | journal = endocrinology and metabolism clinics of north america | volume = 20 | issue = 1 | pages = 71–83 | year = 1991 | pmid = 2029889 }}</ref>  adrenarche is a process related to [[puberty]], but distinct from [[hypothalamus|hypothalamic]]-[[pituitary gland|pituitary]]-[[gonad]]al maturation and function.\n\n==animal prevalence==\nadrenarche occurs in only a small number of primates, and only [[chimpanzee]]s and [[gorilla]]s show a pattern of adrenarche development similar to humans.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = cutler jr | first1 = gb | last2 = glenn | first2 = m | last3 = bush | first3 = m | last4 = hodgen | first4 = gd | last5 = graham | first5 = ce | last6 = loriaux | first6 = dl | title = adrenarche: a survey of rodents, domestic animals, and primates | journal = endocrinology | volume = 103 | issue = 6 | pages = 2112–8 | year = 1978 | pmid = 155005 | doi=10.1210/endo-103-6-2112}}</ref>\n\n==role in puberty==\nan initiator of adrenarche has not yet been identified. researchers have unsuccessfully tried to identify a new pituitary peptide, to be called \"adrenal androgen stimulating hormone\". others have proposed that adrenarchal maturation is a gradual process intrinsic to the adrenal glands that has no distinct trigger. a third avenue of research is pursuing a possible relationship with either fetal or childhood body mass and related signals such as [[insulin]] and [[leptin]]. many children born small for gestational age (sga)
<page> <title>adria_locke_langley</title><text>\n\'\'\'adria locke langley\'\'\' (1899- august 14, 1983) was an [[united states|american]] author best known for her first novel, published in 1945, the best seller \'\'a lion is in the streets\'\' based on life of [[huey long]].  it was made into a film of the [[a lion is in the streets|same name]] in 1953.  she also was a fervent supporter of the repeal of [[prohibition in the united states|prohibition]].  she grew up in [[stanton, nebraska]].<ref name=\"blade1\">coakley, eleanor (12 june 1945). <page> <title>adrian_dvir</title><text>{{orphan|date=july 2009}}\n\n\'\'\'adrian dvir\'\'\' (born in 1958 in [[bucharest]], [[romania]] - died june 6, 2004) was an author and [[mediumship|medium]].<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=ba_mzmjfnjgc&pg=pt87&dq=%22adrian+dvir%22&hl=en&sa=x&ei=2d0mt8bceilq0gg5qsjobq&ved=0ceaq6aewaq#v=onepage&q=%22adrian%20dvir%22&f=false]</ref>\n\nhe held a b.sc ([[bachelor of science]]) in engineering and an m.sc ([[master of science]]) in computer engineering, specializing in computer architecture.  married with two children and living in [[israel]] since 1965, dvir was employed as a developer of military computer systems.<ref>[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=ibjqaaaaibaj&sjid=1fudaaaaibaj&pg=5813,3256410&dq=adrian-dvir&hl=en]</ref>  he acknowledged and began to use his abilities as a medium in 1992, and first became aware of alien other-dimensional beings in 1994.\n\nadrian dvir died on june 6, 2004 from a severe and fatal attack of [[infectious mononucleosis]] and died in his sleep whilst sitting in his armchair one night.\n\n==books==\ndvir is the author of three books, of which only one has been translated to english. his first book, \"x3, healing, entities and aliens\", was published in [[hebrew language|hebrew]] in 2000, and was closely followed by his second book- \"cured by aliens\". it was about another year until his first book was translated to english, in 2003.\nhis third book was published in romanian, and is actually his two previous books under a single binder.\n\n==references==\n\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.adriandvir.com adrian dvir\'s website]\n*[http://imminst.org immortality institute website - criticism]\n\n{{authority control|viaf=97786353}}\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = dvir, adrian\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     = 1958\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = june 6, 2004\n| place of death
<page> <title>adrian_grygiel</title><text>{{infobox ice hockey player\n| name = adrian grygiel\n| image = \n| caption =\n| image_size = 230px\n| team = [[grizzly adams wolfsburg]] \n| league = [[deutsche eishockey liga|del]] \n| former_teams = [[krefeld pinguine]]<br>[[thomas sabo ice tigers]]\n| ntl_team = germany\n| position = [[winger (ice hockey)|right wing]]\n| shoots = right\n| height_ft = 5\n| height_in = 11\n| weight_lb = 187\n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1983|08|13}}\n| birth_place = [[katowice]], [[poland]]\n| draft = undrafted\n| career_start = 2000\n| career_end = \n}}\n\'\'\'adrian grygiel\'\'\' (born may 8, 1983) is a [[poland|polish]]-born [[germany|german]] professional [[ice hockey]] player. he is currently playing for [[grizzly adams wolfsburg]] in the [[deutsche eishockey liga]] (del). he has previously played with [[krefeld pinguine]] and the [[thomas sabo ice tigers]] in the del.<ref>{{citeweb| url = http://del.stats.pointstreak.com/teamplayerstats.html?teamid=92243&seasonid=7325 | title = thomas sabo ice tigers roster | publisher = \'\'[[thomas sabo ice tigers]]\'\' | date = 2011-10-04 | accessdate = 2011-10-04 | language = german}}</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*{{eliteprospects|21596}}\n*{{hockeydb|55704}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name = frosch, dusan\n| alternative names = \n| short description = german ice hockey player\n| date of birth = may 8, 1983\n| place of birth = [[katowice]], [[poland]]\n| date of death = \n| place of death = \n}}\n{{defaultsort:grygiel, adrian}}\n[[category:1983 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:german ice hockey players]]\n[[category:krefeld pinguine players]]\n[[category:thomas sabo ice tigers players]]\n[[category:ehc wolfsburg players]]\n\n\n{{germany-icehockey-bio-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adrian_lamo</title><text>{{infobox person\n|name        = adrian lamo\n|image       = adrian lamo.png\n|caption     = adrian lamo\n|birth_date  = {{birth date and age|1981|02|20}}\n|birth_place = [[boston]], [[massachusetts]]\n|other_names = adrián lamo, r. adrián lamo\n|occupation  = [[computer security]] consultant\n|website     = {{url|https://twitter.com/6}}<br>{{url|https://facebook.com/felon}}<br>{{url|http://warrantless.tumblr.com/}}\n|parents     = mario lamo and mary atwood\n}}\n\'\'\'adrian lamo\'\'\' (born february 20, 1981{{citation needed|date=june 2013}}) is an [[united states|american]] [[computer security]] consultant<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/68662/security_holes_closed_in_new_york_times_intranet_after_hacker_intrusion?pagenumber=1 |title=security holes closed in new york times intranet after hacker intrusion |author=todd r. weiss |date=27 february 2002 |accessdate=07 september 2013}}</ref> and former [[hacker (computer security)|hacker]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://articles.washingtonpost.com/2013-06-04/world/39729591_1_hacker-adrian-lamo-ashden-fein-manning-s |title=hacker adrian lamo testifies at wikileaks suspect bradley manning’s court-martial |publisher=[[washington post]] |date=04 june 2013 |accessdate=07 september 2013}}</ref>\n\nlamo first gained media attention for breaking into several high-profile computer networks, including those of \'\'[[the new york times]]\'\', [[yahoo!]], and [[microsoft]], culminating in his 2003 arrest.<ref name=kahn>{{cite web|url=http://www.wired.com/wired/archive/12.04/hacker_pr.html |title=wired 12.04: the homeless hacker v. the new york times |publisher=wired.com |date= |accessdate=2013-08-25}}</ref>  in 2010, lamo reported u.s. soldier pfc. bradley manning (later known as [[chelsea manning]]) to federal authorities, claiming that manning had [[internet leak|leaked]] hundreds of thousands of sensitive u.s. government documents to [[wikileaks]]. manning was a

<page> <title>adrian_mora</title><text>{{infobox boxer|name= adrián mora\n|image=\n|realname          = adrián mora\n|nickname          = juanito\n|weight            = [[welterweight]]\n|height            = 6 ft 0 in (183 cm)\n|reach             = 78 in (198 cm)\n|nationality       = american\n|birth_date        = {{birth date and age|1978|9|2}}\n|death_date        \n|birth_place       = [[thornton, colorado]]\n|home_town         = [[thornton, colorado]]\n|style             = [[orthodox stance|orthodox]]\n|total             = 22\n|wins              = 20\n|ko                = 12\n|losses            = 1\n|draws             = 1\n|no contests       = 0\n}}\n\'\'\'adrián mora\'\'\' (born february 26, 1978 in [[thornton, colorado]]) is a [[mexican american]] professional [[boxing|boxer]] and the former [[international boxing association (professional body)|iba]] [[light welterweight]] champion.<ref>http://www.boxingscene.com/silverhawk-boxing-signs-adrian-mora--4362</ref> adrián is the younger brother of both [[light welterweight]] contender anthony mora and boxing referee russell mora.<ref>http://boxrec.com/list_bouts.php?human_id=57995&cat=boxer</ref>\n\n==amateur career==\nmora had an amateur career of 62-8 and also won a silver medal at the 2000 western trials. he\'s the younger brother of both [[light welterweight]] contender anthony mora and boxing referee russell mora.\n\n==professional career==\nin january 2007, adrián flattened american aaron drake to win the national boxing association [[light welterweight]] championship.<ref>http://www.championsofboxing.com/new_adrian_mora.html</ref>\n\n===iba light welterweight championship===\non may 15, 2007 mora destroyed marc thompson (15-1) in just the first round to become the [[international boxing association (professional body)|iba]] [[light welterweight]] championship.<ref>http://boxrec.com/media/index.php/adrian_mora_vs._marc_thompson</ref> this bout was held at the broomfield event center in [[broomfield, colo
<page> <title>adrian_pagan</title><text>\'\'\'adrian pagan\'\'\' (born 12 january 1947, [[mungindi]], queensland, australia) is an [[australia]]n economist and professor of economics in the school of economics at the  [[university of sydney]]. from 1995 to 2000 he was a member of the board of the [[reserve bank of australia]] <ref name=\"urlrba: past & present board members\">{{cite web |url=http://www.rba.gov.au/abouttherba/history/rba_board_members.html |title=rba: past & present board members |work= |accessdate=}}</ref>\n\n==career==\n\npagan was educated at the [[university of queensland]], where he gained first class honours in economics, and completed his phd at the [[australian national university]] in 1972.<ref name=\"urlwww.bus.qut.edu.au\">{{cite web |url=http://www.bus.qut.edu.au/adrianpagan/documents/cv1.pdf |title=adrian pagan cv |format= |work= |accessdate=}}</ref> he has held visiting and permanent appointments at anu and at a number of universities around the world including the university of oxford, the university of rochester, princeton university, yale university, johns hopkins university and the university of california at los angeles.\n\n==major contributions==\n\npagan is known for work in [[time-series econometrics]] and [[hypothesis testing]], notably including the [[breusch–pagan test]] for [[heteroscedasticity]] and other applications of the [[lagrange multiplier test]]. his recent work has focused on macro-econometric modeling and its uses in policy analysis and for the explanation of business cycles.\n\n==honours==\npagan is a fellow of the [[academy of social sciences in australia]], the [[econometric society]] and the [[journal of econometrics]]; a medallist fellow of the [[modelling and simulation society of australia and new zealand]]; and has been awarded the distinguished fellow medal of the [[economic society of australia]].\n\n== see also ==\n* [[nicola acocella]]\n\n==notes==\n{{reflist|2}}\n\n{{authority control|viaf=29030010}

<page> <title>adrian_sina</title><text>{{infobox musical artist\n| name = adrian sina\n| image = adi sina performing.jpg\n| image_size = 200px\n| background = non_vocal_instrumentalist\n| birth_name=adrian claudiu sînă\n| birth_date = {{birth date and age|1977|4|18|df=yes}}\n| origin = [[baia mare]], [[romania]]\n| genre = [[house music|house]], [[electro music|electronic]], [[dancepop]]\n| instrument = vocals\n| occupation = [[musician]], [[dj]], [[record producer]], [[performer]], [[singer-songwriter]], [[radio dj]], [[entertainer]] \n| years_active = 1999–present\n| label = [[roton (label)|roton]], sisterhoodlive records\n| associated_acts = [[akcent]], ramona barta, marius nedelcu, [[edward maya]], [[mia martina]], [[nico (romanian singer)|nico]], lora, roller sis, vivien o\'hara, [[beverlei brown]], sandra n, ruxandra bar, diana hetea, etc.\n| website = {{url|www.adriansina.com/}}\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adrian claudiu sînă\'\'\' (born april 18, 1977), better known as \'\'\'adrian sina\'\'\' or simply \'\'\'adi sina\'\'\' is a [[romania]]n [[singer-songwriter]], [[record producer]], [[radio dj]] and [[entertainer]]. he is best known for creating, producing and singing in the dance group [[akcent]] and also for writing and producing [[mainstream]] hit songs for himself and other international artists. he started out as a [[disc jockey]] in the 1990s and then created a group with his fellow musician ramona barta. he came to prominence as a member of [[akcent]] with the song \"ultima varǎ\" (\'\'the last summer\'\') in 1999. his group was joined by marius nedelcu, sorin brotnei and mihai gruia. together they scored multiple number-one hits both in [[romania]] and throughout [[eastern europe]], especially in the mid-2000s. their albums have been certified multi-[[music recording sales certification|platinum]] by the [[romanian top 100|uniunea naţională a producătorilor de fonograme din românia]] and were sold in millions of copies worldwide. their [[signature song]

<page> <title>adrianna_lamalle</title><text>{{infobox sportsperson\n|birth_date=september 27, 1982\n|birth_place=\n|medaltemplates={{medalsport|women\'s [[athletics (sport)|athletics]]}}\n{{medalcountry|{{fra}}}}\n{{medalcompetition|[[mediterranean games]]}}\n{{medalsilver|[[2005 mediterranean games|2005 almería]]|[[athletics at the 2005 mediterranean games|100m hurdles]]}}\n{{medalcountry | {{glp}} }}\n{{medalcompetition|[[carifta games]] <br> junior (u20)}}\n{{medalgold |[[1999 carifta games|1999 fort-de-france]] | 100 m hurdles}}\n{{medalgold |[[2000 carifta games|2000 st. george\'s]] | 100 m hurdles}}\n{{medalgold |[[2001 carifta games|2001 bridgetown]] | 100 m hurdles}}\n{{medalbronze |[[1999 carifta games|1999 fort-de-france]] | 100 m}}\n{{medalcompetition|[[carifta games]] <br> youth (u17)}}\n{{medalgold |[[1998 carifta games|1998 port of spain]] | 100 m hurdles}}\n}}\n\n\'\'\'adrianna lamalle\'\'\' (born september 27, 1982) is a [[france|french]] hurdler born in les abymes, guadeloupe. \n\nshe finished 8th in the [[100m hurdles]] final at the [[2006 european athletics championships]] in [[gothenburg]].\n\nshe also won the bronze medal in the same event at the [[2000 world junior championships in athletics|2000 world junior championships]]<ref>http://www.gbrathletics.com/ic/wj.htm</ref> running 13.27 seconds.\n\nadriana won the 100m hurdles at the 1st iaaf world youth championships<ref>http://www.gbrathletics.com/ic/wy.htm</ref> in bydgoszcz, poland. she ran 13.08 to win, still the [[list of world youth bests in athletics|best time ever]]<ref>http://www.iaaf.org/statistics/toplists/inout=o/age=y/season=0/sex=w/all=y/legal=a/disc=100hy/detail.html</ref> run by an athlete under the age of 18. she also ran 11.66 to finish third in the flat 100. \n\nher best time in the women\'s 100 hurdles is 12.67,<ref>http://www.iaaf.org/athletes/biographies/country=fra/athcode=170259/index.html</ref> which she achieved in 2006.\n\n==references==\n\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external

<page> <title>adrien_duquesnoy</title><text>\'\'\'adrien dusquenoy\'\'\' (26 november 1759 &ndash; 3 march 1808)<ref name=\"assemblee-nationale\">{{cite web|url=http://www.assemblee-nationale.fr/sycomore/fiche.asp?num_dept=11882 |title=adrien, cyprien duquesnoy |accessdate=2012-09-08 |work=assemblee-nationale}}</ref> was a leading figure in the [[french revolution]].\n\ndusquenoy was born in [[briey]].  he was elected as a deputy for [[nancy, france|nancy]], where he had been mayor, for the third estate in the estates general of 1789. he took part in the [[storming of the bastille]], where he remarked famously, \"yes, truly we shall be free! our hands will never wear shackles again.\"\n\nhe subsequently joined the national convention, where he was regarded as a moderate. he came under the suspicion of the committee of public safety late in the \'[[reign of terror]]\', but was saved from the [[guillotine]] by the [[thermidorian reaction]]. \n\nunder [[napoleon]], he worked at the ministry of the interior.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = duquesnoy, adrien\n| alternative names =\n| short description =\n| date of birth     = 26 november 1759\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = 3 march 1808\n| place of death    =\n}}\n\n{{defaultsort:duquesnoy, adrien}}\n[[category:1759 births]]\n[[category:1808 deaths]]\n[[category:people from meurthe-et-moselle]]\n{{france-hist-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adrienne_anderson</title><text>\'\'\'adrienne anderson\'\'\' is an american songwriter, most notable for being the co-writer of \"[[could it be magic]]\", among other [[barry manilow]] songs, as well as being the co-writer of [[signature song]]s for [[dionne warwick]] (\"[[déjà vu (dionne warwick song)|déjà vu]]\") and [[peter allen]] (\"[[i go to rio]]\").\n\n==history==\n\nadrienne anderson (maiden name arzt, married neal anderson) has had a continuing association with barry manilow that goes back to his first album, released in july, 1973, and which featured their co-written \"[[could it be magic]]\".\n\n==collaboration==\n* [[barry manilow]]\n* [[enoch anderson]]\n* [[melissa manchester]] \n* [[bette midler]]\n* [[isaac hayes]]\n* [[leon ware]]\n\nactually, their collaboration goes back even further. in late 1970 or very early 1971, barry manilow recorded anderson\'s composition of \"amy\". this was issued as bell single 971 in february, 1971 as by featherbed featuring barry manilow. this was the very first release of any kind for manilow.\n\nanderson and manilow have co-written approximately thirty songs that have been recorded.<ref>[http://www.garyoye.com/barrynet/bmnet262.htm barry manilow - his music: who writes the songs]. the barry net; www.garyoye.com/barrynet.</ref>  two of their best-known collaborations are \"could it be magic\" and \"[[daybreak (barry manilow song)|daybreak]]\".  when manilow was inducted into the [[songwriters hall of fame]] in 2002, he made a point of attending with and crediting his co-writers, including anderson.<ref>[http://en.allexperts.com/q/manilow-barry-511/barry-hit-songs.htm \"barry\'s hit songs\"].  response by john w. baldwin, march 12, 2006, to question, \"who wrote the most hit songs for barry?\".  other manilow co-writers who attended the songwriters hall of fame ceremonies with anderson were [[marty panzer]], [[enoch anderson]] and [[bruce sussman]]; www.en.allexperts.com.</ref>  in 2010, anderson wa
<page> <title>adrsta</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'adrsta\'\'\'\'\' ({{lang-sa|अदृष्ट}}, pronounced: adrsta) is a concept in [[indian philosophy]] often confused with \'\'[[karma]]\'\'. whereas karma can be seen as a direct result of one\'s own actions, \'\'adrsta\'\' is more akin to the notion of fate or [[destiny]]. it implies an unknown and invisible force at work behind the universe.\n\nthe concept of \'\'adrsta\'\' is discussed in the \'\'vaiśeṣika sūtra\'\', the main text of the [[vaisheshika]] hindu school of philosophy, as part of its philosophical discussion on the composition of our world and universe. after explaining the atomistic cosmology that this text theorizes as the order of existence, it focuses on that which cannot be attributed to nature from a scientific point of view, such as phenomena{{which|date=september 2012}} and the inexplicable. such occurrences are attributed to manifestations of \'\'adrsta\'\', or a supersensible force behind all things.<ref>\"indian philosophy :: the \"vaisesika-sutras\" -- britannica online encyclopedia.\" encyclopedia - britannica online encyclopedia. web. 24 nov. 2010.<http://www.britannica.com/ebchecked/topic/285905/indian-philosophy/61603/the-vaisesika-sutras?anchor=ref314663></ref>\n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:indian philosophy]]\n\n\n{{philosophy-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adscita_schmidti</title><text>{{italic title }}\n{{taxobox\n| name = adscita schmidti\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[zygaenidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[adscita]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. schmidti\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'adscita schmidti\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[albert jun. naufock|naufock]], 1933)<ref>[http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=440598 fauna europaea]</ref>\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'procris schmidti\'\' <small>naufock, 1933</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'adscita schmidti\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[zygaenidae]] [[family (biology)|family]]. it is found on the [[iberian peninsula]] west of [[ebro]]\n\nthe length of the forewings is 10-13.5 mm for males and 9-13 mm for females. adults are on wing from may to august.\n\nthe larvae feed on \'\'[[rumex acetosa]]\'\' and \'\'[[rumex acetosella]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n*c. m. naumann, w. g. tremewan: \'\'the western palaearctic zygaenidae\'\'. apollo books, stenstrup 1999, isbn 87-88757-15-3\n\n{{commons}}\n{{wikispecies}}\n\n[[category:procridinae]]\n[[category:animals described in 1933]]\n\n{{zygaenidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adsidui</title><text>in [[ancient rome]], \'\'\'\'\'adsidui\'\'\'\'\' (also \'\'assidui\'\'; sg. \'\'adsiduus\'\' or \'\'assiduus\'\', [[latin]] for \"diligent, loyal\", and collectively, \"[[tax-payers]]\"<ref>[http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=perseus%3atext%3a1999.04.0060%3aentry%3dadsiduus \'\'adsiduus\'\' in charlton t. lewis, \'\'an elementary latin dictionary\'\']</ref>) were the citizens who were liable to [[military service]] in the main line of battle, that is, for much of the history of the [[roman republic]], as [[legionaries]]. the \'\'adsidui\'\' were the members of the [[social class in ancient rome|first five census classes]], which were, according to the roman historian [[livy]], created under the reign of [[servius tullius#army|servius tullius]], the sixth legendary [[roman king|king]] of [[ancient rome]].<ref>livy, \'\'history of rome\'\', [http://old.perseus.tufts.edu/cgi-bin/ptext?doc=perseus%3atext%3a1999.02.0026;layout=;query=chapter%3d%2342;loc=1.42 book i, chapter 42] and [http://old.perseus.tufts.edu/cgi-bin/ptext?doc=perseus%3atext%3a1999.02.0026;layout=;query=chapter%3d%2342;loc=1.43 book i, chapter 43]</ref> under tullius\' original organisation, the first class was made of the richest, and thus best-equipped citizens, with [[helmet]], [[shield]], [[greave]]s, [[cuirass]], [[spear]] and [[sword]]. as one went down through the classes and the corresponding levels of wealth, equipment went lighter and lighter.<ref>connolly, peter, \'\'greece and rome at war\'\', pp95-96.</ref> according to [[peter connolly]], the goal of tullius\' reform was to base military service on wealth, and not race, thus better integrating the [[etruscan civilization|etruscans]], who at that time ruled [[rome]], and the [[roman kingdom|romans]] themselves ; he points out, however, that in the beginning most members of the richest first class must have been etruscans.<ref>connolly, peter, \'\'greece and rome at war\'\', p95.</ref>\n\nthe \'\
<page> <title>adult_check</title><text>{{redirect|cybernet ventures}}\n\n\'\'\'adult check, inc.\'\'\' created and hosted one of the first and largest online age verification services.  the network of web sites using the adult check verification system reached as many as 400,000<ref name=\"forbes\">{{cite news|last=lubove|first=seth|title=see no evil.|work=forbes magazine|date=17 september 2001|url=http://www.forbes.com/forbes/2001/0917/068.html|accessdate=<!-----25 february 2010----->}}</ref> and the \'\'\'adultcheck.com\'\'\' domain was ranked in the top 100 most visited [[website|internet web sites]] as late as 1999.<ref>{{cite news|date=10 august 1999|title=apple ranks in the top 100 web sites internet-wide for july.|publisher=mac observer|accessdate=3 march 2010|url=http://www.macobserver.com/news/99/august/990810/pcdatajulywebsites.html}}</ref>\n\n==background==\nage verification services (avs) arose as an effort to limit access by minors to [[internet_pornography|adult sites]] by providing access to a large number of sites through a common id and [[password]]. \'\'\'cybernet ventures, inc.\'\'\' created the adult check system when the [[communications decency act of 1996]] allowed websites to let visitors prove they were adults by using credit cards.<ref>{{cite news|last=dotinga|first=randy|title=dirty sites jittery after ruling.|work=wired magazine|date=10 may 2002|url=http://www.wired.com/techbiz/media/news/2002/05/52429|accessdate=3 march 2010}}</ref> for a fee, customers bought an adult check password that unlocked hundreds of thousands of sites, and operators of these sites (webmasters) received a commission.<ref>{{cite web|last=gimein|first=mark|title=sex sells, doesn\'t it?|date=1 december 1999|publisher=[[salon.com]]|url=http://www.salon.com/technology/feature/1999/12/01/ieg/print.html|accessdate=3 march 2010}}</ref>\n\nforbes estimated adult check\'s annual revenue as $320 million in 2001.<ref name=\"forbes\"/>\n\n==perfect 10 lawsuit==\non april 22,

(actor)|prabhu]]), a christian boy, hates radha ([[urvashi (actress)|urvashi]]), a brahmin girl. mary, albert\'s siter, and raja, radha\'s brother are in love. albert decides to help the lovers but the lovers commit suicide to save their family. albert and radha begin to scare their family, they finally fall in love with each other.\n\n==cast==\n\n*[[prabhu (actor)|prabhu]] as albert\n*[[urvashi julia: \'\'1999 kit aircraft directory\'\', kitplanes, volume 15, number 12, december 1998, page 37. primedia publications. issn 0891-1851</ref> [[highcraft aeromarine]], [[advanced aviation]] and [[keuthan aircraft]].\n\n==development==\nthe original single-seat model buccaneer xa was introduced in 1984 and qualified for the us [[ultralight aircraft (united states)|far 103 ultralight vehicle]] category. the aircraft was commercial success and sold well until being replaced by the buccaneer sx in 1988. the sx remained available on the market until general production ended in 1998, although in 2001 the model 
<page> <title>advanced_component_framework</title><text>{{infobox software\n| name                   =  acf\n| logo                   = \n| screenshot             = [[file:acfcompositor.png|300px]]\n| caption                = the compositor tool used to edit component connections\n| collapsible            = yes\n| developer              = [[imagingtools]]\n| status                 = active\n| latest release version = 1.6.3.5\n| latest release date    = {{release date and age|2012|09|22}}\n| programming language   = [[c++]]\n| operating system       = [[cross-platform]]\n| genre                  = [[application framework]]\n| license                = [[gnu lgpl]]\n| website                = [http://www.ilena.org/ www.ilena.org]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'advanced component framework\'\'\' (\'\'\'acf\'\'\') is a c++ component framework created by imagingtools.\nusing the built-acf compositor tool, the internal application architecture can be visually edited. the front end is based on the [[qt (framework)|qt]] gui framework by [[nokia]].\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.ilena.org/redmine/ the acf project homepage]\n* [http://www.ilena.org/download/acf/ the download page]\n* [http://www.ilena.org/technicaldocs/acf/index.html technical documentation of acf]\n\n[[category:software that uses qt]]\n[[category:application programming interfaces]]</text> </page>

<page> <title>advanced_flow_engineering</title><text>{{multiple issues|\n\n{{notability|companies|date=august 2012}}\n\n|advert = august 2012|orphan = september 2012|coi = august 2012}}\n\'\'\'advanced flow engineering\'\'\' (afe) is a manufacturer of high performance automotive [[cold air intake]] systems, performance [[air filter]]s, fluid filters, intake manifolds, turbochargers, programmers, [[throttle body spacer]]s and [[exhaust systems]].<ref>dicker,allen (2009, june) [http://www.sema.org/sema-enews/2009/23/member-visit-advanced-flow-engineering sema enews] vol. 12 no.22</ref> afe was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in [[corona, california]] in two facilities totaling {{convert|160000|sqft|m2|lk=off|sigfig=2|abbr=on}} including their {{convert|77000|sqft|m2|lk=off|sigfig=2|abbr=on}} headquarters and manufacturing facilities. an {{convert|87000|sqft|m2|lk=off|sigfig=2|abbr=on}} warehouse and r&d facility was added in 2012.\n\n==history==\nafe’s product line up currently includes over 2,300 applications, which are all designed, developed and manufactured in corona, ca.<ref>thompson,j. (2011, march) project 6.7,dieselpower, p.108-110.</ref> the afe power product line-up includes performance air filters, air intake and exhaust systems for most late model cars and trucks. in the fall of 2007, afe added diesel fluid filters for diesel applications. in 2008, afe introduced the aries 1 and aries 2 performance filters and intakes for popular powersport applications. in 2009 saw the release of the bladerunner intercooler [[intercooler]] for performance diesel applications as well as the takeda usa intake line for sport compacts. in 2012 afe power entered into the differential cover and transmission pan market. 2011 saw the release of a new turbocharger and scorcher programmer product lines.\n\nafe produces three versions of air filter media including their original pro 5r, pro guard 7 and pro dry s. the pro 5r media is a progressive five layer cotton gauze media
<page> <title>advanced_placement_awards</title><text>{{advanced placement}}\nthe [[college board]] offers several awards to select students who take \'\'\'advanced placement (ap)\'\'\' exams.\nthe term \"award\" is perhaps misleading, as no benefit is awarded to the recipient except the title itself.\n\n==ap scholar designations==\neach year, the ap program recognizes students who have performed exceptionally well on ap examinations. exams are taken in may and awards are usually granted in september. the following designations can be earned:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.collegeboard.com/student/testing/ap/scholarawards.html |title=ap scholar awards |publisher=college board |accessdate=2006-07-09 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20060708235951/http://www.collegeboard.com/student/testing/ap/scholarawards.html |archivedate=8 july 2006<!--dashbot--> |deadurl=no}}</ref>\n\n{| border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"4\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;\"\n|+\'\'\'ap scholar awards\'\'\'\n!designation\n!criteria\n|-\n|ap scholar\n|grades of \'\'\'3\'\'\' or better on \'\'\'three\'\'\' or more ap exams.\n|-\n|ap scholar with honor\n|grades of \'\'\'3\'\'\' or better on \'\'\'four\'\'\' or more ap exams \'\'\'and\'\'\' an average of \'\'\'3.25\'\'\' on all ap exams taken.\n|-\n|ap scholar with distinction\n|grades of \'\'\'3\'\'\' or better on \'\'\'five\'\'\' or more ap exams \'\'\'and\'\'\' an average of \'\'\'3.5\'\'\' on all ap exams taken.\n|-\n|national ap scholar\n|grades of \'\'\'4\'\'\' or better on \'\'\'eight\'\'\' or more ap exams \'\'\'and\'\'\' an average of \'\'\'4\'\'\' on all ap exams. must be a student in the [[united states]].\n|-\n|national ap scholar (canada)\n|grades of \'\'\'4\'\'\' or better on \'\'\'five\'\'\' or more ap exams \'\'\'and\'\'\' an average of \'\'\'4\'\'\' on all ap exams taken. must be a student in [[canada]].\n|-\n|ap state scholar\n|top
<page> <title>advanced_vector_extensions</title><text>\'\'\'advanced vector extensions\'\'\' (\'\'\'avx\'\'\') are extensions to the [[x86]] [[instruction set architecture]] for [[microprocessor]]s from [[intel corporation|intel]] and [[advanced micro devices|amd]] proposed by intel in march 2008 and first supported by intel with the [[sandy bridge]] processor shipping in q1 2011 and later on by amd with the [[bulldozer (microarchitecture)|bulldozer]] processor shipping in q3 2011. \'\'\'[[avx-512]]\'\'\' expands avx to 512-bit support utilizing a new evex prefix encoding proposed by intel in july 2013 and first supported by intel with the [[knights landing (microarchitecture)|knights landing]] processor scheduled to ship in 2015.<ref name=\"reinders512\">{{citation |url= http://software.intel.com/en-us/blogs/2013/avx-512-instructions |title= avx-512 instructions |date= 23 july 2013 |author= james reinders |publisher= [[intel]] |accessdate= 20 august 2013}}</ref>\n\navx provides new features, new instructions and a new coding scheme.\n\n== new features ==\n{| class=\"wikitable floatright\" style=\"width: 22em; margin-left: 1rem; text-align: center; font-size: x-small; line-height: normal\"\n|+ style=\"margin-bottom: 0.2em; font-size: small\" | avx register scheme as extension from the sse registers\n|-\n| style=\"width: 50%; <page> <title>advanced_practice_registered_nurse</title><text>an \'\'\'advanced practice registered nurse\'\'\' (\'\'\'aprn\'\'\') is a nurse with [[postgraduate education|post-graduate]] education in nursing.  aprns are prepared with advanced didactic and clinical education, knowledge, skills, and scope of practice in [[nursing]].<ref name=\"american nurses association\"/>\n\naprn defines a level of nursing practice that utilizes extended and expanded skills, experience and knowledge in assessment, planning, implementation, diagnosis and evaluation of the care required. nurses practicing at this level are educationally prepared at the [[postgraduate education|post-graduate]] level and may work in either a [[specialty (medicine)|specialist]] or [[general practitioner|generalist]] capacity. however, the basis of advanced practice is the high degree of knowledge, skill and experience that is applied within the nurse-patient/client relationship to achieve optimal outcomes through critical analysis, problem solving and [[evidence-based medicine|evidence-based]] decision making.\n\n==education, accreditation, and certification==\naprns demonstrate effective integration of theory, practice and experiences along with increasing degrees of autonomy in judgments and interventions. intensive [[postgraduate education|post-graduate]] education is designed to teach an aprn to use multiple approaches to [[decision-making]], manage the care of individuals and groups, engage in collaborative practices with the patient or client to achieve best outcomes; provide a supportive environment for colleagues; manage the utilization of staff and physical resources; engage in ethically justifiable nursing practice; protect the rights of individuals and groups; engage in activities to improve nursing practice; develop therapeutic and caring relationships; fulfill the conduct requirements of the profession; act to enhance the professional development of self; and function in accordance with le
<page> <title>advancement_via_individual_determination</title><text>{{multiple issues|\n{{notability|date=april 2010}}\n{{refimprove|date=april 2010}}\n}}\n\n\'\'\'advancement via individual determination\'\'\' (\'\'\'avid\'\'\') is a college-readiness system designed to increase the number of students who enroll in and complete a degree at four-year colleges, focusing on students in the academic middle. the formula is to raise expectations of students. originating at the high school level, the program now serves grades 4-12, through the avid college readiness system (acrs) for elementary and secondary schools and avid for higher education (ahe) for colleges.\n\n== background ==\navid, which stands for advancement via individual determination, is a program designed to give the necessary support to students, particularly those in the academic middle, so that they can attend college and achieve their fullest potential. it also serves to level the playing field for minority and low-income students, as well as students who may be the first in their families to potentially attend college. the avid program serves to support its students by teaching and reinforcing study and organizational skills (cornell note-taking, 3-ring binder with labeled dividers, etc.), encouraging students to take more rigorous and challenging classes, providing skills necessary to succeed in college (public speaking, team building skills, interaction with professors, etc.), and ultimately preparing them for success at a four-year university/college. avid students have skilled tutors, often college students studying to be teachers or studying one of the major subject areas, to help them with their studies. students are taken on field trips to local colleges and universities throughout the program to familiarize them with some options. the projects planned are rich in content, cooperative learning, and applications that simulate \"the real world\" after high school. community service is advocated t

[[peer review]] is determined on a case-by-case basis. the [[editor-in-chief]] is david sherrington ([[university of oxford]]).<ref name=author>\n{{cite web\n | year = 2011\n | title =instructions for authors \n | publisher = taylor & francis\n | url =http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/authors/tadpauth.asp \n | quote =contributions to advances in physics will be subjected to review by referees at the discretion of the editorial office\n| accessdate =2011-01-06\n}}</ref><ref name=hollis>\n{{cite web\n | year = 2011\n | title = library catalogue\n | publisher = hollis - harvard university libraries \n | url = http://hollis.harvard.edu/?q=issn:0001-8732\n | format = \"issued as a supplement to the \'\'philosophical magazine\'\'\"\n | quote = chemical abstracts 0009-2258, international aerospace abstracts 0020-5842, nuclear science abstracts 0029-5612\n | accessdate =2011-01-06\n}}</ref><ref name=jnldetail/
<page> <title>adventure_master</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=june 2007}}\n\n\'\'\'adventure master\'\'\' was a system for writing text adventures with graphics. it was written by [[cristopher chance]] and published by [[cbs software]] in 1984. it ran on [[apple ii]]+/iie/iic, [[atari]], [[commodore 64]] and pc/pcjr computers. it came with a few test adventures such as clever catacombs (by christopher chance), becca in outlaw cave and wild trails (by the author [[jean craighead george]]).\n\n[[category:1984 software]]\n[[category:interactive fiction]]\n[[category:text adventure game engines]]\n[[category:video game development software]]\n\n{{adventure-videogame-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>adventures_in_rainbow_country</title><text>{{infobox television\n| bgcolour =\n| show_name = adventures in rainbow country\n| image = \n| caption = \n| format = [[adventure]]-[[drama]]\n| camera = \n| picture_format = \n| audio_format = \n| runtime = 30 min (time slot)\n| creator = \n| developer = \n| producer = [[ralph ellis]]\n| executive_producer = \n| starring = [[susan conway]]<br />[[stephen cottier]]<br />[[wally koster]]<br />[[lois maxwell]]<br />[[albert millaire]]<br />[[buckley petawabano]]\n| narrated = \n| opentheme = \n| endtheme = \n| country = canada\n| language = english\n| network = [[cbc television|cbc]]\n| first_run =\n| first_aired = 20 september 1970\n| last_aired = 28 march 1971\n| num_episodes = 26\n| website = \n}}{{use dmy dates|date=january 2012}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'adventures in rainbow country\'\'\'\'\' was a [[canada|canadian]] television series, which aired on [[cbc television]] in 1970 and 1971. reruns were later shown on the american children\'s cable channel [[nickelodeon]] during the early 1980s.\n\na half hour family drama, the show starred [[lois maxwell]] (of james bond fame) as nancy williams, a widow raising her children billy ([[stephen cottier]]) and hannah ([[susan conway]]) in rural [[northern ontario]]. other characters included billy\'s [[ojibwa]] friend pete gawa ([[buckley petawabano]]) and bush pilot dennis mcgubgub ([[wally koster]]).\n\nthe show was filmed around [[whitefish falls, ontario|whitefish falls]], which is near [[espanola, ontario|espanola]]. many scenes were also shot at [[birch island, ontario|birch island]] and on [[manitoulin island]] in 1969. there were 26 episodes of the series. it has continued to air in repeats, both in canada and internationally — in canada, the show had been seen on [[dejaview]], and is currently seen on [[silver screen classics]] without commercial breaks, in australia, the canada-based series was the last program to be screened on [[gem (australian tv channel)|gem]]

[[eagle-lion films]]\n| released       = 1948 (usa)\n<br/>{{start date|1952|09|05}} (sweden)<ref>\'\'[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0040078/releaseinfo adventures of gallant bess]\'\' release information, imbd.com</ref>\n\n| runtime        = 71 minutes\n| country        = united states\n| language       = english\n| budget         =\n| gross          =\n| preceded by    =\n| followed by    =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'adventures of gallant bess\'\'\'\'\' is a 1948 american contemporary western film directed by [[lew landers]] and filmed in [[cinecolor]]. it has no relation to producer matthew rapf\'s father harry rapf\'s film \'\'[[gallant bess]]\'\'.\n\n== plot summary ==\ndrifting and down on his luck cowboy ted daniels captures a beautiful [[mustang horse|mustang]], names her bess and teaches her a variety of tricks. fate turns on him when he rides bess into town where she causes expensive damage to motor vehicles as ted drinks in a bar. ted thinks his luck will change by winning a large prize in a local rodeo, but the unscrupulous carnival owner who desires bess in his show has one of his stooges cover the horns of the steer ted is to [[bulldogging|wrestle]] with slippery oil breaking ted\'s leg in the process.

<page> <title>adverse_food_reaction</title><text>an \'\'\'adverse food reaction\'\'\' is an [[adverse]] response by the body to [[food]] or a specific type of food.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/icd10online/?gt66.htm+t780 | work=world health organisation |title=icd code t78.1 | date=2007 | accessdate=21 june 2010| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20100726090503/http://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/icd10online/?gt66.htm+t780| archivedate= 26 july 2010 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>\n\nthe most common adverse reaction is a [[food allergy]], which is an adverse [[immune response]] to either a specific type or a range of food [[protein]]s.\n\nhowever, other adverse responses to food are not allergies.  these reactions include responses to food such as [[food intolerance]], pharmacological reactions, and toxin-mediated reactions, as well as physical responses, such as [[choking]].\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{food-stub}}\n{{health-stub}}\n\n[[category:food science]]\n[[category:causes of death]]\n[[category:food allergies]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>adversus_valentinianos</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'adversus valentinianos\'\'\'\'\' is a famous refutation of [[valentinianism]] by [[tertullian]],<ref>[[#seb99|seban 1999]]. p. 947.</ref> an orthodox contemporary of the gnostics and one of the first to investigate them. the work satirized the bizarre elements that appear in gnostic mythology, ridiculing the gnostics for creating elaborate cosmologies, with multi-storied heavens like apartment houses.<ref>[[#pag89|pagels 1989]]. pp. xxix, 154.</ref>\n\nthough an enemy of [[valentinus]], tertullian nevertheless spoke of him as a brilliant and eloquent man. tertullian claims that valentinus refused to submit himself to the superior authority of the bishop of rome because he wanted to become bishop himself. in tertullian\'s version of events, when another man was chosen to be bishop, valentinus was filled with envy and frustrated ambition and separated himself from the church to found a rival group of his own. tertullian\'s story follows a typical polemic against heresy, maintaining that envy and ambition lead heretics to deviate from the true faith, and for this and other reasons is largely rejected by historians. twenty years after the incident which tertullian claims led to their separation from it, followers of valentinus still considered themselves full members of the church, and they resisted orthodox attempts to expel them.<ref>[[#pag89|pagels 1989]]. pp. 36, 39, 161, 162.</ref>\n\nthough tertullian\'s story may be untrue, it illustrates the potential of heresy to encourage insubordination to clerical authority, which christians saw as one of its dangers.<ref>[[#pag89|pagels 1989]]. pp. 39, 162.</ref>\n\n==see also==\n* [[elaine pagels]]\n* [[gnosticism]]\n* [[robert audi]]\n* \'\'[[the cambridge dictionary of philosophy]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[the gnostic gospels]]\'\'\n\n==references==\n===footnotes===\n{{reflist|20em}}\n\n===bibliography===\n;books\n{{refbegin}}\n* {{cite book |author=pagels, elaine |title=th
<page> <title>advice_to_a_friend_on_choosing_a_mistress</title><text>\'\'\'\"advice to a friend on choosing a mistress\"\'\'\' is a letter by [[benjamin franklin]] dated june 25, 1745 in which franklin counsels a young man about channeling sexual urges.  due to its licentious nature the letter was not published in collections of franklin\'s papers in the [[united states]] during the nineteenth century.  federal court decisions from the mid- to late- twentieth century cited the document as a reason for overturning obscenity laws.\n\n==text==\nfranklin begins by advising a young man that a cure for sexual urges is unknown, and the proper solution is to take a wife.  then, expressing doubts that the intended reader will actually marry, franklin names several advantages of marriage.  as supplementary advice in case the recipient rejects all previous arguments, franklin lists seven reasons why an older mistress is preferable to a young one.  advantages include better conversation, less risk of unwanted pregnancy, and \'\'greater prudence in conducting an intrigue.\'\'<ref name=\"franklin\">benjamin franklin, \"[http://www.bibliomania.com/2/9/77/124/21473/1/frameset.html advice to a friend on choosing a mistress]\" (accessed 19 july 2008).</ref>\n\naccording to john richard stevens, the unnamed correspondent is a friend of franklin\'s named cadwaller colton, and it remains unknown whether franklin was serious or if the letter was ever delivered.<ref>john richard stevens, \'\'weird history 101: my dinner with attila the hun, i started world war i\'\', adams media, 1997 p. 219.  isbn 1-55850-715-9</ref>  whether serious or humorous, the letter is frankly sexual:\n{{cquote|the face first grows lank and wrinkled; then the neck; then the breast and arms; the lower parts continuing to the last as plump as ever: so that covering all above with a basket, and regarding only what is below the girdle, it is impossible of two women to know an old from a young one. and as in the dark 
<page> <title>advisory_council</title><text>\'\'\'advisory council\'\'\' may refer to:\n\nin \'\'\'the united kingdom\'\'\':\n\n* [[advisory council on the misuse of drugs]], a statutory and non-executive non-departmental british public body\n* [[pakistan - <page> <title>advisory_council_on_california_indian_policy</title><text>the \'\'\'advisory council on california indian policy (accip)\'\'\' was created by an act of the [[united states congress]] and signed by president [[george h. w. bush]] on october 14, 1992.<ref name=\"advisory council\">“advisory council on california indian policy,” october 14, 1992, in documents of united states indian policy, ed. [[francis paul prucha]] (lincoln: university of nebraska press, 2000), 336-337.</ref> it provided for the creation of a special advisory council made up of eighteen members with the purpose of studying the unique problems that [[california]] [[native americans in the united states|native americans]] face in receiving federal acknowledgment. additionally, they were given the task of studying the social and economic conditions of california natives, “characterized by, among other things, alcohol and substance abuse, critical health problems, family violence and [[child abuse]], lack of educational and employment opportunities, and significant barriers to tribal economic development.”<ref name=\"advisory council\"/> under the provisions for the act, the advisory council was to make recommendations regarding california indian policy to the congress and the [[department of the interior|departments of the interior]] and of [[department of health and human services|health and human services]].\n\n== federal acknowledgment process ==\nthe accip was especially important as an advocate for california’s terminated and unacknowledged tribes in receiving federal acknowledgment. in 1978, the [[united states secretary of the interior|secretary of the interior]] established the federal acknowledgment process (fap) to consider the extension of federal recognition to previously unrecognized indian groups. among other things, the federal acknowledgment regulations required that the group petitioning for a federally recognized tribal status live in a distinct community, be i
<page> <title>advokatfirman_vinge</title><text>\'\'\'vinge\'\'\' is one of [[sweden]]\'s two largest [[law firm]]s and one of europe\'s 100 largest law firms (see [[list of largest european law firms]]), with approximately 300 [[lawyer]]s working in the firm and an annual [[revenue|turnover]] of about 936 million sek (about 100 million euro).<ref>http://www.vinge.se/upload/broschyrer/vinge_business_review.pdf</ref>  the current firm was created by a merger of several smaller swedish law firms in 1983.<ref>[http://www.vinge.se/en/about-vinge/ about the firm]</ref>\n\nvinge is composed of several specialized practice groups and is considered a \"full-service\" commercial law firm. vinges offices in sweden are located in [[stockholm]], [[gothenburg]], [[malmö]] and [[helsingborg]], and the international offices are located in [[brussels]], [[hong kong]] and [[shanghai]].\n\nvinge was chosen swedens best law firm 2006 and 2007 in a survey conducted by the [[international law office]].<ref>[http://www.clientchoiceawards.com/2007/winners.aspx client choice awards 2007<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.vinge.se/en/ official web site]\n*[http://www.internationallawoffice.com/ international law office web site]\n\n[[category:law firms of sweden]]\n[[category:law firms established in 1983]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>ady_stern</title><text>\'\'\'ady stern\'\'\' is an [[israel]]i [[physics|physicist]]. \n\nady stern is a professor at the condensed matter physics department at the [[weizmann institute of science]]. stern and fellow researchers claim to have demonstrated the existence of \'quasiparticles\' with one quarter the charge of an electron.<ref>[http://www.eetimes.com/document.asp?doc_id=1251090 researchers claim to find particles with quarter-electron charge]</ref>\n\nstern is best known for his research relating to the theoretical aspects of the fractional quantum hall effect<ref>{{cite news | author = | title = fractional quantum hall effects| publisher =physicsworld.com | date =march 2, 2002 | url =http://web.archive.org/web/20071027041700/http://physicsworld.com/cws/article/indepth/734 | accessdate=2011-08-29}}</ref> and the properties of \'\'quasiparticles\'\' that have one-quarter the charge of an electron.<ref>{{cite news |author =amir ben-artzi |title = researchers claim to find particles with quarter-electron charge |publisher =rf designline | date =june 2, 2008 | url =http://www.eetimes.com/electronics-news/4192213/researchers-claim-to-find-particles-with-quarter-electron-charge | accessdate=2009-02-01}}</ref>\n==published works==\n*[http://www.sciencemag.org/content/339/6124/1179 topological quantum computation—from basic concepts to first experiments]\n==see also==\n*[[science and technology in israel]]\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.weizmann.ac.il/condmat/stern.html ady stern home page]\n*[http://online.kitp.ucsb.edu/online/qhall_c98/stern/ \"coulomb drag at the half-filled landau level\" (audio presentation by ady stern)]\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = stern, ady\n| alternative names =\n| short description = israeli physicist\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:stern, ady}}\n[[ca
<page> <title>aedophron_rhodites</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = aedophron rhodites\n| image = \n| image_width = 240px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[noctuidae]]\n| tribus = \n| subtribus = \n| genus = \'\'[[aedophron]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. rhodites\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'aedophron rhodites\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (eversmann, 1851)\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'heliothis rhodites\'\' <small>eversmann, 1851</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'aedophron rhodites\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found in the eastern [[mediterranean]], including the [[balkans]], through [[ukraine]] and [[moldova]] to central [[asia]].\n\nit is found on dry steppes and semi-deserts in eurasia. it is more common in central asian oases.\n\n==external links==\n* [http://macroid.ru/showphoto.php?photo=25399&lang=ru images]\n* [http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=299155 fauna europaea]\n* [http://www.lepiforum.de/cgi-bin/lepiwiki.pl?aedophron_rhodites lepiforum.de]\n* [http://www.lepidoptera.pl/show.php?id=3706&country=ua lepidoptera.pl]\n\n[[category:heliothinae]]\n\n\n{{heliothinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aefligen</title><text>{{infobox swiss town\n | subject_name\t\t= aefligen\n | municipality_name\t= aefligen\n | municipality_type\t= municipality\n | imagepath_coa\t= aefligen-coat of arms.svg|pixel_coa=\n | map\t\t\t= \n | languages\t\t= german\n | canton\t\t= bern\n | iso-code-region \t= ch-be\n | district\t\t= [[emmental (administrative district)|emmental]]\n | lat_d=47|lat_m=6|lat_ns=n|long_d=7|long_m=33|long_ew=e\n | postal_code\t\t= 3426\n | municipality_code\t= 0401\n | area\t\t\t= 2.04\n | elevation\t\t= 497|elevation_description= \n | population\t\t= {{swiss populations nc|ch-be|0401}} | populationof = {{swiss populations ym|ch-be}} |  popofyear = {{swiss populations y|ch-be}} \n | website\t\t= www.aefligen.ch\n | mayor\t\t= |mayor_asof=|mayor_party=\n | mayor_title\t= |list_of_mayors\t= \n | places\t\t= \n | demonym\t\t= \n | neighboring_municipalities= [[bätterkinden]], [[fraubrunnen]], [[kirchberg, bern|kirchberg]], [[rüdtligen-alchenflüh]], [[utzenstorf]]\n | twintowns\t\t= \n|}}\n\'\'\'aefligen\'\'\' is a [[municipalities of switzerland|municipality]] in the [[emmental (administrative district)|emmental administrative district]] in the [[cantons of switzerland|canton]] of [[canton of bern|bern]] in [[switzerland]].\n\n==history==\nthe first mention of the town is in 1261 when it was known as \'\'efflingen\'\'.<ref name=hds>{{hds|238|aefligen}}</ref>  during the 13th century, the nearby [[fraubrunnen abbey]] became independent of the local nobility and brought aefligen with them.  by 1297 the neighboring villages were administered from aefligen.  however, it was far from fully independent.  the [[low justice]] court (petty crimes and punishments) for aefligen was in [[bätterkinden]], it belonged to the county of [[landshut]] and was part of the [[parish (catholic church)|parish]] of [[kirchberg, bern|kirchberg]].  around 1510-14 landshut lost the rights to aefligen and it became a [[vogt]]ie of bern.  \n\nstarting in the 14th century,

<page> <title>aegilops_speltoides</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n|name = \'\'aegilops speltoides\'\'\n|image = aegilops-speltoides-heads.jpg\n|image_caption = \'\'aegilops speltoides\'\'\n|regnum = [[plantae]]\n|unranked_divisio = [[angiosperms]]\n|unranked_classis = [[monocots]]\n|unranked_ordo = [[commelinids]]\n|ordo = [[poales]]\n|familia = [[poaceae]]\n|genus = \'\'[[aegilops]]\'\'\n|species = \'\'\'\'\'a. speltoides\'\'\'\'\'\n|binomial = \'\'aegilops speltoides\'\'\n|binomial_authority = [[ignaz friedrich tausch|tausch]]\n|}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'aegilops speltoides\'\'\'\'\' ([[syn.]] \'\'sitopsis speltoides\'\' ([[ignaz friedrich tausch|tausch]]) [[Á.löve]]) is an [[edible]] plant in the [[poaceae]] family native to [[southeastern europe]] and [[western asia]], which is often used for [[fodder|animal feed]], and it has grown in cultivated [[garden bed|beds]]. this plant is an important natural source disease resistance in [[wheat]], and it is known or likely to be [[susceptible]] to [[barley mild mosaic bymovirus]].\n\n==references==\n* [http://image.fs.uidaho.edu/vide/refs.htm#authors brunt, a.a., crabtree, k., dallwitz, m.j., gibbs, a.j., watson, l. and zurcher, e.j. (eds.)]  (1996 onwards).  [http://image.fs.uidaho.edu/vide/descr059.htm \'\'barley mild mosaic bymovirus\'\']. [http://image.fs.uidaho.edu/vide/refs.htm plant viruses online: descriptions and lists from the vide database. version: 20 august 1996].\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/npgs/html/taxon.pl?1547 germplasm resources information network: \'\'aegilops speltoides\'\']\n*[http://www.pfaf.org/database/plants.php?aegilops+speltoides plants for a future: \'\'aegilops speltoides\'\'] \n*{{itis|id=506694|taxon=aegilops speltoides}}\n*[http://plants.usda.gov/java/profile?symbol=aesp2 usda plants profile: \'\'aegilops speltoides\'\']\n*{{eol|1115624}}\n{{defaultsort:aegilops speltoides}}\n[[category:aegilops|speltoides]]\n[[category:flora of western asia]]\n[[category
