<page> <title>africa_mining_intelligence</title><text>{{multiple issues|\n{{unreferenced|date=august 2011}}\n{{advert|date=august 2011}}\n}}\n\n{{infobox newspaper\n| name = africa mining intelligence\n| type = fortnightly [[newspaper]]\n|language = french and english\n| foundation = 2000\n| language = french and english\n| owners = [[indigo publications]]\n| headquarters = [[paris]]\n| issn = 1624-0022\n| website = http://www.africaintelligence.com/ama/\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'africa mining intelligence\'\'\'\'\' is a specialist publication for the [[mining]] industry in africa. it has been published fortnightly by paris-based news group [[indigo publications]] since 2000.\n\n\'\'africa mining intelligence\'\' covers the mining business, reporting on deals in the sector, the business strategies of the key players and on the policies of governments and state-owned mining companies. \'\'africa mining intelligence\'\' also provides detailed background information about the sector\'s movers and shakers.\n\nthe newsletter investigates large scale exploration and production projects in diamond, precious metals, rare-earth minerals, nickel, copper, uranium. it also covers government policy and intervention, mining authorities, and national and international mining organizations.\n\n[[gaëlle arenson]] is also the editor-in-chief of \'\'africa mining intelligence\'\'′s sister publication \'\'[[maghreb confidential]]\'\'.\n\n==other publications==\n{{portal|journalism}}\n* \'\'[[africa energy intelligence]]\'\' (specialist publication for the energy sector in africa)\n* [[intelligence online]] (specialist publication for the mining industry in africa)\n* \'\'[[west africa newsletter]]\'\' (“la lettre du continent” in french, covers politics and business in west and central africa)\n* [[the indian ocean newsletter]] (specialist publication covering the countries on the east coast of africa and the indian ocean islands)\n* [[maghreb confidential]] (newsletter specializing in n
<page> <title>africa_renewal</title><text>{{no footnotes|date=january 2013}}\n{{infobox magazine\n| title =africa renewal - afrique renouveau\n| category = [[africa]]\n| language  = [[english language|english]], [[french language|french]]\n| website  = {{url|http://www.un.org/africarenewal}}\n| publisher = [[united nations]]\n| country  = [[united states]]\n| history  =\n| frequency =\n| issn = 1816-9627\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'africa renewal\'\'\'\'\' is a [[magazine]] published by the [[united nations]]. the magazine focuses on the critical economic, political and social situation in [[africa]]. africa renewal (print and online) highlights the efforts made by africa and the international community to promote the economic recovery and sustainable development of the region in pursuit of the goals of the new partnership for africa’s development ([[nepad]]) and the achievement of the [[millennium development goals]] (mdgs).\n\nthe magazine’s stories are usually about climate change, food security, conflict resolution efforts, gender equality and women’s empowerment, youth, etc. its focus and writing style enables it to leverage the increasing reader interest in stories about africa that are not in the mainstream media.\n\nit was formerly published as \'\'africa recovery/afrique relance\'\'.\n\n== external links==\n* [http://ezb.uni-regensburg.de/detail.phtml?bibid=aaaaa&colors=7&lang=en&jour_id=5159 electronic journals library (ezb)]\n* [http://opc4-ascl.pica.nl/ppn?ppn=308205502&lng=en catalogue (asc leiden)]\n* [http://atoz.ebsco.com/titles.asp?id=2749&sid=167573239&tabid=2 atoz electronic journals focused on africa (nai)]\n* [http://www.un.org/africarenewal/ africa renewal online]\n\n[[category:african studies]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>africa_specialty_group</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=january 2011}}\nthe \'\'\'\'\'africa specialty group\'\'\'\'\' is one of many specialty groups within the [[association of american geographers]].  the group is composed of academic [[geographers]] with research interests in [[africa]].  this group publishes the [[african geographical review]], a peer-reviewed [[academic journal]].\n\n==external links==\n{{sister project links|africa specialty group}}\n\n** [http://www.public.iastate.edu/~asg/homepage.htm - africa specialty group website]\n\n[[category:geography organizations]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>african_forum_for_reconstruction</title><text>the \'\'\'african forum for reconstruction\'\'\' is a [[political party]] in [[gabon]]. it is a radical opposition party led by [[léon mbou yembi]]. in the [[gabonese legislative election, 2006|17 december/24 december 2006 parliamentary election]], the party won one out of 120 seats in the [[national assembly of gabon|national assembly]]; this seat was won by mbou yembi.\n\n\n{{gabonese political parties}}\n\n[[category:political parties in gabon]]\n\n{{gabon-stub}}\n{{africa-party-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>african_free_trade_zone</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=may 2013}}\nthe \'\'\'african free trade zone (aftz)\'\'\' is a [[free trade zone]] announced at the [[eac-sadc-comesa summit]] on wednesday 22 october 2008 by the heads of [[southern african development community]] (sadc), the [[common market for eastern and southern africa]] (comesa) and the [[east african community]] (eac). the african free trade zone is also referred to as the \'\'\'african free trade area\'\'\' in some official documents and press releases.\n\nin may 2012 the idea was extended to also include ecowas, eccas and amu.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2012-05/26/c_123195304.htm |title=africa free trade zone in operation by 2018 |publisher=xinhua |date=26 may 2012 |accessdate=2012-06-21}}</ref>\n\n==signing==\nthe leaders of the three aftz trading blocks, comesa, eac, and sadc, announced the agreement, with the aim of creating a single free trade zone to be named the african free trade zone, consisting of 26 countries with a gdp of an estimated us$624bn (£382.9bn). it was hoped that the african free trade zone agreement would ease access to markets within the aftz zone and end problems due to several of the member countries in the aftz belonging to multiple regional groups.\n\nthe african free trade zone announced at the eac-sadc-comesa summit (also known the aftz summit and tripartite summit) effectively is the realization of a dream more than a hundred years in the making, a trade zone spanning the length of african continent from [[cape to cairo road|cape to cairo]], from north african [[egypt]] all the way to the southernmost tip of africa in south africa ([[cape town]]). the cape to cairo dream was envisioned by [[cecil rhodes]] and other british imperialists in the 1890s and was expressed in different contexts and versions including, but not limited to, the following ideals: cape to cairo road, cape to cairo railway, cape to cairo telegraph, and 
<page> <title>african_golden_oriole</title><text>{{taxobox\n| name = african golden oriole\n| image = oriolus auratus ahisgett1.jpg\n| status = lc\n| status_system = iucn3.1\n| status_ref = <ref>{{iucn|id=106005883 |title=\'\'oriolus auratus\'\' |assessors=[[birdlife international]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 july 2012}}</ref>\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[chordate|chordata]]\n| classis = [[bird|aves]]\n| ordo = [[passeriformes]]\n| familia = [[oriolidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[oriolus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'o. auratus\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'oriolus auratus\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[louis jean pierre vieillot|vieillot]], 1817\n}}\n[[file:african golden oriole smtc.jpg|left|thumb|at [[san diego zoo]]]]\n\nthe \'\'\'african golden oriole\'\'\' (\'\'oriolus auratus\'\') is a member of the [[old world oriole|oriole]] family of [[passerine]] birds which is a resident breeder in [[africa]] south of the [[sahara]].\n\nit is a bird of thick bush and other well-wooded areas. the hanging basket-shaped nest is built in a tree, and contains two eggs. the food is insects and fruit, especially figs, found in the tree canopies where the orioles spend much of their time.\n\nthe male is striking in the typical oriole black and yellow plumage, although the plumage is predominantly yellow, with solid black only in the flight feathers and tail centre. there is a great deal of gold in the wings, which is a distinction from [[golden oriole]], \'\'oriolus oriolus\'\', which winters in africa.\n\nthe female is a drabber green bird, distinguished from the european species by more contrasting wings and black around the eye. orioles are shy, and even the male is remarkably difficult to see in the dappled yellow and green leaves of the canopy.\n\nthe flight is somewhat like a [[thrush (bird)|thrush]], strong and direct with some shallow dips over longer distances.\n\nthe call is a screech like a [[jay]], but the song is a beautiful fluting \'\'fee-ooo fee-ooo\
<page> <title>african_journal_of_economic_policy</title><text>{{multiple issues|orphan=january 2010|primarysources=january 2010}}\n{{infobox journal\n| title = african journal of economic policy\n| cover =\n| discipline = [[economic policy]]\n| abbreviation = afr. j. econ. pol.\n| editor = abiodun bankole\n| publisher = [[african journals online]]\n| country = nigeria\n| history = 1994-present\n| frequency = biannually\n| website = http://www.ajol.info/journal_index.php?jid=147&ab=ajep\n| link1 =\n| link1-name =\n| issn = 1116-4875\n| eissn =\n| jstor =\n| oclc =\n| lccn =\n}}\nthe \'\'\'\'\'african journal of economic policy\'\'\'\'\' is an [[academic journal]] covering [[economic policy]] in africa. it is an offshoot of the trade policy research and training programme in the economics department at the [[university of ibadan]].\n\n== external links ==\n* {{official|1=http://www.ajol.info/journal_index.php?jid=147&ab=ajep}}\n\n[[category:economics journals]]\n[[category:open access journals]]\n[[category:biannual journals]]\n[[category:english-language journals]]\n[[category:publications established in 1994]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>african_pitta</title><text>{{taxobox\n| name = african pitta\n| image = pittareichenowilongipennisgoodchild.jpg\n| image_caption = illustration (right) with \'\'[[pitta reichenowi]]\'\' (left)\n| status = lc\n| status_system = iucn3.1\n| status_ref = <ref>{{iucn|id=106004015 |title=\'\'pitta angolensis\'\' |assessors=[[birdlife international]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 july 2012}}</ref>\n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[aves]]\n| ordo = [[passeriformes]]\n| familia = [[pitta|pittidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[pitta (genus)|pitta]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'p. angolensis\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'pitta angolensis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[louis jean pierre vieillot|vieillot]], 1816\n| synonyms = \n| range_map = african_pitta_distribution.jpg\n| range_map_caption = the distribution of the african pitta\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'african pitta\'\'\' (\'\'pitta angolensis\'\') is a species of [[bird]] in the [[pittidae]] family.\n\n==distribution and habitat==\nit is found in [[angola]], [[burundi]], [[cameroon]], [[central african republic]], [[republic of the congo]], [[democratic republic of the congo]], [[ivory coast]], [[equatorial guinea]], [[ethiopia]], [[gabon]], [[ghana]], [[kenya]], [[liberia]], [[malawi]], [[mozambique]], [[nigeria]], [[rwanda]], [[sierra leone]], [[south africa]], [[tanzania]], [[togo]], [[uganda]], [[zambia]], and [[zimbabwe]].  it is a migratory species,and while it breeds in tanzania and southern africa,it also migrates to the congo basin farther north.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n*encyclopedia of animals: mammals,birds,reptiles and amphibians. harold g. cogger, edwin gould, joseph forshaw\n\n==external links==\n*(angola pitta =) african pitta - [http://sabap2.adu.org.za/docs/sabap1/491.pdf species text in the atlas of southern african birds].\n*[http://animaldiversity.ummz.umich.edu/site/resources/grzimek_birds/pittidae/pitta_angolensis.jpg/view.html image at adw]\n\n[[category:pitta (genus)]]\n
<page> <title>african_renaissance</title><text>[[file:african renaissance monument cape town.jpg|thumb|a monument from the people of [[carrara, italy]] given to the city of [[cape town]] to \"celebrate the first ten years of the african renaissance (1994-2004).\"]]\nthe \'\'\'african renaissance\'\'\' is the concept that [[africa]]n people and nations shall overcome the current challenges confronting the continent and achieve cultural, scientific, and economic renewal. the african renaissance concept was first articulated by [[cheikh anta diop]] in a series of essays beginning in 1946, which are collected in his book \'\'\"towards the african renaissance: essays in culture and development, 1946-1960,\"\'\'. this concept has been popularized by [[president of south africa|south african president]] [[thabo mbeki]] during his term of office, heralding the beginning of the african renaissance, and it continues to be a key part of the post-[[apartheid]] intellectual agenda.\n\n==origins==\ncheikh anta diop wrote a series of essays as a student from 1946 to 1960, charting the development of africa. the essays, which are seen as a form of [[blueprint]], are collected in book form as \'\'\"towards the african renaissance: essays in culture and development, 1946-1960\"\'\'.<ref>http://www.africaspeaks.com/reasoning/index.php?topic=5993.0;wap2</ref>\n\nin 1994 in [[south africa]] following the first democratic election after the end of apartheid, and was clarified with then-deputy president mbeki\'s famous \"[[i am an african]]\" speech in may 1996 following the adoption of a new constitution:\n<blockquote>\ni am born of a people who are heroes and heroines [...] patient because history is on their side, these masses do not despair because today the weather is bad. nor do they turn triumphalist when, tomorrow, the sun shines. [...] whatever the circumstances they have lived through and because of that experience, they are determined to define for themselves who they are and w

<page> <title>african_migration_to_malaysia</title><text>{{ethnic group\n|group     = african migration to malaysia\n|image     = \n|pop       = \'\'\'undefined\'\'\'\n|regions   = [[kuala lumpur]]{{·}}[[negeri sembilan]]{{·}}[[selangor]]\n|langs     = [[english language|english]]{{·}} [[malay language|malay]]{{·}} [[arabic language|arabic]]\n|rels      = [[muslim]]{{·}}[[christianity]]\n|related-c = [[african people]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'african migration to malaysia\'\'\' comprise migrants and residents from [[africa]] and their descendants living in [[malaysia]]. many of them are illegal residents while there are a smaller number of students and fewer permanent residents.\n\n==illegal immigration issues==\nimmigration department, from january to october 2011 arrested 764 africans, the department also compounded 1,107 africans and deported 146 to their countries of origin.<ref>[http://www.theborneopost.com/2011/12/11/be-wary-of-25000-african-students/ be wary of 25,000 african ‘students’]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{african diaspora}}\n{{immigration from africa}}\n\n[[category:ethnic groups in malaysia|african]]\n[[category:african diaspora in asia|malaysia]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>africando</title><text>\'\'\'africando\'\'\' is a musical project formed in 1992<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rfimusique.com/musique/siteen/biographie/biographie_7894.asp|title=rfi music bio: africando|accessdate=2012-06-12|date=march 2007|publisher=[[radio france internationale|rfi musique]]}}</ref> to unite [[new york city|new york]]-based [[salsa music|salsa]] musicians with [[senegal]]ese vocalists. musicians from other african countries were later included under the name \'\'\'africando all stars\'\'\'.\n\nsalsa has been a hugely popular style in [[central africa|central]] and [[west africa]] since the 1940s-1950s, and the goal of africando was to merge salsa rhythms from both sides of the atlantic, mainly based on the african salsa tradition.\n\nafricando was initiated by producer [[ibrahim sylla]] from [[côte d\'ivoire]] and [[mali]]an arranger [[boncana maiga]] of [[fania all stars]]. some of the musicians initially involved were: [[ronnie baro]] (of [[orquesta broadway]]) [[pape seck]] (ex member of [[star band]]), [[nicholas menheim]] (associate of [[youssou n\'dour]]), and [[medoune diallo]] (formerly with [[orchestre baobab]]).\n\nthe first two albums were a big success in africa and in the [[world music]] scene. singer pape seck died in 1995, and was replaced by [[gnonnas pedro]] from benin (who died august 2005) and [[ronnie baró]] of [[orquestra broadway]].\n\nfor the album \'\'mandali\'\', well known african musicians, such as [[tabu ley rochereau]], [[koffi olomide]], [[salif keita]], [[sekouba bambino]], [[amadou balaké]] and [[thione seck]] were invited. this new constallation led to the new name \'\'africando all stars\'\'. whilst in the beginning, the songs were latin american classics sung in [[wolof language]] or a mix of wolof and [[spanish language|spanish]], newer songs were [[african popular music]] classics, redone with latin rhythms and instrumentation. with both approaches, africando has been equally successful.\n\nfor th
<page> <title>africville_apology</title><text>[[file:africvillechurchnovascotiacanada.jpg|thumb|300px|africville church nova scotia canada|thumb|africville church - rebuilt as part of the africville apology]]\n{{history of halifax, nova scotia}}\nthe \'\'\'africville apology\'\'\' was delivered on 24 february 2010 by [[halifax regional municipality|halifax, nova scotia]] for the eviction and eventual destruction of [[africville]], a [[black nova scotian]] community.\n\n== historical context ==\n=== eviction ===\nduring the 1940s and 1950s in different parts of canada, the federal, provincial and municipal governments were working together to take communities labelled \"slums\" and relocate the people to better housing. the intent was to use the land for business and industry. many years earlier, and again in 1947, after a major fire burnt several africville houses, the topic of relocation of africville was discussed. concrete plans of relocation did not officially emerge until 1961. stimulated by the stephenson report of 1957 and the creation of the city\'s department of development in 1961, the topic of relocation finally became a reality. in 1962 halifax adopted the relocation proposal unanimously, and the rose report, published in 1964, was passed 37/41 in favour of relocation{{where|date=april 2013}}.<ref>james w. st. g. walker. allegories and orientations in african-canadian historiography: the spirit of africville. (dalhousie review, summer 97, vol 77, issue 2, p155, 25p) page 160.</ref> the rose report promised free lawyers and social workers, job training, employment assistance, education services, etc. to those affected. the report never went into details or analyzed what the lives of residents would be like in their new homes, but was insistent that their best interests were at heart. \n\nthe relocation took place mainly between 1964 and 1967. the residents were assisted in their move by the city\'s authorities, moving the africvillians with the city dump 
<page> <title>afrida_mesomelaena</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = afrida mesomelaena\n| image = afrida mesomelaena.jpg\n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| image2 = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[nolidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[afrida]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. mesomelaena\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'afrida mesomelaena\'\'\n| binomial_authority = hampson, 1914\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'afrida mesomelaena\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[nolidae]] family. it is found in [[jamaica]].<ref>[http://www.mbarnes.force9.co.uk/jamaicamoths/images/afrmes.htm moths of jamaica]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1914]]\n[[category:nolidae]]\n\n{{nolidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>afrixalus_lacteus</title><text><!-- this article was auto-generated by [[user:polbot]]. -->\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| status = en | status_system = iucn3.1\n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[amphibia]]\n| ordo = [[anura (frog)|anura]]\n| familia = [[hyperoliidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[afrixalus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. lacteus\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'afrixalus lacteus\'\'\n| binomial_authority = perret, 1976\n| synonyms = }}\n\'\'\'\'\'afrixalus lacteus\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[frog]] in the [[hyperoliidae]] family. it is [[endemism|endemic]] to [[cameroon]].\n\nits natural [[habitat]]s are subtropical or tropical moist [[montane forest]]s, [[river]]s, [[swamp]]s, and heavily degraded former forest.\n\nit is threatened by [[habitat loss]] and [[habitat fragmentation]].\n==references==\n* amiet, j.-l. & schiøtz, a. 2004.  [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/56066/all afrixalus lacteus]. <page> <title>afrixalus_morerei</title><text><!-- this article was auto-generated by [[user:polbot]]. -->\n{{taxobox\n| image = \n| status = vu | status_system = iucn3.1\n| regnum = [[animalia]]\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[amphibia]]\n| ordo = [[anura (frog)|anura]]\n| familia = [[hyperoliidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[afrixalus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. morerei\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'afrixalus morerei\'\'\n| binomial_authority = dubois, 1986\n| synonyms = \'\'afrixalus dabagae\'\' pickersgill, 1992}}\n\'\'\'\'\'afrixalus morerei\'\'\'\'\' is a species of [[frog]] in the [[hyperoliidae]] family. its common name is \'\'\'morere\'s banana frog\'\'\'.\nit is [[endemism|endemic]] to [[tanzania]], where it occurs in the [[udzungwa mountains]], and possibly the [[uluguru mountains]].\nits natural [[habitat]]s are subtropical or tropical moist [[montane forest]]s, subtropical or tropical high-altitude [[grassland]], [[swamp]]s, and pastureland.\nit is threatened by [[habitat loss]].\n\n==references==\n* pickersgill, m., schiøtz, a. & howell, k. 2004.  [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/56070/all afrixalus morerei].   [http://www.iucnredlist.org 2006 iucn red list of threatened species. ]  downloaded on 22 july 2007.\n\n[[category:afrixalus]]\n[[category:endemic fauna of tanzania]]\n[[category:amphibians of tanzania]]\n\n\n{{hyperoliidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>afro_psalms</title><text>{{notability|date=january 2010}}\n\'\'\'afro psalms\'\'\' is an illustrated book of poetry, a collaborative effort between 20th century illustrator [[grant reynard]] and the contemporary poet [[charles fort (poet)|charles fort]].<ref>[http://mockingbird.creighton.edu/ncw/fortbib.htm]</ref>  in 2001 the [[museum of nebraska art]] discovered several works by reynard in its permanent collection. reynard created many pieces on the theme of [[african american]] life in the first half of the twentieth century. museum administrators decided to build an exhibition around these prints, and they accepted fort\'s proposal to write poems creating a context for the images in the artworks. fort responded with a [[crown of sonnets|sonnet redoublé]]. \n\n\'\'afro psalms\'\', published by university of nebraska at kearney press (isbn 0-9791002-3-2), is currently part of [[artreach]], the outreach program of the [[university of nebraska]] at kearney, which allows it to tour nebraska, reaching rural areas where fine art and poetry don\'t often travel.<ref>[http://monet.unk.edu/mona/artreach2.html]</ref><ref>[http://monet.unk.edu/mona/newsletter/05_spring/newsletter.html]</ref>\n\n==references==\n<references/>\n\n\n[[category:art exhibitions in the united states]]\n[[category:poetry collections]]\n\n\n{{poetry-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>afrosphere</title><text>{{multiple issues|cleanup = september 2009|refimprove = november 2009}}\n\nthe \'\'\'afrosphere\'\'\' is an international movement consisting of all [[african american culture|black]] blogs working toward black political, cultural, economic self-determination. there is also a membership group within the afrosphere that is called the \'\'\'afrospear\'\'\', which includes over one hundred and fifty black blogs.{{citation needed|date=september 2009}}\n\n== history ==\n\nthe genesis of the afrospear/afrosphere movement can attributed to the involvement of many bloggers of african descent, and their blogs and websites  throughout the [[african diaspora]]. in the first months of 2007, black bloggers such as afronetizen, african american political pundit, jack and jill politics,  [[black commentator]] booker rising, prometheus 6, mirror on america and francis l. holland had for many months expressed the need for inclusion of black bloggers into the majority blogosphere discussion on all issues impacting americans. \n\nwhite bloggers in many ways refused to hear the outcry of black bloggers for participation and inclusion and even met in the middle of an historic black community of [[harlem]], n.y. with former president [[bill clinton]], to discuss politics, without including a single black blogger.\n\nmembers of the white blogosphere coming into the black community, and only inviting one black person, (who was not able to attend for personal reasons) was considered by many black bloggers an insult to black bloggers and their communities.{{citation needed|date=september 2009}}\n\nthe picture of all white bloggers in harlem, with bill clinton talking politics, when black voters are a critical base of the [[democratic party (united states)|democratic party]] insulted black bloggers from the conservative [[la shawn barber]], the moderate the republic of t and the liberal steve gillard and the culture kitchen created early discussions for a

<page> <title>afrotragulus</title><text>{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'afrotragulus\'\'\n| fossil_range = {{fossil range|early miocene}}\n| image = \n| image_width = 250px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[chordata]]\n| classis = [[mammal]]ia\n| ordo = [[artiodactyla]]\n| subordo = [[ruminantia]]\n| familia = [[tragulidae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'afrotragulus\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = sánchez \'\'et al\'\'., [[2010 in paleontology|2010]]\n| subdivision_ranks = [[species]]\n| subdivision = \n*\'\'a. moruorotensis\'\' <small> pickford \'\'et al.\'\', 2001 ([[type species|type]])</small>\n*\'\'a. parvus\'\' <small> withworth \'\'et al.\'\', 1958</small>\n| synonyms = \n\'\'dorcatherium moruorotensis\'\' <br>\n\'\'dorcatherium parvus\'\'\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'afrotragulus\'\'\'\'\' is an extinct genus of [[tragulidae|tragulid]] ruminant which existed in [[kenya]] during the early [[miocene]] period.<ref name=\"sánchez2010\">{{cite journal|author=israel m. sánchez; victoria quiralte; jorge morales; martin pickford|year=2010|title=a new genus of tragulid ruminant from the early miocene of kenya|journal=acta palaeontologica polonica|volume=55|issue=2|pages=177–187|url=http://www.app.pan.pl/archive/published/app55/app20090087.pdf | doi = 10.4202/app.2009.0087}}</ref> it contains the species \'\'afrotragulus moruorotensis\'\' and \'\'afrotragulus parvus\'\', formerly classified in genus \'\'[[dorcatherium]]\'\'.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:chevrotains]]\n[[category:miocene even-toed ungulates]]\n[[category:fossil taxa described in 2010]]\n[[category:prehistoric mammals of africa]]\n\n\n{{paleo-eventoedungulate-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>afshin_ellian</title><text>{{infobox person \n| name        = afshin ellian\n| residence   = [[leiden]], [[netherlands]]\n| other_names = \n| image       =\n| imagesize   = \n| caption ellian\'\'\' (born 27 february 1966 in [[tehran]], [[iran]]) is a [[dutch people|dutch]] [[professor|professor of law]], [[philosopher]], [[poet]], and  [[criticism of islam|critic of political islam]].<ref>r.a.berman, freedom or terror: europe faces jihad (stanford: hoover institution press 2010.</ref> he is an expert in [[international public law]] and [[philosophy of law]].\n\n==biography==\nin 1989, ellian came to the [[netherlands]] as a political [[refugee]].\nhaving experienced first-hand the islamic theocratic government of [[iran]], he writes often about how such issues are affecting the world in general and the [[netherlands]] in particular. due to threats on his life tied to such criticism, he is currently heavily guarded.<ref>for public figures in netherlands, terror becomes a personal concern, washington post, november 11, 2005</ref>\n\nellian grew up in [[iran]]. as a youngster, he learned the profession of journalism with one of the most prominent journalists of iran. he was a freelance journalist for iranian political magazines aimed at youth. during the [[iranian revolution]] 1978-1979 he became, like many youngsters of his age, a supporter of the fedayan-e khalq-e i
<page> <title>afshord</title><text>{{infobox settlement\n|official_name =afshord\n|native_name =افشرد\n|settlement_type        = village\n|pushpin_map            =iran\n|mapsize                =150px\n|coordinates_region     = ir\n|subdivision_type       = [[list of countries|country]]\n|subdivision_name = {{flag|iran}}\n|subdivision_type1 =[[provinces of iran|province]]\n|subdivision_name1 =[[east azerbaijan province|east azerbaijan]]\n|subdivision_type2 =[[counties of iran|county]]\n|subdivision_name2 = [[heris county|heris]]\n|subdivision_type3 =[[bakhsh]]\n|subdivision_name3 =[[khvajeh district|khvajeh]]\n|subdivision_type4 =[[rural districts of iran|rural district]]\n|subdivision_name4 =[[mavazekhan-e shomali rural district|mavazekhan-e shomali]]\n|leader_title           = \n|leader_name            = \n|established_title      =\n|established_date       = \n|area_total_km2           = \n|area_footnotes           = \n|population_as_of         = 2006\n|population_total =527\n|population_density_km2   =auto\n|timezone               = [[iran standard time|irst]]\n|utc_offset             = +3:30\n|timezone_dst           = [[iran daylight time|irdt]]\n|utc_offset_dst         = +4:30\n|coordinates_display      = %\n|latd=38|latm=20|lats=03|latns=n\n|longd=46|longm=32|longs=47|longew=e\n|elevation_m            = \n|area_code              = \n|website                = \n|footnotes              =\n}}\n\'\'\'afshord\'\'\' ({{lang-fa|افشرد}}; also known as \'\'\'Ābshārī\'\'\' and \'\'\'ovshar\'\'\')<ref>{{geonet3|-3051815|afshord}}</ref> is a village in [[mavazekhan-e shomali rural district]], [[khvajeh district]], [[heris county]], [[east azerbaijan province]], [[iran]]. at the 2006 census, its population was 527, in 104 families.<ref>{{irancensus2006|03}}</ref>  \n\n== references ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{heris county}}\n\n\n[[category:populated places in heris county]]\n\n{{heris-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aft</title><text>[[image:aft (psf).jpg|thumb|200px]]\n:\'\'for the acronym, see [[aft (disambiguation)]].\'\'\n\n\'\'\'aft\'\'\', in [[navy|naval]] [[terminology]], is an [[adjective]] or [[adverb]] meaning, \'\'towards the [[stern]] (rear) of the [[ship]]\'\', when the [[frame of reference]] is within the ship. example: \"able seaman smith; lay aft!\".  or; \"what\'s happening \'\'\'aft\'\'\'?\"\n* the corresponding \'\'[[adjective]]\'\', in distinguishing one feature of the vessel from another is \'\'\'after\'\'\'. see the caption to the right. its antonym is \'\'\'forward\'\'\'.\n* the corresponding \'\'[[preposition]]\'\' is \'\'\'abaft\'\'\'. for example, the [[mizzenmast]] is abaft the [[mainmast]]. its [[antonym]] is \'\'\'before\'\'\' or, in a more clumsy form, \'\'\'forward of\'\'\'. \n\n\'\'\'aft\'\'\' also describes the direction of movement within an [[aircraft]]; that is, towards the tail. example: \"let\'s go aft.\" meaning to pull back on the yoke. it may also describe the back/tail location or region within an aircraft cabin. example: \"aft lavatory.\"\n\nthe difference of \'\'\'aft\'\'\' and \'\'\'stern\'\'\' is that aft is the \'\'inside\'\' (onboard) rearmost part of the vessel, while stern refers to the \'\'outside\'\' (offboard) rearmost part of the vessel.\n\n==references==\n* [[oxford english dictionary]] 2nd. edition (1989)\n\n[[category:nautical terms]]\n\n\n{{navy-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aftaab</title><text>\n{{primary sources|date=october 2010}}\n\'\'\'\'\'lemar-aftaab\'\'\'\'\' is an [[afghanistan|afghan]] independent weekly magazine that focuses on the culture and politics of afghanistan.  compared to other publications in the country, \'\'aftaab\'\' has a secular bent and has drawn criticism from conservative [[islam]]ic scholars.\n\nin june 2003, the magazine was [[censorship|banned]] by the afghan government because several articles on islam were deemed to be [[sacrilege|sacrilegious]].  the editor of the magazine, [[mir hussein mehdavi]], was arrested by the authorities and charged with blasphemy.  he was later ordered to be released but may still stand trial.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.afghanmagazine.com official website]\n\n[[category:cultural magazines]]\n[[category:afghan political magazines]]\n\n\n{{poli-mag-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aftab_ahmad_khan</title><text>{{distinguish|aftab ahmed khan}}\n{{infobox military person\n|name=aftab ahmad khan\n|birth_date=22 october 1923\n|death_date= {{death date and age|2011|7|12|1923|10|22}}\n|birth_place= [[batala]], [[gurdaspur district]], [[punjab region|state of punjab]], [[british raj]], present-day india\n|death_place=[[lahore]], [[pakistan]]\n|image=\n|caption= lt. general aftab ahmad khan<br> (painted by [[hal bevan-petman]] ca. 1976)<br>from the collection of the family\n|nickname=\n|country={{pak}}\n|allegiance= {{flag icon|pak}}[[pakistan]]<br>[[file:british raj red ensign.svg|22x25px]] [[british raj|british india]]\n|branch= {{army|pakistan}}\n|servicenumber=pa - 656\n|serviceyears= 1941–1976\n|rank=[[file:us-o9 insignia.svg|25px]] [[lieutenant general]]\n|current position=\'\'retired\'\'\n|commands=[[x corps (pakistan)|x corps]], [[rawalpindi]]<br>[[vice chief of general staff (pakistan army)|vcgs]]\n|unit= [[punjab regiment (pakistan)|punjab regiment]]\n|battles= [[world war ii]]<br>[[indo-pakistani war of 1947]]<br>[[indo-pakistani war of 1965]]<br>[[indo-pakistani war of 1971]]\n|awards=datu of the [[order of sikatuna]]<br>[[file:phl order of sikatuna - grand cross bar.png|100px]]<br>großes verdienst kreuz der bundesrepublic deutschland<br>[[file:ger bundesverdienstkreuz 4 grvk.svg|100px]]\n|laterwork= ambassador of pakistan to libya<br>ambassador of pakistan to philippines\n}}\n\n[[lieutenant-general]] \'\'\'aftab ahmad khan\'\'\' was a retired [[pakistan army]] [[infantry]] officer, born in [[batala]], [[gurdaspur district]], [[british india]] on october 22, 1923 to the illustrious family of [[khan bahadur]] mian altaf hussain khan (1874–1946) and mehndi begum.\n\n== biography ==\n\n=== early life, military education and honors ===\n\nafter his initial education, at the municipal board (mb) high school batala, lt. general aftab ahmad khan graduated from the [[government college, lahore]], and joined the [[indian militar
<page> <title>aftab_ahmed_vohra</title><text>{{multiple issues|\n{{blp sources|date=april 2007}}\n{{pov|date=july 2013}}\n{{notability|date=july 2013}}\n}}\n\n\'\'\'aftab ahmed vohra\'\'\' is a [[pakistan]]i business figure based in [[lahore]], mostly in the [[chemical industry]]. he started his business in early 1970s.  he is the [[chairman]] of vohra group of companies. he belongs to reputable family of [[chiniotis|chinioti]] [[sheikh]]s.\n\nvohra is the former [[vice president]] of the [[lahore chamber of commerce & industry]] (lcci).\n\ncurrently, he is member executive committee of the lcci as well as life member of the [[federation of pakistan chambers of commerce & industry]] (fpcci). he is a member of fbr’s “alternate dispute resolution committee”. vohra has remained an executive committee member of india- pakistan chamber of commerce & industry (ipcci) under the patronage of fpcci & ficci.\n\nhe is a member of the [[lahore gymkhana]] club. he served as joint secretary of chiniot sheikh association, [[lahore]]. he has traveled extensively to [[germany]], [[sweden]], [[united kingdom]], [[malaysia]], [[india]] etc.\n\n==pak india trade promotion committee==\nvohra is the chairman of the pak india trade promotion committee. he is working hard since 2005 to strengthen the relations of [[pakistan]] and [[india]]. vohra regularly chairs meetings with companies and organisations relating to this.\n\non the 23of july 2013, a 12- member [[world bank]] mission visited lahore chamber of commerce and industry on monday and had an interactive session with the lcci members including aftab ahmed vohra on pak-india trade through land route. the world bank team headed by ms diep nguyen-van houtte, senior operations officer, south asia regional integration spent well over an hour at the lcci to gather the views of lcci members about facilities at [[wagha]].\n\n“everyone talks about indo-pak trade, but very few question insufficient facilities at the dry port. the gro
<page> <title>aftab_seth</title><text>\'\'\'aftab seth\'\'\' is a retired indian diplomat who served as ambassador of india to greece, vietnam and tokyo.<ref>{{cite web|author=dr. neeraj says: |url=http://sunandsands.com/blog/2010/06/15/chairman-ambassador-aftab-seth-with-h-e-mr-naoto-kan-file-photo/ |title=sun and sands advisors’ chairman, ambassador aftab seth with the prime minister h.e. mr. naoto kan (file photo) « sunandsands.com blog |publisher=sunandsands.com |date=2010-06-15 |accessdate=2012-03-26}}</ref> he is the brother of indian actor [[roshan seth]].<ref>[http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=7qpzaaaamaaj&q=roshan+seth+doon&dq=roshan+seth+doon&hl=en&sa=x&ei=uzxkuikoeiep0axtlodaaq&ved=0ce8q6aewbg requiem for a rainbow: a fijian indian story – satendra pratap nandan – google books<!-- bot generated title -->]</ref>\n\n== education ==\nseth completed his schooling from [[the doon school]].<ref>\'an indian in japan\' by aftab seth; about the author (graduated from the doon school...) p.xii</ref><ref>aftab seth (189-jaipur house) 1954-1959;the doon school old boys\' society register (2011) p.143</ref> he then went on to pursue b.a. (honours) in history from [[st. stephen\'s college, delhi|st. stephen\'s college]], [[university of delhi]] where he topped the university with first class honours. he then received a [[rhodes scholarship]] to read history and politics, constitutional history at [[christ church, oxford|christ church]], [[university of oxford|oxford]]. he then proceeded to do a doctorate in law from [[american college of greece]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gatewayhouse.in/expert/external/analysts/ambassador-aftab-seth |title=ambassador aftab seth &#124; gateway house |publisher=gatewayhouse.in |date= |accessdate=2012-03-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://jp.fujitsu.com/group/fri/en/topics/120217-profile.html |title=the 3rd japan india intellectual forum, guest speaker profile : fujitsu research institute |publisher=jp.fujitsu.com |date= |
<page> <title>aftenland</title><text>{{infobox album | <!-- see wikipedia:wikiproject_albums -->\n| name        = aftenland\n| type        = album\n| artist      = [[jan garbarek]]\n| cover       = aftenland.jpg\n| released    = 1980\n| recorded    = december 1979\n| genre       = [[jazz]]\n| length      = 45:13\n| label       = [[ecm records|ecm]]\n| producer    = [[manfred eicher]]\n| chronology  = [[jan garbarek]]\n| last album  = \'\'[[photo with blue sky, white cloud, wires, windows and a red roof]]\'\'<br>(1978)\n| this album  = \'\'\'\'\'aftenland\'\'\'\'\'<br>(1979)\n| next album  = \'\'[[eventyr]]\'\'<br>(1980)\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'aftenland\'\'\'\'\' is an album by norwegian jazz composer and saxophonist [[jan garbarek]] and organist kjell johnsen recorded in 1979 and released on the [[ecm records|ecm]] label in 1980.<ref name=\"ecm discography\">[http://www.ecmrecords.com/catalogue/ecm/1100/1169.php? ecm discography] accessed september 15, 2011</ref>\n\n==reception==\nthe [[allmusic]] review awarded the album 2 stars.<ref name=\"allmusic\">[http://www.allmusic.com/album/aftenland-r139059 allmusic review] accessed september 15, 2011</ref>  \n{{album ratings\n| rev1 = \'\'[[allmusic]]\'\'\n| rev1score = {{rating|2|5}}<ref name=\"allmusic\"/>}}\n\n==track listing==\n:\'\'all compositions by jan garbarek and kjell johnsen\'\'\n# \" aftenland\" - 7:14   \n# \"syn\" - 6:42   \n# \"linje\" - 1:58   \n# \"bue\" - 2:04   \n# \"enigma\" - 3:39   \n# \"kilden\" - 7:33   \n# \"spill\" - 4:21   \n# \"iskirken\" - 6:48   \n# \"tegn\" - 4:54  \n**recorded at engelbrektskyrkan in stockolm, sweden in december 1979\n\n==personnel==\n*[[jan garbarek]] - [[soprano saxophone]], [[tenor saxophone]], [[flute|wood flute]]\n*kjell johnsen - [[pipe organ]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{jan garbarek}}\n\n[[category:ecm records albums]]\n[[category:jan garbarek albums]]\n[[category:1980 albums]]\n[[category:albums produced by manfred eicher]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>after_miss_julie</title><text>{{infobox play\n| name              = after miss julie\n| image             = after miss julie poster.jpg\n| image_size        =\n| caption           = after miss julie original west end production poster\n| writer            = [[patrick marber]]\n| chorus            =\n| characters        =\n| mute              =\n| setting           =\n| date of premiere  = 20 november 2003\n| country of origin = {{flagicon|england}} [[england]]\n| original language = [[english language|english]]\n| series            =\n| subject           =\n| genre             = comedy drama\n| web               = http://www.donmarwarehouse.com/pl26.html\n| playbill_event    =\n| ibdb_id           =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'after miss julie\'\'\'\'\' is a [[play (theatre)|play]] by [[patrick marber]] which relocates [[august strindberg]]\'s naturalist tragedy, \'\'[[miss julie]]\'\' (1888), to an [[english country house]] in july 1945. the re-imagining of the events of strindberg\'s original are transposed to the night of the [[labour party (uk)|british labour party\'s]] \"landslide\" election victory.\n\n==plot and characters==\nthere are only three characters in \'\'after miss julie\'\'; miss julie, a rich lady in her 25s, and two servants: john, a valet/chauffer, aged 30, and christine, a cook aged 35. the action takes place in the kitchen of a large country house outside london, when the british labour party have just won their famous \'landslide\' election victory.\n\n==production history==\n===screen history===\n\'\'after miss julie\'\', written and directed by [[patrick marber]], was screened by [[bbc two]] on 4 november 1995 as part of the performance season. miss julie was played by [[geraldine somerville]], john was played by [[phil daniels]] and christine was played by [[kathy burke]].\n\n===stage history===\nthe stage premiere was at the [[donmar warehouse]] in london on 20 november 2003; its run ended on 7 february 2004. the three characters were pl

<page> <title>afterfeast</title><text>an \'\'\'afterfeast\'\'\' is a period of celebration attached to one of the [[great feasts]] celebrated by the [[eastern orthodox church|orthodox christian]] and [[eastern catholic churches]] (roughly equivalent to what in the west would be called an [[octave (liturgical)|octave]]). \n\nthe celebration of the [[great feasts of the orthodox church|great feasts]] of the [[church year#eastern orthodox church|church year]] are extended for a number of days, depending upon the particular feast. each day of an afterfeast will have particular hymns assigned to it, continuing the theme of the feast being celebrated. at each of the [[divine services]] during an afterfeast, the [[troparion]] and [[kontakion]] of the feast are read or chanted. the [[canon (hymnography)|canon]] of the feast will usually be chanted on every day of the afterfeast (if two canons were chanted on the day of the feast, they will be alternated on the days of the afterfeast). some of the great feasts of the lord will have a special canon composed of only three odes, called a \'\'triode\'\', which will be chanted at [[compline]] on each day of the afterfeast. \n\nmost of these great feasts also have a day or more of preparation called a \'\'\'forefeast\'\'\' (those feasts that are on the moveable [[paschal cycle]] do not have forefeasts). forefeasts and afterfeasts will affect the structure of the services during the [[canonical hours#eastern orthodox and eastern catholic usage|canonical hours]].\n\nthe last day of an afterfeast is called the \'\'\'apodosis\'\'\' (\"leave-taking\", lit. \"giving-back\") of the feast. on the apodosis, most of the hymns that were chanted on the first day of the feast are repeated. on the apodosis of feasts of the [[theotokos]], the epistle and gospel from the day of the feast are repeated again at the [[divine liturgy]].\n\nthe forefeasts and afterfeasts break down as follows:\n\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! days of \nforefeast\n! na
<page> <title>afternoon_of_a_faun</title><text>\'\'\'l\'après-midi d\'un faune\'\'\' (or \'\'\'the afternoon of a faun\'\'\') may refer to the following:\n*[[l\'après-midi d\'un faune (poem)]] by stéphane mallarmé\n**\'\'[[prélude à l\'après-midi d\'un faune]]\'\' (\'\'prelude to the afternoon of a faun\'\'), composition by claude debussy, inspired by mallarmé\'s poem\n**[[afternoon of a faun (nijinsky)|\'\'afternoon of a faun\'\' (nijinsky)]], ballet by vaslav nijinsky, which uses debussy\'s music and was also inspired by mallarmé\n**[[afternoon of a faun (robbins)|\'\'afternoon of a faun\'\' (robbins)]], ballet by jerome robbins to debussy\'s music\n**[[afternoon of a faun (rushton)|\'\'afternoon of a faun\'\' (rushton)]], ballet by tim rushton to debussy\'s music made on johan kobborg \n\n{{disambig}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aftimios_ofiesh</title><text>[[image:aftimios ofiesh.gif|right|frame|aftimios ofiesh]]\n{{orthodoxyinamerica}}\n\'\'\'aftimios ofiesh\'\'\' (1880-1966, né abdullah aftimios ofiesh, names sometimes spelled variously as \"oftimios,\" \"ofeish,\" or \"ofiesch\") was an early 20th-century orthodox [[bishop]] in america, serving as the immediate successor to st. [[raphael of brooklyn]] under the auspices of the [[church of russia]].  he held the title \'\'bishop of brooklyn\'\' from 1917 until april 1933, when he married, thus deposing himself from the episcopacy.  he is perhaps best known in our day as being the source of numerous lines of succession of \'\'[[episcopi vagantes]]\'\' and led the [[american orthodox catholic church]] for most of its existence.  he died in 1966.\n\n==life==\nfollowing the untimely death of st. [[raphael of brooklyn]] in 1915, [[archimandrite]] aftimios (ofiesh) was elected to serve as his replacement in caring for the arab orthodox faithful in america under the [[church of russia]]\'s canonical authority.  he was consecrated by archbishop [[evdokim (meschersky) of the aleutians|evdokim (meschersky)]] as an [[auxiliary bishop]] in 1917 with the title of \'\'bishop of brooklyn\'\'.  in 1923, in recognition for his work in america, he was elevated by metropolitan [[platon (rozhdestvensky) of new york]] to the rank of [[archbishop]].\n\nin 1924, in the canonical chaos of american orthodoxy following the onset of the bolshevik revolution in russia, the arab orthodox faithful split into two factions, one which wished to go under the canonical authority of the [[church of antioch]] and another which wished to stay faithful to the [[church of russia]].  the former group was organized by bishop [[victor (abu assaly) of new york]], thus beginning the official presence of the church of antioch on american soil.\n\nin 1927, aftimios was commissioned by the russian [[diocese]] in america to form an english-speaking \"[[american orthodox 
<page> <title>afzal_ahsan_randhawa</title><text>\'\'\'afzal ahsan randhawa\'\'\' is a [[pakistan]]i [[writer]]. he has written several [[novel]]s in the [[punjabi language]] including \'\'sooraj grehan\'\' and \'\'doaba\'\'.<ref>http://openlibrary.org/a/ol4416595a/afzal-ahsan-randhawa</ref> in 1986, he was awarded the prof. [[piara singh gill]] & karam singh sandhu memorial antar-rashtari shiromani sahitkaar/kalakaar award at the international association of punjabi authors and artists.<ref>http://www.nriinternet.com/associations/canada/a_z/i/i.a.p.a.a/2_award-list.htm</ref>\n\n==references==\n {{portal|literature}}\n<references/>\n\n{{authority control|viaf=9018833}}\n{{persondata\n| name              = randhawa, afzal ahsan\n| alternative names =\n| short description = pakistani writer\n| date of birth     =\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:randhawa, afzal ahsan}}\n[[category:pakistani writers]]\n[[category:living people]]\n\n\n{{pakistan-writer-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>afzelia_bipindensis</title><text><!-- this article was auto-generated by [[user:polbot]]. -->\n{{taxobox\n|status = vu\n|status_system = iucn2.3\n|regnum = [[plant]]ae\n|unranked_divisio = [[angiosperms]]\n|unranked_classis = [[eudicots]]\n|unranked_ordo = [[rosids]]\n|ordo = [[fabales]]\n|familia = [[fabaceae]]\n|genus = \'\'[[afzelia]]\'\'\n|species = \'\'\'\'\'a. bipindensis\'\'\'\'\'\n|binomial = \'\'afzelia bipindensis\'\'\n|binomial_authority = [[hermann harms|harms]]\n|}}\n\'\'\'\'\'afzelia bipindensis\'\'\'\'\' (common name \'\'\'apa\'\'\') is an economic species of [[tropical rainforest|rain forest]] [[tree]] in the [[fabaceae]] family.  it is found in [[angola]], [[cameroon]], [[central african republic]], [[republic of the congo]], [[democratic republic of the congo]], [[gabon]], [[nigeria]], and [[uganda]].\nit is threatened by [[habitat loss]].\n==references==\n* african regional workshop (conservation & sustainable management of trees, zimbabwe) 1998.  [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/33033/all afzelia bipindensis]. <page> <title>agapeta</title><text>{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'\'\'\'agapeta\'\'\'\'\'\n| image = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[tortricidae]]\n| subfamilia = [[tortricinae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'agapeta\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = hubner, 1822\n| subdivision_ranks = species\n| subdivision = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agapeta\'\'\'\'\' is a genus of [[moth]]s belonging to the subfamily [[tortricinae]] of the family [[tortricidae]].<ref>{{cite web|author=baixeras, j., brown, j. w., and gilligan, t. m. |url=http://www.tortricidae.com/catalogue.asp |title=online world catalogue of the tortricidae|publisher=tortricidae.com|accessdate=january 20, 2009}}</ref>\n\n==species==\n*\'\'[[agapeta angelana]]\'\' <small>(kennel, 1919)</small>\n*\'\'[[agapeta hamana]]\'\' <small>(linnaeus, 1758)</small>\n*\'\'[[agapeta largana]]\'\' <small>(rebel, 1906)</small>\n*\'\'[[agapeta zoegana]]\'\' <small>(linnaeus, 1767)</small>\n\n==see also==\n*[[list of tortricidae genera]]\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.tortricidae.com/cataloguegenuslist.asp?gcode=25 tortricidae.com]\n\n{{tortricinae-stub}}\n\n[[category:tortricidae]]\n\n{{italictitle}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agapius_ii_matar</title><text>{{infobox patriarch\n|image=\n|honorific-prefix =\n|name= agapius ii matar\n|birth_name= agapius matar\n|church=[[melkite greek catholic church]]\n|see=[[patriarch of antioch]]\n|patriarch_of=[[list of melkite greek catholic patriarchs of antioch|patriarch of antioch]]\n|enthroned= 11 september 1796\n|ended= 2 february 1812\n|predecessor=[[cyril vii siaj]]\n|successor=[[ignatius iv sarrouf]]\n|birth_date= 1736\n|birth_place= [[damascus]], [[syria]]\n|death_date= {{birthdeathage||1736|||1812|2|2|yes}}\n|death_place= [[ain traz]], [[lebanon]]\n|consecration = 1795 ([[bishop (catholic church)|bishop]])\n|consecrated_by=[[cyril vii siaj]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'agapius ii matar\'\'\', (sometime also known as \'\'agapios iii\'\', 1736–1812) was [[patriarch]] of the [[melkite greek catholic church]] from 1796 to 1812.\n\n== life ==\nagapius matar was born in 1736 in [[damascus]]. he entered young in the [[basilian salvatorian order]]. in 1779, when he was already a [[priesthood (catholic church)|priest]], he traveled to [[rome]] and later to [[paris]]. in 1789 he was appointed [[abbot|superior]] of the basilian salvatorian order and in 1795 he was appointed and consecrated bishop of [[sidon|saida]] by patriarch [[cyril vii siaj]]. on 11 september 1796<ref>on 31 august according to the [[julian calendar]]</ref> he was elected patriarch.<ref name=\"dhge\">{{cite encyclopedia |author=c.karalevsky|title=agapios iii|encyclopedia=[[dictionnaire d\'histoire et de géographie ecclésiastiques]]| volume=1| pages=897–899| publisher =letouzey et ané|location=paris|year=1912}}</ref>\n\nthe first problem agapius matar had to face as patriarch were the clashes with the [[metropolitan bishop|metropolitan]] of [[beirut]] (see article [[ignatius iv sarrouf]]) that saw agapius matar allied with [[germanos adam]] bishop of [[aleppo]] in rejecting the disciplinary reform (and later the new foundation) of the monastic orders promoted by sarrouf and by th
<page> <title>agar_tum_na_hote</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name           = agar tum na hote\n| image          = agar tum na hote.jpg\n| image size     =\n| caption        =\n| director       = [[lekh tandon]]\n| producer       = [[rajeev kumar]]\n| writer         = ramesh pant\n| narrator       =\n| starring       = [[rajesh khanna]]<br />[[rekha]]<br />[[raj babbar]]<br />[[madan puri]]<br />[[asrani]]\n| music          = [[r d burman]]<br />[[gulshan bawra]] (lyrics)\n| cinematography =\n| editing        =\n| distributor    =\n| released       = 4 november 1983\n| runtime        =\n| country        = [[india]]\n| language       = [[hindi]]\n| budget         =\n| gross          =\n| preceded by    =\n| followed by    =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agar tum na hote\'\'\'\'\' is a [[1983 in film|1983]] [[cinema of india|indian]] [[bollywood]] film directed by lekh tandon. the film stars [[rajesh khanna]], [[rekha]] and [[raj babbar]] in leading roles.\n\n==story==\n\'\'\'ashok mehra\'\'\', played by [[rajesh khanna]], is a wealthy industrialist, whose business produces cosmetic products. he is happily married to \'\'\'purnima\'\'\', played by [[rekha]], but she suffers complications after giving birth to their daughter, and the doctors are not able to save her life, leaving ashok devastated. he is able to pull himself together and rediscover his will to live only because of his obligation to his daughter, \'\'\'mini\'\'\'.\n\nseveral years pass, and ashok is able to resume his life as normal, except that he is unable to handle mini’s (played now by \'\'\'baby shabana\'\'\') envious pining for a mother to love her the way other children’s mothers love them. he is forced to lie to satisfy her, saying that it is possible that her mother will return from “[[heaven|god’s house]]”. eventually, mini becomes frustrated with waiting for her mother to return to her, and her behavior degrades severely, to the point that no school is willing to teach her, nor is any governess wi
<page> <title>agaraea_klagesi</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 220px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropoda]]\n| classis = [[insecta]]\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[arctiidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agaraea]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. klagesi\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agaraea klagesi\'\'\n| binomial_authority = rothschild, 1909\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agaraea klagesi\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[arctiidae]] family. it was described by rothschild in 1909. it is found in [[brazil]].<ref>[ftp://ftp.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/noctuoidea/arctiidae/arctiinae/agaraea/index.html agaraea at funet]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{refs}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1909]]\n[[category:arctiidae]]\n\n{{arctiidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agaraea_phaeophlebia</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = \n| image_width = 220px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropoda]]\n| classis = [[insecta]]\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[arctiidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agaraea]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. phaeophlebia\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agaraea phaeophlebia\'\'\n| binomial_authority = hampson, 1920 \n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agaraea phaeophlebia\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[arctiidae]] family. it was described by hampson in 1920. it is found in [[venezuela]].<ref>[ftp://ftp.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/noctuoidea/arctiidae/arctiinae/agaraea/index.html agaraea at funet]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{refs}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1920]]\n[[category:arctiidae]]\n\n{{arctiidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agarakkirangudi</title><text>{{orphan|date=april 2011}}\n{{no footnotes|date=january 2013}}\n{{infobox indian jurisdiction |\nnative_name = agarakkirangudi | \ntype = village | \nlatd = |latm = |lats =   | longd =  |longm = |longs=|\nlocator_position = right | \nskyline=|\nskyline_caption=  |\nstate_name = tamil nadu |\ndistrict = [[nagapattinam district|nagapattinam]] |\nleader_title=panchayat president |\nleader_name=  |\naltitude=|\npopulation_as_of = 2001 |\npopulation_total = 1792| \npopulation_density =   |\narea_magnitude= |\narea_total =  |\npostal_code=  |\narea_telephone=  |\nvehicle_code_range=  |\nfootnotes = | \nwebsite=\n}}\n\'\'\'agarakkirangudi\'\'\' is a village in the [[mayiladuthurai taluk]] of [[nagapattinam district]], [[tamil nadu]], [[india]].\n\n== demographics ==\n\nas per the 2001 census, agarakkirangudi had a total population of 1792 with 915 males and 877 females. the sex ratio was 978. the literacy rate was 74.01.\n\n== references ==\n\n* {{cite web|title=primary census abstract - census 2001|url=http://www.census.tn.nic.in/pca2001.aspx|publisher=directorate of census operations-tamil nadu}}\n\n{{coord missing|tamil nadu}}\n\n[[category:villages in nagapattinam district]]\n\n\n{{nagapattinam-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agaricus_subrutilescens</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = agaricus subrutilescens 125191.jpg\n| image_width = 234px\n| regnum = [[fungi]]\n| divisio = [[basidiomycota]]\n| classis = [[agaricomycetes]]\n| ordo = [[agaricales]]\n| familia = [[agaricaceae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agaricus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. subrutilescens\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agaricus subrutilescens\'\'\n| binomial_authority =  ([[calvin henry kauffman|kauffman]]) [[john w. hotson|hotson]] & [[daniel e. stuntz|d.e.stuntz]] (1938)\n| synonyms_ref =\n| synonyms = \'\'psalliota subrutilescens\'\' <small>[[william henry kauffman|kauffman]] (1925)</small>\n}}\n{{mycomorphbox \n| name = \'\'agaricus subrutilescens\'\'\n| whichgills = free \n| capshape = convex \n| hymeniumtype=gills\n| stipecharacter=ring\n| ecologicaltype=saprotrophic\n| sporeprintcolor=brown\n| howedible=edible\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agaricus subrutilescens\'\'\'\'\', also known as the \'\'\'wine-colored agaricus\'\'\', is a [[mushroom]] of the genus \'\'[[agaricus]]\'\'.  this mushroom is a good [[edible mushroom|edible]]. it was first described scientifically in 1925 as \'\'psalliota subrutilescens\'\',<ref name=kauffman1925/> and later transferred to \'\'agaricus\'\' in 1938.<ref name=hotson1938/>\n\n==description==\n\'\'\'\'\'agaricus subrutilescens\'\'\'\'\' has a [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] that is {{convert|5|–|13|cm|in|abbr=on}} across, dry, and has many and wine to brown colored fibers, especially near the center.  the [[lamella (mycology)|gills]] are close and white at first, turning dark brown in age.  the [[stipe (mycology)|stalk]] has a skirt-like [[annulus (mycology)|ring]] and is {{convert|4|to|20|cm|in|abbr=on}} long, {{convert|1|–|3|cm|in|1|abbr=on}} thick, long, white, and covered with soft woolly scales.  the [[trama (mycology)|flesh]] is white and does not stain, and the odor and taste is pleasant.\n\nthe purplish fibrous cap and shaggy white stem differentiate this mushroom from others which res
<page> <title>agasti_lakshmi_stotra</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=january 2008}}\n\n{{hinduism_small}}\nthis is a prayer to goddess [[lakshmi]] by the great sage [[agasti]]. it is said to be a very fruitful prayer. the benefits of reciting this prayer are listed at the end of the page.\n\n==agasti\'s sri lakshmi stotra==\n\'\'jaya padma-pala-akshi jay tvam sri pati priyeye\'\'\n\'\'jaya matr maha lakshmi sansaaraarn-avtaarini\'\'\n\n\'\'\'glory be to ma lashmi, who has eyes like lotus flower petals. glory be to the one who is dear to the husband of sri (sri herself). glory be to mother lakshmi, the great lakshmi, who delivers us from the ocean of this world\'\'\'\n\n\'\'maha-lakshmi namast-ubhayam namast-ubhyam sur-eshwari\'\'\n\'\'hari-priye namast-ubhyam namast-ubhyam daya-nidhe\'\'\n\n\'\'\'o great lakshmi, i bow to you. i bow to you o queen of gods. o dear to the lord [[hari]], i bow to you, i bow to you o full of kindness\'\'\'\n\n\'\'padma-alye namast-ubhyam namast-ubhyam cha sarvade\'\'\n\'\'sarva-bhoot-hit-aarthye vasuvrishtim sada kuru\'\'\n\n\'\'\'o seated on a lotus seat, i bow to you, i bow to you always. for the benefit of all beings, please spread your mercy always.\'\'\'\n\n\'\'jagan-martr-namast-ubhyam namast-ubhyam dayanidhe\'\'\n\'\'dayavati namast-ubhyam vishv-eshwari namo-astu te\'\'\n\n\'\'\'o mother of this world, i bow to you, i bow to you o full of kindness, o kind-hearted, i bow to you, o ruler of this world, i am bowed to you.\'\'\'\n\n\'\'namah ksheer-arn-vasute namas-trai-lokya-dharini\'\'\n\'\'vasuvrishte namast-ubhyam raksh <page> <title>agathagowdanahalli</title><text>{{infobox indian jurisdiction\n|type = village\n|native_name = agathagowdanahalli\n|other_name =\n|taluk_names = gundlupet\n|district = [[chamarajanagar]]\n|state_name = karnataka\n|nearest_city = chamarajanagar\n|parliament_const =\n|assembly_const =\n|civic_agency = village panchayat\n|skyline =\n|skyline_caption = agathagowdanahalli is in chamarajanagar district\n|latd = |latm = |lats =\n|longd= |longm= |longs=\n|locator_position = right\n|area_total =\n|area_magnitude =\n|altitude =\n|population_total =\n|population_as_of = 2001\n|population_density =\n|sex_ratio =\n|literacy =\n|area_telephone =\n|postal_code =\n|vehicle_code_range =\n|climate=\n|website=\n}}\n\n\'\'\' agathagowdanahalli \'\'\' is a [[village]] in the [[south india|southern]] state of [[karnataka]], [[india]].<ref name=\"censusindia\">{{cite web|url=http://www.censusindia.gov.in/census_data_2001/village_directory/list_of_village/list_of_villages_alphabetical.aspx|title=census of india : list of villages alphabetical order > karnataka|first=registrar general & census commissioner, india|accessdate=2008-12-18}} , census village code= 2892500</ref><ref name=\"yahoomaps\">{{cite web|url=http://in.maps.yahoo.com|title=yahoo! maps india :|accessdate=2009-04-17}} agathagowdanahalli, chamarajanagar, karnataka</ref> it is located in the [[gundlupet]] [[taluk]] of [[chamarajanagar district]] in karnataka.\n\n==see also==\n* [[chamarajanagar]]\n* [[districts of karnataka]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* http://chamarajanagar.nic.in/\n\n{{settlements in chamarajanagar district}}\n\n{{coord missing|karnataka}}\n\n[[category:villages in chamarajanagar district]]\n\n{{chamarajanagar-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agathis_dammara</title><text>{{italictitle}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'agathis dammara\'\'\n| status = ne | status_system = iucn3.1\n| image =agathis_dammara_-_köhler–s_medizinal-pflanzen-155.jpg\n| image_width = 220px\n| status = \n| regnum = [[plant]]ae\n| divisio = [[pinophyta]]\n| classis = [[pinophyta|pinopsida]]\n| ordo = [[pinales]]\n| familia = [[araucariaceae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agathis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. dammara\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agathis dammara\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[lamb.]]) [[rich.]]\n| synonyms= \n#\'\'a. alba\'\' (koord.) warb\n#\'\'a. celebica\'\' (koord.) warb\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agathis dammara\'\'\'\'\' is a [[pinophyta|coniferous]] [[lumber|timber]]<ref>[http://tropix.cirad.fr/asia/agathis.pdf agathis wood]</ref> tree native to the [[moluccas]] and the [[philippines]].\n\n==description==\n[[file:collectie tropenmuseum het sorteren van het zaad van een damarboom (agathis alba) west-preanger tmnr 60051135.jpg|thumb|left|women sorting dammar seeds in west-preanger, [[java]]. 1936]]\n\'\'agathis dammara\'\' is a medium-large conifer up to 60 metres in height found in tropical rainforests, growing from sea level to very high mountainous regions where it becomes extremely stunted. it belongs to the southern hemisphere family [[araucariaceae]], widespread throughout the entire mesozoic, emerging about 200 million years ago. an extinct genus, \'\'protodammara\'\' (which appeared long ago, during the mesozoic), derives its name from this tree. this tree is a source of [[dammar gum]], also known as cat-eye resin.\n\n==taxonomy==\n\nwhen first discovered and listed as a species it was placed in the genus \'\'[[pinus]]\'\' (lambert, 1803), and later with \'\'[[abies]]\'\', (poir 1817) the firs, and later with its own genus (\'\'dammara\'\'). it was first recognised as being part of \'\'agathis\'\' in 1807 when it was listed as \'\'agathis loranthifolia\'\', and beyond that with species names \'\'beccarii\'\', \'\'ce

<page> <title>agaton_sax_and_the_diamond_thieves</title><text>\'\'\'\'\'agaton sax and the diamond thieves\'\'\'\'\' (originally published as \'\'agaton sax och de slipade diamanttjuvarna\'\' in 1959; published in english in 1973) is a book about detective [[agaton sax]] by swedish author [[nils-olof franzen]].\n\n==plot summary==\nthe koh-mi-nor diamond is stolen and a very clever thief is putting messages about it, in a secret code, in the personal column of the newspaper published by the swedish detective agaton sax.\n\n{{child-novel-stub}}\n\n[[category:children\'s novels]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agave_macroacantha</title><text>{{no footnotes|date=december 2012}}\n{{hatnote|not to be confused with \'\'agave macrantha\'\', a synonym of \'\'[[agave mitis]]\'\'}}\n{{speciesbox\n|taxon = agave macroacantha\n|image = agave macroacantha 1.jpg\n|authority = [[joseph gerhard zuccarini|zucc.]]\n|}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agave macroacantha\'\'\'\'\' is a species of succulent in the [[agavaceae]] family naturally occurring in [[oaxaca]] and the town of [[tehuacan]] in mexico.\n\n==description==\n\'\'agave macroacantha\'\' is a medium sized leaf rosette that can be basal or can grow on a very short stem. leaves are succulent, greyish green and up to 1.8 feet long at a maximum, ending in sharp black spines that are up to 1.2 inches long at the tips. flowers are small, grey and red, growing in bunches on sturdy stems of up to 10 feet in height.\n\n==cultivation==\nthe plant prefers a dry, sunny and hot location for summer and from early autumn onwards a cooler, well-lit space. it likes regular watering in summer and only minimum watering in winter, and will fare well in a large pot with sparse, gravelly soil.\n\n==references==\n*the complete encyclopedia of succulents by zdenek jezek and libor kunte\n\n[[category:agave|macroacantha]]\n[[category:flora of oaxaca]]\n[[category:flora of puebla]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agawmeder</title><text>\'\'\'agawmeder\'\'\' was a historical state and region in the northwestern part of [[ethiopia]]. its most likely etymology is from \'\'agew\'\' ([[ge\'ez language|ge\'ez]], አገው [[agaw]]), a people living in the area, plus \'\'meder\'\' (land), thus meaning \"land of the agaw\".<ref>herausgegeben von uhlig, siegbert, \'\'encyclopaedia aethiopica: a-c\'\'. wiesbaden:harrassowitz verlag, 2003. pp. 117</ref> the western neighbor of [[gojjam]], it was located where the [[agew awi zone]] now lies.\n\n==history==\nnot much is known about agawmeder, as much of is existence was marked by ethiopian isolation from the remainder of the world.<ref name=\"encyclopaedia\">herausgegeben von uhlig, siegbert. \'\'encyclopaedia: a-c\'\'. pp. 142.</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{coord missing|ethiopia}}\n\n[[category:geography of ethiopia]]\n\n{{ethiopia-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agdistis_cappadociensis</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agdistis cappadociensis\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pterophoridae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agdistis (moth)|agdistis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. cappadociensis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agdistis cappadociensis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = fazekas, 2000\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agdistis cappadociensis\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[pterophoridae]] family. it is found in [[turkey]] (including the sivas province). the habitat consists of heavily pastured steppe interspersed with ploughed fields. plants recorded on the site are \'\'[[crataegus]]\'\', \'\'[[allium]]\'\' and \'\'[[dianthus]]\'\' species.\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is about 22 mm. the ground colour of the forewings is brown with a slightly paler central area. there is a scattering of brown scales along the costal and dorsal areas. the fringe is unicolourous light brown-grey. the hindwings are light brown-grey.<ref>[http://www.archive.org/stream/nachrichtenblatt4951200002mn/nachrichtenblatt4951200002mn_djvu.txt nachrichtenblatt der bayerischen entomologen]</ref> adults have been recorded in may.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 2000]]\n[[category:agdistinae]]\n[[category:endemic fauna of turkey]]\n\n{{agdistinae-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>agdistis_nanodes</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agdistis nanodes\n| image = \n| image_size = 200px\n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[pterophoridae]]\n| subfamilia = \n| genus = \'\'[[agdistis (moth)|agdistis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. nanodes\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agdistis nanodes\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[edward meyrick|meyrick]], 1906<ref>[http://www.afromoths.net/species/show/39169 afro moths]</ref>\n| synonyms = \n*\'\'agdistis debilis\'\' <small>bigot, 1968</small>\n*\'\'agdistis sindicola\'\' <small>amsel, 1968</small> \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agdistis nanodes\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] in the [[pterophoridae]] family. it is known from [[egypt]], [[iran]], [[pakistan]], [[sri lanka]], [[bahrain]], [[saudi arabia]], the [[united arab emirates]], [[oman]] and [[yemen]].<ref>[http://www.soceurlep.eu/tl_files/nota/bd29_2/05_alipanah_final.indd.pdf a new species, a new synonym, and new distribution records in the genus agdistis hübner, 1825 from iran (pterophoridae: agdistinae)]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:agdistinae]]\n[[category:moths of iran]]\n\n{{agdistinae-stub}}</text> </page>
