<page> <title>agema</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=august 2013}}\n\'\'\'agema\'\'\' ({{lang-el|Άγημα}}), is a term to describe a military detachment, used for a special cause, such as guarding high valued targets. due to its nature the \'\'agema\'\' is most probably composed by elite troops. \n\n== etymology ==\nthe word derives from the greek verb \'\'ago\'\' ({{lang-el|\'\'Άγω\'\'}}; to route/to drive). it can literally mean a \'\'pack\'\', a \'\'routing\'\' party and/or a detachment that has a single commander.\n\n== macedonian army ==\nin ancient [[macedon]]ia, they were [[hypaspist]]s and [[asthetairoi]], and later [[argyraspids]] (silver shields). in the eastern [[diadochi]] states (the [[seleucid empire]], [[ptolemaic dynasty|ptolemaic]] egypt, the kingdom of [[bactria]]) they were the infantry guards of the king. the eastern agema guards wore bronze plate, [[phrygia]]n (or [[thrace|thracian]]) helmet and [[argos|argive]] shield, and carried [[sarissa]] and short sword.\n\n=== the agema in the antigonid army ===\nin macedon, especially under [[philip v of macedon]] and [[perseus of macedon]], the agema formed an elite body within the corps of \'[[peltasts]]\'. this corps is not to be confused with the light infantry. the macedonian peltast corps was the equivalent of the [[hypaspists]] in alexander the great\'s army. the agema, as well as the peltasts, according to duncan head, would fight in pitched battle as a conventional phalanx. yet they may have used lighter equipment for forced marches.\n\n=== the agema in the seleucid army ===\nthe agema had a full name, ‘the agema of the hypaspists’. the fact that there is an absence of them in detailed writings about the seleucid campaigns may be due that they only retained the second half of their name and were the hypaspists. they formed a crack force within the infantry guardsmen corps.\n\nthe agema in the [[seleucid]] army was also elite corps of cavalry that would escort the king into battle or be
<page> <title>agency_cost</title><text>an \'\'\'agency cost\'\'\' is an [[economics|economic]] concept concerning the cost to a \"[[principal (commercial law)|principal]]\" (an organization, person or group of persons), when the principal chooses or hires an \"[[agent (economics)|agent]]\" to act on its behalf. because the two parties have different interests and the agent has [[information asymmetry|more information]], the principal cannot directly ensure that its agent is always acting in its (the principals\') best interests.<ref name=bebchuk>\'\'pay without performance\'\' by lucian bebchuk and jesse fried, harvard university press 2004 ([http://www.pay-without-performance.com/preface%20and%20introduction.pdf preface and introduction])</ref>\n\ncommon examples of this cost include that borne by [[shareholder]]s (the principal), when [[corporate management#top-level managers|corporate management]] (the agent) buys other companies to expand its power, or spends money on wasteful pet projects, instead of maximizing the value of the corporation\'s worth; or by the voters of a politician\'s district (the principal) when the politician (the agent) passes legislation helpful to large contributors to their campaign rather than the  voters.<ref>[http://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/agencycosts.asp#ixzz1zbytzjnh investopedia explains \'agency costs\']</ref>  though effects of agency cost are present in any agency relationship, the term is most used in business contexts.\n\n==sources of the costs==\n\nthe costs consist of two main sources:\n\n# the costs inherently associated with using an agent (e.g., the risk that agents will use organizational resource for their own benefit) and\n# the costs of techniques used to mitigate the problems associated with using an agent—gathering more information on what the agent is doing (e.g., the costs of producing [[financial statements]]) or employing mechanisms to align the interests of the agent with those of the principal (e.g. com
<page> <title>agenda_for_change</title><text>\'\'\'agenda for change\'\'\' (\'\'\'afc\'\'\') is the current [[national health service]] (nhs) grading and pay system for all nhs staff, with the exception of [[physician|doctor]]s, [[dentist]]s and some senior [[management|managers]]. it covers more than 1 million people and harmonises their pay scales and career progression arrangements across traditionally separate pay groups, in the most radical change since the nhs was founded. \n\nit was agreed 1 december 2004, by unions, employers and government, but it is not yet fully implemented nationwide. although most nhs employees in england and wales have been transferred to the new system and received their back-pay, scotland has been slower to implement the system because scotland has taken a more robust approach to the implementation. all the signatory organisations have agreed to implement it through a partnership approach.\n\nafc assimilates staff to a new salary according to an evaluation of their job weight under an nhs job evaluation scheme. there are nine new numbered pay bands subdivided into points, similar to the old alphabetic [[whitley council]] \'grades\' pay scales. a set of national job profiles has been agreed to assist in the process of matching posts to pay bands. all staff will either be matched to a national job profile, or their job will be evaluated locally. in theory, afc is designed to evaluate the job rather than the person in it, and to ensure equity between similar posts in different areas. in reality it has been implemented differently in different places, and some posts have been graded very differently to similar jobs elsewhere, despite the supposedly tighter definitions. around 5% of staff have appealed their gradings, but again the appeals process varies from site to site. current indications suggest that lower bandings are being used in london and scotland than elsewhere in the country.\n\nunder afc, all staff will have annual developmen
<page> <title>agent_of_vega</title><text>{{infobox book | <!-- see [[wikipedia:wikiproject novels]] or [[wikipedia:wikiproject books]] -->\n| name          = agent of vega\n| title_orig    = \n| translator    = \n| image         = [[image:agent of vega.jpg|200px]]\n| caption = first edition cover\n| author        = [[james h. schmitz]]\n| illustrator   = \n| cover_artist  = w.i. van der poel\n| country       = [[united states]]\n| language      = [[english language|english]]\n| series        = \n| genre         = [[science fiction]] [[short stories]]\n| publisher     = [[gnome press]]\n| release_date  = [[1960 in literature|1960]]\n| media_type    = print ([[hardcover]])\n| pages         = 191 pp\n| isbn          = na\n| preceded_by   = \n| followed_by   = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agent of vega\'\'\'\'\' is a science fiction novel by [[james h. schmitz]], 1960. like the [[the foundation series|\'\'foundation\'\' series]], it is a collection of stories that originally appeared separately in magazines. it was republished in 2001 as \'\'agent of vega & other stories\'\'.\n\nthe tale began in 1949 as a longish short story published in the sf magazine \'\'[[analog science fiction and fact|astounding]]\'\'. in 1960 it appeared as a book, along with three loosely related stories set in the same time and context: \'\'the illusionists; the truth about cushgar; the second night of summer\'\'.  \n\nin the far future, humans are building a \'confederacy of [[vega in fiction|vega]]\' to replace the original fallen empire of earth. the new empire includes some mutated humans and also some non-humans. enemies are also a mix of humans and aliens and it is very much [[space opera]], featuring vega\'s \'zone agents\'. combat involves both physical weapons and telepathic attacks. it clearly owes a lot to [[e. e. smith]]\'s \'\'[[lensman]]\'\' series.\n\nunlike the six lensman books, the four stories are only loosely connected. each features a completely different set of enemies. the non-huma
<page> <title>agenville</title><text>{{infobox french commune\n|name                   = agenville\n|region                 = picardie\n|department             = somme\n|arrondissement         = amiens\n|canton                 = bernaville\n|insee                  = 80005\n|postal code            = 80370\n|mayor                  = dany petit\n|term                   = 2001&ndash;2008\n|intercommunality       = bernavillois\n|longitude              = 2.1036\n|latitude               = 50.1664\n|elevation m            = 140\n|elevation min m        = 88\n|elevation max m        = 136\n|area km2               = 3.3\n|population             = 106\n|population date        = 2006\n}}\n\n\'\'\'agenville\'\'\' is a [[communes of france|commune]] in the [[somme]] [[department in france|department]] in [[picardie]] in northern [[france]].\n\n==geography==\nthe commune is a village of mixed farming situated {{convert|15|mi|km|0}} northeast of abbeville on the d56 road.\n\nsurrounded by the common  [[domléger-longvillers]], [[conteville, somme|conteville]] and [[prouville]], agenville is located 20 km north-east of abbeville\'s largest city nearby. <ref>[http://www.annuaire-mairie.fr/mairie-agenville.html \"annuaire-mairie\"]</ref>\n\n==history==\ndestroyed by the english at the time of the [[battle of crecy]] in 1346 and rebuilt on a new site.\nrebuilt after the bombardments of 1944, when 95% of the village was destroyed, as the [[v1 rocket]] site was nearby.\nagenville was once a centre of a pilgrimage.\n\n==demography==\n{{demography\n|1962 = 99\n|1968 = 103\n|1975 = 95\n|1982 = 89\n|1990 = 84\n|1999 = 91\n|2006 = 106\n|withoutdoublecount = 1962\n}}\n\n==see also==\n[[communes of the somme department]]\n\n==references==\n*[http://www.insee.fr/en/home/home_page.asp insee]\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.agenville.com/ an agenville website]\n* [http://www.quid.fr/communes.html?mode=detail&id=31379&req=agenville agenville on the website of quid]\n* [http://www
<page> <title>agenzia_fides</title><text>[[image:logo agenzia fides.gif|thumb|right|agenzia fides logo]]\n\'\'\'agenzia fides\'\'\' is the [[news agency]] of the [[holy see|vatican]]. it is based in the \'\'palazzo de propaganda fide\'\' in [[vatican city]]. it is part of the [[congregation for the evangelization of peoples]]. it was formed on june 5, 1927 as the first missionary news agency of the [[roman catholic church]] and was approved by [[pope pius xi]]. current director is prof. luca de mata.\n \nagenzia fides started to issue editions in english, french and polish (latter for a short period) followed by those in italian (1929), spanish (1930), german (1932), chinese (1998), portuguese (2002) and arabic (2008). since 1998 fides service went online with up to five reports daily from non-european events. its homepage consists of information about statistics and [[missionaries]] killed as [[christian martyrs|martyrs]]. \n\nthe image archive of the agency includes about 10,000 photographs<ref>[http://www.fides.org/galleria/ image archive]</ref> documenting the history of catholic missions from the years 1930 to 1990.\n\n== references ==\n<references/>\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.fides.org/index.php?lan=eng agenzia fides website]\n\n[[category:news agencies]]\n\n{{rc-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aggersborg</title><text>[[image:aggersborg viking castle.jpg|thumb|300px|aggersborg, the largest viking ring castle in denmark.]]\n\n\'\'\'aggersborg\'\'\' is the largest of [[denmark]]\'s former [[viking ring castles]], and one of the largest archeological sites in denmark. it is located near [[aggersund]] on the north side of the [[limfjord]]. it consisted of a [[circular rampart]] surrounded by a [[ditch]]. four main [[road]]s arranged in a [[cross]] connected the castle centre with the outer ring. the roads were tunnelled under the outer rampart, leaving the circular structure intact.\n\nthe ring castle had an inner diameter of 240 metres. the ditch was located eight metres outside of the rampart, and was approximately 1.3 metres deep. the wall is believed to have been four metres tall. the rampart was constructed of soil and turf, reinforced and clad with oak wood. the rampart formed the basis for a wooden [[parapet]]. smaller streets were located within the four main sections of the fortress.\n\nthe modern aggersborg is a reconstruction created in the 1990s. it is lower than the original fortress.\n\n== dating of the site ==\n[[image:wikingerburgen.jpg|right|thumb|sites of the viking ring castles.]]\n[[image:fyrkat hus stor.jpg|thumb|200px|reconstruction of a viking house.]]\n[[image:aggersborg guldarmring stor.jpg|thumb|golden armband found near aggersborg.]]\n\ndating the structure has proven difficult, since the archaeological site has also been the site of an [[germanic iron age|iron age]] village. the ring castle is believed to have been constructed around 980 during the reign of king [[harold bluetooth]] and / or [[sweyn forkbeard]]. five of the six ring castles in historical denmark have been dated to this era. the structure was completed within one or two years, and only used for a short period of time; between five and twenty years.\n\n== archaeological remains ==\n\narchaeologists have estimated that the ring castle could hold a 5,000-m
<page> <title>agglomeration_community_of_rouen</title><text>{{french communate\n| nom=agglomeration community of rouen\n| images=\n|rég=[[haute-normandie]] [[image:blason_region_fr_normandie.svg|20px]]\n|dépt=[[seine-maritime]]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[[image:blason76.svg|20px]]\n| création=2001\n| nbcomm=45\n| siège=[[rouen]]\n| prés=[[laurent fabius]]\n| party=[[socialist party (france)|ps]]\n| term=2008-2014\n| pop=411,435\n| datepop=2007\n| superf=448\n| dens=\n| budget=\n| siteweb=[http://www.agglo-rouen.fr/ official site of the agglo-rouen.fr]\n| imagesfin=\n|}}\n[[image:panorama rouen.jpg|thumb|a view of the agglomeration of rouen|right|380px]]\nthe \'\'\'[[agglomeration communities in france|agglomeration community]] of rouen\'\'\' is located in the [[seine-maritime]] \'\'[[departments of france|département]]\'\' in the [[haute-normandie]] region of northern [[france]]. \n\n== participants ==\nthe agglomeration community is composed of the following 45 communes:\n*[[amfreville-la-mi-voie]]\n*[[les authieux-sur-le-port-saint-ouen]]\n*[[belbeuf]]\n*[[bihorel]]\n*[[bois-guillaume]]\n*[[bonsecours]]\n*[[boos, seine-maritime|boos]]\n*[[la bouille]]\n*[[canteleu]]\n*[[darnétal]]\n*[[déville-lès-rouen]]\n*[[fontaine-sous-préaux]]\n*[[franqueville-saint-pierre]]\n*[[gouy, seine-maritime|gouy]]\n*[[grand-couronne]]\n*[[le grand-quevilly]]\n*[[hautot-sur-seine]]\n*[[le houlme]]\n*[[houppeville]]\n*[[isneauville]]\n*[[malaunay]]\n*[[maromme]]\n*[[le mesnil-esnard]]\n*[[montmain, seine-maritime|montmain]]\n*[[mont-saint-aignan]]\n*[[moulineaux]]\n*[[la neuville-chant-d\'oisel]]\n*[[notre-dame-de-bondeville]]\n*[[oissel]]\n*[[petit-couronne]]\n*[[petit-quevilly]]\n*[[préaux]]\n*[[quévreville-la-poterie]]\n*[[roncherolles-sur-le-vivier]]\n*[[rouen]]\n*[[sahurs]]\n*[[saint-aubin-celloville]]\n*[[saint-aubin-Épinay]]\n*[[saint-Étienne-du-rouvray]]\n*[[saint-jacques-sur-darnétal]]\n*[[saint-léger-du-bourg-denis]]\n*[[saint-martin-du-vivier]]\n*[[saint-pi
<page> <title>aggregate_demand</title><text>{{about|a concept in macroeconomics|the microeconomic demand aggregated over consumers|demand curve}}\n\nin [[macroeconomics]], \'\'\'aggregate demand\'\'\' (\'\'\'ad\'\'\') is the total demand for final goods and services in the economy at a given time and [[price level]].<ref>\n{{cite book | title = exploring economics | first1 = robert | last1 = sexton | first2 = peter | last2 = fortura | isbn = 0-17-641482-7 | year = 2005 | quote = this is the sum of the demand for all final goods and services in the economy. it can also be seen as the quantity of real gdp demanded at different price levels.}}\n</ref> it specifies the amounts of goods and services that will be purchased at all possible price levels.<ref>{{cite book\n  | last = o\'sullivan\n  | first = arthur\n  | authorlink = arthur o\'sullivan (economist)\n  | coauthors = steven m. sheffrin\n  | title = economics: principles in action\n  | publisher = pearson prentice hall\n  | year = 2003\n  | location = upper saddle river, new jersey 07458\n  | pages = 307\n  | url = http://www.pearsonschool.com/index.cfm?locator=psz3r9&pmdbsiteid=2781&pmdbsolutionid=6724&pmdbcategoryid=&pmdbprogramid=12881&level=4\n oi = \n  | id = \n  | isbn = 0-13-063085-3}}</ref> this is the demand for the [[gross domestic product]] of a country. it is often called [[effective demand]], though at other times this term is distinguished.\n\nit is often cited that the aggregate demand curve is downward sloping because at lower price levels a greater quantity is demanded. while this is correct at the microeconomic, single good level, at the aggregate level this is incorrect. the aggregate demand curve is in fact downward sloping as a result of three distinct effects: [[pigou effect|pigou\'s wealth effect]], [[keynes effect|the keynes\' interest rate effect]] and the [[mundell–fleming model|mundell-fleming exchange-rate effect]].\n\n==history==\n{{main|the general theory of employment, interest and
<page> <title>aggregate_project_plan</title><text>an \'\'\'aggregate project plan\'\'\' (app) is the process of creating development goals and objectives and using these goals and objectives to improve productivity as well as development capabilities.  the purpose of this process is generally to ensure that each project will accomplish its development goals and objectives. projects can be differentiated into five types of projects: breakthrough, platform, derivative, [[r&d]], or partnered projects (such as projects performed with partners or [[allianced firms]]). this differentiation determines a project\'s development goals and objectives as well as resources allocated to that project.<ref>{{cite book\n | last = wheelwright\n | first = steven\n | first2 = kim b. \n | last2 = clark\n | title = revolutionizing product development\n | publisher = simon and schuster\n | year = 1992\n | page = 48\n | isbn = 0-02-905515-6 }}</ref>\n\nan aggregate project plan provides [[management]] with a categorized list of projects, which balances short and long term goals. this list assists management in making difficult decisions such as when to start projects and which projects should be cannibalized. starting projects in a sequential manner according to the firm\'s strategy as well as resources available will allow fewer projects to continue simultaneously and improve productivity.\nanother benefit is the creation of an organizational form for each project type. this creates a focus on the generation of competence and builds the speed and productivity of individuals as well as the organization itself.<ref>\n{{cite web\n| url = http://web.mit.edu/rhenders/www/teaching/day2b_jan05.ppt\n| title = actually doing (technology & product) strategy.\n| accessdate = 2009-04-28\n| author = rebecca henderson\n}}</ref>\n\n== aggregate project planning process ==\nthis is the process a firm undergoes to create an aggregate project plan: <br />\n:1.\tcreate a well-defined and easily understood s
<page> <title>aggregate_supply</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=may 2013}}\n[[image:aggregate supply.svg|thumb|right|400px|aggregate supply curve showing the three ranges: keynesian, intermediate, and classical.]]\n\nin [[economics]], \'\'\'aggregate supply\'\'\' is the total supply of goods and services that firms in a national economy plan on selling during a specific time period. it is the total amount of goods and services that firms are willing to sell at a given price level in an economy.{{citation needed|date=february 2012}}\n==analysis==\nthere are two main reasons why \'\'\'q<sup>s</sup>\'\'\' might rise as \'\'\'p\'\'\' rises, i.e., why the \'\'\'as\'\'\' curve is upward sloping:\n\n*aggregate supply is usually inadequate to supply ample opportunity. usually this is fixed [[capital (economics)|capital]] equipment. the \'\'\'as\'\'\' curve is drawn given some nominal variable, such as the nominal wage rate. in the \'\'short run\'\', the nominal wage rate is taken as fixed. thus, rising \'\'\'p\'\'\' implies higher profits that justify expansion of output. in the [[neoclassical economics|neoclassical]] \'\'long run\'\', on the other hand, the nominal wage rate varies with economic conditions. (high unemployment leads to falling nominal wages -- and vice-versa.)\n*an alternative model starts with the notion that any economy involves a large number of heterogeneous types of inputs, including both fixed capital equipment and labor. both main types of inputs can be unemployed. the upward-sloping \'\'\'as\'\'\' curve arises because (1) some nominal input prices are fixed in the short run (as in the neoclassical theory) and (2) as output rises, more and more production processes encounter [[bottlenecks]]. at low levels of demand, there are large numbers of production processes that do not use their fixed capital equipment fully. thus, production can be increased without much in the way of diminishing returns and the average price level need not rise much (if at al

<page> <title>agha_bashir_ahmed</title><text>{{notability|biographies|date=november 2012}}\n{{unreferenced|date=november 2012}}\n{{infobox person\n| name        = agha bashir ahmed\n| image       =\n| caption     =\n| birth_date  = {{birth date|1911|7|13}} \n| birth_place = [[sahiwal|montgomery]] (sahiwal), [[punjab province (british india)|punjab]], [[british india]] (now in pakistan)\n| death_date  = {{death date and age|1986|11|17|1911|7|13}}\n| death_place = [[lahore]], [[punjab (pakistan)|punjab]], [[pakistan]]\n| nationality = \n| education   = \n| occupation  = businessman\n| website     = \n| residence   = \n| other_names =\n| known_for   = [[cricket]] and administration\n| field       = \n| party       = \n| boards      = member [[pakistan cricket board|bccp]]\n| religion    = [[islam]]\n}}\n\n\'\'\'agha bashir ahmed\'\'\' ([[urdu]]: \'\'\' آغا بشیر احمد\'\'\') (july 13, 1911–november 17, 1986) was a businessman, administrator, cricket administrator and social activist of pakistan.\n\nborn and raised in [[sahiwal]], a town south of [[lahore]], in [[british india]] (now in pakistan), and formerly known as montgomery, he was the first to bring [[japan]]ese collaboration to [[pakistan]] and set up a [[textile industry|textile]] related industry at his birthplace, named nippon bobbin company (pakistan) limited. he was involved in administrative matters of the town. the [[government of pakistan]]  honored him for his services with regards to [[civil defence]] during the [[india|indo]]-[[pakistan]]i [[indo-pakistani war of 1971|war of 1971]]. \n\nhe was a noted cricket administrator. he was the president of  the [[multan]] division cricket association for many years. various international matches including two [[one day international|odis (one-day internationals)]] were staged at the small stadium of [[sahiwal]] owing to his efforts. he was a member for life of bccp – board of control for cricket in pakistan – presently known as [[pakistan cricke

<page> <title>agila_town</title><text>{{engvarb|date=september 2013}}\n{{use dmy dates|date=september 2013}}\n{{mi|\n{{refimprove|date=may 2011}}\n{{confusing|date=may 2011}}\n}}\n\'\'\'agila town\'\'\' is the traditional home of the [[agilan]] people from [[ado, nigeria|ado]] and the local government area [[benue state]]. it is in the western part of the african continent.\n\nthe area comprises many settlements, which include apa ivetse, ikpenba new agila, ogbokwu, udokwu and odah. apa was historically dominated by the agilan who were not able to return to the main town after the [[biafra war]]. today however, apa is the major town in agila land. agila shares boundaries with [[ebonyi state]] in the east, [[enugu state]] in the west and [[igumale]], the local government headquarters in the north. ado is the boundary between agila and igumale. \n\nado is a local government area of [[benue]] state, nigeria and was created in 1991. it is one of the 9 local government areas in the southern senatorial zone, which is mainly occupied by the [[idoma people|idoma]] people. the administrative headquarters are at [[igumale]], situated on the railway line crossing nigeria in the north-south direction. \n\nchief [[dan agbese]], the editor-in-chief of nigerian \'\'[[newswatch (nigeria)|newswatch]]\'\', is from this area.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newswatchngr.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=2104&itemid=34|title=in the news|first=augustine|last=adah|work=newswatch|publisher=newswatch communications|date=23 may 2010|accessdate=16 may 2011}}</ref> \n\n==economoy==\nthe area contains minerals and natural resources, such as [[limestone]], [[kaolin]], petroleum, and coal in commercial quantities. the benue state cement factory, one of the largest employers in this geographical region, was to be located there.\n\n\n==demographics==\nit is a culturally rich and diverse area comprising the agila/apa, [[ulayi]], [[ijigbam]], [[utonkon]], and igumale communities. \n\n==edu
<page> <title>agile_wallaby</title><text>[[file:agile wallaby family.jpg|thumb|left|300 px|agile wallaby family]]\n{{taxobox\n| name = agile wallaby<ref name=msw3>{{msw3 groves|pages=63}}</ref>\n| status = lc\n| status_system = iucn3.1\n| status_ref = <ref name=iucn>{{iucn2008|assessors=aplin, k., dickman, c., salas, l., woinarski, j. & winter, j.|year=2008|id=40560|title=macropus agilis|downloaded=28 december 2008}} database entry includes justification for why this species is of least concern </ref>\n| image = macropus agilis - 02.jpg\n| image_width = 225px\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[chordate|chordata]]\n| classis = [[mammal]]ia\n| infraclassis = [[marsupialia]]\n| ordo = [[diprotodontia]]\n| familia = [[macropodidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[macropus]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'m. agilis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'macropus agilis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[john gould|gould]], 1842)\n| range_map = agile wallaby area.png\n| range_map_caption = agile wallaby range\n}}\n\n==description==\n\nthe \'\'\'agile wallaby\'\'\' (\'\'macropus agilis\'\') also known as the \'\'\'sandy wallaby\'\'\', is a species of [[wallaby]] found in northern [[australia]] and [[new guinea]]. it is the most common wallaby in australia\'s north.<ref name=menkhorst>{{cite book|last=menkhorst|first=peter|year=2001|title=a field guide to the mammals of australia|publisher=oxford university press|page=110}}</ref>\n\nthe agile wallaby, as its alternative name implies, is a sandy colour becoming paler below. it is a sociable animal and grazes on grasses and other plants.<ref name=menkhorst/>\n\nthere are four subspecies of the agile wallaby:\n*\'\'m. a. agilis\'\' - the nominate subspecies is found in [[northern territory]];\n*\'\'m. a. jardinii\'\' - this subspecies is found on the northern and eastern coasts of [[queensland]];\n*\'\'m. a. nigrescens\'\' - found in the [[kimberley region of western australia|kimberley]] and [[arnhem land]] regions of [[western australia]];\n*\'\'m. a. p

<page> <title>agladrillia_piscorum</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=july 2013}}\n{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'agladrillia piscorum\'\'\n| image =\n| image_caption =\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[mollusca]]\n| classis = [[gastropoda]]\n| unranked_superfamilia= clade [[caenogastropoda]]<br/>clade [[hypsogastropoda]]<br/>clade [[neogastropoda]]\n| superfamilia = [[conoidea]]\n| familia = [[drilliidae]]\n| subfamilia =\n| genus = \'\'[[agladrillia]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. piscorum\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agladrillia piscorum\'\'\n| binomial_authority = kilburn, 1988\n| synonyms_ref =\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agladrillia piscorum\'\'\'\'\' is a [[species]] of [[sea snail]], a marine [[gastropod]] [[mollusk]] in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[drilliidae]].<ref name=\"worms\">{{wrms species|432935|\'\'agladrillia piscorum\'\' kilburn, 1988||5 september 2011}}</ref><ref name=\"conoidea\">{{cite journal |author=p. bouchet, yu. i. kantor, a. sysoev & n. puillandre |year=2011 |title=a new operational classification of the conoidea (gastropoda) |journal=[[journal of molluscan studies]] |volume=77 |issue=3 |pages=273–308 |doi=10.1093/mollus/eyr017}}</ref>\n\n==description==\n{{empty section|date=april 2010}}\n\n==distribution==\nthis marine species occurs in the [[agulhas bank]], south africa.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*\n\n{{defaultsort:agladrillia piscorum}}\n[[category:agladrillia|piscorum]]\n\n\n{{drilliidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agladrillia_ukuminxa</title><text>{{use dmy dates|date=july 2013}}\n{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'agladrillia ukuminxa\'\'\n| image =\n| image_caption =\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[mollusca]]\n| classis = [[gastropoda]]\n| unranked_superfamilia= clade [[caenogastropoda]]<br/>clade [[hypsogastropoda]]<br/>clade [[neogastropoda]]\n| superfamilia = [[conoidea]]\n| familia = [[drilliidae]]\n| subfamilia =\n| genus = \'\'[[agladrillia]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. ukuminxa\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agladrillia ukuminxa\'\'\n| binomial_authority = kilburn, 1988\n| synonyms_ref =\n| synonyms =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agladrillia ukuminxa\'\'\'\'\' is a [[species]] of [[sea snail]], a marine [[gastropod]] [[mollusk]] in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[drilliidae]].<ref name=\"worms\">{{wrms species|432938|\'\'agladrillia ukuminxa\'\' kilburn, 1988||5 september 2011}}</ref><ref name=\"conoidea\">{{cite journal |author=p. bouchet, yu. i. kantor, a. sysoev & n. puillandre |year=2011 |title=a new operational classification of the conoidea (gastropoda) |journal=[[journal of molluscan studies]] |volume=77 |issue=3 |pages=273–308 |doi=10.1093/mollus/eyr017}}</ref>\n\n==description==\n{{empty section|date=april 2010}}\n\n==distribution==\nthis marine species occurs along [[transkei]], south africa.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*\n\n{{defaultsort:agladrillia ukuminxa}}\n[[category:agladrillia|ukuminxa]]\n\n\n{{drilliidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aglais</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'aglais\'\'\n| image = milbert\'s tortoiseshell, ottawa.jpg\n| image_width = \n| image_caption = [[milbert\'s tortoiseshell]], [[ottawa]], canada\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[nymphalidae]]\n| subfamilia = [[nymphalinae]]\n| tribus = [[nymphalini]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'aglais\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = dalman, 1816\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'aglais\'\'\'\'\' is a [[genus]] of [[nymphalidae|brush-footed]] [[butterflies]], containing the \'\'\'tortoiseshells\'\'\'. this genus is sometimes included as a subgenus of \'\'[[nymphalis]]\'\',<ref>[http://www.funet.fi/pub/sci/bio/life/insecta/lepidoptera/ditrysia/papilionoidea/nymphalidae/nymphalinae/nymphalis/index.html \'\'nymphalis\'\'], funet.fi</ref> which also includes tortoiseshells, but it is usually considered to be separate.<ref>[http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/research/projects/lepindex/] lepindex</ref>\n\n==species==\n*\'\'[[aglais ichnusa]]\'\' [[jacob hübner|hübner]], 1819 – corsican small tortoiseshell\n*\'\'[[aglais kaschmirensis]]\'\' (kollar, 1844) – [[indian tortoiseshell]]\n*\'\'[[aglais ladakensis]]\'\' (moore, 1882) – [[ladakh tortoiseshell]]\n*\'\'[[aglais milberti]]\'\' (godart, 1819) – [[milbert\'s tortoiseshell]] or [[fire-rim tortoiseshell]]\n*\'\'[[aglais rizana]]\'\' (moore, 1872) – [[mountain tortoiseshell]]\n*\'\'[[aglais urticae]]\'\' ([[linnaeus]], 1758) – [[small tortoiseshell]] \n\n===images of notable species===\n<gallery>\nfile:indian tortoiseshell butterflly i img 3276.jpg|indian tortoiseshell (\'\'[[aglais kaschmirensis]]\'\')\nfile:nyladak.jpg|ladakh tortoiseshell (\'\'[[aglais ladakensis]]\'\')\nfile:milbert\'s tortoiseshell.jpg|milbert\'s tortoiseshell (\'\'[[aglais milberti]]\'\')\nfile:aglais urticae lc0310.jpg|small tortoiseshell (\'\'[[aglais urticae]]\'\')\n</gallery>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{
<page> <title>aglia_tau</title><text>{{taxobox\n| image = aglia tau.jpg\n| image2 = tau_emperor_nagelfleck.jpg\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[saturniidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[aglia]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. tau\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'aglia tau\'\'\n| binomial_authority = ([[carl linnaeus|linnaeus]], [[10th edition of systema naturae|1758]])\n}}\nthe \'\'\'tau emperor\'\'\' \'\'(aglia tau)\'\' is a [[moth]] of the family [[saturniidae]]. it is found in [[europe]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is 60-84&nbsp;mm. the moth flies in one generation from march to july depending on the location.\n\nthe larvae primarily feed on [[european beech]], but also [[birch]], [[alnus glutinosa]], [[salix caprea]] and [[sorbus aucuparia]]\n\n[[file:aglia tau larva\'s 4th instar.jpg|thumb|4th instar of the larva of the tau emperor (aglia tau)]]\n\n==external links==\n* [http://www.lepidoptera.pl/show.php?id=140&country=uk/ european butterflies and moths] by christopher jonko\n*[http://www.vlindernet.nl/?soortcode=aglitau vlindernet {{nl}}]\n*[http://waarneming.nl/soort.php?id=1639 waarneming.nl {{nl}}]\n*[http://webh01.ua.ac.be/vve/checklists/lepidoptera/saturniidae/atau.htm lepidoptera of belgium]\n\n{{commons|aglia tau}}\n\n[[category:agliinae]]\n[[category:animals described in 1758]]\n\n{{saturniidae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agnar_helgason</title><text>{{icelandic name|agnar}}\n\'\'\'agnar helgason\'\'\' (born 31 july 1968 in [[reykjavík]]) is an [[iceland]]ic scientist working with genetic [[anthropology]]. phd in biological anthropology, university of oxford, 2001. he is best known for his research on the origin of icelandic population. he is a brother of [[Ásgeir helgason]], the son of [[helgi valdimarsson]] and a brother-in-law of [[tim moore (writer)]].\n\n==sources and links==\n*{{cite news | title=dna tests debunk blond inuit legend | date=2003-10-28 | publisher=cbc news | url=http://www.cbc.ca/health/story/2003/10/28/inuit_blond031028.html}}\n\n <!-- first-name sorted category -->\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = helgason, agnar\n| alternative names =\n| short description = icelandic scientist\n| date of birth     = 31 july 1968\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:helgason, agnar}}\n[[category:icelandic scientists|agnar helgason]]<!-- first-name sorted category -->\n[[category:1968 births]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:20th-century icelandic people]]\n\nhttp://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=agnar+helgason\n\n{{iceland-bio-stub}}\n{{anthropologist-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>agnes_blannbekin</title><text>{{ infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:template:infobox writer/doc]] --> \n| name          = agnes blannbekin\n| image         = \n| imagesize     = 200px\n| caption       = \n| birth_date     = c. 1244\n| birth_place     = [[hofstetten-grünau|plambach]], [[austria]]\n| death_date      = {{death date|1315|3|10}} (about 71)\n| death_place     = [[vienna]], [[austria]]\n| occupation    = [[third order of saint francis|franciscan tertiary]]\n| language      = [[middle high german]], [[latin]]\n| genre         = [[revelation]]s\n| movement      = [[beghards and beguines|beguine]] [[christian mysticism]]\n| notableworks  = \'\'venerabilis agnetis blannbekin\'\'\n}}\n\'\'\'agnes blannbekin\'\'\' ({{ipac-en|ˈ|b|l|æ|n|b|iː|k|ən}} or {{ipac-en|ˈ|b|l|æ|m|b|iː|k|ən}}; c. 1244<ref name=mcginn/> – march 10, 1315),<ref name=wilson/> was an [[austria]]n [[beghards and beguines|beguine]] and [[christian mysticism|christian mystic]]. she was also referred to as \'\'saint agnes blannbekin\'\' or the \'\'venerable agnes blannbekin\'\', though never [[beatified]] or [[canonized]] by the [[roman catholic church]]. her controversial revelations were compiled by her [[confession (religion)|confessor]] ermenrich and later published in 1731 as \'\'venerabilis agnetis blannbekin\'\'. the copies were confiscated by the [[society of jesus]], and only two manuscripts survived. one was destroyed in a fire at the [[straßburg, austria|straßburg]] library in 1870.<ref name=wilson/> the surviving manuscript, currently owned by a [[cistercians|cistercian]] convent in [[zwettl]], austria,<ref name=wilson/> was not released until the 20th century.<ref name=wilson/><ref name=dunbar/> although blannbekin is best remembered today for her visions, during her life she was known for her ministry to the [[common people|urban population]].<ref>{{cite book |title=women christian mystics speak to our times |last=perrin |first=david b. |authorli
<page> <title>agnes_louisa_weston</title><text>\'\'\'agnes louisa weston\'\'\' (mrs) (17 january 1879 – 8 august 1972) from wellington was appointed a member of the [[new zealand legislative council]] on 22 june 1950.<ref>{{cite book |last= wilson |first= j.o. |title= new zealand parliamentary record 1840-1984 |accessdate= 21 january 2012 |edition= 4 |origyear= 1913 |year= 1985  |publisher= v.r. ward, government printer |location= wellington |isbn=  |oclc= |page= 166 |pages= }}</ref>\n\nshe was one of three woman members of the [[suicide squad (new zealand)|suicide squad]], which was appointed by the [[first national government of new zealand|first national government]] in 1950 to vote for its abolition. the other women appointed in 1950 were [[cora louisa burrell]] and [[ethel marion gould]]. only two other women, [[mary patricia anderson]] and [[mary dreaver]], had ever been appointed to the council (in 1946).\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n{{persondata\n| name              = weston, ag\n| alternative names =\n| short description = new zealand politician\n| date of birth     = 1879\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     = 1972\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:weston, ag}}\n[[category:1879 births]]\n[[category:1972 deaths]]\n[[category:members of the new zealand legislative council]]\n[[category:new zealand national party mlcs]]\n[[category:new zealand women in politics]]\n\n\n{{newzealand-politician-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agnes_of_denmark</title><text>{{for|the wife of eric v of denmark|agnes of brandenburg}}\n{{infobox royalty\n| title          = abbess of st. agneta\n| image          =\n| reign          = 1264-1266\n| spouse         =\n| issue          = \n| house          = [[house of estridsen]]\n| father         = [[eric iv of denmark]]\n| mother         = [[jutta of saxony]]\n| birth_date  = 1249\n| birth_place =\n| death_date  = after 1290\n| death_place =\n| place of burial=\n| religion       = [[roman catholicism]]\n|}}\n\n\'\'\'agnes of denmark\'\'\' (1249-after 1290) was the youngest daughter of [[eric iv of denmark]] and his wife [[jutta of saxony]]. she founded the convent of st. agneta in [[roskilde]], becoming abbess there.\n\nagnes lost her father at the age of one, and after her mother left for remarriage in germany, she and her sister jutta remained to be raised at the court of her paternal uncle, the king of denmark. the sisters had the right to large estates after their father, but were not able to enforce them against their uncle, who deposed their father. in 1264, a convent for women of the dominican order was founded in roskilde and named after her. the convent was founded by initiative of countess ingerd of hvide, but the application was sent to the pope in the name of agnes, who was officially named as founder. agnes was placed there as its first abbess, and the regent of denmark was forced to swear that she had been placed there by her own free will. in 1266, also her sister jutta was placed in the convent, and replaced her as abbess. both sister greatly disliked the life as nuns, and the both left the convent in 1270. agnes seem to have managed to gain control over at least parts of her father\'s estates. she lived the rest of her life managing her estates at [[själland]], and there are several documents mentioning her acts as a landowner. she is last mentioned alive in 1290. the year of her death is unknown. the danish royal house and the sa

<page> <title>agneta_ringman</title><text><!-- missing image removed: [[image:agneta ringman.jpg|thumb|agneta ringman]] -->\n\n\'\'\'agneta ringman\'\'\', born 1949, is a [[sweden|swedish]] [[swedish social democratic party|social democratic]] [[politician]]. she was a [[list of members of the swedish riksdag|member]] of the [[parliament of sweden|riksdag]] from 1994 to 2006.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.riksdagen.se/webbnav/index.aspx?nid=1811&iid=0698785853314 agneta ringman] at the [[parliament of sweden|riksdag]] website\n\n{{persondata <!-- metadata: see [[wikipedia:persondata]]. -->\n| name              = ringman, agneta\n| alternative names =\n| short description = swedish politician\n| date of birth     = 1949\n| place of birth    =\n| date of death     =\n| place of death    =\n}}\n{{defaultsort:ringman, agneta}}\n[[category:swedish social democratic party politicians]]\n[[category:members of the parliament of sweden]]\n[[category:living people]]\n[[category:1949 births]]\n[[category:swedish women in politics]]\n\n\n{{sweden-socialdemocratic-politician-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agni</title><text>{{other uses}}\n{{refimprove|date = july 2007}}\n{{infobox deity<!--wikipedia:wikiproject hindu mythology-->\n|type = hindu\n|image = agni god of fire.jpg|caption = agni the fire god\n|name = agni\n|devanagari = {{lang|sa|अग्नि}}\n|sanskrit_transliteration = agni\n|pali_transliteration = \n|tamil_script = \n|affiliation = [[deva (hinduism)|deva]]\n|god_of = god of [[fire]]\n|abode =\n|mantra =\n|weapon = \n|consort = [[svaha]]\n|daughter = [[agneya]]\n|shakti = [[meshavahini]]\n|mount = [[ram (animal)|ram]]\n|planet = \n}}\n\'\'\'agni\'\'\' ({{lang-sa|अग्नि}}) is a [[rigvedic deities|hindu deity]], one of the most important of the [[vedic civilization|vedic]] gods. he is the god of fire<ref>[[richard cavendish (occult writer)|cavendish, richard]] (1998). \'\'mythology, an illustrated encyclopedia of the principal myths and religions of the world\'\'. isbn 1-84056-070-3</ref> and the acceptor of sacrifices. the sacrifices made to agni go to the [[deity|deities]] because agni is a messenger<ref>{{cite web|author=january 19, 2013 |url=http://rigvedaanalysis.wordpress.com/2013/01/19/agni-the-messenger-god/ |title=agni - the messenger god |publisher=rigvedaanalysis.wordpress.com |date=2013-01-19 |accessdate=2013-08-09}}</ref> from and to the other gods. he is ever-young, because the fire is re-lit every day, and also immortal. \n\nagni, the vedic god of fire, has two heads, one marks immortality and the other marks an unknown symbol of life. agni has made the transition into the hindu pantheon of gods, without losing his importance. with [[varuna]] and [[indra]] he is one of the supreme gods in the [[rigveda]]. the link between heaven and earth, the deities and the humans, he is associated with vedic sacrifice, taking offerings to the other world in his fire. in [[hinduism]], his vehicle is the ram.<ref>[[john bowker (theologian)|bowker, john]] (1997). \'\'world religions\'\'. new york: dk publishing, inc.</ref>\n\n==et
<page> <title>agni_tirtham</title><text>\n\'\'\'agni tirtham\'\'\' is one of the [[tirthas of rameswaram]], [[tamil nadu]], [[india]]. the beach east of [[ramanathaswamy temple, rameswaram|ramanathaswamy temple]] is known by this name. this tirtham is one of the most visited tirthams of rameswaram for a holy bath.<ref name=\"seturaman221\">seturaman (2001), p. 221.</ref>\n\n[[image:ramesw2.jpg|thumb|240x180px|agni tirtham]]\n\n== legends ==\n=== sita ===\n{{empty section|date=january 2011}}\nsitha\n\n=== sudakshina & the young merchant ===\n{{empty section|date=january 2011}}\n\n== faith & beliefs ==\nthe faith among pilgrims is that child-less\ncouples bathing in this tirtham and offering\nprayers to lord shiva at the temple would be\nblessed with children.<ref name=\"seturaman221\"/>\n\nnew moon days and full moon days are considered to be\nthe most auspicious bathing days here.<ref name=\"seturaman221\"/>\n\n== references in literature ==\nreferences to this tirtha is made in [[sethu puranam]], [[skanda puranam]], [[narada puranam]].<ref name=\"seturaman221\"/>\n\n== see also ==\n* [[tirtha and kshetra|tirthas]]\n* [[rameswaram]]\n* [[tirthas of rameswaram]]\n* [[ramanathaswamy temple, rameswaram]]\n\n== notes ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n== references ==\n<div class=\"references-small\">\n{{col-begin}}\n* {{cite book |last= seturaman |first= k|title= rameswaram koil |year=2001 |publisher= j. j. publications |location= madurai}}\n{{col-end}}\n</div>\n\n{{coord|9.288498|79.320731|display=title}}\n\n[[category:hindu pilgrimage sites]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agnibesa_punctilinearia</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\t\n| name = agnibesa punctilinearia\n| image = \n| image_size = \n| image_caption = \n| image2 = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[geometridae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agnibesa]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. punctilinearia\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agnibesa punctilinearia\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (leech, 1897)<ref>{{cite web|title=home of ichneumonoidea|publisher=dicky sick ki yu|accessdate=2013|work=taxapad|date=1997-2012|url=http://www.taxapad.com/local.php?taxonidlc=82842168}}</ref>\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'hydrelia punctilinearia\'\' <small>leech, 1897</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agnibesa punctilinearia\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] in the [[geometridae]] family. it is found in western [[china]].<ref>[http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/research/projects/lepindex/search/detail.dsml?userid=&username=&taxonno=217437.0&scientific_name_on_card=punctilinearia&listpageurl=list.dsml%3fsort%3dscientific%255fname%255fon%255fcard%26scientific_name_on_cardqtype%3dstarts%2bwith%26scientific_name_on_card%3dpictaria%26reclimit%3d30&searchpageurl=index.dsml%3fscientific_name_on_cardqtype%3dstarts%2bwith%26sort%3dscientific%255fname%255fon%255fcard%26scientific_name_on_card%3dpictaria%26reclimit%3d30 lepindex]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n{{commons}}\n{{wikispecies}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1897]]\n[[category:asthenini]]\n\n{{asthenini-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agnieszka_warchulska</title><text>{{no footnotes|date=january 2013}}\n{{infobox person\n| name                  = agnieszka warchulska\n| image                 = agnieszka warchulska.jpg\n| imagesize             = 200px\n| caption               = \n| birthname             = \n| birth_date             = may 15, 1972\n| birth_place            = [[ostrowiec Świętokrzyski]]\n| death_date             = \n| death_place            = \n| othername             = \n| occupation            = actress\n| yearsactive           = since 1995\n| spouse                = [[przemysław sadowski]]\n| domesticpartner       = \n| website               = \n| academyawards         = \n| afiawards             = \n| arielaward            = \n| baftaawards           = \n| cesarawards           = \n| emmyawards            = \n| filmfareawards        = \n| geminiawards          = \n| goldencalfawards      = \n| goldenglobeawards     = \n| goldenraspberryawards = \n| goyaawards            = \n| grammyawards          = \n| iftaawards            = \n| laurenceolivierawards = \n| naacpimageawards      = \n| nationalfilmawards    = \n| sagawards             = \n| tonyawards            = \n| awards                = \n}}\n\'\'\'agnieszka warchulska\'\'\' (b. may 15, 1972 in [[ostrowiec Świętokrzyski]]) is a polish actress.\n\n== filmography ==\n*1996: \'\'[[cwał]]\'\'\n*1997: \'\'[[wojenna narzeczona]]\'\'\n*1997: \'\'[[linia opóźniająca]]\'\'\n*1997: \'\'[[sława i chwała]]\'\'\n*1998: \'\'[[pierwszy milion]]\'\'\n*1998: \'\'[[dług]]\'\'\n*1999-2001: \'\'[[miasteczko]]\'\'\n*2002: \'\'[[zaginiona]]\'\'\n*2003: \'\'tak czy nie\'\'\n*2003: \'\'[[sfora]]\'\'\n*2004: \'\'wieża\'\'\n*2004-2005, 2007-2008: \'\'[[m jak miłość]]\'\'\n*2005: \'\'[[teraz ja]]\'\'\n*2006-2007: \'\'[[pogoda na piątek]]\'\'\n*2007: \'\'[[dlaczego nie!]]\'\'\n\n== external links ==\n* {{imdb name|id=0911333|name=agnieszka warchulska}}\n*[http://www.filmpolski.pl/fp/index.php/1123180 agnieszka warchulska
<page> <title>agnostogonus</title><text>{{taxobox\n|name = \'\'agnostogonus\'\'\n|fossil_range = [[dresbachian]]<ref name=\"sepkoski\">{{cite journal\n  | last = sepkoski| first = jack| authorlink =| coauthors =| title =  a compendium of fossil marine animal genera (trilobita entry)| journal = bulletins of american paleontology| volume = 364| issue =| pages = p.560| publisher =| location =| year = 2002| url = http://strata.ummp.lsa.umich.edu/jack/showgenera.php?taxon=307&rank=class| doi =| id =| accessdate = 2008-01-12 }}</ref>\n|regnum = [[animal]]ia\n|phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n|classis = [[trilobita]]\n|ordo =\n|superfamilia =\n|genus = \'\'\'\'\'agnostogonus\'\'\'\'\'\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agnostogonus\'\'\'\'\' is an [[extinct]] [[genus]] from a well-known class of [[fossil]] marine [[arthropod]]s, the [[trilobite]]s. it lived from 501 to 490 million years ago during the [[dresbachian]] [[faunal stage]] of the late [[cambrian period]].<ref name=\"sepkoski\"/>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:cambrian trilobites]]\n\n\n{{trilobite-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>agonoclita</title><text>{{orphan|date=february 2009}}\n{{no footnotes|date=january 2013}}\n\'\'\'agonoclita\'\'\', or \'\'\'agonoclites\'\'\', in antiquity, is a christian sect from the 7th century whose distinguishing principle was never to kneel, but to deliver all their [[prayer]]s standing.\n\nthe word is compounded of the [[privative]] particle \'\'α\'\' (\"not\"), \'\'γονυ\'\' (\"knee\"), and \'\'κλινω\'\' (\"i bend\").\n\n==see also==\n*[[genuflection]]\n\n{{1728}}\n\n[[category:7th-century christianity]]\n\n\n{{christianity-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agonopterix_adspersella</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agonopterix adspersella\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[oecophoridae]] <small>(disputed)</small>\n| tribus = \n| genus = \'\'[[agonopterix]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. adspersella\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agonopterix adspersella\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (kollar, 1832)<ref>[http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=435137 fauna europaea]</ref>\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'haemylis adspersella\'\' <small>kollar, 1832</small>\n*\'\'depressaria amanthicella\'\' <small>heinemann, 1870</small>\n*\'\'agonopterix athamanticella\'\' <small>steudel & hofmann, 1882</small>\n*\'\'agonopterix reichlini\'\' <small>heinemann, 1870</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agonopterix adspersella\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[oecophoridae]] family. it is found in southern [[europe]], [[asia minor]], the [[palestinian territories]], [[iran]] and the [[crimea]].<ref>[http://www.landesmuseum.at/pdf_frei_remote/quad_6_0043-0054.pdf dritter nachtrag zur mikrolepidopterenfauna zyperns]</ref>\n\nthe larvae feed on \'\'[[bupleurum falcatum]]\'\'. they spin the leaves of their host plant together to create a shelter from which they feed. pupation takes place on the ground in a spinning of sand grains.<ref>[http://www.lepiforum.de/cgi-bin/lepiwiki.pl?agonopterix_adspersella lepiforum.de]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1832]]\n[[category:agonopterix]]\n\n{{oecophoridae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agonopterix_cachritis</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agonopterix cachritis\n| image = \n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[oecophoridae]] <small>(disputed)</small>\n| tribus = \n| genus = \'\'[[agonopterix]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. cachritis\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agonopterix cachritis\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (staudinger, 1859)<ref>[http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=435211 fauna europaea]</ref>\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'depressaria cachritis\'\' <small>staudinger, 1859</small>\n*\'\'depressaria epicachritis\'\' <small>ragonot, 1895</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agonopterix cachritis\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[oecophoridae]] family. it is found in [[spain]] and on [[sardinia]] and [[cyprus]].\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is 17-22 mm.<ref>[http://www.lepiforum.de/cgi-bin/lepiwiki.pl?agonopterix_cachritis lepiforum.de]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n[[category:animals described in 1859]]\n[[category:agonopterix]]\n\n{{oecophoridae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agonopterix_irrorata</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agonopterix irrorata\n| image = agonopterix_irrorata.jpg\n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[oecophoridae]] <small>(disputed)</small>\n| tribus = \n| genus = \'\'[[agonopterix]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. irrorata\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agonopterix irrorata\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (staudinger, 1870)\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'depressaria irrorata\'\' <small>staudinger, 1870</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agonopterix irrorata\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[oecophoridae]] family. it is found in [[france]], [[switzerland]], [[sicily]], [[croatia]], [[ukraine]], [[greece]], [[crete]]<ref>[http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=435108 fauna europaea]</ref> and [[israel]].<ref>[http://www.ftic.info/donahaye/insects/lepidoptera/depressariidae/depressariidae.html jonathan\'s check-list of israeli insects]</ref>\n\nthe [[wingspan]] is 16–20&nbsp;mm.\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.lepiforum.de/cgi-bin/lepiwiki.pl?agonopterix_irrorata lepiforum.de]\n\n[[category:animals described in 1870]]\n[[category:agonopterix]]\n\n\n{{oecophoridae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agonopterix_squamosa</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agonopterix squamosa\n| image = agonopterix_squamosa.jpg\n| image_width = \n| image_caption = \n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[oecophoridae]] <small>(disputed)</small>\n| tribus = \n| genus = \'\'[[agonopterix]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. squamosa\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agonopterix squamosa\'\'\n| binomial_authority = (mann, 1864)\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'depressaria squamosa\'\' <small>mann, 1864</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agonopterix squamosa\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[oecophoridae]] family. it is found in [[spain]], [[france]],  [[italy]], [[croatia]], the [[republic of macedonia]] and [[turkey]] and on [[sardinia]] and [[sicily]].<ref>[http://www.faunaeur.org/full_results.php?id=435156 fauna europaea]</ref> it has also been recorded from [[israel]].<ref>[http://www.ftic.info/donahaye/insects/lepidoptera/depressariidae/list2.html jonathan\'s check-list of israeli insects]</ref>\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.lepiforum.de/cgi-bin/lepiwiki.pl?agonopterix_squamosa lepiforum.de]\n\n[[category:animals described in 1864]]\n[[category:agonopterix]]\n\n{{oecophoridae-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>agostinho_neto_airport</title><text>{{no footnotes|date=august 2010}}\n{{infobox airport\n| name         = agostinho neto airport\n| nativename   = \n| nativename-a = \n| nativename-r = \n| image        = \n| image-width  = \n| caption      = \n| iata         = nto\n| icao         = gvan\n| type         = public\n| owner        = \n| operator     = \n| city-served  = \n| location     = ponta do sol, santo antão, cape verde\n| elevation-f  = 32\n| elevation-m  = 10\n| coordinates  = {{coord|17.203058|n|25.090874|w|type:airport|display=inline,title}}\n| latd = 17 | latm = 12 | lats = 10.7 | latns = n\n| longd = 25 | longm = 5 | longs = 26.8 | longew = w\n| pushpin_map  = cape verde\n| pushpin_label= gvan\n| pushpin_map_caption = location of aeródromo agostinho neto/ilha de são antão in cape verde\n| website      = \n| metric-elev  = \n| metric-rwy   = \n| r1-number    = 14/32\n| r1-length-f  = 1,476\n| r1-length-m  = 450\n| r1-surface   = [[asphalt]]\n| stat-year    = \n| stat1-header = \n| stat1-data   = \n| stat2-header = \n| stat2-data   = \n| footnotes    = \n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'agostinho neto\'\'\' ([[portuguese language|portuguese]] \'\'\'\'\'aeroporto agostinho neto\'\'\'\'\') {{airport codes|nto|gvan}} is an airport in [[cape verde]] located next to the town of [[ponta do sol, cape verde]] on the northern tip of the island of [[santo antão, cape verde|santo antão]]. the airport was named after [[agostinho neto]], an angolan politician. because of dangerous crosswinds and weather that is often below vfr minima, the airport is closed until further notice. \n\n==see also==\n*[[list of airports in cape verde]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n*[http://gc.kls2.com/airport/gvan great circle mapper]\n\n[[category:airports in cape verde]]\n[[category:boa vista, cape verde|boa vista]]\n\n{{capeverde-airport-stub}}</text> </page>
