<page> <title>agrafiotis</title><text>{{infobox river|\nimage_name=agrafiotis.png|\nriver_name=agrafiotis|\norigin=[[evrytania]]|\nbasin_countries=[[greece]]|\nlength=approx. 50 km|\nmouth=[[achelous river|acheloos]]<br>{{coord|38|54|42|n|21|31|49|e|display=inline,title}}|\nwatershed=|\n}}\n\nthe \'\'\'agrafiotis\'\'\' ({{lang-el|Αγραφιώτης}}) is a river in [[evrytania]], [[greece]].  the river takes its name from [[agrafa]], the mountainous region where it flows. the river begins near the village [[agrafa (municipality)|trovato]] in the north of evrytania. it flows south through a valley with forests and small farmlands. it is crossed by a few stone bridges. near the village [[fragkista|tripotamo]], the river empties into [[kremasta (lake)|kremasta reservoir]], built in 1969, which is drained by the river [[achelous river|acheloos]]. the kremasta reservoir is the largest in greece.\n\n==external links==\n*[http://www.gtp.gr/locpage.asp?id=62884 agrafiotis on gtp travel pages] (in english and greek)\n\n[[category:evrytania]]\n[[category:rivers of greece]]</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agrarian_labor_party</title><text>the \'\'\'agrarian labor party\'\'\' ({{lang-es|partido agrario laborista}}, pal) was a [[chile]]an [[political party]] supporting the candidacy of [[carlos ibáñez del campo]] for the [[chilean presidential election, 1952|1952 presidential election]]. formed in 1945, it was dissolved in 1958.\n\nit was formed in 1945 from the merger of the [[chilean agrarian party|agrarian party]], the [[popular freedom alliance]] (an offshoot of the [[national socialist movement of chile]]), the \'\'[[movimiento nacionalista de chile]]\'\' and the \'\'[[unión nacionalista]]\'\'.<ref>garay, cristián. 1990. \'\'el partido agrario laborista. 1945-1958\'\'. editorial andrés bello. santiago. {{listed invalid isbn|956-13-0889-3}} (pages 133-135)</ref> its foundational program, emphasising [[law and order (politics)|law and order]], asserted the need to \"secure [[public order]] in the country, on the functional basis that labour has not only obligations but also indisputable [[civil right]]s.\"\n\nin 1951 the pal proclaimed as its presidential candidate the former dictator [[carlos ibáñez del campo]], who had, since his first term, somehow changed political orientation. after his election in 1952, it took part in his first cabinet, along with the [[popular socialist party (chile)|popular socialist party]] formed of dissidents of the [[socialist party (chile)|socialist party]]. starting in 1954, the pal\'s influence on ibáñez\'s cabinet declined, leading to an internal crisis and to the subsequent use of the pal label by two different organizations.\n\nlegally, the ownership of the pal label was among the faction opposing ibáñez, led by the senator [[julio von mühlenbrock]]. new divisions split the pal for the [[chilean presidential election, 1958|1958 presidential election]], with the official faction supporting the candidate of the [[christian democrat party (chile)|christian democrat party]], [[eduardo frei montalva]], while a
<page> <title>agrarian_national_party</title><text>{{unreferenced stub|date=december 2009}}\n{{politics of peru}}\n\'\'\'agrarian national party\'\'\' (in [[spanish language|spanish]]: \'\'partido nacional agrario\'\') was a [[political party]] in [[peru]]. it was founded in 1930 by pedro beltrán espantoso, gerardo klinge and manuel gonzález olaechea.\n\n[[category:agrarian parties]]\n[[category:political parties in peru]]\n[[category:political parties established in 1930]]\n\n{{peru-party-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agreeable_tiger_moth</title><text>{{taxobox\n| name = agreeable tiger moth\n| image = spilosoma congrua.jpg\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[arctiidae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'[[spilosoma]]\'\'\'\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'s. congrua\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'spilosoma congrua\'\'\n| binomial_authority = walker, 1855\n}}\nthe \'\'\'agreeable tiger moth\'\'\' (\'\'spilosoma congrua\'\') is one of three species of white tiger moth which are common in the us. it has pronounced black eyes, white [[abdomen]], and orange \"bib\" which set it apart from its cousin the [[virginia tiger moth]]. like its cousins, it tents its wings when at rest.\n\n==references==\n* {{cite book |author=amelia hansen; eastman, john |authorlink= |editor= |others= |title=the book of swamp and bog: trees, shrubs, and wildflowers of the eastern freshwater wetlands |edition= |language= |publisher=stackpole books |location=mechanicsburg, pa |year=1995 |origyear= |quote= |isbn=0-8117-2518-9 |oclc= |doi= |url= http://books.google.com/books?id=n7fkt2fdznsc&pg=pa87&dq=%22spilosoma+congrua%22&lr=&as_brr=3&ei=ep9lsl2cez72iwgv8pz-bq&sig=acfu3u0vq_xfpxxdvr6jnsyyemscb32zgq|accessdate=|page= 87}}\n*{{cite book |author=amelia hansen; eastman, john |authorlink= |editor= |others= |title=the book of field and roadside: open-country weeds, trees, and wildflowers of eastern north america |edition= |language= |publisher=stackpole books |location=mechanicsburg, pa |year=2003 |origyear= |quote= |isbn=0-8117-2625-8 |oclc= |doi= |url= http://books.google.com/books?id=b9hlyh-pwkyc&pg=pa125&vq=%22spilosoma+congrua%22&dq=%22spilosoma+congrua%22&lr=&as_brr=3&source=gbs_search_s&sig=acfu3u3v6_ib4fujk47fiiuy-odiicxohq|accessdate=|page= 125}}\n[[category:spilosomini]]\n\n{{arctiinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agrias_aedon</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'agrias aedon\'\'\n| image = agriasaedonhewitson.jpg\n| image_width = 240px\n| image_caption = \'\'agrias aedon\'\' plate accompanying the original description in \'\'proceedings of the zoological society of london\'\', 1848.\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[nymphalidae]]\n| tribus = [[preponini]]\n| genus = [[agrias]]\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. aedon\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agrias aedon\'\'\n| binomial_authority = [[william chapman hewitson|hewitson]], [1848]\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'agrias salvini\'\' fruhstorfer, 1895\n*\'\'agrias aedon ab. magdalenae\'\' schultze, 1928\n*\'\'agrias aedon aedon schultzei\'\' rebillard, 1961\n*\'\'agrias aedon f. denhezi\'\' descimon & mast, 1975\n}} \nthe \'\'\'aedon agrias\'\'\' (\'\'agrias aedon\'\') is a butterfly of the [[nymphalidae]] family. it is found in the [[neotropical ecozone]]\n\n==subspecies==\n*\'\'a. a. aedon\'\' (colombia, venezuela, possibly panama)\n*\'\'a. a. rodriguezi\'\' schaus, 1918 (mexico, guatemala, costa rica)\n*\'\'a. a. pepitoensis\'\' michael, 1930 (western colombia)\n\n==references==\n* rebillard, p. (1961), \'\'révision systématique des lépidoptères nymphalides du genre agrias\'\'. \'\'memoires du museum national d`histoire naturelle\'\', nouvelle serie, serie a, zoologie, tome xxii, fasicule 2.\n\n[[category:charaxinae]]\n\n\n{{charaxinae-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agriculture_and_aquaculture_in_hong_kong</title><text>{{economy of hong kong}}\n\'\'\'agriculture and aquaculture in hong kong\'\'\' are considered [[sunset industry|sunset industries]]. most agricultural produce is directly imported from the neighbouring [[mainland china]]. in 2006 the industry accounts for less than 0.3% of the labor sector.<ref>hong kong census. \"[http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/filemanager/en/content_800/labour.pdf census labour data pdf].\" \'\'labour.\'\' retrieved on 2007-03-14.</ref> geographically hong kong consists largely of steep, unproductive hillside.  the local aquaculture industry is also facing challenges from competition with imported aquatic food products and concern of fish and seafood safety.<ref name=\"hkfishaqu\">hong kong agriculture, fisheries and conservation department. \" [http://www.afcd.gov.hk/english/fisheries/fish_aqu/fish_aqu_good/fish_aqu_good.html fish aqu].\" \'\'fishing aquaculture.\'\' retrieved on 2007-04-03.</ref>\n\n==history==\n[[image:old office of dairy farm international holdings.jpg|thumb|left|300px|old office of [[dairy farm international holdings|hong kong dairy farm]]]] \n\nin the [[colonial hong kong]] era around 1850s, agriculture in hong kong consisted mostly of [[revenue farm|revenue farm]]s that focused on [[opium]] productions. the industry led to many wealthy chinese businessmen, who established themselves as the middlemen merchants with international connection. some of the successful farmers included yan wo hong and wo hang hong from 1858 to 1887.<ref>ngo, tak-wing. [1999] (1999). hong kong\'s history: state and society under colonial rule. united kingdom: routledge. isbn 0-415-20305-8.</ref> the system was discontinued by colonial authorities, when the economy needed to diversify in other activities. the last opium farm ended in 1913.<ref>dahles, heidi. muijzenber, otto van den. [2003] (2003) capital and knowledge in asia: changing power relations. routledge. isbn 0-415-30417-2.</r
<page> <title>agriculture_in_concert_with_the_environment</title><text>\'\'\'agriculture in concert with the environment\'\'\' (ace) is a program of the [[united states environmental protection agency|environmental protection agency]], administered cooperatively with [[usda]]\'s [[sustainable agriculture research and education]] (sare) program, to fund [[research project]]s that reduce the risk of [[pollution]] from [[pesticide]]s and [[soluble]] [[fertilizer]]s.\n\n== references ==\n\n*{{crs|article = report for congress: agriculture: a glossary of terms, programs, and laws, 2005 edition|url = http://ncseonline.org/nle/crsreports/05jun/97-905.pdf|author= jasper womach}}\n\n{{defaultsort:agriculture in concert with the environment}}\n[[category:agriculture in the united states]]\n[[category:agriculture and the environment]]\n\n\n{{agriculture-stub}}\n{{environment-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agriculture_in_scotland_in_the_early_modern_era</title><text>[[file:17thc scottish lowland farm.jpg|thumb|300px|right|a scottish lowland farm from [[john slezer]]\'s \'\'prospect of dunfermline\'\', published in the \'\'theatrum scotiae\'\', 1693]]\n\'\'\'agriculture in scotland in the early modern era\'\'\' includes all forms of farm production in the modern boundaries of scotland, between the establishment of the [[renaissance in scotland|renaissance]] in the early sixteenth century and the beginning of the industrial revolution in the mid-eighteenth century. this era saw the impact of the [[little ice age]], which peaked towards the end of the seventeenth century. almost half the years in the second half of the sixteenth century saw local or national scarcity, necessitating the shipping of large quantities of grain from the baltic. in the early seventeenth century famine was relatively common. the closing decade of the seventeenth century saw a slump, followed by four years of failed harvests, in what is known as the \"[[seven ill years]]\", but these shortages would be the last of their kind.\n\nas feudal distinctions declined in the early modern era, the [[baron]]s and [[tenant-in-chief|tenants-in-chief]] merged to form a new identifiable group, the [[laird]]s. with the [[yeomen]], these [[heritor]]s were the major landholding orders. others with property rights included husbandmen and free tenants. many young people left home to become domestic and agricultural servants. the english invasions of the 1640s had a profound impact on the scottish economy. under the [[scotland under the commonwealth|commonwealth]], the country was relatively highly taxed, but gained access to english markets. after the [[restoration (scotland)|restoration]] customs duties with england were re-established. economic conditions were generally favourable, as land owners promoted better tillage and cattle-raising. after the [[union of 1707]] there was a conscious attempt t
<page> <title>agriculture_in_sudan</title><text>{{update|date=november 2010}}\n{{one source|date=august 2008}}\n[[image:sudan agriculture landsat.jpg|thumb|right|340px|irrigation of the nile delta]]\n[[image:nuba farming 2.jpg|thumb|right|340px|a farmer in the [[nuba mountains]]]]\nin the early 1990s, agriculture and livestock raising were the main sources of livelihood in \'\'\'[[sudan]]\'\'\' for about 61 percent of the working population.<ref name=\"loc\">{{cite web|url=http://lcweb2.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/d?cstdy:4:./temp/~frd_htx5::|title=agriculture, livestock, fisheries and forestry in sudan|date=june 1991|publisher=embassy of the republic of sudan, washington, [[library of congress]]|accessdate=august 30, 2008}}</ref> approximately one-third of the total area of sudan, the largest country on the african continent is suitable for agricultural development and heavier rainfall in the south permits both agriculture and herding by nomadic tribes.\n\nagricultural products in total account for about 95 percent of the country\'s exports.<ref name=\"loc\"/> in 1998 there was an estimated 16.9 million hectares (41.8 million acres) of arable land and approximately 1.9 million hectares (4.7 million acres) set aside for irrigation, primarily in the north of the country along the banks of the [[nile]] and other rivers. [[cash crops]] (as of 1999) grown under irrigation in these areas include [[cotton]] and [[cottonseed]], which is of primary importance to the economy with 172,000 tons and 131,000 tons produced annually respectively,<ref name=\"nations\">{{cite web|url=http://www.nationsencyclopedia.com/africa/sudan-agriculture.html|title=sudan agriculture|publisher=nations encyclopedia|accessdate=august 30, 2008| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20081007185823/http://www.nationsencyclopedia.com/africa/sudan-agriculture.html| archivedate= 7 october 2008 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>[[sesame]] (220,000 tons), [[sugarcane]] (5,950,000 tons), [[peanut]]s (980,000 t
<page> <title>agriculture_in_the_classroom</title><text>[[image:aitc-ca-radish.jpg|right]]\n\'\'\'agriculture in the classroom\'\'\' (\'\'\'aitc\'\'\') is a grassroots program coordinated by the [[united states department of agriculture]] (usda). its goal is to help students gain a greater awareness of the role of agriculture in the economy and society, so that they may become citizens who support wise agricultural policies. aitc raises agricultural literacy by helping students\' understand the farm sources of their food, fabric and flowers.\n\nthe program is carried out in each state, according to state needs and interests, by individuals representing farm organizations, [[agribusiness]], education and government.\n\nthe usda supports the state organizations by:\n* helping to develop agriculture in the classroom programs\n* acting as a central clearinghouse for materials and information\n* encouraging usda agencies to assist in the state programs, and\n* coordinating with national organizations to promote the goal of an increased awareness of agriculture among the nation\'s students.\n\n==history==\nthroughout much of the history of the united states, agriculture and education have been closely related. during the decades when most americans lived on farms or in small towns, students often did farm chores before and after school. the school year was determined by planting, cultivating and harvesting schedules. old school books are full of agricultural references and examples because farming and farm animals were a familiar part of nearly every child\'s life.\n\n[[image:aitc-il-germination.jpg|left]]<br />\nin the 1920s, \'30s and \'40s, as the farm population shrank and agricultural emphasis decreased in school books and educational materials, educators focused on agriculture as an occupational specialty, rather than an integral part of every student\'s life. agriculture education was mainly offered to those few students wanting to make a career of agriculture.\n\n
<page> <title>agrippina_the_younger</title><text>{{infobox royalty\n|name        =agrippina the younger\n|image       =rome agrippina minor.jpg\n|caption     =agrippina, mother of nero, [[national museum, warsaw|national museum]], [[warsaw]]\n|succession  =[[list of roman and byzantine empresses|empress consort]] of the [[roman empire]]\n|reign       =1 january ad 49 – 13 october ad 54\n|reign-type  =tenure\n|spouse      =[[gnaeus domitius ahenobarbus (consul 32)|gnaeus domitius ahenobarbus]]<br />[[gaius sallustius crispus passienus]]<br>[[claudius]]\n|issue       =[[nero|nero, emperor of rome]]\n|house       =[[julio-claudian dynasty|julio-claudian dynasty]]\n|father      =[[germanicus]]\n|mother      =[[agrippina the elder]]\n|birth_date  =7 november ad 15\n|birth_place =[[cologne|oppidum ubiorum]] ([[cologne]])\n|death_date  =23 march ad 59 (aged 43)\n|death_place =[[misenum]]\n|place of burial =[[misenum]]\n|}}\n{{julio-claudian dynasty}}\n\'\'\'julia agrippina\'\'\', most commonly referred to as \'\'\'agrippina minor\'\'\' or \'\'\'agrippina the younger\'\'\', and after ad 50 known as \'\'\'julia augusta agrippina\'\'\' (\'\'minor\'\' latin for the \'\'‘younger’\'\',<ref>{{aut|e. groag, a. stein, l. petersen – e.a.}} (edd.), \'\'prosopographia imperii romani saeculi i, ii et iii\'\' (\'\'\'pir\'\'\'), berlin, 1933 – i 641</ref> 7 november 15 or 6 november 16<ref>maike vogt-lüerssen, \'\'agrippina die jüngere – die große römische politikerin und ihre zeit\'\', norderstedt 2006, isbn 3-8334-5214-5, pp. 34–35</ref> – 19/23 march 59) was a roman empress and one of the more prominent women in the [[julio-claudian dynasty]]. she was a great-granddaughter of the emperor [[augustus]], great-niece and adoptive granddaughter of the emperor [[tiberius]], sister of the emperor [[caligula]], niece and fourth wife of the emperor [[claudius]], and mother of the emperor [[nero]].\n\nagrippina the younger has been described by the ancient and modern sources
<page> <title>agrisius</title><text>{{italictitle}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = \'\'agrisius\'\'\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[arctiidae]]\n| genus = \'\'\'\'\'agrisius\'\'\'\'\'\n| genus_authority = walker, 1855\n}}\n\n\'\'\'\'\'agrisius\'\'\'\'\' is a [[genus]] of [[moth]]s in the [[arctiidae]] family.\n\n==species==\n* \'\'[[agrisius aestivalis]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius albida]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius albula]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius bolovena]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius dubatolovi]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius fuliginosus]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius guttivitta]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius similis]]\'\'\n* \'\'[[agrisius vernalis]]\'\'\n\n==references==\n*[http://www.nhm.ac.uk/jdsml/research-curation/projects/butmoth/genuslist3.dsml?searchpageurl=index.dsml&superfamil=&familyqtype=starts+with&family=arctiidae&subfamilyqtype=starts+with&subfamily=&tribeqtype=starts+with&tribe=&subtribeqtype=starts+with&subtribe=&genusqtype=starts+with&genus=&authorqtype=starts+with&author=&yearqtype=equals&year=&sort=genus natural history museum lepidoptera generic names catalog]\n* {{aut|dubatolov, v.v., kishida, y., wang, m.}}, 2012: two new species from the \'\'agrisius guttivitta\'\' species group from nanling mts., guangdong, south china (lepidoptera, arctiidae: lithosiinae). \'\'lepidoptera science\'\' \'\'\'63\'\'\' (3): 116-118.\n* {{aut|fang, c.-l.}}, 1991: a study on the chinese \'\'agrisius\'\' walker (lepidoptera: arctiidae, lithosiinae). \'\'acta entomologica sinica\'\' \'\'\'34\'\'\' (4): 470-471. (in chinese).\n* {{aut|orhant, g.}}, 1997: \'\'agrisius albula\'\' n. sp. (arctiidae – lithosiinae). \'\'bulletin de la société entomologique de mulhouse\'\' \'\'\'1997\'\'\' (juillet-septembre): 33-35.\n* {{aut|orhant, g.}}, 2012: deux nouveaux \'\'agrisius\'\' orientaux (lepidoptera, arctiidae, lithosiinae). \'\'bulletin de la société entomologique de mulhouse\'\' \'\'\'68\'\'\' (3): 37-38.\n\n[[category:lithos
<page> <title>agror</title><text>{{refimprove|date=may 2008}}\n\nthe \'\'\'agror\'\'\' valley is located in [[mansehra district]], [[hazara, pakistan|hazara]] in the [[khyber pakhtunkhwa|khyber-pakhtunkhwa]] province of [[pakistan]]. it consists of three mountain glens, {{convert|10|mi|km}} in length and {{convert|6|mi|km}} in breadth, located between\n{{coord|34|29|n|72|58|e|}} and {{coord|34|35|n|75|9|e|}}.<ref name=\"igi\">[http://dsal.uchicago.edu/reference/gazetteer/pager.html?objectid=ds405.1.i34_v05_100.gif agror imperial gazetteer of india, v. 5, p. 92.]</ref>\n\n== environment ==\nthe lower portions of the agror valley are heavily cultivated and contain many villages and hamlets. the valley area has few strictly level spaces, but consist of terraced flats, water is abundant year round.<ref name=\"igi\"/>\n\n== population ==\nthe main tribes and ethnic groups are the [[pashto]] speaking pakhtun tribes such as the  [[swati (pashtun tribe)|swati]]s, and other indigenous races such as the [[gurjar|gujar]]s, [[awan (pakistan)|awan]]s and [[tanoli]]s.<ref>hazara district gazetteer, 1921</ref>\n\n== history ==\nagror is the ancient atyugrapura of the [[rajatarangini]] and the \'Ιθάγονρος town in [[Ούαρσα]] mentioned by [[ptolemy]]. from the time of [[timur]] until the beginning of the eighteenth century the agror valley was held by a family of karlugh [[turkic peoples|turks]]. these were expelled in 1703 by a [[saiyid]] named jalal baba,<ref name=\"igi\"/> (who happened to be a son-in-law of last turk ruler of hazara, sultan mehmud khurd) with his bigoted [[swati (tribe)|swati]] lashker{{citation needed|date=may 2008}} and the conquered country was divided among the [[swati (tribe)|swati]]s, one mullah from the tribe, akhund sad-ud-din, who died in 1783, rising to the position of khan of agror.<ref name=\"igi\"/>\n\nthe [[nawab]] of [[amb (princely state)|amb]] took the valley in 1834, but in 1841 it was restored by the [[sikh]]s to ata muhammad, a 
<page> <title>agrotis_sardzeana</title><text>{{italic title}}\n{{taxobox\n| name = agrotis sardzeana\n| image = \n| image_width = 100px\n| image_caption =\n| regnum = [[animal]]ia\n| phylum = [[arthropod]]a\n| classis = [[insect]]a\n| ordo = [[lepidoptera]]\n| familia = [[noctuidae]]\n| genus = \'\'[[agrotis]]\'\'\n| species = \'\'\'\'\'a. sardzeana\'\'\'\'\'\n| binomial = \'\'agrotis sardzeana\'\'\n| binomial_authority = brandt, 1941\n| synonyms =\n*\'\'agrotis sardzeana saharae\'\' <small>pinker, 1974</small>\n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'agrotis sardzeana\'\'\'\'\' is a [[moth]] of the [[noctuidae]] family. it is found in the eremic zone from [[north africa]] to the [[arabian peninsula]] to [[pakistan]] and [[india]].\n\nadults are on wing from october to december. there is one generation per year.\n\n==external links==\n* [http://redalyc.uaemex.mx/redalyc/html/455/45513605/45513605.html noctuinae of israel]\n\n[[category:agrotis]]\n\n{{agrotis-stub}}</text> </page>

<page> <title>aguallamaya_lake</title><text>{{infobox_lake\n| lake_name          = laguna aguallamaya\n| image_lake         = \n| caption_lake       = \n| image_bathymetry   = \n| caption_bathymetry = \n| location           = [[la paz department (bolivia)|la paz department]]\n| coords             = {{coord|16.685|s|68.975|w|type:waterbody_region:bo|display=inline,title}}\n| type               = \n| inflow             = [[río desaguadero]]\n| outflow            = [[río desaguadero]]\n| catchment          = \n| basin_countries    = bolivia\n| length             = \n| width              = \n| area               = 96 km²\n| depth              = \n| max-depth          = \n| volume             = \n| residence_time     = \n| shore              = \n| elevation          = \n| frozen             = \n| islands            = none\n| cities             = [[desaguadero (bolivia)|desaguadero]]\n| reference          = \n}}\n\'\'\'laguna aguallamaya\'\'\' is a [[lake]] in the [[la paz department (bolivia)|la paz department]], [[bolivia]]. its surface area is 96&nbsp;km².\n\n== references ==\n*{{iw-ref|es}}\n\n{{defaultsort:aguallamaya}}\n[[category:lakes of la paz department (bolivia)]]\n\n\n{{lapazbo-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>agualonga</title><text>{{unreferenced|date=november 2007}}\n{{infobox parish pt|\n|official_name = agualonga\n|image_shield =\n|municipality = [[paredes de coura]]\n|area_total = 4.14\n|population_total = 284\n| population_as_of = 2001\n|population_density = auto\n|website = none\n|footnotes =\n}}\n\n\'\'\'agualonga\'\'\' is a [[portugal|portuguese]] parish, located in the municipality of [[paredes de coura]]. it has a population of 284 inhabitants, it has a total area of 4.14 km² and the density was 68.6/km².\n\n{{paredes de coura}}\n\n{{coord|41.886|n|8.615|w|display=title|source:ptwiki}}\n\n[[category:parishes of paredes de coura]]\n\n{{vianadocastelo-geo-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>aguateca</title><text><!-- hide until it can be attended to\n{{infobox pre-columbian site\n|name =\n|image = \n|image size = 250px\n|alt = \n|caption = \n|pushpin_map =\n|map=\n|latd = | latm = | lats = | latns = n\n|longd= | longm= | longs =| longew = w\n|map_caption = location within \n|mapsize = 250\n|country = {{flag|guatemala}}\n|region = \n|municipality = \n|nearest_town = \n|culture = \n|first_occupied = \n|period = \n|conquered_by = \n|abandoned =\n|responsible_body = \n|restored_by = \n|date_restored = \n|dates_excavated = \n|archaeological_bodies=\n|notable_archaeologists = \n|architectural_styles=\n|number_of_temples=\n|number_of_monuments=\n|inscriptions=\n}}\n--->\n[[image:aguateca-plaza.jpg|thumb|right|upright=1.7|the main plaza of aguateca showing a large stone [[maya stelae|stela]]]]\n{{maya civilization}}\n[[image:aguateca-temple.jpg|thumb|right|palacio real]]\n[[image:aguateca.jpg|thumb|right|view from palacio in plaza 2 de aguateca]]\n\'\'\'aguateca\'\'\' is a [[maya civilization|maya]] site located in northern [[guatemala]]\'s [[petexbatun]] basin, in the department of [[petén department|petén]]. the first settlements at aguateca date to the [[mesoamerican chronology|late preclassic]] period (300 bc - ad 350). the center was occupied from about 200 b.c. until about 800 b.c, when the city was attacked and ransacked. because the city was rapidly abandoned by its population, pompeii-style assemblages were left scattered on the floors of elite residences. horizontal excavation of these residences has revealed ancient elite activity and household level craft production areas.<ref name=\"aoyama, kazuo 2007\">aoyama, kazuo, and kitty emery. \"bone, shell, and lithic evidence for crafting in elite maya households at aguateca, guatemala.\" ancient mesoamerica 18 (2007): 69-89. print.</ref> aguateca sits on top of a {{convert|90|m|ft}} tall [[limestone]] bluff, creating a highly defensible position. this steep escarpment overlooks petexbatu

<page> <title>agus_salim</title><text>{{redirect|haji agus salim|agus salim stadium|haji agus salim stadium}}\n\n{{infobox officeholder\n|name = agus salim\n|image = agus salim headshot.jpg\n|imagesize = 200px\n|caption =\n|office = foreign minister of indonesia\n|order = 3rd\n|term_start = july 3, 1947\n|term_end = december 20, 1949\n|succeeding =\n|president = [[sukarno]]\n|predecessor = [[sutan syahrir]]\n|successor = [[mohammad roem]]\n|birth_date = {{birth date|1884|10|8}}\n|birth_place = [[kota gadang]], [[agam regency|agam]], [[west sumatra]], [[dutch east indies]]\n|death_date = {{death date and age|1954|11|4|1884|10|8}}\n|death_place = [[jakarta]], [[indonesia]]\n|nationality = [[indonesia]]\n|party =\n|spouse =\n|relations =\n|children =\n|alma_mater =\n|occupation =\n|profession = [[journalist]], [[diplomat]]\n|religion = [[islam]]\n|signature =\n|website =\n|footnotes =\n}}\n\nhaji \'\'\'agus salim\'\'\' ({{ipa-id|ˈaɡʊs ˈsalɪm|}}; born \'\'\'musyudul haq\'\'\';<ref name=\"bioins\"/> 8 october 1884 &ndash; 4 november 1954) was one of [[indonesia]]\'s founding fathers and prominent diplomats. he played a leading role in the creation of the [[constitution of indonesia|indonesian constitution]] in 1945 and served as indonesia\'s [[foreign minister]] between 1947 and 1949.\n\n==early life==\n[[file:collectie tropenmuseum president soekarno tijdens een wandeling met hadji agus salim tmnr 10018810.jpg|thumb|president [[sukarno]] and agus salim in dutch custody, 1949.]]\nsalim was born in kota gadang, [[agam regency|agam]], [[west sumatra]] to sutan muhammad salim, a court official, and siti zaenab on 8 october 1884. his birth name was musyudul haq; agus was his nickname.<ref name=\"bioins\">{{cite web |url= http://www.biographyinstitute.com/biography/agus-salim/ |title= biography&nbsp;— agus salim |work= biographyinstitute.com |accessdate= june 10, 2011}}</ref><ref name=\"kahfip5\">{{harvnb|kahfi|2000|p=8}}</ref> his father was a prosecutor (called \'\'h
<page> <title>agusan_del_sur_provincial_board</title><text>the \'\'\'agusan del sur provincial board\'\'\' is the [[sangguniang panlalawigan]] (provincial legislature) of the [[philippine province]] of [[agusan del sur]].\n\nthe members are elected via [[plurality-at-large voting]]: the province is divided into two districts, each sending five members to the provincial board; the electorate votes for five members, with the five candidates with the highest number of votes being elected.\n\n==list of members==\nan additional two \'\'ex officio\'\' members are the presidents of the provincial chapter of the association of barangay captains and the [[sangguniang kabataan]] provincial president; the municipal and city (if applicable) presidents of the association of barangay captains, and [[sangguniang kabataan]], shall elect amongst themselves their provincial presidents which shall be their representatives at the board.\n\n===1st district===\n{|class=wikitable style=\"font-size:90%\"\n|-\n!width=60px|election<br>year !!colspan=2 width=140px|member (party) !!colspan=2 width=140px|member (party) !!colspan=2 width=140px|member (party) !!colspan=2 width=140px|member (party) !!colspan=2 width=140px|member (party)\n|-\n|2004\n|bgcolor={{lakas-christian muslim democrats/meta/color}}| ||aida campos<br>([[lakas-cmd]])\n|rowspan=2 bgcolor={{lakas-christian muslim democrats/meta/color}}| ||rowspan=2|alfelito bascug<br>([[lakas-cmd]])\n|bgcolor={{lakas-christian muslim democrats/meta/color}}| ||santiago cane, jr.<br>([[lakas-cmd]])\n|rowspan=2 bgcolor={{lakas-christian muslim democrats/meta/color}}| ||rowspan=2|cesar alonde<br>([[lakas-cmd]])\n|rowspan=2 bgcolor={{lakas-christian muslim democrats/meta/color}}| ||rowspan=2|allan santiago<br>([[lakas-cmd]])\n|-\n|2007\n|bgcolor={{lakas-christian muslim democrats/meta/color}}| ||albin magdamit<br>([[lakas-cmd]])\n|bgcolor={{independent/meta/color}}| ||virginia getes<br>(independent)\n|-\n|2010\n|bgcolor={{independent/meta/color}}| ||

<page> <title>ah_ying</title><text>{{infobox film\n| name           = ah ying\n| image          = \n| caption        = \n| director       = [[allen fong]]\n| producer       = \n| writer         = \n| starring       = \n| music          = \n| cinematography = \n| editing        = \n| studio         = \n| distributor    = \n| released       = {{film date|1983}}\n| runtime        = \n| country        = hong kong\n| language       = \n| budget         = \n| gross          = \n}}\n\'\'\'\'\'ah ying\'\'\'\'\' (半邊人) is a 1983 [[cinema of hong kong|hong kong film]] directed by [[allen fong]]. it won the [[hong kong film award for best film|best film award]] at the 3rd [[hong kong film awards]]. it was also entered into the [[34th berlin international film festival]].<ref name=\"berlinale\">{{cite web |url=http://www.berlinale.de/en/archiv/jahresarchive/1984/02_programm_1984/02_programm_1984.html |title=berlinale: 1984 programme |accessdate=2010-11-22 |work=berlinale.de| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20101228085415/http://www.berlinale.de/en/archiv/jahresarchive/1984/02_programm_1984/02_programm_1984.html| archivedate= 28 december 2010 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>\n\n==awards==\n\'\'\'3rd [[hong kong film awards]]\'\'\'<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hkfaa.com/history/list_03.html |title= 第三屆香港電影金像獎得獎名單 |accessdate= 2010-02-02|language= chinese|publisher= [[hong kong film awards]]| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20100211022510/http://www.hkfaa.com/history/list_03.html| archivedate= 11 february 2010 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>\n* \'\'\'won\'\'\': best film\n* \'\'\'won\'\'\': [[hong kong film award for best director|best director]] - [[allen fong]]\n\n==references==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==external links==\n* {{imdb title|0085144}}\n\n{{best film hkfa}}\n\n[[category:1983 films]]\n[[category:best film hkfa]]\n[[category:films directed by allen fong]]\n[[category:hong kong films]]\n\n{{hk-film-stub}}</text> </page>	
<page> <title>ahad_israfil</title><text>{{infobox person\n| name        = ahad israfil\n| image       = ahadbefore.jpg\n| image_size  = 180px\n| caption     = ahad israfil prior to reconstructive surgery.\n| birth_name  =  \n| birth_date  = {{birth year and age|1973}} \n| birth_place = [[dayton, ohio]], [[united states|u.s.]]\n| death_date  = \n| death_place =  \n| known_for   = \n}}\n\n\'\'\'ahad israfil\'\'\' is a [[gunshot]] victim from [[dayton, ohio]], remarkable for his recovery from an injury that destroyed most of one of his [[brain|cerebral hemisphere]]s.\n\nin 1987, aged 14, ahad was shot in the head at work when his employer had supposedly knocked a firearm to the floor.  after a five-hour operation, doctors were amazed when he attempted to speak. <ref>\"[http://www.mymultiplesclerosis.co.uk/stranger-than-fiction/ahadisrafil.html loss of half his brain - ahad israfil survives a freak shooting accident]\" url accessed june 22, 2006.</ref> <!-- there\'s a photo here post-reconstruction, but i don\'t know if it\'s free for use -->\n\nthe injury destroyed much brain tissue and half of his skull, but the skin of his scalp survived.  after the void within his skull had been filled in with a silicone block, the flap of skin was pulled over and hair regrew, giving him a fairly normal appearance.\n\nalthough ahad now uses a wheelchair, he has regained most of his faculties and has successfully obtained a degree.<ref>http://www.mymultiplesclerosis.co.uk/stranger-than-fiction/ahadisrafil.html</ref>\nhe has also appeared on television programs such as \'\'world of pain\'\' ([[bravo (uk tv network)|bravo]], uk), and \'\'ripley\'s believe it or not\'\'.<ref>episode #218\n\n(wednesday, november 14th, 2001) [http://www.sonypictures.com/tv/shows/ripleys/database/ep_218a.html]</ref>\n\n==see also==\n* [[cognitive neuropsychology]]\n* [[hm (patient)]]\n* [[hemispherectomy]]\nother neurological trauma/damage cases:\n* [[phineas gage]]\n* [[clive wearing]]\n\n==references==\n
<page> <title>aharon_amir</title><text>\'\'\'aharon amir\'\'\' ({{lang-he|אהרן אמיר}}, january 5, 1923 in [[kaunas]], [[lithuania]] - february 28, 2008 in [[tzrifin]]) was an [[israelis|israeli]] [[hebrew]] poet, a literary translator and a writer.\n\n== biography ==\namir was born in [[kaunas]], [[lithuania]]. he moved to palestine with his family in 1933 and grew up in [[tel aviv]]. his father,\nmeir lipec, was later director of the publishing house am oved. he attended [[herzliya hebrew high school|gymnasia herzliya]] high school. at the time of the [[british mandate in palestine]], while studying [[arabic]] language and literature at the [[hebrew university]], amir was a member of the [[irgun]] and [[lehi (group)|lehi]] undergrounds as well as a founding member of the [[canaanites (movement)|canaanite movement]] ([[canaanism]]),<ref name=laor>{{cite news\n| volume = 5\n| last = laor\n| first = dan\n| title = american literature and israeli culture: the case of the canaanites\n| work = questia\n| accessdate = 2007-12-22\n| year = 2000\n| url = http://www.questia.com/googlescholar.qst;jsessionid=htjdlhfqqkt9nm9jb2tvsvlslp747wv35cfpbjyjsy3m2gkknpkg!-338391498?docid=98497215\n}}</ref> which saw hebrew or israeli culture as defined by geographical location rather than religious affiliation. amir was married to bettine, a poet and painter. he had three children from a previous marriage.\n\nhe died of cancer on february 28, 2008, at the age of 85, and left his body to science.<ref name=levari>{{cite news\n| last = lev-ari\n| first = shiri\n| title = tribute to a hebrew man\n| work = haaretz\n| accessdate = 2008-04-14\n| date = 2008-03-13\n| url = http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/961711.html\n| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20080409193745/http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/961711.html| archivedate= 9 april 2008 <!--dashbot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>\n\n==literary career==\namir translated over 300 books into hebrew, including [[english language|english
<page> <title>aharon_appelfeld</title><text>{{infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:template:infobox writer/doc]]. --> \n| name          = aharon appelfeld\n| image         =  appelfeldprofile.jpg\n| image_size    = 200px\n| alt           = \n| caption       = appelfeld at the<br>[[jerusalem international book fair]], 2007\n| pseudonym     = \n| birth_name    = \n| birth_date    = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1932|2|16}}\n| birth_place   = zhadova, near [[chernivtsi|czernowitz]], [[kingdom of romania|romania]] (now [[ukraine]])\n| death_date    = <!-- {{death date and age|mf=yes|year|month|day|year|month|day}} -->\n| death_place   = \n| resting_place = \n| occupation    = novelist\n| language      = [[hebrew language|hebrew]] \n| nationality   = \n| ethnicity     = \n| citizenship   = israeli\n| education     = \n| alma_mater    = the [[hebrew university of jerusalem]]\n| period        = \n| genre         = \n| subject       = \n| movement      = \n| notableworks  = \n| spouse        = \n| partner       = \n| children      = \n| relatives     = \n| influences    = \n| influenced    = \n| awards        = \n*[[bialik prize]]\n*[[israel prize]]\n*[[national jewish book award]]\n*foreign honorary member of the [[american academy of arts and sciences]]\n*[[prix médicis]]\n*[[nelly sachs prize]]\n| signature     = \n| signature_alt = \n| website       = \n| portaldisp    = \n}}\n\'\'\'aharon appelfeld\'\'\' ({{lang-he|אהרן אפלפלד}}) (born february 16, 1932) is an [[israeli jews|israel]]i [[novelist]].\n\n==biography==\naharon appelfeld was born in the town of zhadova or [[sadhora]] (Садгора), now part of [[chernivtsi|czernowitz]], [[bucovina]], [[kingdom of romania|romania]], now [[ukraine]]. in 1941, when he was eight years old, the romanian army invaded his hometown and his mother was murdered. appelfeld was deported with his father to a [[nazi concentration camps|nazi concentration camp]] in [[romanians|romanian]]/[[axis powers|axis]]-control

<page> <title>ahlfors_finiteness_theorem</title><text>in the mathematical theory of [[kleinian group]]s, the \'\'\'ahlfors finiteness theorem\'\'\' describes the quotient of the domain of discontinuity by a finitely generated kleinian group. the theorem was proved by {{harvs|txt|authorlink=lars ahlfors|first=lars |last=ahlfors|year1=1964|year2=1965}}, apart from a gap that was filled by {{harvtxt|greenberg|1967}}.\n\n==ahlfors finiteness theorem==\n\nthe ahlfors finiteness theorem  states that if Γ is a finitely-generated kleinian group  with region of discontinuity Ω, then\nΩ/Γ has a finite number of components, each of which is a compact riemann surface with a finite number of points removed.\n\n==bers area inequality==\n\nthe \'\'\'bers area inequality\'\'\' is a quantitative refinement of the ahlfors finiteness theorem proved by {{harvs|first=lipman|last=bers|authorlink=lipman bers|txt|year=1967a}}. it states that if Γ is a non-elementary finitely-generated kleinian group with \'\'n\'\' generators and with region of discontinuity Ω, then\n:area(&omega;/&gamma;) &le; 4&pi;(\'\'n\'\'&nbsp;&minus;&nbsp;1)\nwith equality only for [[schottky group]]s. (the area is given by the poincaré metric in each component.)\nmoreover, if Ω<sub>1</sub> is an invariant component then\n:area(&omega;/&gamma;) &le; 2area(&omega;<sub>1</sub>/&gamma;)\nwith equality only for [[fuchsian group]]s of the first kind (so in particular there can be at most two invariant components).\n\n==references==\n\n*{{citation | last1=ahlfors | first1=lars v. | author1-link=lars ahlfors | title=finitely generated kleinian groups | jstor=2373173 | mr=0167618 | year=1964 | journal=[[american journal of mathematics]] | issn=0002-9327 | volume=86 | pages=413–429}}\n*{{citation | last1=ahlfors | first1=lars | author1-link=lars ahlfors | title=correction to \"finitely generated kleinian groups\" | jstor=2373073 | mr=0180675 | year=1965 | journal=[[american journal of mathematics]] | issn=0002-9327 |
<page> <title>ahlten_station</title><text>\'\'\'ahlten\'\'\' is a [[railway station]] located in [[ahlten]], [[hannover]], [[germany]]. the station is located on the [[hanover–brunswick railway]]. the train services are operated by [[deutsche bahn]] as part of the [[hanover s-bahn]]. hannover-anderten-misburg is served by the s3 and s7. it is in \'\'zone umland\'\' of hannover. \n\n==train services==\nthe following services currently call at ahlten:\n\n{{s-rail-start}}\n{{s-rail|title=s-bahn hannover}}\n{{s-line|system=hsb|line=3|previous=hannover-anderten-misburg|next=lehrte}}\n{{s-line|system=hsb|line=7|previous=hannover-anderten-misburg|next=lehrte}}\n{{end}}\n\n{{coord|52|22|34|n|9|54|15|e|type:railwaystation_region:de-ni|display=title}}\n\n[[category:railway stations in lower saxony]]\n[[category:hannover s-bahn railway stations]]\n\n\n{{lowersaxony-railstation-stub}}\n{{germany-metro-stub}}</text> </page>
